loans.name: Zumradkhon

texts.en:
Zumradkhon is married and a loving mother of two children. Her husband works in Russia. She sells fabric and women’s clothing at the market. Zumradkhon started her business by helping her mother and now has her own outlet and stable customers. Over the past five years of running her own business, she has gained a lot of experience. Zumradkhon would like a loan of 7000 Somoni to purchase new fabric and clothing, which will help her expand her business.  
 
More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to purchase new fabric and clothing

loans.name: Ismatillokhuja

texts.en:
Ismatillokhuja is a 40-year-old man who lives in Isfara, Tajikistan with his wife and four children. He has worked in transportation since 2007. He provides transportation services in the area of Isfara and Kanibadam and also engages in cattle breeding. 

Ismatillokhuja acquires cattle in Kanibadam and sells them in Isfara. He would like to get a loan 5000 Somoni to purchase more cattle. Ismatillokhuja also hopes to provide happiness and good health to his wife and children.     

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Kadidiatou

texts.fr:
Née le 22 mai 1982 à Bamako, Kadidiatou C. est une femme mariée et mère de deux enfants qui vit avec son époux et leurs enfants à Kamalen Sirakoro, un des  quartiers périphériques de la ville de Sikasso.
Kadidiatou C. mène cette activité d’achat et vente de bois de chauffe il y a environ trois ans. Elle jouit d’une forte réputation dans cette activité et reçoit beaucoup de commandes surtout en saison d’hivernage, mais ses ressources ne peuvent pas lui permettre de les satisfaire. Ainsi, elle décida il y environ une année de collaborer avec le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso avec lequel elle sollicite ce premier crédit qui lui permettra d’augmenter son fonds de commerce afin d’acheter 5 chargements de charrette en bois de chauffe dans les localités environnantes de la ville de Sikasso. Elle vend les bois de chauffe à domicile, en détail et au comptant. Avec ce prêt, elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 70 000 FCFA qui sera utiliser pour  réaliser l’essentielle de ses dépenses, contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Born on May 22, 1982 in Bamako, Ms. Kadidiatou C. is a married woman and the mother of two children. She lives with her husband and their children in Kamalen Sirakoro, an outlying district of Sikasso City. Kadidiatou has been running this business buying and selling firewood for about three years. She enjoys a great reputation in this business and receives many orders, especially during the off-season. 

But her resources cannot allow her to meet the demand. Thus, about a year ago, she decided to collaborate with the loan program of the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso. She is now requesting this initial loan enabling her to increase her business capital for buying 5 cart loads of firewood from towns surrounding Sikasso City. Accepting cash or credit, she sells the firewood at her house.

With this loan, Kadidiatou envisions making a monthly profit of 70,000 francs CFA that will be used for covering most of her costs, helping with family expenses, and paying the loan interest. The rest will be invested in her business.

loans.use: to buy firewood

loans.name: Souleymane

texts.fr:
Né vers 1970 à Dourou Préfecture de Bandiangara (région de Mopti), Monsieur  Souleymane S.est marié et père de six enfants. Il réside avec ses deux femmes et ses enfants dans sa propre maison à Sanoubougou I, un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso (troisième région administrtive de la république du Mali).
 Souleymane n’a pas eu la chance d’aller à l’école,  et après avoir mené plusieurs activités sans succès, il s’est vite initié aux activités commerciales notamment aux stockage et commercialisation des céréales, vente de carburant et embouche bovine il y a maintenant quinze ans. Avec sa grande expérience dans ce domaine, il jouit d’une forte réputation et reçoit beaucoup de commandes, mais les ressources nécessaires pour satisfaire ces besoins fait défaut. Ainsi, il décide d’intégrer le programme de crédit de Soro Yiriwaso avec lequel il sollicite ce premier crédit, lui permettant d’augmenter son fonds de commerce afin de mieux répondre aux attentes de ses clients. 
Il compte acheter une importante quantité de céréales (mil, maïs, son de riz, etc.)  pour constituer un stock et quelques bidons de carburants pour la vente en détail.
Avec ce prêt, il envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 270 000 FCFA. Avec ces bénéfices réalisés, il compte résoudre  les dépenses de sa famille, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité principale.
texts.en:
Born around 1970 in Douro Prefecture of Badnangara (Mopti Region), Mr. Souleymane S.is married and the fathe of xis. He lives with his two wives and children in his own house in Sanoubougou I, a working-class district of the  city of Sikasso (the third administrative region of Mali). Souleymane did not have an opportunity to go to school. After trying several business activities without success, he started stocking and reselling cereals, selling fuel and raising sheep. He has been doing this for almost 15 years.  With a lot of work experience, he has a good reputation in the business and receives many orders, but lacks the necessary resources to meet customer demand. And so he decided to joint he credit program of Soro Yiriwaso, requesting his first loan. T

his loan will allow him to increase his working capital in order to better respond to customer demand. He plans to purchase a big quantity of cereals (millet, corn, rice bran etc) to build up his stock and several jugs of fuel for retailing. Wit this loan, he plans to achieve an average monthly income of 270,000 Western African francs. With this income, he plans to cover family expenses, pay off the interest on his loan, and reinvest the rest in his principal business activity.

loans.use: to purchase various articles for resale

loans.name: Lona

texts.en: Lona is currently in the business of selling paste. She is 38 years old, married and has 4 children who all go to school. Lona took a loan to stock more paste to sell. In the future, she hopes to expand with the extra profits from her business.

loans.use: to stock more paste to sell.

loans.name: Yaya

texts.fr:
Monsieur Yaya D.  est âgé de plus 40 ans, marié et père de deux  enfants. Il réside avec sa famille dans sa propre maison à Banconi, un des quartiers périphériques de la ville de Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
 Après une formation de thérapeute, il s’est vite initié aux activités de ventes de produits pharmaceutiques depuis plus de vingt  ans. Avec une telle expérience dans ce domaine, il jouit d’une forte réputation. Après 3 prêts individuels tous correctement remboursés, il est à son quatrième prêt qui sera utiliser pour acheter 15 cartons de Manames, 5 cartons d’Aloé, 9 bidons d’inzam indien, 3 cartons de nifroxacin, etc. 
Sa source d’approvisionnement principale est à Lomé (république de Togo) grâce au programme de crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Auparavant, il s’approvisionnait auprès de son fournisseur à Koutiala pour venir les revendre à Sikasso dans sa pharmacopée située à la gare routière de Sikasso à une clientèle composée des voyageurs et surtout des routiers. Certains de ses clients payent au comptant, d’autre à crédit. 
Avec ce  nouveau prêt, il envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 350 000 FCFA. Avec ces bénéfices réalisés, il compte résoudre l’essentielle de ses dépenses, celles de sa famille, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Mr. Yaya D. is more than 40 years old, married and has two children. He resides with his family in his own house in Banconi, an outlying district of the city of Sikasso (third administrative region of Mali).

After training as a therapist, he was soon introduced to the business of pharmaceutical sales and has been in this business for over twenty years. With such strong experience in this field, he has a good reputation. Having fully repaid his previous three individual loans, he is requesting his fourth loan. He will use the loan to purchase 15 cartons of Manames, five cartons of aloe, nine cans of Indian inzam, three boxes of nifroxacin etc. His main source of supply is in Lomé (Togo Republic) through the credit program of Soro Yiriwaso. He used to obtain supplies from his supplier in Koutiala and re-sell the goods in Sikasso in his pharmacy located at the bus station in Sikasso.  His clientele is composed mainly of travelers and truckers. Some of his customers pay cash, others use credit.

With this new loan, he expects to earn a monthly profit of 350,000 FCFA. With these profits, he intends pay for the bulk of his expenditures, his family's expenses, pay the interest on the loan and invest the rest in his business.

loans.use: To purchase medicines (aloe, Maname, Lipton, nifroxacin, etc.)

loans.name: Constansio

texts.en: Constansio is a fifty-eight-year old married woman with six children. She lives in her own permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda.She has been trading in goats for over twenty years. She is very proud of the business as she has been able to pay school fees for most of her children and is almost finished the house construction. She faces challenges in raising funds to sustain the business and to run her family. Her greatest desire is to own a ranch. Constansio needs the loan to purchase goats to sell.

loans.use: to buy goats to sell

loans.name: Tecla

texts.en:
Tecla is 40 years old. She is married to Musa Kiptum, who is a mechanic, and they are blessed with five children. Tecla is a tailor in Kabirirsang center in Kapsabet town. She has been in this business for 16 years and earns a monthly income of 8,700 KES. 

Tecla learned about KADET LTD through a friend and this is her first loan. She will use the entire loan to buy a modern sewing machine, cloth materials, and thread. Tecla will use the profits from her loan for savings and to pay school fees for her children. In the future, she plans to expand her business and buy a vehicle.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine, material, and thread

loans.name: Christine

texts.en: Christine is currently in the business of selling cooking oil and onions. She is 29 years old, married to a driver, and has 5 children who all go to school. Christine took a loan to stock more cooking oil and onions to sell. In the future, she hopes to build a concrete house with the extra profits from her business.

loans.use: to stock more cooking oil and onions to sell

loans.name: Francisca Mumbua

texts.en:
Francisca M. is 52 years old. She runs a Boutique in Athi River, Kenya. She is married to Alfred M. and together they have four children. Francisca was introduced to KADET LTD by the credit officer in charge of the Kitengela office.

Francisca has been running her business for a period of six years and her monthly income is KES 10,000. This loan of KES 65,000 will be her fourth loan with KADET LTD.  She plans to use it to open another boutique in Kitengela. If the loan boosts the business, she plans to use the profit to pay school fees for her son who is in college.

Francisca describes herself as hardworking, and dreams of managing a big boutique shop in Athi River.

loans.use: open another clothing boutique

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Clementine

texts.en: Clementine is 22 years old. She has one child who is three years old. She is requesting a loan to buy a motorcycle. Her husband is a motorcyclist and he hopes to use it for business. With the profits, together with her savings, she wants to buy a car.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is single and supports two children between 10 and 12 years old.  Elizabeth joined KADET through existing clients and has never borrowed from any other MFI. 

Elizabeth operates a butchery business and has been in operation for the last two years. She earns an income of KES 15,000 per month.

Elizabeth is requesting a loan of KES. 20,000 to buy more stock of meat for sale.  Elizabeth will use the anticipated profits to educate the children she supports.  Elizabeth hopes to expand her business and become financially stable.

loans.use: purchase more meat for sale

loans.name: Armen

texts.en:
Armen G. is 27 years old. He lives in Sevan city with his parents and his sister. Armen is an auto mechanic but, since 2004, he has worked as a waiter. He has also operated a fruit and vegetable business since 2006. Armen’s parents help him in his trading and, thus, they support their family.  
This is Armen’s second loan from Nor Horizon and he is asking for 500.000 AMD to buy stock such as potatoes, tomatoes, greens and cucumbers to resell. 
Armen will use the expected income for his wedding preparations.

loans.use: To buy stock such as potatoes, tomatoes, greens and cucumbers to resell

loans.name: Rodolfo

texts.es: Rodolfo es un hombre viudo que vive en el barrio Carrizal con sus 4 hijos en las edades de 12 a 33 años; en esta comunidad alegre y solidaria está ubicada su tienda llamada “Tienda del señor Rodol”, como comerciante,  Rodolfo tiene una experiencia de 25 años y 5 de haber comenzado su propia tienda, allí vende ranchos, víveres, bebidas y en general productos de la canasta familiar. Rodolfo tiene una familia muy unida  y está rodeado de buenos  vecinos, los cuales  han sido sus pilares para recuperarse en las etapas más difíciles de su vida personal,  como la muerte de su esposa hace 8 meses. El negocio de Rodolfo vende diariamente desde muy temprano en la mañana hasta muy tarde en la noche, por eso es muy reconocido en el sector y esto es su gran fortaleza; él está interesado en hacerlo crecer y por eso recurre a su primer financiamiento con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo mediante un credikiva, con el comprará mercancías en mayor volumen, como arroz, azúcar, aceite, enlatados aprovechando que al adquirirlas en gran cantidad obtiene mejores precios, que así mismo puede trasladar  a sus clientes de manera muy competitiva y también ahorra mediante su credikiva porque lo adquiere   a una tasa de interés apropiada. El sueño de Rodolfo se centra en generar con su negocio, la posibilidad de llevar a sus hijos a ser profesionales de éxito, aumentando sus utilidades a más de un 32%, mientras se recupera poco a poco de la pérdida de su esposa.
texts.en: Rodolfo is a widow living in the Carrizal neighborhood with his 4 children, aged from 12 to 33. He has established his shop, called “Tienda del señor Rodol” (Mister Rodol’s Shop), in this cheerful and caring community. Rodolfo has been a trader for 25 years, and he has been running his own shop for 5 years. He sells meals, groceries, drinks and common products for families. Rodolfo’s family is a very close-knit one, and he is surrounded by good neighbors, who have assisted him when recovering from the most difficult phases of his life, such as his wife’s death 8 months ago. Rodolfo works every day in his shop from very early in the morning till very late at night: this is why he is well known in the field, and this is his great strength. He is interested in making his activity grow, and for this reason he has requested his firs loans to the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo though a credikiva loan. He will use the loan to buy greater quantities of products such as rice, sugar, oil, canned food; he will take advantage of the fact that by purchasing large quantities he can buy at better prices, which in turn means he can offer more competitive prices to his customers; at the same time, he will be able to save through his credikiva loan, as he will obtain the loan at a suitable interest rate. Rodolfo drams of being able to offer his children the chance to become successful professionals thanks to his job, by raising his profits of more than 32%, while recovering little by little from the loss of his wife.

loans.use: To buy greater quantities of products such as rice, sugar, oil, canned food.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther is currently in a business of selling groundnut paste. She is 25 years old and married to a driver. They have two children, and both of them go to school. Esther borrowed a loan to stock more paste to sell. She hopes to expand her business with extra profits from her business in the future.

loans.use: to stock more paste to sell

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is a 22-year-old, hardworking man living in his own house in Fort Portal, Uganda. After failing to raise school fees for his education, he resorted to motorcycle riding and has been in service for a year. He has an ambition of buying his own motorcycle since almost 80 percent of his daily earnings have to be remitted to the owner of the motorcycle. Peter intends to use the credit facility to buy a motorcycle.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay wages for people weeding his plantations

loans.name: Faith

texts.en: Faith is a 35 year-old single mother of four children living in Kyenjojo, Uganda .After separating from her husband, she decided to venture into maize selling in order to provide for her children the basic necessities. Her future plan is buy a plot and build a food store, educate her children and build a house. Faith wants a loan to buy maize to resell.

loans.use: to buy maize to resell

loans.name: Stanley

texts.en: Stanley wants a loan to purchase furniture for his restaurant. He is a teacher by profession and has been in service for seven years .With the increasing demands of his family, Stanley realised his salary alone cannot sustain the family and he decided to set up a restaurant. However, he has a challenge of limited furniture as customers are increasing and his aspiration is to host at least 100 customers for a meal.  Stanley needs the loan in order to purchase furniture for his restuarant.

loans.use: to purchase furniture for his restaurant

loans.name: Fred

texts.en: Fred wants a loan to buy fertilizers for his tea plantation. He is a married man with four children living in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He is employed at the tea factory and he is also a farmer.  Due to the increasing demand of the factory on maintaining high quality tea, Fred has realised that it is important to use fertilizers to boost the plantation despite challenges in finances. His business desire is to own at least 100 acres of tea and supply to the leading factories.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for his tea plantation

loans.name: Ernest

texts.en: Ernest, aged 52 years-old, wants a loan to pay school fees for his child.  He lives in Kyenjojo, Uganda and is solely responsible for providing for the family. He is a farmer dealing in live mixed farming and this has enabled him to educate three of his children.  He desires to have an educated family and become a commercial farmer.

loans.use: to pay school fees

loans.name: Philomena

texts.en: Philomena is 59 years-old, she has seven children who are between the ages of 17-25 years-old. She owns a restaurant and sells beer and she has been doing this business for 17 years. She is requesting a loan to reinvest in her business and with the profits she plans to renovate her house.

loans.use: to reinvest in her restaurant and beer business.

loans.name: Shaban

texts.en: Shaban, aged 34 years-old, is a married man charged with the responsibility of taking care of his five children living in Kyenjojo, Uganda.Seventeen years back he started selling a cow per month but now he can buy and sell five cows in a week.  He dreams of buying and selling twenty cows per week and educating his children.  Shaban wants a loan to buy cattle for resell.

loans.use: to buy cattle to resell

loans.name: Deggo Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité DEGGO est créé depuis 1996. Il est composé de 13 femmes qui sont toutes du même village. Elles ont formé leur groupe par voisinage et par liens de parenté. Le groupe fait partie du Banc Villageois de BABACK.

Madame MBAYANG G. (debout à l’extrême gauche de la photo et levant la main) est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 53 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 10 enfants. 

Elle fait u petit commerce, elle vend précisément des poissons frais. Elle est la principale fournisseuse de poissons dans le village.

Le nouveau crédit de 200.000 francs CFA lui permettra de financer son activité de vente de poissons

Son objectif est de soutenir son mari dans la prise en charge de la famille en participant à la prise en charge de la nourriture et au payement des fournitures scolaires des enfants.
texts.en:
The solidarity group DEGGO was founded in 1996. It has 13 women members all from the same village. They have formed the group from among the neighborhood and among relatives. The group is a part of the Banc Villageois, BABACK.

Mrs. MBAYANG G. (the women on the left with her hand raised) is the leader of the group. She is 53 years old, married and has 10 children.

She has a small business of selling fresh fish. She is the main supplier of fish for the village.

The new loan of 200,000 CFA francs will allow her to finance her business of selling fish.

Her goal is to help her husband with the family expenses by paying for their food and for their children's school supplies.

loans.use: to purchase fresh fish

loans.name: Kamulikwizi Women Group

texts.en: Robert is a 41 year-old married man with three children and he owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. He has been dealing in electrical accessories for ten years.  He started with capital of 500,000 and now has 3,000,000 shillings. His hardship is bad debtors and his vision is to be the leading supplier of electrical accessories. He is a member of Kamulikwizi women group which literally means "Visionary" and each member has to guarantee the other to access a loan.  Robert intends to use the loan to buy phones, bulbs and chargers for sell.

loans.use: To buy phones, bulbs and chargers for sell

loans.name: Lilianne

texts.en: Lilianne is 29 years-old and she has three children aged between two and a half years and seven years-old.  She owns a capentry and sells sorghum and she has had this business for 8 years.  She is requesting a loan to buy more sorghum.

loans.use: to buy sorghum

loans.name: Alma Ileana

texts.es: Alma Ileana se dedica a la venta de mercadería en general, esta no es la primera vez que solicita créditos para su negocio. Inicialmente empezó con medio de ingreso necesario para su hogar, tiene 2 hijos a su cargo como toda madre responsable busca el trabajo diariamente para ofrecer el pan de cada día. Tiene más de 9 años en su actividad, por lo que siempre está al pendiente de lo que sus clientes solicitan. Este crédito es para la compra de camisas, faldas, pantalones, cosméticos, bolsos, calzado y perfumes. Sueña con establecer una tienda y mejorar su propiedad.
texts.en: Alma Ileana engages in selling general merchandise. This is not the first time she is requesting a loan for her activity. She started this activity to have an income to provide for her family, as she has 2 children in her care, and like every responsible mother she goes to work every day to provide them with the daily basic necessities. She has been running her activity for more than 9 years, and she is always keeps an eye on what her customers request. The loan she is requesting will be use to buy shirts, skirts, trousers, cosmetics, handbags, shoes and perfumes. She dreams of opening a shop and of improving her property.

loans.use: To buy shirts, skirts, trousers, cosmetics, handbags, shoes and perfumes.

loans.name: Jaqueline

texts.en: Jacqueline is 31 years-old and she has four children who are between the ages 1.6 months to 12 years. She sells several items including food stuffs such as Irish potatoes and she also sells goats. She is requesting a loan to buy food stuffs for her business and make more profits.

loans.use: To buy more food stuffs such as Irish potatoes.

loans.name: Jhimmy

texts.es: El señor Jhimmy trabaja como mecánico y tiene un pequeño taller donde arregla autos. El crédito lo requiere para la compra de herramientas de mecánica para el arreglo de movilidades, para ampliar su taller y atender a más clientes; así podrá mejorar sus ingresos . Vive en alquiler en la zona de Villa copacabana de la ciudad de La Paz; es soltero y no tiene hijos. Es primer crédito con IMPRO y KIVA.
texts.en: Jhimmy is a mechanic: he owns a small garage where he repairs cars. The loan he is requesting will be used to buy mechanical tools to repair vehicles, as well as to expand his garage in order to serve more customers and consequently increase his earnings. He lives in a rented house in the Villa Copacaban neighborhood of the city of La Paz; he is single and he has no children. This is the first cycle he is working with IMPRO and KIVA.

loans.use: To buy tools for his auto repair garage.

loans.name: Sop Mame Diarra Group

texts.fr:
le groupe de solidarité SOP MAME DIARRA est créé le 28 juin 2007. Il est composé de 15 femmes qui sont toutes issues du même quartier. Elles se sont regroupe par affinité et voisinage. Leur activité principale est le petit commerce. Le groupe fait partie du banc Villageois de MEDINA FALL1.

Madame Seynabou D. (debout à gauche de la photo et levant la main) est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 47 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 05 enfant. Des proches lui ont aussi confié la charge de leur enfants. 

Elle développe une activité de petit commerce. Elle vend de la friperie. Elle a une bonne expérience dans ce domaine d'activité pour l'avoir pratiquée depuis son adhésion dans le Banc Villageois.

Son nouveau crédit lui permettra de de renforcer son activité en achetant une quantité plus importante en friperie afin d'accroitre ses bénéfices. 

Son objectif est de renforcer ses épargnes, de soutenir son mari dans la prise en charge de la famille et de payer la scolarité de ses enfants
texts.en:
The solidarity group SOP MAME DIARRA was created on June 28, 2007. It is composed of 15 women from the same district. They have formed a group based on affinity and neighborhoods. Their principal work is in small-scale commerce. The group is part of the Banc Villageois of MEDINA FALL1.

Ms. Seynabou D. (standing at the left in the photo with her hand raised) is the group’s leader. She is 47 years old, married, and the mother of five children. Also, people near and dear to her have entrusted her with their children.  

Seynabou is developing a small-scale business. She sells used clothing. She has good experience in this business domain having worked at it since joining the Banc Villageois. Her new loan will enable her to bolster her business by buying a more significant quantity of second-hand clothing in order to grow her profits.

Her goal is to boost her savings, to support her husband in supporting the family, and to cover the costs of her children’s schooling.

loans.use: to buy second-hand clothing for resale

loans.name: Jean

texts.fr:
Jean S. est commerçant au marché plateau des 15ans, il est marié père de famille de 2enfants et un niveau bac.
Il vend de  l’huile  en détails depuis 110ans,/p>.
Par jour il vend minimum 25.000F et maximum 35.000F. il achète des bidon d’huile qu’il vends en litre, demi-litre et d’autres mesurettes pour que tout ses clients soient servi  
Le prêt va lui permettre d’augmenter son stock, il va acheter 5bidons d’huile, des lots de sachets d’emballage, 3entonnoires de différentes dimensions, 10bouteilles vides pour mesurer.
En vendant plus, ses revenus vont augmentés, il pourra réaliser ses ambitions et construire une maison pour sa famille.
texts.en:
John S. has been a merchant at the Plateau market for 15 years. He is married and the father of two children. He holds a bachelor’s degree. He has been selling oil at retail for 10 years. 

His daily sales range from 25,000 to 35,000F. He buys cans of oil to sell in liter, half liter and other formats, thus ensuring that all his customers get what they need.

The loan will allow him to increase his stock by buying five cans of oil, some packaging bags, three funnels in different sizes, and ten empty bottles for measuring. 

Increased sales will boost his revenues, which will help him to fulfill his ambition of building a house for his family.

loans.use: to buy cans of oil, packaging bags, funnels, and empty bottles (liter and half liter)

loans.name: Nuevo Diamante 1 & 2 Group

texts.en:
Evelis is the coordinator of the group Nuevo Diamante (New Diamond) 1 & 2. Her story is representative of both her group and of Esperanza's Haitian (many of whom have recently immigrated to the Dominican Republic) and Dominican clients. The group is based in Los Alcarrizos, a dusty industrial town north of Santo Domingo, where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable at best. Here she makes her home in a simple structure with her husband and three children.

Evelis has come to Esperanza with the goal of growing her business but, also, because it is a way of development for the community. She is not only interested in the money; she cares about the community. She operates a business where she sells household and beauty products. She is associated to a franchise. She sells those products and motivates others to join and go forward. 

With this loan she intends to increase her inventory. She believes that this will allow her to supply more clients (other businesses, households and salons) and to distinguish herself by always having what is needed in stock, while providing high quality products. She will use the profits to save and to address some needs in her family. In the long term she would like to continue growing her business with Esperanza to the point where she can sell more products, reach more clients, motivate others and eventually have enough profits to purchase her own home and to continuing helping her children. She especially wants to pay for their studies. Thank you so much for your support!

loans.use: to buy household products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy American rice, sugar, oil, flour, toilet paper, beans, dough, Nido brand formula, soy milk and laudry soap.

loans.name: Alain Francis Ludovic

texts.fr:
Monsieur Alain Francis est âgé de 30ans, célibataire avec 1efant de 8ans qui s’appelle Grâce. Avec son niveau 3em, il se lance dans la vente des divers au marché en 1993 avec un capital de 5000F.
Il vends des produits suivants :bissap, farine, huile végétale, sucre , levure, sucre vanillé, colorants, sachets pour sky et glaces, arômes, maïs pour pop corn.
Ses ventes journalières sont  comprises entre 40.000F et 75.000F.
Avec le prêt, il va renforcer son activité en achetant :
1sac de bissap, 1sac de sucre, 1bidon d’huile, 1carton de différentes senteurs d’arômes, 5paquets d’emballage, 5bocales de différentes couleurs de colorants, 1sac de farine, 1/2sac de maïs pour pop corn.
En voulant toujours resté dans ce commerce, il veut devenir fournisseur et vendre les sacs de bissap et le maïs.
En gros afin d’être capable de prendre un prêt plus important à l’avenir et s’occuper valablement de son fils Grâce.
texts.en: Mr Alain Francis is a single 30 year old with one eight-year-old son called Grâce. He attended school up to fourth grade of secondary school, and began selling miscellaneous products at the market in 1993 with starting capital of 5000F.  He sells the following products: hibiscus, flour, vegetable oil, vanilla sugar, flavourings, and corn to make popcorn. His daily revenues are between 40,000 and 75,000F. He is aiming to boost his business by buying: one bag of hibiscus, one bag of sugar, one can of oil, one box of various flavourings, five packs of wrapping, 5 jugs of food colourings, one bag of sugar, 1/2 a bag of corn to make popcorn.   He would like to remain in the same line of work by becoming a wholesaler and sell bags of hibiscus and corn. He would like to take a larger loan out in future and look after his son Grâce.

loans.use: To purchase bags of sugar, flour, corn, hibiscus, flavourings, and packs of baking flour and vanilla sugar

loans.name: Rubida

texts.es: Rubida, de 30 años, es una mujer sencilla y amable, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Frans de 33 años y sus 2 queridos hijos Yolida de 12 y Wilfredo de 9 años, a quienes desea brindar un mejor futuro. En la pequeña comunidad de Puerto Ipoki, Rubida ha pasado la mayor parte de su vida, desde muy niña aprendió la actividad familiar y es por eso que ahora se dedica al cultivo de plátano, cacao y café, trabajo que le ha brindado los ingresos necesarios para mantenerse. Todo lo cosechado, lo vende en el mercado de la ciudad de la Merced, que es donde mejores precios obtiene por sus productos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es sembrar sus tierras y lo hace con mucho esmero, lleva 3 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos hasta el mercado, ya que los transportes son muy escasos por su zona. Con el tiempo, desea comprar nuevas tierras, con el fin de incrementar su producción. Es el tercer crédito con MFP, ha sido muy puntual en sus créditos y espera serlo también ahora, en su banco comunal es muy activa y es muy querida por el resto de las socias. Con los ochocientos nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más abono y fertilizantes para sus chacras.
texts.en: Rubida, aged 30, is a modest and kind woman. She lives in her own house with her husband Frans, aged 33, and their 2 beloved children, Yolida, 12 and Wilfredo, 9 to whom she wants to offer a better future. Rubida has spent the greatest part of her life in the small community of Puerto Ipoki, where from a very young age she was trained in the family activity, and for this reason she now engages in growing plantain, cocoa and coffee, a job that has provided her with the income she needs to support herself. She sells all of her crops in the market of the town of Merced, because it’s there where she gets the best prices for her products. The part of her job she enjoys the most is sowing her lands, something she does with very carefully. She has been engaging in this activity for 3 years, and she thinks the most difficult task is to transport her products to the market, being as it is that there are few transportation means in her area. In time she wishes to buy more farmlands, in order to increase her production. This is the third loan she has requested to MFP: she has been very punctual with her loans and she hopes to do the same now. She is a very active member of her communal banks, and she is really loved by the rest of her teammates. With the 800 PE she requested she will buy more manure and fertilizers for her fields.

loans.use: To buy more bags of manure and more fertilizers

loans.name: Maria Mercedes

texts.es: Maria Mercedes es cliente de Fundación, pues ha sido un gran avance para su negocio. Maria es una mujer muy emprendedora que disfruta de obtener un medio de vida, a ella siempre le ha gustado trabajar arduamente y mejorar sus ingresos cada día más. Ella se dedica a la venta de bolsas, desde hace más de 16 años, que tiene este medio de vida ha logrado obtener lo necesario para su familia. El crédito que solicita es para la compra de materia prima como  bolsas, pequeñas, bolsas grandes, medianas y de todos los colores, pues la mayoría de sus clientes le solicitan una gran variedad.
texts.en:
Maria Mercedes is a client of the Fundación Leon which has been a great help for her business. Maria is a very enterprising woman who enjoys earning a living; she has always liked working hard and trying to increase her income with each passing day. 

For more than sixteen years, Maria has been in the business of selling bags -- a business that has allowed her to provide everything that her family needs. She is seeking a loan in order to purchase inventory of bags in an assortment of colors and sizes as her clients demand a great variety in her offerings.

loans.use: to purchase bags in an assortment of sizes and colors

loans.name: Agbegnidor

texts.fr: Monsieur  Agbegnidor  exerce comme activité génératrice de revenus la vente de matériaux de constructions.  Il a commencé depuis 1997 et s’approvisionne en gros au grand marché de Lomé. Ensuite il revend en détail dans un magasin à Nukafu. Il est très accueillant ce qui lui permet d’avoir plus de clients tous les jours. La demande est énorme et son stock ne pourrait couvrir toutes ces demandes, raison pour laquelle il sollicite un crédit pour se réapprovisionner. Il a 38 ans et père de 2 enfants. Il habite Djidjolé un quartier périphérique de Lomé.
texts.en:
Mr. Agbegnidor has a revenue-generating business selling construction supplies and equipment. He started it in 1997 and gets his supplies wholesale at the main market of Lomé. He then sells them retail in a store in Nukafu. He is very accommodating, and this enables him to have more customers all the time. The demand is enormous, and his stock of goods would not be able to meet the demand. This is why he is requesting a loan to stock up again. 

He is 38 years old and the father of two children. He lives in Djidjolé, an outlying district of Lomé.

loans.use: To buy construction equipment and supplies

loans.name: Fonk Sa Ligueye Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité FONK SA LIGUEYE est créé le 04 décembre 2007. Il est composé de onze femmes qui sont du même quartier. Elles ont des liens d'amitié très solides. Le groupe fait partie du banc Villageois de SANTHIABA SUD.
Madame MARETOU S. (debout à droite sur la photo avec une écharpe jaune) est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 55 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 03 enfants.

Elle fait du petit commerce. Elle vend des légumes. Elle pratique cette activité depuis plus de dix ans

Son objectif est de participer à la prise en charge des dépenses quotidiennes de la famille et de soutenir financièrement son mari
texts.en:
The solidarity group FONK SA LIGUEYE was created on December 4, 2007. It is composed of eleven women from the same district. Very solid friendships tie them together. The group is part of the Banc Villageois of SANTHIABA SUD.

Ms. Maretou S. (standing at the right in the photo and wearing a yellow scarf) is the group's leader. She is 55 years old, married, and the mother of three children. 

Maretou has a small-scale business selling vegetables. She has been in this business for over ten years. 

Her goal is to help cover day-to-day family expenses and to support her husband financially.

loans.use: to buy vegetables for small-scale businesses

loans.name: Santos

texts.es: Santos, de 64 años, es un hombre que siempre ha luchado por sobresalir en la vida, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa Natalia de 71 años y lo que más desea es trabajar muy duro para poder vivir junto a su esposa una vejez tranquila. Los largos días de trabajo que Santos tiene en sus chacras, le han hecho ver que tiene que trabajar muy duro para lograr una buena calidad en sus cultivos. Todas las mañanas, junto a los primeros rayos de sol, camina hasta sus chacras de café, plátano, yuca y fréjoles, las  cuales están a una hora aproximadamente Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cultivar sus tierras y lo hace con mucho esmero, lleva 44 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es fumigar sus tierras, por las sustancias que puede perjudicar su salud. En  adelante, espera comprar nuevas tierras para ampliar sus cultivos. Este es el cuarto crédito con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar sus cuotas puntualmente si desea acceder a otro crédito posteriormente. En su banco comunal, es un socio muy participativo. Con los trescientos nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más abono para sus cultivos.
texts.en: Santos is 64 years old. He is a man who has always striven to excel in life. He lives in his own house with his wife Natalia, 71, and what her desires the most is to work really hard in order to quietly spend his later years next to his wife. Santo's long working days in his fields have proven to him that he has to work really hard to obtain good quality products form his crops. Every morning, at the light of dawn, he walks for about an hour from his home to reach the fields where he grows coffee, plantain, yucca and beans. The part of his job he enjoys the most is farming his lands, something he does with very carefully. He has been engaging in this activity for 44 years, and he thinks the most difficult task is to spray his lands, because the substances he uses can compromise his health. In the future, he hopes to buy new farmlands in order to increase his crops. This is his fourth loan with MFP: he knows he has to promptly pay his dues if he wishes to be granted other loans in the future. He is a very participative member of his communal bank. With the 300 PEN he requested he will buy more manure for his crops.

loans.use: To buy more bags of manure.

loans.name: Mujeres En Desarrollo 3 Group

texts.en:
Clisiana is a 40-year-old borrower who lives near San Pedro de Macorís, Dominican Republic. She is the coordinator for her group, Mujeres en Desarrollo (Women in Development) 3, and her story is representative of the other borrowers in the group.

Clisiana and her fellow borrowers live in a Batey. Bateyes are small, rural communities built by sugar companies for their field workers. They are isolated, have no running water, and have unreliable electricity at best. Clisiana lives with her long-term partner and she has 4 children.

Clisiana runs a successful eatery which serves traditional Dominican foods (rice and beans, plantains, stewed chicken and beef) and also a Colmado (small food-grocery store). Clisiana says that she really enjoys working and loves the loans she has received from Esperanza. This is her 8th loan. After 4 years she decided to join this group.

She has a perfect repayment record so far and hopes to continue using the financial services available to her. Thank you for lending to Clisiana and the Mujeres en Desarrollo group 3!

loans.use: to buy stock such as rice, beans, canned meals, snacks and vegetables

loans.name: Kokouvi

texts.fr: Monsieur Kokouvi a 27 ans. Il est un résident du quartier Adidogomé et est née à Baguida un quartier populaire de Lomé. Il exerce comme activité la soudure.  Il a commencé en 2008 et s’approvisionne dans les zones environnantes de Lomé.  Il a son atelier non loin du bar Madibar et a beaucoup de demande à satisfaire, voilà pourquoi il demande un prêt pour acheter un poste aluminium pour pouvoir faire face à ces clients.
texts.en: Kokouvi is 27 years old. He lives in the Adidogomé district and was born in Baguida, a working-class area of Lomé. He has a welding business. He began this in 2008 and gets his supplies in the surroundings of Lomé. He has a workshop which is not far from the Madibar bar and has a lot of demand to satisfy. This is the reason he is requesting a loan in order to buy welding equipment for aluminium so he can meet customer demand.

loans.use: to buy welding equipment for aluminum

loans.name: Jeanne

texts.fr:
Madame Jean est une dame très dynamique et exerce comme activité génératrice de revenus la vente d’alimentation générale et diverse d’autres produits. Elle a commencé depuis 2009 son activité et revend dans une boutique non loin de la pharmacie djidjolé. Elle cherche à satisfaire tous ces clients, elle sollicite un crédit pour l’achat de 7 cartons de huiles patron de 1litre, 8 cartons d’eau minérale voltic, 5 cartons de boîte de sardine, 4 cartons de mayonnaise et 2 cartons de savon Fissi.
Mariée et mère d’un enfant, elle a 38 ans. Elle contribue aux charges ménagères avec son commerce.
texts.en: Madame Jean is a very dynamic lady and sells general food products for a living. She started in this field in 2009 and sells her wares from her shop near the Djidjolé pharmacy. In order to see to her customers' demands she is seeking a loan to purchase seven boxes of one litre bottles of oil, 8 crates of Voltic mineral water, 5 boxes of sardine tins, four boxes of mayonnaise, and two boxes of Fissi soap. She is 38 years old and  married with one child; she sees to the family's needs with the revenues from her business.

loans.use: to purchase various food products

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es: Sonia, de 39 años, es una mujer muy amable y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Augusto de 30 años y sus 5 queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. La actividad a la que Sonia se dedica es el cultivo de plátano, kion y café. Todos los días muy temprano por la mañana, comienza con el cuidado de sus chacras, ya que sabe que mientras más cuidadosa sea con sus cultivos, mejores productos obtendrá el momento de la cosecha. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es sembrar sus tierras y lo hace con mucha paciencia, lleva 9 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus cultivos hasta el mercado de la ciudad de Pichanaki, que es donde vende sus productos. Con el tiempo, espera comprar más tierras, para aumentar sus cultivos. Este es cuarto crédito con MFP, sabe que tiene que ser puntual en el pago de sus cuotas si quiere acceder a otro crédito en el futuro. En su banco comunal es una socia muy responsable, motivo por el cual es muy respetada por sus compañeras. Con los dos mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más abono y fertilizantes para sus cultivos.
texts.en: Sonia, aged 39, is a very kind and hardworking woman. She lives in her own house with her husband Augusto, aged 30, and their 5 beloved children, to whom, she wishes to offer a better standard of living. Sonia engages in growing plantain, ginger and coffee. Every day, from very early in the morning, she goes about taking care of her fields, as she knows that the more caring she is with her crops, the better products she will obtain when harvesting. The part of her job she enjoys the most is sowing her lands, something she does with great patience. She has been engaging in this activity for 9 years, and she thinks the most difficult task is to transport her crops to the market in the town of Pichanaki, where she sells her products. In time, she wishes to be able to buy more farmlands, in order to increase her crops. This is her fourth loan with MFP: she knows she has to promptly repay her dues if she wants to be granted other loans in the future. She is a very responsible member of her communal bank, and for this reason she is very respected by her fellow teammates. With the 2000 PEN she requested she will buy more manure and fertilizers for her crops.

loans.use: To buy more bags of manure.

loans.name: Bok Xalat Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité BOK XALAT est créé le 04 décembre 2007. Il est composé de 10 femmes issues du même quartier. Elles ont formé leur groupe par affinité et par proximité. Le groupe fait partie du Banc Villageois de SANTHIABA SUD

Madame FATMA THIOUBOU D. (debout à droite de la photo, vêtue de bleu avec une écharpe blanche) est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 59 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 09 enfants. 

Elle fait une petit commerce de produits divers. Elle achète des matelas et des chaises qu'elle met en location. Elle vend du gaz butane en bouteille. Elle fait un petit élevage de poulets de chaire et vend également des moutons. Elle a une bonne expérience dans ce domaine d'activité pour l'avoir pratiqué depuis environ cinq ans. 

L'objet de son nouveau crédit est l'achat d'une bâche pour la confection d'une tente qu'elle va mettre en location

Son objectif est d'augmenter son niveau d'épargne et de participer financièrement à la prise en charge de la famille
texts.en:
The solidarity group BOK XALAT was created on December 4, 2007. It is composed of ten women from the same district. They have formed their group based on affinity and proximity. The group is part of the Banc Villageois of SANTHIABA SUD.

Ms. FATMA THIOUBOU D. (standing at the right in the photo and dressed in blue with a white scarf) is the group’s leader. She is 59 years old, married, and the mother of nine children. She has a small business involving various goods. She buys mattresses and chairs and rents them out. She sells butane gas in bottles. She has a few chickens she raises for meat, and she also sells sheep. She has good experience in this activity, having worked at it for about five years. 

The goal of her new loan is to buy tarp for making tents, which she is going to rent out.

Her goal is to increase her savings and to help support her family financially.

loans.use: to buy mattresses, chairs, bottled butane gas, and tarp to make tents

loans.name: Teofilo

texts.es: Teofilo, de 40 años, es un hombre muy sencillo y trabajador, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa Ana de 50 años y sus 2 queridos hijos Luis de 15 y Daisy de 11 años, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. La actividad a la que se dedica Teofilo, es el cultivo de plátanos, cítricos y café, las extensas tierras que posee, lo han convertido en uno de los principales productores de la zona. Sus productos los lleva a vender hasta la ciudad de Pichanaki, donde ya tiene compradores esperándolo, ya que sus cultivos son de muy buena calidad. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cosechar sus tierras y lo hace con mucho empeño, lleva 16 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es cuidar sus plantaciones de las plagas que pueden afectarlas. En el futuro, desea comprar nuevas tierras, para ampliar su producción. Este es el tercer crédito con MFP, está dispuesto a pagar sus cuotas puntualmente y para eso ya está empezando a ahorrar. En su banco comunal es un socio muy alegre y siempre esta muy al tanto de los acuerdos a los que llegan en sus reuniones. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más abono para sus cultivos.
texts.en: Teofilo is 40 years old. He is a very modest and hardworking man. He lives in his own house with his wife Ana, aged 50, and their 2 beloved children Luis, 15, and Daisy, 11, to whom he wants to offer a better standard of living. Teofilo engages in growing plantain, citrus fruits and coffee. Thanks to the vast lands he possesses, he has become one of the main producers of the area. He sells his products in the town of Pichanaki, where he always finds awaiting customers, thanks to the very good quality of his crops. The part of his job he enjoys the most is harvesting his lands, something he does with strong determination. He has been engaging in this activity for 16 years, and he thinks the most difficult task is to protect his plantations from the pests that can infect them. In the future, he wishes to buy additional famrlands in order to increase his production. This is his third loan with MFP. He is willing to promptly pay his dues, and for this reason he has started saving. He is a very cheerful member of his communal bank, and he is always aware of the agreements that have been reached in his group. With the 1000 PEN he requested he will buy more manure for his crops.

loans.use: To buy more bags of manure.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock of pans and dishes

loans.name: Carlos Emilio

texts.es: Carlos Emilio se dedica a brindar el servicio de auto lavado. Su negocio está localizado en una calle donde es muy transitada, la mayoría de sus clientes se encuentran muy contentos ya que siempre Carlos les ofrece un buen servicio, siempre la ha gustado el trabajo y ganarse la vida de la manera más humilde.  Él le ayuda a su familia de forma económica,  este crédito es para aumentar capital de trabajo  como mangueras, barriles, aromatizantes, líquidos, spray entre otros. Sueña con mejorar sus ingresos para su actividad.
texts.en: Carlos Emilio engages in offering a car washing service. His yard is located along a very busy road. The majority of his customers are happy as Carlos always provides a good service. He has always enjoyed working and making a living with his work in the most humble way. He economically helps his family; he will use this loan to increase his working capital by buying hosepipes, barrels, car aromatizers, brake fluids and sprays among other products. He dreams of increasing the earnings of his activity.

loans.use: To buy hosepipes, barrels, car aromatizers, brake fluids and sprays.

loans.name: Yoni

texts.es: Yoni, de 33 años, es un hombre muy amable y trabajador, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa Elba de 28 años y sus 4 queridos hijos a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. En la provincia de Chanchamayo, se encuentran las chacras de Yoni, sus tierras son amplias y con los cuidados que les brinda las ha convertido en uno de los cultivos mejores trabajados del poblado, es por eso que cuando lleva a vender sus plátanos, yuca y café al mercado de la ciudad de Pichanaki, obtiene muy buenos precios debido a la buena calidad de sus productos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es sembrar sus tierras y hacerlas fértiles, lleva 16 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es cuidar sus cultivos de la plagas que pueden afectarlos. Con el tiempo, desea comprar más tierras en otros poblados para así aumentar su producción y variar sus cultivos. Este es el primer crédito con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagarlo puntualmente, si quiere acceder a otro crédito en el futuro. En su banco comunal es un socio muy responsable y siempre esta pendiente de los acuerdos a los que llegan en el grupo. Con los ochocientos nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más abono y fertilizantes para sus mejorar sus tierras.
texts.en: Yoni is 33 years old. He is a very kind and hardworking man. He lives in his own house with his wife Elba, 28, and their 4 beloved children to whom he wishes to offer a better standard of leaving. Yoni’s small farm is located in the Chanchamayo province: his lands are wide, and thanks to the care with which he tends to them they have become some of the best carefully worked crops of the area. This is why, his products being of a very good quality, he obtains very good prices when selling his plantains, yucca and coffee at the market in the town of Pichanaki. The part of his job he enjoys the most is sowing his lands and making them fertile. He has been engaging in this activity for 16 years, and he thinks that the most difficult part is protecting his crops from the pests than may infect them. In time he wishes to acquire more farmlands in other villages in order to increase he production and vary his crops. This is his first loan with MFP. He knows he will have to promptly repay his dues if he wants to be granted other loans in the future. He is a very responsible member of his communal bank, and he is always aware of the agreements that have been reached in his group. With the 800 PEN he requested he will buy more manure and fertilizers to improve his lands.

loans.use: To buy bags of manure and fertilizers.

loans.name: El Pedregal De Los Pinos Group

texts.es: El grupo D. nombre "EL PEDREGAL D. LOS PINOS" cuenta con 12 integrantes, cuyo nombre se tomo apartir D. la zona donD. ellas radican ya que es bastante pedregoza y a sus alrededores hay muchos pinos. La señora Maria Dolores G. es una D. las iniciadoras del grupo, es actualmente la tesorera tiene 37 años, casada, con 2 hijos 1 varon y 1 mujer, no tiene estudios, Ama D. casa y comerciante en venta D. tortilllas y crianza D. pollos. Inicio su hogar con un cuarto D. tabicon y lamina D. asbesto. Solicita el prestamo para invertir en la compra D. maiz para la elaboracion D. tortillas, y crianza D. pollos, y lograr el mejoramiento D. su vivienda. Se encuentra muy contenta por la oportunidad que se le esta brindando, tiene muchas espectativas para su negocio y su familia. Ella comenta que desea invertir en su negocio para posteriormente ahorrar y comprar un comal D. gas ya que ahora solo cuenta con uno D. leña y se le dificulta el ir a buscar la leña para cocinar sus tortillas. Con el credito pretenD. hacer crecer su negocio cada vez mas y asi obtener mas ingresos y mejorar su calidad D. vida y la D. su familia.
texts.en:
The group is called "EL PEDREGAL D. LOS PINOS" (The Rocky Area of the Pine Trees) and it has 12 members.  The members chose this name for their group because the area where they live is quite rocky and there are a lot of pine trees round about.

Maria Dolores G. was one of the women who started this group.  She is currently the group's treasurer.  Maria is 37 years old, married, and has two children: one son and one daughter.  She did not attend school.

Maria is a housewife who also sells tortillas and raises chickens.  She started her home with one room maD. from blocks and asbestos sheets.  She is requesting this loan to invest in buying corn to make tortillas and chickens to raise, and to improve her home.  She is very happy to have the opportunity that she is being offered.  Maria has a lot of goals for her business and her family.  She tells us that she would like to invest in her business so that she can then save and buy a gas 'comal' (special hotplate for cooking tortillas) since the one she has right now runs on firewood and it is difficult to go and look for firewood to cook her tortillas with.  Maria plans to use her loan to grow her business even more so that she can make more income and improve her family's quality of life as well as her own.

loans.use: to invest in corn and chickens for her business

loans.name: Reynaldo

texts.es:
El señor Reynaldo T. tiene ya más de tres años dedicándose a la reparación y ventas de llantas para automóviles.  
Al negocio le esta haciendo falta maquinaria mas moderna y mercancía, pero en esta momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para la inversión que su negocio requiere y no quiere descapitalizar el negocio ya que es la fuente de ingreso que tiene para su familia.
texts.en:
Reynaldo T. now has over three years of experience repairing and selling automobile tires.  The business needs a more modern machine and merchandise.  

However, he does not now have the money needed for the investment that his business requires.  He does not want to decapitalize the business because it is the source of income that he has for his family.

loans.use: to invest in machinery, equipment, and material for his business

loans.name: Isatu

texts.en: This is 49-year-old Isatu.  She is married and has 4 children aged 4, 7, 9 and 12. In 1985, Isatu established her food stuff business. She found it to be a means of self employment and a way to sustain her family. Working 6 days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about Le 350,000 every month. Isatu has already received and successfully repaid 1 loan, and now requires a new loan to buy more assorted food items by the carton. She would like a loan of Le 4,500,000. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 250,000. In the future, Isatu plans to open a bigger shop. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more assorted food items

loans.name: And Liggey Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité AND LIGGEY est né le 04 décembre 2007 a l'issu de l'inauguration du Banc Villageois de SANTHIAB. SUD qui l'abrite. Il est composé de 10 femmes qui sont issues du même quartier. Elles se sont organisées par affinité et par des liens de parentés.

Madame Khoudia Y. (debout à l'extrême droite de la photo, emmitouflée d'une écharpe verte) est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de  58 ans. Elle elle mariée et mère de 04 enfants. Elle a aussi la charge de ses quatre petits fils. 

Elle développe un petit commerce de légumes comme activité principale. Elle vend aussi de la crème glacée. Elle est vendeuse de légumes depuis environ six ans. 

Avec son nouveau crédit elle va renforcer activité en s'approvisionnement en quantité plus importante en légumes

Son objectif est de participer à la prise en charge de la dépense quotidienne de la famille et prendre en charge les frais scolaires de ses enfants.
texts.en:
The And Liggey solidarity group was created on 4th December 2007, following the inauguration of the Banc Villageois in SanthiaB. Sud, which serves as the group's base. It is made up of ten women who all come from the same neighborhood. They are all friends or relatives. 

Mrs. Khoudia Y. (standing on the far right of the photo and wrapped up in a green scarf) is in charge of the group. She is 58 years old, married and mother to four children. She also takes care of her four grandchildren.

As her main activity, she is building up a small vegetable business. She also sells ice-cream. She has been selling vegetables for around six years. With her new loan she is going to strengthen her business by getting a larger quantity of fresh supplies of vegetables. Her aim is to contribute to the daily running costs in her household and pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to buy baskets of vegetables for selling

loans.name: Yovana

texts.es: Yovana, de 21 años es una joven muy trabajadora y sencilla, vive en casa de sus padres y lo que más desea es trabajar muy duro para forjarse un buen futuro. La tienda de Yovana es una de las más visitadas en la comunidad de Puerto Ipoki, desde muy temprano por la mañana abre su tienda en espera de que sus vecinos lleguen a comprar las cosas que necesitan. Ella es una vendedora muy alegre y atenta, ya que siempre recibe a sus clientes con una sonrisa y esta dispuesta ayudarlos en sus compras. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus vecinos, lleva 1 año en este negocio y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer todo el día dentro de su tienda sin poder salir. Con el tiempo, espera poder ampliar su tienda y llenarla de más mercadería, para poder ofrecer a sus clientes una mejor variedad de productos. Es el segundo crédito con MFP y esta dispuesta a pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo, ya que no quiere causarle problemas a su banco comunal, donde es muy querida por el resto de sus socias. Con los dos mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más productos, para implementar mejor su tienda.
texts.en:
Yovana, age 21, is a very hard-working and unassuming young woman.  She lives in her parents’ house.  What she wants most of all is to work very hard in order to build a good future.

Yovana’s store is one of the most frequented in the Puerto Ipoki community.  She opens her store very early in the morning as she prepares for her neighbors to come and buy the things they need.  She is a very happy and attentive saleswoman.  She always receives her customers with a smile, and she is ready to help them with their purchases.  

What she likes the most about her work is talking with her neighbors.  She has had this business for one year.  The most difficult part is having to stay all day inside the store and not being able to leave.  In time she hopes to be able to expand her store and fill it with more merchandise.  This is to be able to offer her customers a greater variety of products.

This is her second loan with MFP.  She is prepared to make all of her payments on time.  She does not want to cause problems for her communal bank, where she is very well-liked by the rest of the members.  She will use the requested 2,000 soles to buy more products to better set up her store.

loans.use: to buy more products for her store

loans.name: Infonavit San Marcos Group

texts.es: El grupo se llama INFONAVIT SAN MARCOS porque el lugar en donde se reunen lleva ese nombre y las señora lo eligieron para que las ubicaran más rapido ya que el grupo lleva el nombre de su localidad, la señora Maria de Lourdes M. se dedica a vender peluches, mochilas y juguetes desde hace 10  años va a ocupar su credito para invertir en su negocio para tener variendad en su mercancia ya que se acerca la epoca donde ella vende mas, ella desea que su negocio sobre salga porque tiene la ilusion de que con sus ganancias pueda hacer crecer su negocio, así como brindarles a una mejor calidad de vida a su familia y apoyarlos con los gastos economicos y posteriormente lo que vaya ahorrando llevar a sus hijos de vacaciones ya que nunca han salido de viaje y le gustaria darle esa alegria a su familia.
texts.en:
This group is called 'INFONAVIT SAN MARCOS' because that is the name of the place where they meet.  The ladies chose this name so that they could be located more quickly since their group name is also the name of their neighborhood.

Maria de Lourdes M. has been selling stuffed toys, backpacks and toys for ten years.  She will use this loan to invest in her business so that she has a wider variety of merchandise since the time of year when she makes most sales is approaching.  She would like her business to do well because she believes that, with the profits, she can further grow her business and also provide her family with a better quality of life and support them financially.  Later she will be able to use the money she saves to take her children on holiday because they have never gone away anywhere and she would like to provide her family with this happiness.

loans.use: to invest in merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy pants, shirts, skirts, dresses and swimming costumes

loans.name: Aminata

texts.en: This is 31-year-old Aminata T..  She is married and has 3 children aged 7, 9, and 13 who live with her. She helps her husband to support the family.  In 2006, Aminata T. established her ready-made items business. She began her business to educate her children, buy land and help in the upkeep of the home. Working 6 days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about Le 250,000 every month. She would like a loan of Le 4,000,000 to buy more stock. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 300,000 . In the future, Aminata plans to buy larger volumes to supply to other traders  and to travel to neighboring Guinea for more profit. She is very determined. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to add more items to stock

loans.name: Cristobal Alfredo

texts.es:
Cristóbal de 37 años, es un hombre trabajador que tiene muchas aspiraciones de seguir ganando dinero por su familia. Empezó como taxista pero le robaron el carro entonces se cambio de actividad y se dedico hacer expreso escolar.

En la actualidad el trabaja desde muy temprano de lunes a viernes en la carrera de expreso  a personas particulares. Tiene muchas aspiraciones con su furgoneta por eso quiere seguir trabajando, por ahora quiere compran con el préstamo llantas y repuestos. En un futuro el desea comprarse otra furgoneta para seguir adelante y ayudar a su familia en lo que más necesite.
texts.en:
Cristóbal, 37 years old, is a hardworking man with many aspirations to continue making money for his family.  He began working as a taxi driver, but his car was stolen so he changed jobs and now works as an express school van driver.

Currently he works from very early in the morning Monday through Friday on the express route for private customers.  He has many aspirations with his van, and so he wants to keep working.  For right now, he wants to buy tires and repair parts with the loan.  In the future, he would like to buy another van so that he can continue moving ahead and help his family with the things they need most.

loans.use: to buy tires and repair parts

loans.name: Memunatu

texts.en:
This is 51-year-old Memunatu M.. She is married and has two children, aged 21 and 29 years. In the year 2000, Memunatu established her foodstuff business. She began her business as a means of contributing to the development of her family. Working six days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about 800,000 Sierra Leone Leones (Le) every month from this business. 

She would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,000 000. Memunatu has already received and successfully repaid one loan, and now requires a new loan in order to buy more food items for her business. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 300,000. In the future, Memunatu plans to buy larger quantities to supply to other traders. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more bag of groundnuts and onions for her business

loans.name: Jessenia Lucia

texts.es:
Jessenia de 24, es una joven emprendedora que desde niña su mama le enseño  la preparación de humita y fue entonces comenzar con este negocio para unas buenas ventas.

En la actualidad ella con la ayuda de sus hermanos salen a vender humitas diariamente. Lo que le afecta en su trabajo es la delincuencia por el sector. Con el préstamo ella quiere comprar un congelador y materia prima para la preparación de las humitas y así mejora en las ventas su negocio y en un futuro comprarse un terreno.
texts.en:
24 year old Jessenia is an enterprising young woman whose mother taught her to make humita (a dish similar to tamales) when she was young so she started this humitas business so she will have good sales. 
With the help of her siblings, she currently goes out to sell humitas every day. The crime in her neighborhood is one thing that affects her business. With the loan, she wants to buy a freezer and raw materials for making humitas and with these improve her business so that in the future she can buy land.

loans.use: to buy a freezer and raw materials

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more items for his ready-made items business

loans.name: Benno Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité BENNO est né le 04 décembre 2007. Il est composé de 07 femmes qui sont issues du même quartier. Elles sont nouées par des liens d'amitié et d'affinité. Le groupe fait partie du Banc Villageois de SANTHIABA SUD

Madame NDIAGNA D. (à droite de la photo avec une écharpe noir) est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 49 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 03 enfants. Elle a aussi la charge des 06 enfants de sa jeune sœur 

Elle vend de la bouillie de mil. Elle achète le mil, le transforme en farine avant de le préparer en bouille. Elle vend également dans son quartier des tissus et des chaussures qu'elle achète à la capitale (Dakar)

Son nouveau prêt lui permettra de financer ses activité de vente de bouillie et de petit commerce.

Son objectif est de prendre en charge sa progéniture et ses neveux tout en renforçant son niveau d'épargne dans le Banc Villageois
texts.en:
The Benno solidarity group was created on 4th December 2007. It is made up of seven women who all come from the same neighborhood. They came together through friendship and affinity for one another. The group is part of the Banc Villageois in Santhiaba Sud. 

Mrs. Ndiagna D. (on the right of the photo in a black scarf) is in charge of the group. She is 49 years old, married and mother to three children. She also takes care of her young sister's six children. 

She sells "bouillie" (a type of gruel) made out of millet. She buys the millet and makes it into flour before preparing the "bouillie". She also sells fabric and shoes in her neighborhood; she buys these in the capital (Dakar). 

Her new loan will allow her to finance her sale of "bouillie" as well as her other trading business. 

Her aim is to provide for her children and her nephews while at the same time building up her savings in the Banc Villageois.

loans.use: to buy millet in order to make "bouillie", and also to buy fabric and shoes

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
This is 50-year-old Mary K.. She is married and has five children, aged 7, 9, 13, 17 and 23 years. She has 15 additional dependents who live with her -- two are her parents, she helps in educating some and the others help in the business.  

In 2005, Mary established her essential drugs business. She began her business because she wanted to educate children, buy land and help with the upkeep of the home.  

Working six days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about 400,000 Sierra Leone Leones (Le) every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000. Mary K. has already received and successfully repaid one loan, and now requires a new loan in order to buy essential drugs and hire a pharmacist. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 300,000. 

In the future, Mary plans to buy larger quantities to supply to other traders and travel to neighboring Guinea for lower costs. She is very determined. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more essential drugs for her shop

loans.name: Pablina

texts.es:
Pablina forma parte del banco comunal “Con Esfuerzo se puede”, perteneciente a la ciudad de Concepción. Ella tiene un local establecido de comida rápida y máquinas de juego desde hace 4 años. Su horario laboral es de 11ºº de la mañana hasta la 01ºº de la madrugada. En el negocio de comida rápida se dedica a vender completos, papas fritas y productos de repostería. Además Pablina cuenta con el servicio de banquetería, ahí tiene la necesidad de contratar a jóvenes para el cargo de garzones, cuando los eventos son masivos. A ella le va muy bien en su negocio y tiene muchos clientes. 
Ella compra su mercadería en una distribuidora en la ciudad de Concepción. 
Con éste préstamo comprará una impresora, para decorar las tortas con imágenes y fotos de personas. Además comprará moldes o torres para tortas de novios, una cascada de chocolate, un horno eléctrico, moldes de galletas e ingredientes para sus productos. 
Su sueño es tener una empresa de banquetería. 
Pablina vive junto a sus dos hijas de 21 y 4 años de edad. Su hija mayor estudia kinesiología en la Universidad y la más pequeña está en la etapa pre- escolar. Sus motivaciones son poder brindarles a sus hijas un mejor bienestar económico.
Pablina está muy agradecida del crédito otorgado por Fondo esperanza, ya que con éste ha podido invertir en su negocio. Respecto a su grupo del banco comunal, ella se siente muy cómoda y contenta, ya que las reuniones son muy amenas. 
Concepción, está asentada en la desembocadura del río Bíobío, uno de los más grandes del país, al sur de Chile, en la región del Bíobío. Ha tenido una importante función en nuestra historia, siendo sede de importantes batallas y asentamiento relevante, especialmente durante la Guerra de Arauco, por estar en la frontera con territorio mapuche. Actualmente la ciudad posee un importante desarrollo económico y demográfico, llegando a ser considerada como uno de los núcleos urbanos, demográfico, administrativo, financiero y comercial más relevantes de Chile, después de Santiago y Valparaíso.
texts.en:
Pablina is part of the community bank called "With Effort We Can" which is in the city of Concepción." She has an established fast food and arcade game business and has been running this for 4 years. Her work hours are from 11 in the morning until 1am. In the fast food business, she sells hot dogs, french fries, and baked goods. She also has a catering business and she has to recruit young people to be waiters when she caters big events. The business is doing very well and she has many clients. 
She buys her supplies from a distributor in the city of Concepción.
She will use the loan to buy a printer to decorate cakes with pictures and people's photos. She will also buy molds or towers for wedding cakes, a chocolate fountain, and electric oven, cookie cutters, and ingredients for her products. 
Her dream is to have a full catering business.
Pablina lives with her two daughters, who are 21 and 4 years old. Her oldest daughter studies kinesiology at the university, and the younger girl is in pre-school. She is motivated by the desire to offer her daughters a better standard of living. 
Pablina is very grateful for the loan granted to her by Fondo Esperanza as she has been able to invest in her business. She is very comfortable and happy with her community bank group because the meetings are very enjoyable.
Concepción sits at the mouth of the river Bíobío, one of the biggest rivers in the country, at the south of Chile in the Bíobío region. The city has played an important role in our history, being the location of important battles and settlement, especially during the War of Arauco as it is on the frontier of the Mapuche territory. The city currently plays an important role in economic and demographic development and is coming to be considered one of the most important demographic, administrative, financial, and commercial of Chile, after Santiago and Valparaíso.

loans.use: to buy a printer for decorating cakes; molds, for wedding cakes; a chocolate fountain; an electric oven; cookie cutters, and ingredients.

loans.name: Adjo Donatienne

texts.fr: Madame Donatienne exerce comme activité la coiffure mais elle a associé les tresses et la vente des mèches et tissage.
