Elle a débuté depuis 2001 son activité et s’approvisionne au grand marché de Lomé  pour l’achat des produits pour les cheveux et à la direction Nina pour l’achat des mèches.  Elle est dynamique et fait de beaux cheveux à ces clients raison pour laquelle elle a beaucoup de clients de jours en jours. Elle demande un prêt pour acheter 3 boîtes de shampoing, 3 boîtes de basalme, 2 boîtes de gel et un séchoir.  Elle a 2 apprentis qui apprennent chez elle. Elle est mariée, avec son activité, elle arrive à participer au foyer.
texts.en: Donatienne works as a hairdresser, but she also does braids and sells hair weaves. She started her business in 2001. She buys her hair products from the big market in Lomé and her weaves from a company named Nina. She is dynamic and does hair really well, which is why her clientele gets bigger each day. She is asking for a loan to buy 3 bottles of shampoo, 3 bottles of balsam, 2 bottles of gel, and one hair dryer. Two trainees are learning the trade in her salon. She is married, and with her business, she is able to help her family financially.

loans.use: to buy shampoo, balsam, gel, and a hair dryer

loans.name: Fidélité Plus Group

texts.en:
Fidélité Plus is a 14-member loan group that is lead by a man named Jean. The members of this loan group are jointly liable for loans issued to them by Kiva to grow their businesses.

Jean is married, 48 years old and operates a general store in eastern Kinshasa. He started his business in 2001 by selling palm oil and has used five loans from Hope (a Democratic Republic of Congo microfinance program) to buy more items to sell to his customers. Because demand for his products is high, he will use his portion of this group loan to buy more items to sell to his customers and continue expanding his business. He earns about $240 a week and devotes most of his income to meet the needs of his eight children, who range in age from 9 and 24 years old. All of them are currently enrolled in school.

loans.use: to expand 14 small businesses

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more items to sell to her customers

loans.name: Kodzo Ameko

texts.fr: Monsieur Kodzo exerce comme activité la maintenance et l’informatique, mais il a associé la vente de portable, des ordinateurs et les accessoires  de l’ordinateur.  Il a commencé depuis 2001 son activité et s’approvisionne à la société NEACOM-PS. Ensuite il revend dans un magasin à Adidogomé à côté des frères franciscain. Pour pouvoir répondre à toutes les demandes, il sollicite un prêt pour acheter 10 portables, 10 claviers et un ordinateur. Il a 35 ans et père de 2 enfants,  grâce à cette activité il s’occupe financièrement de sa famille.
texts.en: Kodzo's main activity is computer maintenance, but he combines this with the sale of portables, computers and computer accessories. He began his activity in 2001 and gets his supplies from the company Neacom-PS. He then resells his goods in a shop in Adidogomé next to the Franciscan brothers. In order to respond to demand, he is requesting a loan to buy ten portables, ten keyboards and a computer. He is 35 years old and father to two children. Thanks to this activity he is able to look after his family financially.

loans.use: to buy portables, keyboards and computers

loans.name: Josefina De Jesus

texts.es:
Josefina de 15 años, es una mujer trabajadora que se inspiro en trabaja en ventas por catálogos de Yanbal por medio de su hermana que la incentivo que se inscribiera para mejorar su vida y la de su familia.

En la actualidad ella trabaja diariamente haciendo visitas a amigos y conocidos ofreciéndoles sus productos, realiza limpieza facial gratis y muestras de perfumes para obtener mayor volumen en las ventas.

Con el préstamo ella desea invertir en su mercadería la venta de perfumes para la mejora de su negocio. Una sus metas es llegar a ser Directora de Yanbal.
texts.en:
15 year old Josefina is a hardworking woman who was inspired by her sister to sell products from the Yanbal catalog so that she could improve her life and that of her family.
She currently works everyday, making visits to friends and acquaintances to offer them her products, give free facials, and demonstrate her perfumes so  that she will have a greater volume of sales.
She wants to use the loan to invest in more perfume supplies and improve her business. One of her dreams is to become director of Yanbal.

loans.use: to buy perfumes

loans.name: Isatu

texts.en:
This is 26 year-old Isatu K.. She is married, and has three children, ages 4, 7, and 12 years, who live with her. 

In 2007, Isatu established her plastic slipper business. She began her business because it serves as a means of employment. Working 6 days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about 300,000 Egyptian pounds (L.E.) every month. 

Isatu would like a loan in the amount of 3,000,000 L.E. in order to buy more stock for her business. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately 250,000 L.E. 

In the future, Isatu  plans to buy in larger quantities to supply to other traders. She also wants to open a shop and hire workers. She is very determined. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To add to business capital.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es: Carmen, de 42 años, es una mujer muy alegre y trabajadora, vive en una casa alquilada junto a sus dos queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindar una buena educación. Visitando a sus clientes en sus mismas casas, Carmen realiza la venta de sus productos de belleza, es una vendedora muy persistente y convincente, motivo por el cual termina con las ventas de sus cosméticos rápidamente. En la ciudad de Tarma es muy conocida y saben que los productos que vende son de muy buena calidad. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es aconsejarles a sus clientas sobre lo que mejor le quedará a su rostro, lleva 4 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es cobrar, por la venta de sus productos, ya que no siempre sus clientes tienen plata para pagarle, pero ella siempre se las arregla para que le paguen completamente todas sus ventas. En adelante, espera poner su tienda de cosméticos, donde pueda vender mas cómoda y sin la necesidad de ir casa por casa. Este es el décimo primer crédito con MFP, quiere hacer crecer su negocio, es por eso que desea pagar a tiempo todas sus cuotas para poder acceder a otro préstamo, además sabe que cuenta con el apoyo de su banco comunal. Con los dos mil quinientos nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más cosméticos, ya que últimamente esta teniendo una mayor demanda.
texts.en:
Carmen is 42 years old.  She is a cheerful and hard-working woman who lives in a rental house together with her two beloved children who she would like to provide with a good education.

Carmen sells beauty products and visits her customers in their homes.  She is a very persistent and persuasive saleswoman which means that she finishes her cosmetics sales quickly.  She is very well known in the city of Tarma and people know that the products she sells are very good quality.  What Carmen most enjoys about her work is advising her customers about what will work best with their skin.  She has been in this business for 4 years and considers the most difficult part of her work to be collecting payment for her products since her customers don't always have the money to pay her.  However, she always works things out so that they pay for their purchases in full.

In the future, Carmen hopes to set up a cosmetics store where she can make her sales more comfortably, without having to go from door to door.  This is her tenth loan with MFP.  She would like to grow her business which is why she will make all her repayments on time, so that she can access another loan in the future.  She also knows that she has the support of her community bank.  Carmen will spend the 2,000 Peruvian soles that she has requested to buy more cosmetics since she has had a lot of demand for them lately.

loans.use: to buy more cosmetics to meet her customers' demands

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more food items for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy basic grains, detergent, bread, juices, sodas, and snacks

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to build a concrete floor

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more drums of palm oil for her business.

loans.name: Begga Sa Bop Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité BEGGA SA BOP est né le 04 décembre 2007. Il est composé de 12 femmes qui sont issues du même quartier. Elles se sont organisées par affinité et par proximité. Le groupe fait partie du Banc Villageois de SANTHIABA SUD

Madame BINTA D. (assise sur la chaise à droite de la photo, emmitouflée avec une écharpe orange claire) est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 60 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 06 enfants. 

Elle fait de la transformation de fruits et légumes. Elle fait aussi un petit commerce de glace et de jus de fruits naturels.Elle pratique cette activité bien avant qu'elle n'adhère dans le Banc Villageois. 

Avec son nouveau crédit elle va acheter des fruits destinés à la transformation et la fabrique de jus de fruits naturels.

Son principal objectif est de renforcer son niveau d'épargne afin de faire l'extension de son activité
texts.en:
The Begga Sa Bop solidarity group was created on 4th December 2007. It is made up of 12 women who come from the same neighborhood. They came together through affinity and proximity. The group is part of the Banc Villageois in Santhiaba Sud. 

Mrs. Binta D. (sitting on the chair on the right of the photo and wrapped in a light orange scarf) is in charge of the group. She is 60 years old, married and mother to six children. 

She turns fruit and vegetables into other food products. She also has a small business selling ice and natural fruit juices. She has been carrying out this business since well before she joined the Banc Villageois.

With her new loan she is going to buy fruit which she will make into natural fruit juice. 

Her main aim is to build up her savings in order to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fruit and vegetables in order to make them into other food products

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es: Carmen, de 45 años, es una mujer que a lo largo de su vida siempre ha trabajado mucho por forjarse un buen futuro, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Florentino de 49 años y sus 2 queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindar una buena educación. La tienda de abarrotes de Carmen es una de las más visitadas de la ciudad de Tarma, desde muy temprano por la mañana abre su tienda en espera de que sus clientes lleguen a comprar las cosas que necesitan. Ella es una vendedora muy alegre y atenta, ya que siempre recibe a sus clientes con una sonrisa y esta dispuesta ayudarlos en sus compras. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus clientes, lleva 4 años en este negocio y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer todo el día dentro de su tienda sin poder salir. En adelante, espera poder hacer ampliar su tienda y llenarla de más mercadería, para poder ofrecer a sus clientes una mejor variedad de productos. Es el décimo primer crédito con MFP y esta dispuesta a pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo, ya que no quiere causarle problemas a su banco comunal, donde es muy querida por el resto de sus socias. Con los tres mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más productos, para implementar mejor su tienda de abarrotes.
texts.en: Carmen, 45 years old, is a woman who throughout her life has worked hard to forge a good future. She lives in her own home together with her husband Florentino, 49, and their two beloved children, whom they want to give a good education. Carmen's grocery store is one of the most visited in the city of Tarma.  She opens very early in the morning, waiting for the customers to come buy what they need. She is a very attentive and happy saleswoman; she always greets her customers with a smile and is always ready to help them with their purchases. What she likes most about her job is talking with her customers.  She has been in this business for 4 years and thinks the hardest part is having to be open all day long without being able to leave.  In the future, she hopes to be able to increase the size of the store and add more merchandise, so that she can offer her customers a better variety of products.  This is her 11th loan with MFP and she is ready to make all of her payments on time, since she doesn't want to cause problems for the village bank where she is very well liked by the rest of the members.  With the 3,000 nuevo soles that she has requested, she will buy more products so that she can better run her grocery store.

loans.use: to buy more products to better run her store

loans.name: Bénédiction Plus Group

texts.en:
Bénédiction Plus is a group of 18 owners of small businesses chaired by Réné. Its members are jointly liable for loans granted by Kiva to grow their businesses.

Réné M., 52, operates a general store while taking care of one brother-in-law. He is engaged. He is the father of five children who are between 2 and 11 years old. Three of them attend school.

Réné began his business in 1999. Réné has used seventeen Hope loans (a DRCongo Microfinance Program) to finance the expansion of his business. His store brings in a profit of $180 per week. 

Due to the high demand in his community, he intends with the next loan to buy more resale goods in order to meet client demand and generate additional profit. Réné’s ambition is to become a provider in his area. This loan will help him achieve his plans to grow the business.

loans.use: To purchase additional goods for his store for resale at a profit.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Musa Y.

texts.en:
This is 30 year-old Musa. She is married and has six children, aged 8 months, and 3, 6, 9, 12, and 15 years. 

In 1991, Musa established her cotton clothing business. She began this business because she believed she it would provide enough income to support her family. Working 6 days a week and 10 hours a day, Musa earns about 900,000 Leone (Le) every month. 

Musa would like a loan in the amount of 4,000,000 Le. in order to buy bales of cotton. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately 300,000 Le. In the future, she plans to buy in larger quantities to supply to other traders, hire salespersons, and open another stall. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy assorted cotton materials for his business.

loans.name: Martina B.

texts.en:
This is 43 year-old Martina B..  She is married and has 6 children, aged 3, 6, 9, 12, and 15 years. 

In 2006, Martina established her business selling household utensils and assorted items. She began her business because she wants to promote herself, husband and children. Working 6 days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about 700,000 Leone (Le) every month from this business. 

Martina would like a loan in the amount of 3,000,000 Leone in order to buy various food items by the carton. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately 350,000 Le.

In the future, Martina wishes to grow her business to the point of becoming a wholesaler. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy household utensils for her business.

loans.name: Dimbalante Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité DIMBALANTE est né depuis 1996. Il est composé de 13 femmes qui habitent des quartiers différents mais qui se réunissent tous les mois pour les activités du Banc Villageois. Elles sont très soudées et partagent le même centre d'intérêt qui est le développement de leur terroir. Le groupe fait partie du Banc Villageois de WANGO

Madame KINE F. (debout à gauche de la photo, levant la main) est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 57 ans. Elle est veuve et mère de 06 enfants.

Elle fait de l'élevage de poulets de chaire. Elle est très expérimentée dans ce domaine pour l'avoir exercé pendant environs cinq ans.

Son nouveau crédit lui permettra d'acheter 500 poussins, de l'aliment pour volaille et des produits vétos. 

Son objectif est de participer à la prise en charge de la dépense quotidienne de la famille, d'augmenter son épargne et de subvenir à ses besoins personnels.
texts.en:
The Dimbalante solidarity group was created in 1996. It is made up of 13 women who live in different neighborhoods but who meet every month for Banc Villageois activities. They are very close and share the same core interest which is the development of their local produce. The group is part of the Banc Villageois in Wango. 

Mrs. Kine F. (standing on the left of the photo and raising her hand) is in charge of the group. She is 57 years old, a widow and mother to six children. 

She raises chickens and is very experienced in this field, having carried it out for around five years. 

Her new loan will allow her to buy 500 chickens, food for them and veterinary products.

Her aim is to contribute to her family's daily outgoings, increase her savings and provide for her personal needs.

loans.use: to buy 500 chickens, food for them and veterinary products

loans.name: Najah

texts.en:
Najah is a young woman from Ramallah. Her family owns a number of storerooms that they rent out as space for others to store their goods. Najah and her brothers started a tailoring project using an old machine they had in their house.

Najah took out a loan from FATEN to buy a new machine that is faster so as to increase production, and she also wants to rent a small store so she can move the tailoring activity from the room in their house where they work now to the store she will rent.

Najah's brother appears in the picture here as she is a conservative woman.

loans.use: to rent a space to start a tailoring workshop

loans.name: Cissy

texts.en:
Cissy K. lives in the Ndeeba neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has three children, all of whom are in school.  


Cissy has a business selling clothes. She has been in this business for less than one year, and she works seven days out of every week. Cissy sells her products in a shop by means of wholesale and retail. Cissy has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bales of second-hand clothes.

The main business challenges for Cissy are transportation and the rainy season. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start importing bales of clothes herself. Cissy lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity but doesn't have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include paying utility bills, school fees, and food.

loans.use: To buy more bales of clothes.

loans.name: Takku Ligguey Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité est créé le 28 juin 2007. Il est composé de 15 femmes qui sont issues du même quartier. Elles se sont constituées en groupe par affinité et par des liens d'amitié. Le groupe fait partie du Banc Villageois de MEDINA FALL1 

Madame NOGOYE S. (debout au milieu du groupe, levant la main et mise en médaillon) est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 46 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 07 enfants en charge. 

Elle développe un petit commerce de poisson frais, de tissus et d'encens. Elle pratique cette activité depuis environs cinq ans

Son nouveau crédit lui permettra de financer son activité de petit commerce

Son objectif est de prendre en charge le payement du loyer et des frais scolaires de ses enfants. Elle partice financièrement à la prise en charge de la famille
texts.en:
The solidarity group was created on 28th June 2007. It is made up of 15 women, who come from the same neighborhood. They set up the group as a result of affinity and friendship for one another. The group is part of the Banc Villageois in Medina F. 1.

Mrs. Nogoye S. (standing in the middle of the group, raising her hand and shown in the inset) is in charge of the group. She is 46 years old, married and mother to seven children, who are in her care. 

She is building up a small business selling fresh fish, fabric and incense. She has been carrying out this business for around five years. Her new loan will allow her to finance this small trading business. 

Her aim is to be able to pay the rent and her children's school fees. She contributes to her family's expenses.

loans.use: to purchase fresh fish, incense and fabric for selling

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah N. lives in the Ndeeba neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has four children, all of whom are in school.  Sarah lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and has access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include paying utility bills, rent, school fees, and food.   

Sarah owns a bar. She has been in this business for 10 years, and she works 7 days out of every week. Sarah sells her products in a shop by means of wholesale and retail. She also generates additional income. The main business challenges for Sarah include the rainy season and thieves. 

Sarah has requested a loan of 1,000,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more crates of beer and jerrycans of local gin. Her goal for her business is to own a fully-stocked bar.

loans.use: To buy more crates of beer and jerrycans of local gin.

loans.name: Edwin Oscar

texts.es: El sr. Edwin, vive la zona del cementerio, vive en casa de un familiar trabaja en la  línea de  minibuses de sacaba  trabaja de lunes a sábado los domingos se dedica a su familia a compartir con ellos eso es lo que mas le gusta al Sr. Edwin compartir con su familia, el préstamo lo destinara para la refacción del  domicilio ya que su familia vive hace varios años en esa casa , tiene dos hijos en colegio uno de ellos este año sale bachiller muy orgulloso de sus hijos, su esposa vende  api con pasteles en las noches frente al templo de la zona, su sueño de don Edwin  es juntar dinero para la compra de un terreno y así tener su propia casa y brindar mejor comodidad a su familia, es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable que esta agradecido con la institucion por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Señor Edwin lives in the cemetery zone.  He lives with relatives and works in the minibus line.  He works Monday through Saturday and on Sundays he spends time with his family, his favorite thing to do.  He will use the loan for home renovations since he has lived with his family for several years in this house.  He has two children that are attending school and one of them will graduate high school this year.   He is very proud of his children.  His wife sells api [a beverage made from corn] with pastries at night in front of the church in their area.  His dream is to put together enough money to buy a piece of land and to have his own house to make his family more comfortable.  He is a very hard-working and responsible person and is grateful to the institution for their support.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials for home renovations.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy melons, watermelon, tomatoes, onions, mangoes and other produce.

loans.name: María

texts.es:
María forma parte del banco comunal “Las Pergoleras de Linares”, perteneciente a la ciudad de Linares. Ella se dedica a la producción y venta de empanadas, desde hace 8 años, su horario laboral es de lunes a viernes. Sus clientes son los comercios establecidos y particulares, que solicitan sus empanadas a pedido, sin embargo también vende en su domicilio. Los fines de semana, ella conduce un taxi colectivo como medio de transporte, desde hace 6 años y su horario laboral es por las noches. 
Su mercadería la compra en supermercados mayoristas, todo lo que son ingredientes. 
Con éste préstamo comprará ingredientes para su producción de empanadas.
Su sueño es establecerse en un local con una amasandería. 
María vive junto a su hija de 21 años de edad y su nieto de 4 años. Su hija estudia Técnico en enfermería y su nieto cursa el pre kinder. Sus motivaciones son poder brindarle a su familia un mejor bienestar económico.
María está muy contenta y agradecida del crédito otorgado por Fondo esperanza, ya que con éste podrá invertir en su negocio. Respecto a las reuniones con su banco, ella se siente muy cómoda, ya que estas son muy amenas. 
Linares es un importante centro urbano de la región del Maule, ubicado en la zona centro del país. En esta zona se desarrolla de manera importante la producción agrícola y también vitivinícola sobresaliendo en el ámbito de las exportaciones. Destacan los cultivos de cereales (arroz, trigo, maíz y avena), hortalizas (remolacha, repollo, lechuga y acelga y legumbres) y frutas. Linares es la principal provincia productora de arroz, en Chile; de hecho, el 78% de la producción nacional de este cereal se da en esta provincia, especialmente en la comuna de Parral.
texts.en:
María is a member of the communal bank "Las Pergoleras de Linares" in the city of Linares.  She has been making and selling empanadas for 8 years  and works Monday through Friday.  Her customers are the individual established businesses that order her empanadas, however, she also sells them from her house.  On weekend nights she drives a shared taxi and has been doing this for 6 years.  She buys her ingredients at the wholesale supermarket and will use the loan to buy ingredients to make empanadas. 

Her dream is to have a local with a bakery.  María lives with her daughter who is 21 years old and her grandson who is 4.  Her daughter is studying to be a nurse technician and her grandson goes to preschool.  She wants to be able to better provide for her family financially.  María is very happy and grateful for the loan granted by Fondo Esperanza as she will be able to invest in her business.  María is very comfortable at her communal bank meetings since they are very entertaining.  

Linares is an important urban center in the Maule region, located in the center of the country. In this area they have  developed their agricultural and wine production significantly, most notably their exports.  Their major crops are grains (rice, wheat, corn and oats), vegetables (beets, cabbage, lettuce, chard and legumes) and fruits.  Linares is the leading province for rice production in Chile; in fact, 78% of the national rice production is in this province, especially in the town of Parral.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients to make empanadas.

loans.name: G.s. Manos Unidas Group

texts.es: La señora Flor de Maria se dedica a su negocio que es la venta de nacatamales y cosas de horno. Obtiene ingresos adicionales en su familia del ingreso de su esposo que trabaja como albañil por cuenta propia. El préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de materia prima para la elaboración de nacatamales, no tiene mucha competencia ya que vende de manera ambulante. Su próximo paso es establecer una venta de fritangas en su casa, pretende lograrlo con ahorros obtenidos de las ganancias del préstamo. En un futuro continuara invirtiendo en su negocio en la compra de cerdos. Marta Lizette tiene 37 años de edad, es casada, su esposo es chofer de un microbús. El obstáculo más grande ha sido la venta y elaboración de pan. Invirtió el crédito en la compra de harina, huevos, mantequilla, queso, bolsas,  entre otros.
texts.en:
Flor de Maria works at her business that sells nacatamales and baked goods.  She wants to earn additional income for her family to add to her husband's.  He works as a self-employed bricklayer.  

The loan will be invested in the purchase of materials to make nacatamales.  She does not have much competition because she sells her products on the street.  Her next step is to establish a fried snack stand at her home.  She plans to do this with the savings from the income from the loan.  In the future, she will continue investing in the business of purchasing pigs.  

Marta Lizette is 37 years old, married, and her husband drives a minibus.  The biggest obstacle she faces is the sale and making of bread.  She will invest the loan in the purchase of flour, eggs, butter, cheese, and other items.

loans.use: to buy flour, eggs, butter, cheese, and other items.

loans.name: Harutyun

texts.en: Harutyun lives with his wife (a teacher), his retired parents, and two school-aged children.  Since 2002 he has owned a clothing shop in Hrazdan, Armenia,  which he manages on the weekends.  Harutyun imports clothing and shoes from China. He has applied for a loan to ensure that he has enough inventory for the upcoming busy months. He hopes that his business will do well and will attract more customers.

loans.use: stock up on shoes and clothing to sell in his shop

loans.name: Lizett Gabriela

texts.es: La señora Lizett se dedica al comercio de vajillas edredones, sabanas, juegos de ollas y otros, deja su mercadería a crédito como también al contado trabaja desde hace tres años en el rubro va de casa en casa de oficina en oficina ofreciendo sus mercadería, ella ya tiene muchos clientes , su esposo se dedica a trabajar como promotor, viven en domicilio de propiedad de su madre, tiene una niña de cinco años, solicita el crédito para capital de trabajo y compra de mercadería como edredones ya que actualmente tiene mas mercadería que entrego a crédito y le falta capital para la compra de mas mercadería, ella es un apersona joven y muy trabajadora que esta agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Mrs. Lizett sells dishes, comforters, sheets, sets of pots and pans, and other things. She sells her merchandise on credit as well as by special order. She has been working in this line of business for three years. She goes from house to house, office to office, offering her merchandise. She already has many clients. Her husband works as a promoter, and they live in a home that her mother owns. She has a five-year-old daughter. She is requesting the loan for working capital and to buy merchandise such as comforters, because currently she has more merchandise that she delivered on credit, and she lacks the capital to purchase more merchandise. She is a young, hard-working person who is grateful to the organization for its support.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise such as comforters

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty B. lives in the Ndeeba neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is single and has four children, all of whom are in school. Betty lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include paying utility bills, school fees, and food. 

Betty has a business selling second-hand  clothes. She has been in this business for four years, and she works seven days out of every week. Betty sells her products in a shop by means of wholesale and retail. Her main business challenges include the rainy season and thieves. 

Betty has requested a loan of 1,000,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bales of second-hand clothes. Her goal and aspiration for her business is to sell wholesale only.

loans.use: To buy more bales of second-hand clothes.

loans.name: Don Bosco Group

texts.es:
Paulina es una madre soltera quien tuvo la gran responsabilidad como madre de criar a cinco hijos de los cuales uno es dependiente de ella. Paulina empezó a vender desde muy joven a fin de apoyar en un inicio a su pareja, luego con el tiempo esta persona buscó otro hogar, pero no siendo impedimento para ella pues el vender gaseosas, queques, chupetes, ropa le ayudó mucho para mantener a su familia con los gastos. Posteriormente mejoró su capital que invirtió luego en mercadería de frutas en su pequeño triciclo que le regalaron y lo ofrecía en la zona donde vive; aunque muchas veces tuvo que viajar conseguir sus ventas; lamentablemente enfermó poco después tuvo que dejarlo este negocio y comenzar de nuevo en otro esta vez compró pequeñita mercadería de gaseosas, detergentes, leche y arroz en un pequeño espacio donde vive. Muy esforzada y empeñosa llegó a surtir su kiosquito ubicado a una esquina de su casa; no es así que también trabaja como personal de limpieza en casas además de lavado de ropa. Aunque el dar educación escolar a sus cinco hijos ha sido una de sus metas y espera culminar con su último hijo termine el colegio. Invertirá este préstamo en abarrotes como azúcar, leche, fideos, arroz y gaseosas pues es lo que necesita.
Tener una casa propia en su más grande sueño e instalar una tiendita surtida, pues ella es guardiana de una vivienda hace años. Se siente feliz por el apoyo que brinda los prestamistas Kiva a personas pequeñas como ella pero con muchas ganas de salir adelante. Paulina es la persona que viste de polo amarillo con un bolso rojo.
texts.en:
Paulina is a single mother who had the great responsibility as a mother of raising five children, one of which is dependent on her. Paulina began to sell things when she was very young, originally in order to support her partner. Later, over time, this person looked for another place to live, but this was not an obstacle for her, because selling soda, cakes, pacifiers, and clothing very much helped her support her family with their expenses. Later she improved her capital, which she then invested in a supply of fruit on her little tricycle that was given to her, and she offered it in the area where she lives, although many times she had to travel to make her sales. Sadly, she got sick a little later and had to give up this business and start over with a different one. This time she bought a small supply of soda, detergents, milk, and rice in a small space where she lives. Very diligent and hardworking, she put up her kiosk in a corner of her house. She also works as a housekeeper in addition to washing clothes. Providing school education to her five children has been one of her goals and she hopes to reach it when her last child finishes high school. She will invest this loan in groceries such as sugar, milk, noodles, rice, and soda because that is what she needs.
Having her own house is her greatest dream as well as setting up a small, well-stocked store, given that she has been the guardian of a house for years. She is happy for the support provided by the Kiva loans to small people such as herself who really want to get ahead. Paulina is the person wearing a yellow shirt with a red purse.

loans.use: to buy sugar, milk, noodles, rice, and soda

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy bags of manure and to hire laborers to help her with the sowing.

loans.name: Trabajadoras De Señor De La Cruz Group

texts.es:
La Asociación Comunal   ”TRABAJADORAS DEL SEÑOR  DE LA CRUZ”, está iniciando su primer ciclo en el Centro Focal de Los Andes.  Esta asociación comunal cuenta con la participación de once  integrantes.  La  mesa directiva tiene como presidenta a la señora Wilma, como tesorera a la señora Clementina y como secretaria de actas a la señora Eugenia. Los negocios de las señoras son diferentes, entre ellos tenemos comercio, producción y servicio; ellos son: tejido de chompas, elaboración de mantas, costura de deportivos, venta de ropa, compra de máquina de tejer, negocio de chompas, tejido de buzos, venta de verduras, confección de faldas, tejido de awayos.
La presidenta, la señora Wilma es una mujer joven de 29 años de edad, casada y madre de dos hijos.   Esta es su primera experiencia en el trabajo con asociaciones comunales.
Desde hace cuatro años su negocio es el tejido artesanal, aprendió de su familia.    Con el monto de crédito solicitado piensa comprar lana y producir en cantidad, no poco a poco como sucede cuando no se cuenta con un buen capital.
Cuando le consultamos qué es lo que más le gusta de Pro Mujer, la señora Wilma    responde  “todo”.
texts.en:
The “Workers for the Man on the Cross” Community Association is beginning their first loan cycle in the “Focal Center of the Andes”. This community association has eleven members. Mrs. Wilma is the president, Mrs. Clementina is the treasurer, and Mrs. Eugenia is the secretary.  The businesses that the female members own are all different. Among them are commercial, manufacturing and service oriented businesses. The types of businesses include: knitting sweaters, making shawls, sewing sport’s clothes, selling clothes, buying sewing machines, selling sweaters, knitting tracksuits, selling vegetables, sewing skirts, and weaving traditional women’s shoulder cloths. 
The president, Mrs. Wilma, is a young woman of 29 years. She is married and has two children. This is her first experience working with a community association. For the past four years she has been knitting folk art, a tradition she learned from her family. With the loan money she is requesting she will buy wool in order to increase her production of folk art. Currently she makes her items little by little, which she has to do, as she doesn’t have enough working capital. 
When asked what she likes the most, Wilma responded, “Everything”.

loans.use: To purchase wool wholesale in order to improve her production.

loans.name: Edita

texts.en: Edita has been managing a clothing shop since 2007. She lives with her husband, his parents, and her 3-year-old daughter.  Edita is currently pregnant. She imports clothing from other countries to sell in her shop.  Edita has applied for this loan in preparation of the busy spring season.  She  hopes to attract new customers and keep repeat customers happy with new fashionable inventory.

loans.use: to stock new clothes to sell in her shop

loans.name: Levon

texts.en: Levon is an agricultural economist by trade. He lives with his wife, parents and his two young children.  He has been run a family business since 1995.  Levon buys cattle at the beginning of the year when they are cheaper and sells them during New Year's for a profit.  Levon has applied for this loan to purchase equipment for his farm and food for the cattle.

loans.use: purchase equipment for his farm and food for his cattle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy tables and chairs to open a restaurant

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence S. lives in the Nsooba neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is widowed and has 12 children, 8 of whom are in school. Florence lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include paying utility bills, school fees, and food. 

Florence owns a bar. She has been in this business for 10 years, and she works 7 days out of every week. Florence sells her products from home by means of wholesale and retail. She also generates additional income through rental rooms. The main business challenges for Florence include the rainy season and defaulters. 

Florence has requested a loan of 1,000,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more crates of beer and jerrycans of local gin. Her goal and aspiration for her business is to own a fully-stocked bar and also to educate her children to university level.

loans.use: To buy more jerrycans of local gin and crates of beer.

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en: Aisha N. lives in the Kitawuluzi section of Kampala, Uganda.  She is widowed and has two children, both of whom are in school. She also takes care of additional family members, including several grandchildren. For the last five years, she has made a living by working seven days a week to sell bananas and sweet potatoes. She is applying for a loan for 1,200,000 Ugandan Shillings to buy more bananas and sweet potatoes to sell to her customers. Aisha earns additional income by selling food that she has cooked. Her main challenges are transportation and customers who fail to pay their bills. Her goal is to start buying goods directly from farmers and selling those goods in wholesale markers. She lives in a home that she owns and has access to electricity and piped-in water.  Her major monthly expenses are utilities, school fees and food.

loans.use: To buy bananas and sweet potatoes to sell to her customers

loans.name: Compartimos Group

texts.es:
El grupo Compartimos está conformado por tres mujeres trabajadoras, esforzadas y emprendedora una de ellas es Sugey Martínez de 30 años tiene una pequeña venta que inicio con la venta de dulces desde hace 2 años. Ella con el crédito compra arroz, azúcar, frijoles, aceite, jabón, etc.
Las otras integrantes del grupo son la joven Diana O. de 21 años quien vende ropa de paca y María Teresa Martínez  quien vende baho comida típica que se hace al vapor y lleva Yucas, Plátanos Verdes, Plátanos Maduros, Carne de Res (Cecina), Tomates, Dientes de Ajo, Cebolla, Agrio de Naranja, Hojas de Plátano y una ensalada de repollo
texts.en:
The Compartimos Group (“Let’s Share” Group) is composed of three hard-working, strong and resourceful women. One of them is Sugey Martínez, aged 30, who runs a small activity she started 2 years ago by selling sweets. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy rice, sugar, beans, oil, soap and other products.
The other members of the group are young Diana O., aged 21, who sells clothes made of spotted cavy’s skin, and Teresa Martínez, who sells baho (a typical dish made of yucca, plantains, bananas, jerked beef, tomatoes, garlic cloves, onion, orange juice, steamed under plantain’s leaves and served with a cabbage salad).

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, beans, oil, soap and other products.

loans.name: Katty Elizabeth

texts.es:
Katty de 28 años, es una mujer trabajadora que tiene su taller elaboracion de cama a base de madera. anteriormente la ayudaba su ex esposo pero ahora se dedica al 100%.

Ahora ella tiene tres personas que la ayudan en la fabricación de camas. Trabaja diariamente de 9:00 am a 8:00 pm. Lo que le afecta en el trabajo es la competencia ya que la mayoría son hombres y en ocasiones hay escases de la madera.

Con el préstamo quiere comprar  parrillas, tablones, cabeceras para la fabricación de las camas. Lo que más anhela que su negocio crezca y mejorar su vivienda para así darle lo mejor a sus hijos en lo que más necesite.
texts.en:
Katty is 28 years old.  She is a hard-working woman who has a workshop where she makes wooden beds.  Previously, her ex-husband used to help her but now she works in the business 100%.

Katty has three people who help her to make her beds.  She works from 9.00am to 8.00pm every day.  What affects her in her work is the competition since most of them are men and also sometimes there are shortages of wood.

Katty would like to use her loan to buy metal grills, planks and headboards for making her beds.  What she most desires is for her business to grow and to improve her home so that she can provide her children with the best as regards what they most need.

loans.use: to buy planks, metal grills and headboards for making beds

loans.name: Gagik

texts.en: Gagik is an economist by trade but his family's income comes from his food shop. Gagik lives with his wife, also an economist, his parents (a teacher and a bus driver), and his two young children.  Gagik has applied for this loan to purchase food items to sell in his shop.

loans.use: stock his grocery store

loans.name: Edy

texts.es: Edy, de 32 años, es una mujer muy alegre y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Sergio de 46 años y su querido hijo Geremi de 11 años, quienes son el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos. La panadería “La Estancia” de la ciudad de Tarma, es el lugar donde Edy trabaja todos los días, con mucha habilidad decora los pasteles que serán puestos a la venta, ya que tiene mucha creatividad y buen pulso para adornar las tortas. Paralelamente a esta actividad, también tiene una piñateria, la cual a dejado un poco de lado, por falta de materiales para la elaboración de sus productos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es decorar los pasteles, ya que se divierte mucho haciéndolo, lleva 6 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que cumplir con todos los pedidos que hacen a la panadería. Con el tiempo, espera poder mejorar su piñateria, para así sacar adelante su negocio propio. Este es el segundo crédito con MFP, sabe que tiene que ser puntual en el pago de sus cuotas si quiere acceder a otro crédito en el futuro. En su banco comunal es una socia muy responsable, motivo por el cual es muy respetada por sus compañeras. Con los mil doscientos nuevos soles solicitados, comprará materiales, para implementar mejor su piñateria.
texts.en:
Edy is 32 years old.  She is a very cheerful and hard-working woman who lives in her own home together with her husband, 46 year-old Sergio, and her beloved son, 11 year-old Gerimi, who are the motivation behind all her efforts.

'La Estancia' bakery in the city of Tarma is where Edy works every day.  With a lot of skill she decorates the cakes that will be put on sale since she has a lot of creativity and a good hand for decorating cakes.  In addition to this business, she also has a piñateria (piñata business) which she has left a little to one side because of a lack of materials to make her products.

What Edy most likes about her work is decorating the cakes since she really has fun doing it.  She has been in this business for 6 years and she considers the most difficult part of her work to be having to fill all the orders that they make at the bakery.  Over time, she hopes to be able to improve her piñateria so that she can make progress in her own business.

This is Edy's second loan with MFP and she knows that she has to be punctual in making her repayments if she wants to access another loan in the future.  She is a very responsible member of her community bank which means that she is very well respected by her fellow bank members.  She will use the 2,000 Peruvian soles she has requested to buy materials to better stock her piñateria.

loans.use: to buy products to stock her business selling party supplies

loans.name: María Fátima

texts.es:
Después de conocer el oficio de hacer colchones y quedar desempleada, María Fátima A. P. en compañía de su esposo decidieron emprender su propio negocio, una oportunidad que para esta familia se convierte en la forma de salir adelante con sus 3 hijos para ofrecerles una mejor calidad de vida. 

Actualmente, María Fátima necesita de un préstamo para comprar materia prima e insumos ya que apenas empezó con su negocio hace un mes y necesita de como ella misma lo explica de una empujón que les permita emprender el vuelo.
texts.en:
After learning how to make mattresses and then becoming unemployed, María Fátima A. P., together with her husband, decided to set up their own business.  For this family, this opportunity has become a way of getting ahead with their 3 children, in order to offer them a better quality of life.

Currently, María Fátima needs a loan to buy raw materials and supplies since she only started her business a month ago and she needs, as she puts it, a push that will allow her to take flight.

loans.use: to buy supplies and raw materials

loans.name: Rima

texts.en: Rima G. lives with her husband and three children in Noravan village in the Syunik region. The family has land but is currently unable to cultivate it due to very limited financial resources. Both Rima and her husband are unemployed, and there is no work in the neighborhood. For Rima it is vital to get the spring farming work started to insure some income to cover the most basic costs in her household.

loans.use: buy farming equipment to cultivate her land

loans.name: Vencedoras Group

texts.es:
La Asociación Comunal   ”VENCEDORAS”, está iniciando su segundo ciclo en el Centro Focal de Villa Adela.  Esta asociación comunal cuenta con la participación de nueve  integrantes.  La  mesa directiva tiene como presidenta a la señora Elizabeth. Los negocios de las señoras son diferentes, entre ellos tenemos venta de comida, venta de CD’s, venta de cosméticos, venta de fruta, venta de coca, vena de ropa y licorería.

La presidenta, la señora Elizabeth es una mujer de 44 años de edad, soltera, madre de una hija. Esta trabajando con Pro Mujer 14 años, con los que ha continuado su comercio de CD’s, trabajando diariamente con su hija.  La mercadería la consigue de Desaguadero, población que se encuentra en la frontera de Bolivia y Perú; estos CD’s los vende en la Av. 6 de marzo, en Santiago II y en Horizontes.

Con el monto de crédito solicitado piensa comprar “CD’s y un DVD” y con ello mejorar la comercialización de sus productos.
Cuando le consultamos qué es lo que más le gusta de Pro Mujer, la señora Elizabeth  responde  la capacitación”.
texts.en:
The ”VENCEDORAS” (Winners) community bank are starting out on their second loan cycle with our Villa Adela regional office.  This group has nine members and Elizabeth is the president of its board of executives.  The businesses that the ladies are engaged in are all different.  They include selling meals, selling CDs, selling cosmetics, selling fruit, selling coca leaf, selling clothes and running a liquor store.

The president, Elizabeth, is 44 years old and a single mother with one daughter.  She has been working with Pro Mujer for 14 years and her business is selling CDs.  She works in her business every day, together with her daughter.  She acquires her merchandise in Desaguadero, a town which is located on the border between Bolivia and Peru.  She sells her CDs on Avenida 6 de Marzo in Santiago II and in Horizontes.

Elizabeth plans to use the loan she has requested to buy "CDs and DVDs".  This will help her to improve her product sale.  When we asked her what she most likes about Pro Mujer, Elizabeth replied "the training".

loans.use: to buy CDs and DVDs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy pea seeds

loans.name: La Roca Group

texts.es:
El grupo Roca está conformado por tres personas trabajadoras, esforzadas y emprendedoras una de ellas es Elba Tomara Silvia Ortiz de 25 años se dedica a la venta de ropa desde hace 5 años. Ella es casada, tiene un hijo y su meta es tener su casa.
Silvia invertirá en mercadería de verano.
Las otras integrantes de grupo son Gloria Elena C. tiene una tortillería desde hace 4 años y Belma Ruth B.  quien es comerciante y tiene una pulpería.
texts.en:
The Roca group is made up of three hard-working, driven and entrepreneurial people.  One of them is 25 year-old Elba Tomara Silvia Ortiz who has been selling clothes for 5 years.  She is married, has one child, and her goal is to own her own home.  Silvia will invest her loan in buying summer merchandise.

The other members of the group are Gloria Elena C., who has owned a tortilla bakery for 4 years, and Belma Ruth B. who is a saleswoman and owns a grocery store.

loans.use: to buy clothes, especially shorts, summer shirts, swimsuits, etc.

loans.name: 16 De Noviembre Group

texts.es:
El grupo 16 de noviembre está conformado por tres personas trabajadoras, esforzadas y emprendedoras una de ellas es Candida Silva de 27 años quien se dedica al comercio, fresco, helado, comida desde hace 6 años. Ella tiene dos hijos por los que trabaja arduamente e invertirá el crédito en la compra de granos básicos, carne, verduras etc.
Las otras integrantes del grupo son Glenda C. de 29 años que comercializa productos varios desde ropa, perfume, chinelas etc. y Miguel Orlando C. tiene una vidriería donde fabrica persianas, vitrinas, ventanas, puertas etc.
texts.en:
The 16 de Noviembre group is made up of three hard-working, driven and enterprising people.  One of them is 27 year-old Candida Silva who is a saleswoman.  She has been selling fresh food, frozen food and meals for 6 years.  She has two children for whom she works hard.  She will invest her loan in buying basic grains, meat, vegetables, etc.

The other members of the group are 29 year-old Glenda C., who sells a variety of products including clothes, perfume and thongs (flip-flops), and Miguel Orlando C. who owns a glassworks where he makes blinds, glass cabinets, windows, doors, etc.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, vegetables and fruit

loans.name: Christine

texts.en: Christine S. lives in the Kitawuluzi section of Kampala, Uganda. She is widowed and has four children, all of whom are in school. She also takes care of additional family members, including her grandchildren. For the last five years, Christine has made a living selling second-hand shoes. She works seven days a week out of her home, and is applying for a loan for 1,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy more used shoes to sell to her customers. She supplements her income by farming, and her main challenges are high transportation costs and people who do not pay their bills on time. Her goal is to open a wholesale business. Christine owns her home and has access to electricity and piped-in water. Her major monthly expenses are utilities, school fees and food.

loans.use: To buy more used shoes to sell to her customers

loans.name: Adriana Patricia

texts.es:
Adriana Patricia  desde hace 3 años inició su propio negocio de venta de mercancía, además también trabaja en un restaurante los fines de semana, ya que ella necesita conseguir y mantener el sustento diario de su familia.

Para ella es muy importante seguir creciendo en su negocio ya que su gran sueño es poder tener un almacén y así poder darles a sus hijos estudio y buena calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Adriana Patricia started her business selling merchandise three years ago.  She also works in a restaurant on weekends since she is responsible for supporting her family and providing for their daily needs.

For Adriana Patricia, it is very important to continue growing in her business as her big dream is to own a store so that she can provide her children with an education and a good quality of life.

loans.use: to buy stock

loans.name: Guisela

texts.es: Guísela, de 32 años, es una mujer muy sencilla y alegre, vive en su casa propia junto a sus dos queridos hijos, su esposo es comerciante y vive en Lima, pero cuando puede los visita y lo que más desea es mejorar su calidad de vida. El negocio de Guísela es la venta de Películas, canciones, documentales, dibujos animados, etc., en formato DVD, ella siente que la ciudad de Tarma es un buen mercado, ya que sabe que existe una gran demanda por los DVDs y que es un negocio muy rentable. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo, es que puede decidir cuando trabaja y cuando no, ya que también tiene que dedicarle tiempo a su restaurante, lleva 2 año realizando esta actividad y considera que los más difícil es tener que permanecer en su tienda todo el día, pero sabe que ese es su trabajo y que tiene que cumplirlo, con el tiempo, espera implementar mejor su tienda de DVDs. Es el séptimo crédito con MFP, espera ser muy puntual en el pago de sus cuotas, ya que desea acceder a más créditos, en su banco comunal es muy participativa. Con los dos mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más DVDs, para ofrecer a sus clientes una mayor variedad.
texts.en:
Guísela is 32 years old.  She is a very unassuming and cheerful woman who lives in her own home together with her two beloved children.  Her husband is a salesman and lives in Lima but he visits them when he can.  What Guisela wants more than anything is to improve her quality of life.

Guisela's business is selling movies, music, documentaries, cartoons, etc. on DVD.  She feels that the city of Tarma is a good market since there is a great demand for DVDs and it is a very profitable business.  What Guisela most enjoys about her work is the fact that she can decide when she works and when she doesn't work since she also has to spend time working in her restaurant.  Guisela has been in this business for 2 years and she considers the most difficult part of her work to be the fact that she has to stay in her store all day.  However, she knows that this is her job and that she must do it.  Over time, Guisela would like to better stock her DVD store.

This is Guisela's seventh loan from MFP and she hopes to be very punctual in making her repayments since she would like to access further loans.  She takes a very active part in her community bank.  Guisela will use the 2,000 Peruvian soles she has requested to buy more DVDs, so that she can offer her customers more variety.

loans.use: to buy more DVDs

loans.name: Chasquis Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “CHASQUIS” iniciará su noveno ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Collpani. Está compuesta por ocho integrantes y tiene como presidenta a la señora Benigna.   Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: Tienda de barrio, venta de espejos, trenzado de mantas, venta de cosméticos, pizzeria, joyería.

La señora Benigna, presidenta de la asociación comunal, indica que es la novena vez que participa en Pro Mujer y que integra la institución gracias a la invitación de su cuñada Mercedes.

En la actualidad la señora Benigna tiene un negocio que consiste en una tienda de barrio que inicio por iniciativa propia hace 5 años; el crédito que sacará ahora es para aumentar su mercadería (arroz, aceite, azucar, enlatados, ace, javon), los que compra de La Ceja, en la ciudad de El Alto.

Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, pues ella es casada y tiene cuatro hijos.

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación y el crédito.
texts.en:
The “CHASQUIS” community bank is about to begin its ninth loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Collpani regional office.  This group has eight members and its president is Benigna.  The businesses that the members of this group are engaged in include, running a neighborhood store, selling mirrors, braiding blankets, selling cosmetics, running a pizzeria and selling jewelry.

Benigna, the president of this community bank, says that this is the ninth time that she has participated in Pro Mujer and that she joined the institution after being invited to do so by her sister-in-law Mercedes.

Benigna currently owns a neighborhood store that she set up on her own initiative 5 years ago. The loan she is currently requesting will be used to increase her merchandise (rice, oil, sugar, canned goods, detergent and soap).  She buys her products in La Ceja, in the city of El Alto.

Benigna's business allows her to make money to support her family as she is married and has four children.  When we asked her what she most liked about Pro Mujer she replied that she likes the training and the loans.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, oil, etc. for her store

loans.name: Los Cristianos Group

texts.es:
El grupo los Cristianos  está conformado por tres personas trabajadoras, esforzadas y emprendedoras. El coordinador del grupo es Félix André García de 21 años quien se dedica a la venta de anteojos de sol desde hace un año. El inicio con el negocio con el propósito de sacar adelante a su familia, actualmente como el negocio ha prosperado tiene un vendedor.
El con el crédito comprara mercadería aprovechando la temporada de verano.
Las otras integrantes del Grupo son Rosa A. Barrera de 47 años quien vende golosinas desde hace 4 años y Ruth Vega de 34 años se dedica a la venta de golosinas desde hace 13 años.
texts.en:
The 'Los Cristianos' group is made up of three hard-working, driven and enterprising people.  The group's coordinator is 21 year-old Félix André García, who has been selling sunglasses for one year.  He started his business in order to get his family ahead in life.  Currently, as his business has prospered, he employs a salesman.  He will use his loan to buy merchandise and take advantage of the summer season.

The other members of the group are 47 year-old Rosa A. Barrera who has been selling sweet treats for 4 years and 34 year-old Ruth Vega who has been selling sweet treats for 13 years.

loans.use: to buy sunglasses

loans.name: Nael

texts.en:
Nael is an employee and a father of two daughters and three sons. Nael also runs a small grocery store to have a better income that covers the expenses of a big family.

Nael took out a loan from FATEN's Qalqilia branch to purchase larger variety of grocery store item and increase the profit. 

Nael who appears in the picture above inherited the store from his father.

loans.use: to purchase a large variety of goods to sell in a grocery store.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine  N. lives in the Kisaasi neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is single and has 6 children, all of whom are in school. She also has a business of selling bananas. She has been in this business for 10 years, and she works 7 days out of every week. Catherine sells her products at the market, by means of wholesale/retail. Catherine has requested a loan of 500000 Shillings Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bunches of bananas.

The main business challenges for Catherine include thieves and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start selling wholeasle only. Catherine lives in a home that she rents; she doesn't have access to electricity and has access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include paying utility bills, rent,school fees, and feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy more bunches of bananas

loans.name: Ma Rosa

texts.es: La Sra Rosa M., es una persona muy  seria y responsable ,  su esposo trabaja fuera de la ciudad  ausentándose  por  periodos  muy  largos y en ocasiones le trae ropa usada para vender en su domicilio, para que la señora Rosa se pueda ayudar en lo económico ya que tienen hijos estudiando y necesitan de  muchas  cosas para  continuar  con sus  estudios, es por esta razón que la Sra. Rosa esta solicitando su crédito para invertir mas en la venta de ropa usada, ya que su esposo le  proporciona  la mercancía  solo una vez  al mes, ella  desea  ofrecer a  sus  clientes  una mayor  variedad de  ropa y  de esta  manera  sus  ingresos  aumentaran proporcionando la  oportunidad  de brindarles una mejor  calidad  de   vida a  sus hijos que  son lo  mas  importante  en su  vida.
texts.en:
Rosa M. is a very serious and responsible person.  Her husband works outside of the city and is absent for very long periods.  He often brings her used clothing to sell from home so that she can help out financially since they have children who are in school and they need many things in order to continue in their studies.

Rosa is requesting a loan so that she can invest more in her used clothes business since her husband only provides her with merchandise once a month.  She would like to be able to offer her customers a wider range of clothes.  In this way, her income will increase and she will have the opportunity to provide her children, who are the most important thing in her life, with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: Edilberto

texts.es:
Edilberto O. F., sueña con tener su propio negocio y para ello ya está dando sus primeros pasos, pues actualmente aunque trabaja en una carpintería los fines de semana aprovechando sus conocimientos realiza trabajaos independientemente con el fin de independizarse totalmente con el fin de incrementar sus ingresos y mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia. 

Edilberto necesita de un préstamo para comprar algunas máquinas que actualmente necesita y así aumentar su capacidad de producción.
texts.en:
Edilberto O. F. dreams of owning his own business and so he is taking his first steps.  Although he currently works in a carpenter's workshop, on weekends he takes advantage of his knowledge and does independent jobs so that he can eventually start working for himself.  In this way, he will be able to increase his income and improve his family's quality of life.

Edilberto needs a loan to buy some machines that he currently needs, so that he can increase his production capacity.

loans.use: to buy machinery

loans.name: Los Gladiolos Group

texts.es: El banco de emprendimiento Los gladiolos esta conformado por 8 integrantes,  la presidenta es la Sra. Cecilia, casada tiene dos hijos que se encuentran en edad escolar, trabaja todas las mañanas y cuida a sus hijos por las tardes, es una persona muy trabajadora que realiza el servicio de limpieza en una casa de familia, con el dinero del crédito desea comprar algunos electrodomésticos para su casa como una licuadora y un dvd, etc.   ella vive en la zona de chacacollo , el grupo esta conformado por personas muy humildes y trabajadoras realizan la elaboración de chicharon de pollo , comercio de ladrillos e incluso la elaboración de ladrillos , este banco de emprendimiento este conformado por vecinas de la zona  que viven hace varios años en la misma ,cada una de ellas tienen una actividad independiente trabajan de lunes a domingo  , se conocen bastante bien entre ellas en el grupo  existe la participación de 1 varón de igual manera son muy conocidos con su respectiva actividad .es un banco muy organizado dinámicos .
texts.en:
The 'Los Gladiolos' (Gladioli) community bank has 8 members.  Its president is Cecilia who is married and has two school-age children.  She works every morning and takes care of her children in the afternoon.  She is a very hard-working person who carries out a cleaning service in a private family home.  She would like to use her loan money to buy some electrical appliances for her own home such as a blender, a DVD player, etc.  She lives in Chacacollo neighborhood.

This group is made up of unassuming and hard-working people whose businesses include making 'chicharón de pollo' (fried chicken), selling bricks and even making bricks.   The group's members are all neighbors who have lived in the same neighborhood for several years.  Each one has their own independent business and they work from Monday to Sunday.  The group's members know each other well and one man participates in their group.  They are all very well known for their respective businesses.  This is a very organized and dynamic community bank.

loans.use: to buy electrical appliances such as a blender and a DVD player

loans.name: Luz Del Mundo Group

texts.es:
El grupo Luz del Mundo lo conforman tres personas trabajadoras, esforzadas y emprendedoras  una de ellas es la señora Concepción de 38 años se dedica a la venta de pescado en el populoso mercado oriental desde hace 20 años aproximadamente. 
Concepcion tiene cuatro hijos de los cuales los dos menores de 10 y 13 años viven con ella. Ella invertirá el crédito en pescado seco lo cual está en temporada por la semana santa. 
Las otras integrantes del grupo son Quira de 25 años desde 2,000 se dedica a la venta de pescado el cual inicio comprando y ahora ella pesca y Lucia  desde hace 7 años vende peluches.
texts.en:
The Luz del Mundo (Light of the World) Communal Bank is comprised of three hard-working, tenacious, and enterprising people.  Concepción is one of them.  She is 38 years old, and she has been selling fish in the bustling eastern market for approximately 20 years.

María has four children.  The two youngest, 10 and 13 years old, live with her.  

She will use the loan to buy dried fish, which is in season for Holy Week.

Quira, age 25, is another member of the group.  She has been selling fish since the year 2000.  She started out buying, and now she fishes.

Lucia is the other member of the group.  She has been selling stuffed animals for seven years.

loans.use: to buy dried fish in preparation for Easter Week, salt, gasoline

loans.name: Las Sembradoras Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “SEMBRADORAS” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Villa Adela.  Está compuesta por nueve integrantes y tiene como presidenta a la señora Gloria.   Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de café, venta de comida, venta de medias, carpintería, taller de tejido, venta de broster, tejido de chompas y venta de tejido.

La señora Gloria, presidenta de la asociación comunal, indica que es la primera vez que participa en Pro Mujer y que para que venga a la institución la invitaron sus amigas de su zona.
En la actualidad la señora Gloria tiene un negocio de venta de medias y trabaja en el un año, nos cuenta que este negocio lo aprendió algunas amigas que estaban en este rubro. El crédito que sacará ahora es para aumentar su mercadería (medias), la que compra de  la Isac Tamayo y la vende en la feria 16 de julio los días jueves y domingo.

Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, pues ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud.
texts.en:
The “Sembradoras” (Farmers) Communal bank will start their first cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Villa Adela Community Center.  The bank is comprised of nine members.  Gloria is the president.  The members of the communal bank carry on with varied activities such as selling coffee, selling food, selling hosiery, carpentry, weaving shop, selling broasted chicken, knitting sweaters, and selling weavings.

Gloria, the president of the communal bank, says that this is the first time she has worked with Pro Mujer.  She has a business selling hosiery, and she has been working in this business for a year.  She tells us that she learned this business from some friends who were in this field.

She will use this loan to increase her merchandise (hosiery).  She buys her merchandise from the Isac Tamayo, and she sells it at the 16 de Julio fair on Thursdays and Sundays.  This type of work allows her to generate resources to support her family.  She is married and has three children.  When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she replied that she likes the health services.

loans.use: to increase her merchandise by purchasing hosiery

loans.name: Haydee

texts.es: Haydee, de 34 años, es una mujer muy amable y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Socímo de 38 años y sus 4 queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. Junto a su esposo, Haydee trabaja todos los días en sus cultivos. Con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado que sus tierras sean muy productivas y ahora siembra de todo, ya que sabe que todo producto que obtenga será de muy buena calidad. Ella principalmente siembra flores, ya que estos productos se están vendiendo muy bien en el mercado. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar sus sembríos de las plagas que pueden afectarlas, lleva 4 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus flores, hasta el mercado mayorista de Tarma, ya que es ahí donde vende sus productos. Para el futuro de su negocio, espera juntar el dinero necesario para poner un puesto de venta en el mercado mayorista, ya que actualmente vende de forma ambulatoria. Este es el tercer crédito con MFP, siente que este crédito le ayudará mucho en el desarrollo de su actividad. En su banco comunal es una socia, muy responsable, de lo cual se siente muy orgullosa. Los dos mil nuevos soles solicitados, los invertirá en mejorar sus cultivos, para ello comprará sacos de abono orgánico.
texts.en: Haydée is 34 years old, a friendly, hard-working woman.  She lives in her own home with her husband Sócimo, who is 38 years old, and her 4 beloved children, for whom she would like to provide a better quality of life.  Together with her husband, Haydée works daily in her fields.  By dint of hard work, she has made her land highly productive, so that she sows all kinds of seeds, knowing that the product will be high quality.  She grows mostly flowers, since these sell nicely in the market.  What she likes most about her work is protecting her plants from insects.  She has been in this business for 4 years, and finds that the hardest part is transporting her flowers to the Tarma wholesale market, where she sells her products.  For the future of her business, she hopes to accumulate funds sufficient to set up a stall in the wholesale market, since at present she carries her goods around.  This is her third loan with MFP, and she believes that the loan will help her greatly to develop her business.  She is a responsible member of her communal bank, and she is proud of this.  She will use the two thousand new soles to improve her crops, buying sacks of organic fertilizer.

loans.use: to purchase bags of organic fertilizer

loans.name: Justo Juez Group

texts.es: El Banco D. emprendimiento Justo Juez se encuentra en la zona norte son socias conocidas del lugar es un grupo bastante consolidado la mayoría D. las socias se dedican a la producción D. pan y venta D. cosméticos la presidenta la Sra. Carmen se dedica a la repostería ella realiza pan, galletas, tortas, y todo tipo D. masitas,  ella y sus dos hijos que se encuentran en edad escolar es una persona muy trabajadora uno D. sus deseos es el D. ver a sus hijos profesionales y convertirse en personas D. bien, viven en casa propia y así D. esta manera brinda mayor comodidad a su familia, con el dinero del crédito comprara insumos e ingredientes para la elaboración D. galletas y pan, y todas las socias  sacaron el crédito para aumentar su capital D. trabajo se fueron muy satisfechos y agradecidos con la institución.
texts.en:
The Justo Juez (Fair Judge) Communal Bank is in the northern zone.  The members are from the same area and know each other.  The group is very well-established.  Most of the members make bread and sell cosmetics.

The president, Carmen, makes baked goods.  She makes bread, cookies, cakes, and all types of pastries.  She has two school age children, and she is a very hard-working person.  One of her wishes is to see her children become successful professionals.  They live in their own house, and that provides her family with greater comfort.

She will use the money from the loan to buy supplies and ingredients to make cookies and bread.

All of the members took out the loan to increase their work capital.  They were very satisfied and grateful to the institution.

loans.use: to buy supplies and ingredients to make cookies and bread

loans.name: Jeny

texts.es:
La señora Jenny Gómez es una mujer trabajadora, esforzada y emprendedora quien se dedica a la venta de ropa, cosméticos y chinelas desde hace 10 años. Su inicio fue irregular pero con el tiempos y su ardua labor se fue consolidando.
G. tiene cuatro hijos  de 12, 10, 8 y 5 años respectivamente e invertirá el crédito en mercadería para la temporada de verano.
texts.en:
Jenny Gómez is a hard-working, driven and enterprising woman who has been selling clothes, cosmetics and thongs (flip-flops) for 10 years.  Her first business steps were uneven but, over time and as a result of her hard work, her business has grown stronger.

Mrs Gómez has four children aged 12, 10, 8 and 5 and she will invest her loan in buying merchandise for the summer season.

loans.use: to buy clothes

loans.name: Jesus

texts.es: El Sr. V.  tiene cinco  años trabajando en la industria maquiladora, teniendo como puesto  líder de área , en esta  ocasión solicita  el  crédito  para  mejorar  su  vivienda  ya  que  en la  actualidad  cuenta  con la  barda  lateral de   su hogar pero le  hace  falta el  acabado con estuco, ve   en el  crédito  la  oportunidad  de realizar  su  proyecto  además  de  proporcionar a  su familia    una mayor  privacidad  y  protección a  su  domicilio.
texts.en: Senor V. has been working in the garment manufacture industry for 5 years, holding a post as Area Leader. On this occasion he is seeking a loan to improve his home. It already has a wall around the yard, but it was built without being finished with stucco. He sees the loan as an opportunity to complete the project and thus offer his family a greater measure of privacy and protection in their home.

loans.use: to build a wall around the property.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Cristian

texts.es:
Cristian forma parte del banco comunal “Las Pergoleras de Linares”, perteneciente a la ciudad de Linares. El tiene una florería como local establecido, aquí se dedica a vender flores y realizar arreglos florales. El tiene éste negocio desde hace 12 años, por lo cual tiene mucha clientela. 
Con éste préstamo comprará flores.
Sus sueños son instalarse en otro sector de la ciudad con otra florería y poder comprar una camioneta para trasladar su mercadería.
Cristian vive con su esposa y sus 4 hijos de 24, 21 y dos de 16 años de edad, ya que son gemelos. Toda su familia lo apoya y ayuda en las ventas de la florería. 
Sus motivaciones son brindarles a sus hijos una excelente calidad en la educación profesional, a través de los ingresos generados por su negocio.
Para Cristian Fondo esperanza ha sido un gran apoyo para su negocio, específicamente por el crédito. Además disfruta mucho de las reuniones del grupo, ya que son muy amenas y ha aprendido con los talleres que se imparten. 
Linares es un importante centro urbano de la región del Maule, ubicado en la zona centro del país. En esta zona se desarrolla de manera importante la producción agrícola y también vitivinícola sobresaliendo en el ámbito de las exportaciones. Destacan los cultivos de cereales (arroz, trigo, maíz y avena), hortalizas (remolacha, repollo, lechuga y acelga y legumbres) y frutas. Linares es la principal provincia productora de arroz, en Chile; de hecho, el 78% de la producción nacional de este cereal se da en esta provincia, especialmente en la comuna de Parral.
texts.en:
Cristian is a member of the "Las Pergoleras de Linares" community bank which is located in the city of Linares.  Cristian owns an established florist's where he sells flowers and makes flower arrangements.  He has owned his business for 12 years and, for this reason, he has a lot of customers.

Cristian's dreams are to establish another florist's in a different area of the city and to be able to buy a truck so that he can transport his merchandise.

Cristian lives with his wife and four children aged 24, 21, and 16 (twins).  The whole family supports and helps him in selling his products.

Fondo Esperanza has been a great support to Cristian in his business, particularly because of the loans that they have offered him.  He also really enjoys the group meetings since they are very pleasant and he has learned a lot from the workshops that they host.

Linares is an important urban center which is located in Maule region, in the central area of Chile.  In this area, farming and wine production are important industries and they make a lot of exports.  The main crops grown are cereals (rice, wheat, corn and oats), vegetables (beets, cabbage, lettuce and chard) and fruit.  Linares is the leading rice-producing province in Chile.  In fact, 78% of the national production of this cereal takes place in this province, especially in Parral municipality.

loans.use: to buy flowers

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es:
Lucia del Socorro Ramírez Castillo es una fémina trabajadora, esforzada y emprendedora de 40 años. Ella inicio su negocio con la venta de comida y nacatamales, luego puso una repostería la cual le proporciona un mayor ingreso. 
Ramírez  trabaja por encargo realizando queques, bocadillos, pizas… etc. por más de un año. Ella con el crédito comprara una batidora industrial lo que le permitirá trabajar mejor.
texts.en: Lucia del Socorro Ramírez Castillo is a hardworking, determined and enterprising 40 year old woman. She started her business by selling food and nacatamales [parcels of steamed maize with a savoury filling, wrapped in a banana leaf].
