Later she set up a snack bar, which allowed her to increase her income. Senora Ramírez has been working making cakes, sandwiches, pizzas etc to order for over a year now. With the loan she intends to buy an industrial food mixer.

loans.use: to buy an industrial food mixer.

loans.name: Evas

texts.en:
Evas K. lives in the Kisaasi neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has children, some of whom are in school. Evas has a business of selling bananas. She has been in this business for 10 years, and she works 7 days out of every week. Evas sells her products at the market by means of wholesale/retail. Evas has requested a loan of 500000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bunches of bananas.

The main business challenges for Evas include thieves and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start selling wholeasle only. Evas lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity and has access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include paying utility bills, rent, school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy more bunches of bananas

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es:
La señora Gladys es una mujer trabajadora, esforzada y emprendedora quien habita en el Memorial Sandino. Ella tiene un pequeño negocio de venta de ropa usada desde hace 10 años e invertirá el crédito en ropa y perfumes por la temporada de verano
Gladys inicio con Adim en un grupo solidario llamado “Las Amigas II” y en la actualidad es un crédito individual.
texts.en: Gladys is a hard-working, driven and enterprising woman who lives in Memorial Sandino neighborhood.  She has owned a small business selling used clothing for 10 years and she will invest her loan in buying clothes and perfumes for the summer season.  Gladys started working with ADIM as a member of a community bank called "Las Amigas II" (Friends II) and she is currently requesting an individual loan.

loans.use: to buy clothes and perfumes.

loans.name: Karina

texts.es: Karina, de 25 años, es una joven muy amable y sincera, vive en casa de sus padres junto a su querida hija Gabriela de 2 años y esta dispuesta a trabajar muy duro para sobresalir en la vida. Trabajando arduamente por el bienestar de su hija Karina ha logrado salir adelante, con mucho esfuerzo consiguió trabajo en una de las pizzerías más concurridas de la ciudad de Tarma, ella comenzó atendiendo a los comensales que concurrían al lugar, pero con el tiempo aprendió a preparar las pizzas y ahora también realiza esa labor. Paralelamente a esta actividad, también se dedica a la crianza de cuyes, actividad que le esta dando buenos ingresos, motivo por el cual quiere incursionar más en este negocio. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es preparar las pizzas, se divierte mucho haciéndolo, lleva 1 año realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es atender a todos los clientes que entran a la pizzería, ya que por lo general son muy numerosos. Con el tiempo desea poner un negocio propio, motivo por el cual está ahorrando dinero. Este es el primer crédito con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar sus cuotas puntualmente si quiere acceder a otro crédito en el futuro. En su banco comunal es una socia muy tranquila, motivo por el cual es muy querida. Con los ochocientos nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más cuyes para incrementar su criadero y así tener más cuyes para vender.
texts.en:
25 year-old Karina is a very kind and sincere young woman who lives in her parents' home together with her beloved 2 year-old daughter Gabriela.  She is prepared to work very hard in order to do well in life.  By working hard for the well-being of her daughter, Karina has managed to get ahead in life.  With a lot of effort, she managed to get a job in one of the busiest pizzerias in the city of Tarma.  She started out serving diners but, over time, she learned to make pizzas and now she carries out that task.

In addition to that job, Karina also raises guinea pigs.  This business is making her good income and so she would like to take further steps in it.  What she most enjoys about her work is preparing pizzas as she has a lot of fun doing it.  She has been in this job for one year and she considers the most difficult part of her work to be serving all the customers who come to the pizzeria since there is generally an awful lot of them.  Over time, Karina would like to set up her own business and she is currently saving money for this purpose.

This is Karina's first loan from MFP and she knows that she must make her repayments punctually if she would like to access another loan in the future.  Karina is a very calm member of her community bank which means that she is very well liked.  She will use the 800 Peruvian soles she has requested to buy more guinea pigs in order to increase her farm and have more guinea pigs to sell.

loans.use: to buy more guinea pigs

loans.name: Nora

texts.es:
La señora Nora del Socorro V. es una mujer trabajadora, esforzada y emprendedora, casada y tiene un hijo. Ella tiene una pulpería la cual inicio hace 17 años con la venta de hielo, helados, chocobananos, bolis, puntos rojos, polvorones etc. luego poco a poco fue invirtiendo en otros productos hasta que estuviera surtido.

Ella invertirá en granos básicos, carne, cosméticos… etc.
texts.en: Señora Nora del Socorro V. is a hardworking, determined and enterprising woman. She is married and has a son. She has a grocery store, which she started 17 years ago, selling just ice, icecreams, choco-bananas, pens, polvorones [a kind of shortbread biscuit], etc. Later, little by little, she went on investing in other products until the store was well stocked. She intends to invest in grain, meat, cosmetics etc.

loans.use: to buy grain.

loans.name: Oliver

texts.en:
Oliver N. lives in the Kisaasi neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has four children, all of whom are in school.  

Oliver has a business of poultry farming. She has been in this business for over 10 years, and she works seven days out of every week. Oliver sells her products at the market, by means of wholesale and retail. Oliver has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more chicken feeds.     

She also generates additional income through selling charcoal. The main business challenges for Oliver include thieves, transportation and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start selling on a wholesale basis only.   

Oliver lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity and has access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include utility bills, rent, school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy more bags of chicken feeds

loans.name: Guanacaste Group

texts.es:
El grupo Guanacaste lo conforman tres mujeres trabajadoras, esforzadas y emprendedoras ellas son Reyna G. Guzmán, Ericka García y Digna E.. La coordinadora del grupo es la señora G.  quien se dedica al comercio de cosméticos desde hace 5 años.  Ella invertirá en productos como colonias, perfumes, tratamientos para el cabello, para el cutis etc.
Mientras G. vende ropa y cosméticos desde hace 3 años invertirá el shampoo, cosméticos, ropa etc. y E. propietaria de una comideria invertirá en granos básicos, carne, verduras, especies etc.
texts.en:
The Guanacaste group is made up of three hard-working, driven and enterprising women.  They are Reyna G. Guzmán, Ericka García and Digna E..   The group's coordinator is Mrs G. who has been selling cosmetics for five years.  She will invest her loan in buying products such as colognes, perfumes, hair treatments, skin treatments, etc.

Mrs G. has been selling clothes and cosmetics for three years and will invest her loan in buying shampoo, cosmetics, clothes, etc.  Mrs E. owns an eatery and she will invest in buying basic grains, meat, vegetables, spices, etc.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics

loans.name: Eseza

texts.en:
Eseza N. lives in the Kisaasi neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has four children, all of whom are in school. 

Eseza has a business of a food stand. She has been in this business for three years, and she works seven days out of every week. She also rents out homes as an additional source of income.

Eseza has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO. She wants to use this loan to buy more  bunches of bananas and vegetables like cabbages, tomatoes, eggplants and onions. The main business challenge for Eseza is thieves. 

Eseza lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and food.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of bananas, boxes of tomatoes, onions, eggplants and cabbages

loans.name: Jalia

texts.en:
Jalia S. lives in the Kisaasi neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has six children, all of whom are in school.  

Jalia has a business of selling second-hand shoes. She has been in this business for 10 years, and she works seven days out of every week. Jalia sells her products at the market, by means of wholesale and retail.  

Jalia has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bales of second-hand shoes. She also generates additional income through rental rooms. The main business challenges for Jalia include thieves and seasonality.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start selling on a wholesale basis only.   

Jalia lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and has access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include utility bills, school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more bales of second-hand shoes

loans.name: Cissy

texts.en:
Cissy M. lives in the Kisaasi neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has five children, all of whom are in school.  Cissy lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity but doesn't have access to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include paying utility bills, school fees and feeding her family. 

Cissy has a business selling clothes.  She has been in this business for over ten years, and she works seven days a week. Cissy sells her products at the market, at wholesale and retail prices. Cissy has requested a loan of 400000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bales of second-hand clothes. The main business challenges for Cissy include thieves, transportation and seasonality.  Her goal for her business is to start selling at wholesale only.

loans.use: to buy more bales of second-hand clothes

loans.name: Divino Maestro Group

texts.es:
El grupo Divino Maestro está conformado por tres mujeres trabajadoras las cuales son  María del Socorro F. López, Juana Mercedes Ramírez y Auxiliadora  de Fátima M.. La coordinadora del grupo es la señora F. quien desde hace 6 años se dedica a la venta de cosméticos de manera ambulante.
Ella invertirá en perfumes, tintes, cremas cosméticos…etc.
Mientras M. comercializa ropa usada en la que invertirá el crédito y R. desde hace un año tiene una pulpería; ella inicio haciendo helados, hielos y chocobanano actualmente vende granos básicos, gaseosa…etc. y además vende ropa en la que invertirá el crédito.
texts.en:
The Divino Maestro group is made up of three hard-working women: María del Socorro F. López, Juana Mercedes Ramírez and Auxiliadora de Fátima M..  The group's coordinator is Mrs F. who has been selling cosmetics door to door for six years.  She will invest her loan in buying perfumes, dyes, creams, cosmetics, etc.  

Mrs M. sells used clothing and this is what she will invest her loan in.  Mrs R. has owned a grocery store for one year.  She started out making ice creams, ice and chocolate-covered bananas.  She currently sells basic grains, soda, etc.  She also sells clothes and this is what she will invest her loan in.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics and clothes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy potato and pea seeds as well as fertilizer and insecticides.

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.es:
El señor Ricardo R. es un hombre trabajkador, esforzado y emprendedor quien desde hace 10 años inicio su pequeño negocio de venta de Tomates. El inicio con poco y luego por su trabajo y los prestamo puso un tramo actualmente vende hasta 15 cajas de tomate.

El invertira el prestamo en la compra de dicho producto.
texts.en: Señor Ricardo R. is a hardworking, determined and enterprising man who, 10 years ago, started his small business selling tomatoes. He started small and later, through his hard work and the loans, expanded to selling up to 15 crates of tomatoes. He intends to invest in the purchase of said product.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes.

loans.name: Raul

texts.es: Raúl, de 23 años, es un joven muy amable y trabajador, vive en casa de sus padres junto a su esposa Cecilia de 24 años y su querido hijo Paúl de 1 año, a quien desea brindar un mejor futuro. Los campos de sembrado que con tanto esfuerzo a conseguido Raúl, son el principal sustento que tiene, sus productos son muy solicitados en el mercado mayorista de Tarma, ya que su fama de cosechar papa, arveja y flor de buena calidad, le ayuda a vender sus productos a muy buenos precios. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar sus sembríos de las plaga de insectos que pueden aquejar a sus plantaciones, lleva 3 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar los sacos de papa y arveja, ya que son muy pesados y le cansan mucho. En adelante, espera comprar nuevas tierras, para poder ampliar su producción. Este es el primer crédito con MFP, sabe que el crédito le será muy beneficioso para el desarrollo de su trabajo. En su banco comunal es un socio muy alegre y siempre pone orden en las reuniones. Con los quinientos nuevos soles solicitados, comprará abono para hacer más fértiles sus tierras.
texts.en: Raúl is 23 years old and a very friendly and hard-working young man. He lives in his parents' home along with his wife Cecilia, 24, and their son 1-year-old son Paúl, for whom they want to provide a better future. Their main source of income are the fields of crops that Raúl obtained with a lot of hard work. His products are in very high demand at the wholesale market in Tarma, since his crops of potatoes, peas and flowers have gained fame for their high quality, which helps him sell them at very good prices. What Raúl likes most about his work is protecting his crops from pests that can harm them. He has three years' experience in this activity, and the thing he considers most difficult is transporting the sacks of potatoes and peas because they are very heavy and tiresome to carry. In the future, he wants to purchase more land so he can expand his production. This is his first loan with Kiva partner MFP, and he knows that the loan will be very beneficial in developing his business. He is a very happy member of his community bank, and he always keeps order at the meetings. With the loan of 500 soles he is requesting, Raúl plans to purchase fertilizer to make his land more fertile.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fertilizer

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa, D. 58 años, es una mujer muy trabajadora y alegre, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Hugo D. 58 años y lo que más desea es tener una vejez tranquila. El negocio al que Rosa se dedica, es la venta D. cuyes, gallinas y patos, a los cuales los tiene bien alimentados y cuidados. Su puesto esta ubicado en el mercado mayorista D. la ciudad D. Tarma, donD. tiene muchos clientes y el dinero que obtiene D. sus ventas es muy bueno. Ella trabaja junto a su esposo y los dos se han encargado D. sacar adelante el negocio.  Lo que más le gusta D. su trabajo es alimentar a sus animales, ya que es muy dedicada a su crianza, lleva 6 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil, es tener que permanecer en su puesto todo el día en espera D. clientes. Para el futuro, planea incursionar en el negocio D. la ganadería. Este es el noveno crédito con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar puntualmente sus cuotas y está dispuesta a hacerlo. En su banco comunal es una socia muy alegre y responsable. Con los dos mil quinientos nuevos soles solicitados, comprará alimento para sus animales menores, ya que sabe que tiene que tenerlos bien alimentados, si quiere recibir un buen precio por ellos.
texts.en: Rosa, aged 58, is a happy and hard working woman. She lives in her own house together with her husband Hugo, who is also 58. What she wants most is to have a peaceful old age. The business to which Rosa dedicates her time is the sale of guinea-pigs, chickens and ducks, which are well fed and cared for. Her stall is located in the largest market in the city of Tarma, where she has many customers and makes good money from her sales. She works with her husband and the two of them have developed the business together. What she likes best about her work is feeding her animals, because she is very dedicated to rearing them. She has been doing this for 6 years. The aspect she considers most difficult is having to stay at her stall all day to wait for customers. For the future, she plans to start raising larger livestock. This is her 9th loan with [field partner] MFP; she knows she must make her repayments on time and is happy to do so. She is a happy and responsible member of her communal bank. With the 2,000 Soles she is looking for, she intends to buy food fo her small animals, because she knows that she needs to feed them well if she wants to receive a good price for them.

loans.use: to buy feed for her animals.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
María, de 47 años, es una mujer muy amable y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Juan de 50 años y su querida hija menor Solange de 10 años, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. Para María el trabajo  no es una actividad que le cause problemas, ya que ella es una mil oficios. Entre sus principales actividades esta la venta de comida, la atención de su tienda y el servicio de pensión, ahora se encuentra brindando el servicio de alimentación a unos profesores del Instituto pedagógico de Tarma, ella les prepara el desayuno almuerzo y cena, ya que siente que están a su cargo. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es realizar muy bien las cosas, ya que es muy detallosa en ese aspecto, lleva 2 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es distribuir su tiempo entre cada labor que realiza. Para el futuro, espera poder poner un restaurante con el cual espera mejorar sus ingresos económicos. Este es primer crédito con MFP, espera ser muy puntual en sus pagos, en su banco comunal es una socia muy respetada, debido a la responsabilidad que demuestra.
Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más ingredientes, para preparar más comida.
texts.en: María, who is 47 years old, as a very likable and hardworking woman who lives in her own house with her husband Juan who is 50 years old and their youngest daughter Solange who is 10, and to whom they want to offer a better quality of life. For María, work is not an activity that causes her problems because she has a thousand trades. Among her main activities she sells food, watches her store and her guesthouse. Now she offers a food service to the professors at the Teaching Institute of Tarma. She prepares breakfast, lunch and dinner because she feels like they are in her care. What she likes most about her job is to do things really well because she is very detail oriented in this respect. She has been doing this for 2 years and she thinks the most difficult part is splitting her time between all the various jobs she does. For the future, she wants to be able to have a restaurant which she hopes will increase her economic income. This is her first loan with MFP and she hopes to be very punctual with her payments. In her communal bank she is a very respected member owing to the responsibility she demonstrates. With the 1000 nuevos soles she is requesting she will buy more ingredients to prepare more food.

loans.use: to buy products to prepare more food.

loans.name: Teodocia

texts.es: Teodocia, de 50 años, es una mujer muy sencilla y alegre, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Francisco de 66 años y sus dos menores hijas Pamela de 20 y Zulema de 15, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. La tienda de Teodocia es una de las más visitadas en la ciudad de Tarma, desde muy temprano por la mañana abre su tienda en espera de que sus vecinos lleguen a comprar las cosas que necesitan. Ella es una vendedora muy alegre y atenta, ya que siempre recibe a sus clientes con una sonrisa y esta dispuesta ayudarlos en sus compras. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus vecinos, lleva 11 años en este negocio y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer todo el día dentro de su tienda sin poder salir. Con el tiempo, espera poder ampliar su tienda y llenarla de más mercadería, para poder ofrecer a sus clientes una mejor variedad de productos. Es el noveno crédito con MFP y esta dispuesta a pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo, ya que no quiere causarle problemas a su banco comunal, donde es muy querida por el resto de sus socias. Con los dos mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más productos, para implementar mejor su tienda.
texts.en:
50 year-old Teodocia is a very unassuming and cheerful woman who lives in her own home together with her husband, 66 year-old Francisco, and her two daughters, 20 year-old Pamela and 15 year-old Zulema, who she would like to provide with a better quality of life.

Teodocia's store is one of the most visited in the city of Tarma.  She opens her store very early in the morning and waits for her neighbors to come and buy whatever they need.  Teodocia is a very cheerful and attentive saleswoman.  She always greets her customers with a smile and is ready to help them to make their purchases.  What Teodocia most enjoys about her work is chatting with her neighbors.  She has been in this business for 11 years and she considers the most difficult part of her work to be having to remain in her store all day without being able to go out.

Over time, Teodocia hopes to be able to expand her store and fill it with more merchandise, so that she can offer her customers a better range of products.  This is her ninth loan with MFP and she is ready to make her repayments on time since she doesn't want to cause trouble for her community bank where she is very well liked by the her fellow members.  Teodocia will use the 2,000 Peruvian soles she has requested to buy more products in order to better stock her store.

loans.use: to buy products to stock her store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more fertilizer

loans.name: Huayna Capac (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Huayna Capac está formado por 7 mujeres y 3 hombres quienes laboran en diferentes actividades como la agricultura, la cría de animales o al comercio.  Son personas muy luchadoras y  optimistas que siempre tienen una sonrisa en sus labios. Viven en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es de clima frió, con un  bello centro histórico y  4 ríos que la bañan,  su gastronomía es muy variada y su gente es muy  culta y llena de tradiciones.

La Señora. María del Carmen P. vive por la ciudadela de los Trigales, tiene 45 años de edad, es  divorciada y tiene 4 hijos de 28, 26, 16 y 12 años de edad, sus dos primeros hijos son  casados e  independientes y sus dos últimos hijos estudian en un colegio de la ciudad. La casa en la que habita es propia y es el fruto de su esfuerzo.

Doña María del Carmen hace 19 años labora en su almacén, ella  vende repuestos de automóviles y también brinda el servicio de arreglo eléctrico de los mismos, labora de lunes a sábados desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 7 de la noche y los días domingos trabaja hasta el medio día.

El dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de más repuestos para incrementar su almacén, se encuentra en su primer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y fue invitada por una amiga a formar parte del mismo.

Su meta es tener un Tecnicentro para el chequeo de los vehículos.
texts.en:
The Huayna Capac community bank is made up of 7 women and 3 men who work in different activities, such as farming, raising animals, or commerce. They are fighters and optimists who alwayshave a smile on their lips. They live  in Cuenca, which has a cold climate with a beautiful historical downtown and is surrounded by 4 rivers. Its cuisine is varied and its people are cutured and full of tradition.  

Ms. María del Carmen P. lives in te Los Trigales neighborhood. She is 45 years old, divorced and has 4 children aged 28, 26, 16 and 12. Her two oldest children are married and on their own and the two youngest go to high school in town. The house where she lives is her own and the fruit of her labors.  

Ms. María del Carmen has worked in her store for 19 years. She sells automobile replacement parts and also offers an electrical repair for the same. She works from Monday through Saturday from 8 in the morning until 7 at night and on Sundays she works until noon.

She will invest the money from the loan in buying more replacement parts to grow her store. This is her first loan in the community bank and she was invited by a friend to be part of it. 

Her goal is to have a technical center for checking vehicles.

loans.use: to buy car replacement parts.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet N. lives in the Kisaasi neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has two children, both of whom are in school. She also takes care of three additional family members. Juliet lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity but doesn't have access to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include utility bills, rent, school fees and food for her family.
 
Juliet has a business of selling bananas. She has been in this business for five years, and she works seven days a week. Juliet sells her products at the market, at wholesale and retail prices. Juliet has requested a loan of 200000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bunches of bananas. The main business challenges for Juliet include thieves, transportation and seasonality.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start selling at wholesale only and also to buy a plot of land.

loans.use: to buy more bunches of bananas

loans.name: Iliana Aide

texts.es:
La Sra. Iliana Aidé está solicitando un préstamo por que  requiere invertir  en su negocio de  venta  de  ropa  usada, desea ofrecer a  sus clientes  una  mayor  variedad  de productos  ya  que  se ha caracterizado  por  brindarles  el  mejor  servicio, los lugares de venta varían, los primeros días de la semana generalmente lo hace desde su casa y los fines de semana recorre mercados que se encuentran al aire libre.
Agradece  el  apoyo otorgado, porque de esta  manera  se ha mantenido y así ofrecer a  sus pequeños   hijos una excelente  calidad  de vida.
texts.en:
Iliana Aidé is asking for a loan because she wants to invest in her used clothing business. She wants to offer her clients a greater variety of products since this will result in better service. The places where she sells vary. Usually at the beginning of the week she does it from her house and on the weekends she walks around the open air markets.

She is thankful for the help that has been offered, because this way she has been able to maintain her family and offer her small children an excellent quality of life.

loans.use: to buy clothing to sell.

loans.name: Juan Eder

texts.en: Juan is 26 years old and single. He lives with his family in the urban city of Picsi, a small but growing community. For more than five years, Juan has worked as a bricklayer. Given the decreased demand for bricklayers in the current market, he needs to generate additional income. So he is starting a business providing passenger transport services to members of his community and surrounding towns. To do so, he will convert his motorcycle into a mototaxi, by placing a cabin on the back in which he can transport passengers. Juan has requested a loan of 500 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa to make these changes to his motorbike. He hopes to grow his passenger transport business and plans to own a fleet of mototaxis in the future. Juan has had other loans in the past and has made his scheduled payments on time. He is a responsible and hardworking man who has received good personal and work references from members of his community.

loans.use: to convert his motocycle into a mototaxi so that he can start a transportation business

loans.name: Erina

texts.en:
Erina N. lives in the Kisaasi neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is single and has three children, all of whom are in school. Erina   lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity but doesn't have access to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include utility bills, rent, school fees and food for her family.    

Erina runs a restaurant. She has been in this business for four years, and she works seven days a week. She also generates additional income by selling bread. Erina has requested a loan of 200000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more supplies for her restaurant. The main business challenges for Erina include thieves, transportation and seasonality.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a fully stocked hotel and to buy a plot of land.

loans.use: to buy more supplies for her restaurant

loans.name: Ramon Lindor

texts.en:
Ramon is 22 years old. He lives with his wife and young daughter in the rural community of Sincape, in the district of Olmos, an agricultural area with a lot of commercial activity, located in the province of Lambayeque, more than an hour and a half from the city of Chiclayo. Currently, Ramon and his family do not have the basic services of electricity and running water. 

Ramon makes a living by raising and commercializing farm animals such as sheep and goats. He raises his livestock in a yard near his house, and when the animals have reached an appropriate size and weight, he offers them for sale to the general public and merchants in the local market. Ramon has three years of experience in this business and has built a loyal customer base. Additionally, Ramon works as an agricultural laborer on various small farms in the surrounding area.

Ramon would like to expand his business by purchasing more animals. To achieve this goal, he has solicited a loan of 1,000 nuevos soles through Edpyme Alternativa. This investment will allow Ramon to increase his income to continue investing in his business and cover his family’s expenses. His greatest wish is to continue improving the quality of life that he can offer to his wife and daughter.

loans.use: to purchase additional animals to raise and sell

loans.name: Aracely Del Carmen

texts.en:
Aracely is 23 years old, married and has three children. She and her family live in their own home in the village of Guaraguaos Alto in the Tambogrande district, more than four hours from the city of Chiclayo, capital of the Lambayeque region. Unlike many other residents of the area, Aracely and her family are fortunate to have access to electricity; however they do not have access to potable water. 

For the last three years, Aracely has earned a living by raising poultry and pigs. She raises her animals on land near her house in pens that are spacious and appropriately built. When the animals are full-grown, she sells them to merchants and the general public in the local market. Aracely generates additional income by selling clothes to members of her community and surrounding towns. 

Aracely plans to buy balanced feed to fatten her livestock. She hopes that her animals will gain weight in less time so she can sell them for a higher price in the market. To achieve her goals, she has requested from Edpyme Alternativa a loan of 500 nuevos soles. Aracely is a hard-working woman. With her businesses she is able to supplement her husband’s income and help pay for her family’s expenses.

loans.use: to purchase balanced feed for her livestock

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace N. lives in the Kisaasi neighborhood of Kampala, Uganda. She is single and has 3 children, all of whom are in school. Grace has a restaurant. She has been in this business for 5 years, and she works 7 days out of every week. She sells her products in a shop, by means of wholesale/retail.

Grace has requested a loan of 200,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bunches of bananas, beef, sweet potatoes and Irish potatoes. The main business challenges for Grace include thieves, transportation and seasonality. Her goals and hopes for her business are to own a fully stocked hotel and to buy a plot of land. Grace lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity but not to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include utility bills, rent, school fees and food for the family.

loans.use: to buy sweet and Irish potatoes and bananas

loans.name: Teodoro

texts.en:
Teodoro is 44 years old, married and has two children. He lives with his family in a house that they own in the town of Annape. His community is located in the rural part of the Morrope district and is populated with humble and hardworking people dedicated mostly to agricultural activities.

For more than 10 years, Teodoro has earned a living by cultivating cotton. He performs this activity on a small plot of land located near his house. He learned this trade from his father, who provided him with significant experience and knowledge. The income from his business allows him to continue supporting his family financially.

Teodoro would like to purchase seeds and equipment so that he can plant an additional hectare of cotton. For this reason, he has requested a loan of 2,000 PEN from Edpyme Alternativa. Teodoro is a hardworking man and a devoted father. He always watches over his family’s well-being and development. The people who know him have a lot of respect and affection for him.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and equipment to plant cotton

loans.name: Maria Virginia

texts.en:
Maria is 31 years old, married and has 4 young children. The family lives in their own home in the town of Tranca Fanupe, located 30 minutes from the city of Morrope, an area characterized by a population of humble and hardworking people dedicated mostly to agricultural activities. The community is small with approximately 200 families. Currently, this area does not have access to basic services such as electricity or potable water. 

For more than 12 years, Maria has raised and sold animals such as turkeys, ducks, sheep and pigs. Her business is located in the back part of her house which is equipped with sizable and appropriately built pens. When her animals reach a desired level of development, she sells them to merchants and the general public in the local market. She learned this trade from her parents, which means she understands the business inside and out. Although her business has competition from other farmers in the area, the high level of demand in the market for animals has allowed her to establish a loyal customer base while also providing ample access to potential new clients. 

Maria has requested a loan of 2,000 PEN from Edpyme Alternativa to purchase balanced feed to fatten her pigs and turkeys. She hopes that her animals will reach a better size and weight so that she can sell them for a higher price in the market. Maria has previously solicited a loan from Edpyme Alternativa, which she repaid in a timely manner. The loan allowed her to repair her pens and diversify her livestock by purchasing turkeys. Her business has grown impressively due to her hard work and dedication. Maria’s greatest goal is to continue providing for her family and improving their quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase balanced feed for her livestock

loans.name: Fernando

texts.es:
Fernando tiene 41 años de edad, es casado y tiene 5 hijos de los cuales 2 de ellos aun dependen de él. Viven en  casa propia de material rustico en el distrito de Sallique en la provincia de Jaén. Actualmente, no cuenta con servicios básicos como luz y agua. La única fuente de agua es la que obtiene de una vertiente que pasa cerca del pueblo.

Desde hace más de 10 anos, Fernando se dedica al cultivo de café, maíz , menestras y yuca. Cuenta con un pequeño terreno cerca de su casa donde siembra y cosecha sus productos. En la actualidad siembra 01 hectare de café y proyecta cosechar entre los meses de abril y junio 05 quintales de café, 08 quintales de menestras, 05 quintales de yuca, un millar de paltas y 12 quintales de maíz.

Desea invertir una parte de su crédito en el abono de su finca de café y otra parte para sembrar los mil plantones de café en un área que está preparando. Considerando que el precio del café está alcanzando niveles que no tenía en años anteriores, el invertir en nuevas áreas es una buena opción. Por lograr sus metas, ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 1500 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Fernando, 41, is married and has 5 children, 2 of whom are still dependent upon him.  They live in their own house, made of rustic materials, in the Sallique district of Jaen province.  At this time they lack basic services such as electricity and water.  Their only source of water is obtained from a spring that is located close to their town.

Fernando has been farming coffee, corn, beans and cassava root for more than 10 years.  He has a small piece of land near his house where he cultivates and harvests his products.  He is currently cultivating one hectare of coffee, and between the months of April and June expects to harvest 500 pounds of coffee, 800 pounds of beans, 500 pounds of cassava, 1,000 avocados and 1,200 pounds of corn. 

He wants to invest part of this loan in fertilizer for his coffee plants, and part to plant 1,000 coffee plants on some land that he is preparing.  Considering that the price of coffee is going up to levels not seen in previous years, investing in new areas is a good choice.  To achieve his goals, he is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa for 1,500 Peruvian soles.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other supplies for growing coffee

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret N. lives in the Ndeeba neighborhood of Kampala, Uganda. She is single and has 3 children, all of whom are in school. Margaret has a business selling used shoes. She has been in this business for 5 years, and she works 7 days out of every week. Margaret sells her products at the market, by means of wholesale/retail. She also generates additional income through a small retail shop.

Margaret has requested a loan of 200,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bales of used shoes. The main business challenges for Margaret include thieves, transportation and seasonality. Her goal and hope for her business is to start importing used shoes. Margaret lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity but not to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include utility bills, rent, school fees and food for the family.

loans.use: to buy more bales of used shoes

loans.name: Raul

texts.es:
Raul tiene 37 años de edad y es casado con 2 hijos. Viven en casa propia en Morrope, un distrito poblado por gente humilde y trabajadora que se dedica a la agricultura. Se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Lambayeque, a más de cuarenta minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace 2 años, se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales. Realiza esta actividad en la parte posterior de su domicilio. Cuando sus animales alcancen un buen nivel de desarrollo, los vende a los comerciantes y al público en general en los mercados locales. Cuentan con una clientela ya establecida en la zona. Aprendió esta actividad de su padre, es decir conoce a la perfección el rubro. Adicionalmente, genera ingresos adicionales brindando servicios de transporte de pasajeros en su mototaxi, un vehículo que consta de una moto y una cabina para movilizar personas en su interior.

Desea ampliar su negocio e invertir su crédito en la compra de más animales y alimento balanceado. También planea realizar unos arreglos a sus corrales. Por ello, ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 1000 nuevos soles. Raul es un padre entregado a su familia y que siempre vela por su bienestar y desarrollo. Las personas que le conocen le tienen mucha estima y cariño.
texts.en:
Raul is 37 years old and is married with 2 children. They live in their own house in Morrope, a district populated with humble people and agricultural workers. It is located in the province of Lambayeque, more than 40 minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

For the past 2 years Raul has worked raising and selling animals. He does this in the back part of his house. When his animals reach a good level of development, he sells them to shopkeepers and the public in general in local markets. He has already established a clientele in his area. He learned this trade from his father and is said to know the field perfectly. Additionally, he generates income by offering a transportation service to passengers in his mototaxi, a vehicle that consists of a motor and a cabin in its interior for people. 

He wants to increase his business and invest his loan in buying more animals and balanced feed. He also plans to make some repairs to their pens. For this, he has seen it necessary to request a loan from Edpyme Alternativa of 1000 nuevos soles. Raul is a father devoted to his family and he always looks after their welfare and development. The people who know him have much esteem and affection for him.

loans.use: to buy more cattle, balanced feeds, and to make repairs.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce N. lives in the Mengo Mackay neighborhood of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has 5 children, all of whom are in school. Joyce has a restaurant. She has been in this business for 10 years, and she works 7 days out of every week. Joyce sells her products at the market, by means of wholesale/retail. She also generates additional income through farming.

Joyce has requested a loan of 200,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bunches of bananas, sweet and Irish potatoes and beef. The main business challenges for Joyce include thieves, transportation and seasonality. Her goal and aspiration for her business is to own a fully stocked restaurant. Joyce lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity but not to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include utility bills, school fees and food for the family.

loans.use: to buy bananas, sweet and Irish potatoes and beef

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en:
Jackline N. lives in the Kisaasi neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has two children, both of whom are in school. Jackline has a restaurant. She has been in this business for five years, and she works seven days out of every week. Jackline sells her products in a shop, by means of wholesale/retail. 

Jackline has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bunches of bananas, beef, beans and maize flour. She also generates additional income through selling milk. 

The main business challenges for Jackline include thieves, transportation and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start selling at wholesale only. 

Jackline lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity but not to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include paying utility bills, rent, school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy bananas, beef, beans and maize flour

loans.name: Nulu

texts.en:
Nulu K. lives in the Mengo Mackay neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is widowed and has four children, all of whom are in school. 

Nulu has a business of selling charcoal and bunches of bananas. She has been in this business for six years, and she works seven days out of every week. Nulu sells her products at the market, by means of retail. 

She has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of charcoal and bunches of bananas. She also generates additional income through rental rooms. 

The main business challenges for Nulu include thieves, transportation and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start selling at wholesale only. Nulu lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity but not to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and medication.

loans.use: to buy more bags of charcoal and bunches of bananas

loans.name: Daycis Del Socorro

texts.es: Daycis, tiene 36 años de edad , nacida Rio Abajo comarca ubicada Pueblo Nuevo, municipio de Estelí , esta casada, tiene tres hijos de 16 ,12,y 2 años de edad respectivamente están en la escuela ,se dedica a la venta de pollo negocio en el cual  lleva 5 años su esposo le ayuda a atender la venta. Ella inicio por medio de la ayuda de su hermana quien le presto dinero para comenzar con este negocio, lo primero que hizo fue comprar el  refrigerador , luego compro un quintal de pollo, para ese entonces ella tenia 29 años de edad vendiendo en Pueblo Nuevo donde viaja diario 3km en bicicleta y le toma 20 minutos en el viaje para poder llegar temprana y vender su producto. Su esposo coopera en el hogar ya que el también trabaja en una rosticería. Le gustaría poder vender su producto en el mercado municipal tener un solo punto venta propio. El crédito lo solicito para comprar 750 libras de pollo. Esto le ayudara a adquirir el producto a un mejor precio, pagar de contado el producto, aumentar sus ventas y clientela. Tiene planes de ampliar su negocio y ahorrar para asegurar una buena educación universitaria a sus hijos pues es la mejor herencia que les puede dejar .Como meta próxima desea comprar un congelador para colocar mas producto.
texts.en: Daycis, 36, was born in Rio Abajo, a district located in Pueblo Nuevo in the municipality of Esteli.  She is married and has 3 children aged 16, 12 and 2 years, who are in school.  She has had a business selling chicken for 5 years.  Her husband helps her with the business.  She started with some help from her sister, who lent her money so that she could start this business.  The first thing that she bought was a refrigerator.  Later she bought 100 pounds of chicken.   At the time she was 29.  She goes to sell in Pueblo Nuevo where she travels 3 kilometers each day by bicycle so that she can arrive early to sell her products; the trip takes 20 minutes.  Her husband helps out in the house and he also works in a chicken restaurant.  She would like to be able to sell her products in the municipal market where she could have her own stand.  She will use this loan to purchase 750 pounds of chicken.  This will help her to acquire her products at a better price since she will be paying on a cash basis, helping her to increase her sales and get more customers.  She plans to expand her business and save for her children's college educations, because this is the best inheritance that she could give them.  Her near term goal is to buy a freezer so that she can store more products.

loans.use: to buy 750 pounds of chicken

loans.name: Rene De Jesus

texts.es:
Don René, de 39 años de edad, es originario de San Rafael  un municipio de Jinotega vive en la comunidad de Nomanji, tiene  dos hijos de 9 y 10 años respectivamente, de oficio agricultor lleva 20 años ejerciendo esta actividad. Inicio con su papa sembrando repollo, chiltoma a la edad de 6 años, apoyaba su papa en la labores del campo por tal motivo no pudo seguir estudiando, no logro terminar la primaria pues sus padre no tenia recursos económicos para ponerlo a estudiar, se dedico  en lleno a las labores del campo. A los 14 años  se independizo  logrando tener su propio terreno. El vende  sus hortalizas en Managua, Jinotega, Matagalpa, donde cuenta con ayuda de su compañera de vida  quien lo apoya en la venta además tiene otro negocio de pulpería dentro de su casa. El tiene la visión de que sus negocios irán prosperando poco a poco. Pues le gustaría que su producto fuera de gran demanda en el mercado de Managua y Estelí.
Solicita el préstamo para ampliar la siembra de frijol .Con este crédito el podrá lograr una mayor producción de frijol, venderlo en mayor cantidad y desde luego ayudar en su economía familiar.
Tiene como planes futuros comprar un vehículo de transporte de carga para llevar los quintales de frijol y no pagar altos costos de transporte hacerlo el mismo, así también poder comprar una manzana mas de tierra para sembrar. Tiene como meta próxima sembrar sandias y aumentar la producción de frijol y hortaliza.
texts.en:
René, 39, is originally from San Rafael, a municipality in Jinotega; he lives in the community of Nomanji.  He has two children who are 9 and 10 years of age.  He’s been a farmer, by profession, for twenty years.  He started out at the age of six helping his father plant potatoes, cabbage and peppers and this is why he was unable to continue studying.  He never completed elementary school because his parent’s lacked the economic resources to send him to school.  He devoted himself fully to field work.

At the age of 14 he became independent and managed to acquire his own field.  He sells vegetables in Managua, Jinotega and Matagalpa where his life partner helps him sell; he also has a second business: a home-based grocery store.

His vision is that his businesses will develop gradually because he’d like it if his produce were in great demand in the Managua and Estelí markets.

He is requesting a loan to expand his bean crops.  The loan will make it possible for him to attain higher bean production to sell in larger quantities and thus help his family’s economy.

Among his future plans is the purchase of a cargo transporting vehicle to take his quintals of beans and save paying the high transportation costs by doing it himself; he’d also be able to buy an additional manzana (unit of land measure) of land to cultivate.  His next goal is to plant watermelon and to increase his bean and vegetable production.

loans.use: to expand his bean crops.

loans.name: Merly Pugoy Group

texts.en:
Merla is from the village of Libertad Bajo, Sinacaban. She is 53 years old and is the group leader of this four-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loan of their fellow group members if they are delinquent or default. 

Merla is married and has four adult children. She owns and operates a business producing and selling food in her community. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 3,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. 

On February 18, 2011 Merla joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to do business. 

Merla is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be her first loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About PMPC

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Mercedita

texts.en:
Mercedita is from the village of Mialen, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 43 years old, married, and has five adult children. To make a living, Mercedita runs a beauty salon. 

Mercedita has been engaged in her business for 10 years and earns approximately 4,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. Mercedita joined PMPC in 2009 to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to do business. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase beauty products. 

Mercedita is requesting a new loan of 45,000 PHP with which she will purchase equipment for her beauty salon. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Emily from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it. 

About PMPC

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. loans.name: Florida Semana's Group

While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. 

Florida is married and has three school-aged children. Florida owns and operates a livestock business. The main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for fattening and sale. Florida has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. 

In 2008, Florida joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to do business. Florida has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase breeding livestock. Florida is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase hog feed and other supplies. This loan will be the seventh loan taken out by Florida from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisher-folk and small entrepreneurs. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. loans.name: Flordeliza

texts.en:
Flordeliza is a 40 year-old married woman with 3 children. Her oldest child is 22 years old.

Flordeliza is a farmer working in Banga, South Cotabato. She grows rice that she sells to the people in her community. Aside from farming, she also owns a sari-sari (general) store. Flordeliza works hard to provide for her family. 

This loan will be used to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and other farm inputs

loans.name: Antonio

texts.en:
Antonio A. is from the village of Arwas Diadi, Nueva Vizcaya. He is 56 years old. Antonio is widowed and has three adult children. Antonio owns and operates a furniture-making business. The main source of income for the business comes from making & selling general household furniture to local businesses and community members. Antonio has been engaged in his business for over seven years and earns approximately 3,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. 

In 2011, Antonio joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to do business. Antonio is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw materials to make additional furniture. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Antonio from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisher-folk and small entrepreneurs.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is from the village of P-2 Nailon Tudela Misamis Occidental. She is 29 years old, married, and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Juliet  sells rice in the local community. 

Juliet has been engaged in her business for six years and earns approximately 10,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. Juliet joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to do business. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 50,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional rice to sell. 

Juliet is requesting a new loan of 50,000 PHP with which she will purchase additional inventory and use for working capital. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Juliet from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is a 41-year-old married woman with 3 children. Her eldest is 17 years old. Gloria is engaged in farming. She has been growing rice for 15 years. She sells her harvest to the people in her community.

Gloria has requested a loan to purchase farm fertilizer and other supplies. She is hopeful that this loan will help improve her harvest.

Gloria wishes to have a stable business and for her children to succeed.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and other supplies

loans.name: Hilaria's Group

texts.en:
Hilaria S. is from the village of Culalabat, Cauayan City, Isabela. She is 45 years old. Hilaria is the group leader of a 11-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. 

Hilaria is married and has three adult children. Hilaria owns and operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Hilaria has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 4,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. 

In 2007, Hilaria joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business. She has successfully repaid her last loan from ASKI, which was for 12,000 PHP and was used purchase additional products to sell.

Hilaria is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her eighth from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisher-folk and small entrepreneurs.

loans.name: Bonifacio

texts.en:
Bonifacio is from the village of Centro Napu, Tudela, Misamis Occidental. He is 54 years old, married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Bonifacio runs a business venture in which he makes furniture.

Bonifacio has been engaged in his business for 10 years and earns approximately 10,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month from it. Bonifacio joined PMPC in 2008 to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 42,000 PHP from PMPC.

Bonifacio is requesting a new loan of 50,000 PHP, which he will use to repair a transport vehicle used in delivering orders to his customer. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Bonifacio from PMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

<b>About PMPC</>

loans.name: Quibranza Group

texts.en: Nellie is from the village of Libertad Bajo, Sinacaban Misamis Occidental. She is 57 years old and is the group leader of this four-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loan of their fellow group members if they are delinquent or default. Nellie is married and has seven adult children. She owns and operates a general store, selling food products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over 12 years and earns approximately 12,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month. In 2006, Nellie joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,900 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and was used as working capital. Nellie is requesting a new loan of 14,900 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be her ninth from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About PMPC Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase products to sell at her general store

loans.name: Ruslan

texts.en:
Ruslan is married and has a daughter Snezhanna. He lives in a small town called Maliye Kopani in the Kherson region, and runs his farming venture there. Ruslan owns several greenhouses and grows tomatoes, potatoes and cucumbers in them. He has been in the agricultural business for 16 years and has invested about 200,000 Grivnyas in this enterprise. 

Ruslan is requesting a loan of 15,000 Grivnyas to purchase seeds, wood, fertilizers and polyethylene film for his greenhouses. He is planning to grow 5,000 tomatoes, 4,000 cucumbers and 3,000 potato plants.

loans.use: purchase seeds, plastic film and fertilizers for the spring farming season

loans.name: Yuriy

texts.en:
Yuriy is married with a daughter, Yuliya. He is a farmer from Gladkovka. Yuriy grows early spring vegetables, i.e. tomatoes, cabbage, potatoes and cucumbers. He has been in farming for 10 years. Currently, his turnover capital amounts to 200,000 Grivnyas. 

Yuriy is seeking a loan of 15,000 Grivnyas to purchase seeds, wood, plastic film and fertilizers for greenhouse maintenance. He is planning to grow 4,000 tomatoes and 1,000 cucumbers in his greenhouses and sunflowers on his land lots.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, wood and fertilizers for his greenhouses

loans.name: Dmitriy

texts.en:
Dmytriy is married and has a grown son. Dmytriy runs a farming enterprise growing crops such as tomato, cabbage and marrow squash. He lives in the small town of Gladkovka.  Dmytriy first tried his luck in the farming business 20 years ago. Presently, he has 60,000 Grivnyas of turnover capital. His average net profit amounts to 3,300 Grivnyas a month. 

Dmitriy is requesting a loan of 10,000 Grivnyas to invest in growing 3,000 early spring tomato, 1,000 cucumber, and 500 marrow squash bush-type plants, and 10,000 cabbage clusters.  Dmytriy is an experienced farmer. He knows that the key to success in growing vegetables in greenhouses is to know what to plant and when. Dmitriy enjoys his job. He likes to supply his customers with healthy, organic produce every year.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, clear plastic film and fertilizers for his greenhouses

loans.name: Vladimir

texts.en:
Vladimir is married with an 11 year old son named Igor.  Vladimir lives in Kamenka, a predominantly agricultural region of Ukraine.  He runs a greenhouse business and owns two lots of land and five big-arch greenhouses. Vladimir launched his business ten years ago. He has already invested about 80,000 Grivnyas in his business. His annual expenses on seeds and film are 37,000 Grivnyas.  

Vladimir requests a loan of 15,000 Grivnyas to construct an additional greenhouse and purchase quality polyethylene film to cover it. One of his plans for the future is to expand his farming business and purchase a machine that prepares compound animal feed. The machine will help Vladimir engage in farm animal production as well as keep his greenhouse business running efficiently.

loans.use: To construct an additional greenhouse and purchase plastic film to cover it.

loans.name: Anatolia Morales Group

texts.en:
Anatolia is from the village of Duanguican, Tudela, Misamis Occidental. She is 62 years old and is the group leader of this three-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are both collectively responsible for paying back the loan of their fellow group member if they are delinquent or default.

Anatolia is married and has three adult children. She owns and operates a business in the agriculture sector, raising livestock in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over twenty two years and earns approximately 8,400 PHP a month.

In 2008, Anatolia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC.  

Anatolia is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase livestock feeds and other supplies. This will be her sixth loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business.

About PMPC
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. loans.use: purchase livestock feeds and other supplies

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane P. is from the village of Tuao North Bagabag, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 36 years old, married, and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Mary Jane plants and harvests rice for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2010, Mary Jane joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She  has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to pay for services to increase crop yield. 

Mary Jane is requesting a new loan of 35000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. This will be her  2nd loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: purchase seeds and seedlings for her rice farm

loans.name: Glory's Group

texts.en:
Glory J. is from the village of Luzon, Cabatuan, Isabela. She is 47 years old. Glory is the group leader of a 5-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. 

Glory is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Glory operates a business venture in the food sector making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from making and selling "longganisa" (pork sausages) and "tocino" (cured pork). Glory has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month from these activities. 

In 2011, Glory joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 6000 PHP to purchase ingredients to make more products to sell. This loan will be her first loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 

About ASKI: 

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: purchase ingredients to make food for sale

loans.name: Nilufar

texts.ru: Давлатали Нилуфар проживает в районе Варзоб. Ей 21 год. Не замужем. Живет вместе с родителями. Имеет среднее образование. Она два года как занимается торговлей. У нее имеется магазин со смешанным ассортиментом. То есть она продает продукты питания, парфюмерию, косметику, сувениры и посуду. Кредит берет для покупки посуды, набора чашек и фужеров.
texts.en: Nilufar D. lives in the Varzob district.  She is 21 years old and single.  She lives with her parents.  Nilufar has a secondary education.  She has been involved in retail sales for two years.  She has a store, where she sells various merchandise, including food products, perfumery, cosmetics, souvenirs and dishware.  She is requesting this loan for the purchase of dishware, a set of cups and glasses.

loans.use: to purchase dishware, a set of cups and glasses

loans.name: Hanifa

texts.ru: Комилова Ханифа проживает в районе Варзоб. Возраст, 40 лет. Замужем, имеет 4 детей. Образование - высшее, учительница. По профессии проработала 19 лет. Сейчас она занимается шитьем национальных платьев и вышивкой. Она в основном берет заказы на дому. Еще она берет однотонные материалы и вышивает разные цветочки. В этой области уже 5 лет. Кредит берет для покупки ниток, бисера и тканей.
texts.en: Hanifa K. lives in Varzob. She is 40 years old, married, and has four children. She has a higher education as a teacher.  She worked in her specialty for nineteen years. Now she makes traditional dresses and embroiders. She primarily takes orders and works from home. She takes monochromatic materials and embroiders different flowers on them. She has been doing this for five years.  She is taking out a loan to buy thread, beads, and fabric.

loans.use: to buy thread, beads, and fabric

loans.name: Sangimo

texts.ru: Чагирова Сангимо проживает в городе Курган-Тюбе. Возраст, 47 лет. Замужем, имеет 2 детей. Муж занимается торговлей. Дети, учатся. Сама Сангимо занимается торговлей на центральном рынке района. Она в основном занимается продажей зелени. Кредит берет для покупки зелени и фисташек. Она хочет взять в аренду еще одну торговую точку рядом со своей точкой и начать торговлю фисташками. Так как сейчас сезон торговли фисташек.
texts.en: Sangimo C. lives in the city of Qurgan-Tube. She is 47 years old, married, and has two children. Her husband is in trade. Her children study. Sangimo trades in the central market of the area. She primarily sells greens. She is taking out a loan to buy greens and pistachios. She wishes to lease one more shop near the first and begin to trade in pistachios. This is now the season to sell pistachios.

loans.use: to buy greens and pistachios

loans.name: Erlinda's Group

texts.en:
Erlinda V. is from the village of F., Ilagan, Isabela. She is 49 years old. Erlinda is the group leader of a 9-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Erlinda is married and has 10 school-aged children. To make a living, Erlinda owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for fattening and sale. Erlinda has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2010, Erlinda joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Erlinda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future. 

Erlinda is requesting a new loan of 9000 PHP, which will be used to purchase hog feed and other supplies. This will be her 3rd loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to make improvements to her house. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: purchase hog feed and other supplies

loans.name: Mahmuda

texts.ru: Додохочаева Махмуда проживает в городе Курган-Тюбе. Возраст, 47 лет. Замужем, имеет 3 детей. Муж занимается торговлей на рынке. Дочка и сыновья учатся в средней школе. Сама Махмуда имеет среднее образование. Она более 5 лет занимается торговлей. У нее имеется мебельный магазин. Кредит берет для приобретения новых видов мебели.
texts.en: Mahmuda D. lives in the city of Qurgan-Tube. She is 47 years old, married, and has three children. Her husband trades in the market. Her daughter and sons study in high school. Mahmuda has a secondary education. She has been in trade for more than five years. She has a furniture store. She is taking out a loan to buy new kinds of furniture.

loans.use: to buy new kinds of furniture for resale

loans.name: Michelle's Group

texts.en:
Michelle C. is from the village of San Isidro, Ilagan, Isabela. She is 23 years old. Michelle is the group leader of a 5-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Michelle is married and has one infant child. To make a living, she owns and operates a general store, selling food and daily use products in the local community. Michelle has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2011, Michelle joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Michelle is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This will be her first loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: purchase new items to expand her store's product offering

loans.name: Firdavsjon

texts.ru: Бозоров Фирдавсчон проживает в городе Куляб. Ему 28 лет. Он женат. Имеет 3 детей. Жена, домохозяйка. Сам Фирдавсчон предоставляет услугу, он развозит людей по маршруту Куляб-Хамадони. В этой области уже четыре года. Кредит берет для покупки новой машины этой же марки. Он хочет продать свою имеющуюся машину и, положив сверху деньги, купить новую.
texts.en: Firdavsjon B. lives in the city of Kulob. He is 28 years old, married, and has three children. His wife is a housewife. Firdavsjon provides a service driving people along the route between Kulyab and Hamadoni. He has been doing this for four years. He is taking out a loan to buy a new car just like his old one.  He wants to sell his current car and, with the money from the loan, buy a new one.

loans.use: to buy a new car

loans.name: Persevérance Plus Group

texts.en:
Veronique is the chairwoman of a community bank named “Persevérance Plus”, composed of 13 microentrepreneurs united in solidarity to receive loans from Kiva through IMF HOPE RDC with the goal of developing their businesses. 

Veronique is 36 years old and is married. She runs a telephone booth and sells soft drinks to earn income. She has been in her business for years. With hard work and determination, her business prospered.  Veronique’s business is located in the east of the city of Kinshasa. She has previously received seven Hope RD Congo loans and has repaid them correctly.  With the next loan, she intends to purchase more prepaid cards and increase the inventory in order to reinforce her working capital. Currently, she makes US$11 in profit each day. Her ambition is to someday open a shop in her area. Veronique takes care of her two nephews.

loans.use: purchase more prepaid cards for her phone use business

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Waleed

texts.en:
Waleed is a young man from Tulkarem city; he works in an investment company, Waleed has been saving money for a while and took out a loan from FATEN to purchase a piece of land that he is thinking of using for building a house in the future when he saves more money.

Waleed is single and is trying to build a house, save money, and secure his future, Waleed is photographed in the picture above.

loans.use: to purchase a piece of land to build a house.

loans.name: Progreso Group

texts.es:
