La A.C. “PROGRESO” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Villa Adela.  Está compuesta por ocho integrantes y tiene como presidenta a la señora Florencia.   Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: carnicería, tienda de barrio, costura de polleras, tejido de máquina de buzos, venta de regalos, venta de tenis, venta de CD’s.

La señora Florencia, presidenta de la asociación comunal, indica que trabaja con Pro Mujer hace diez años y que ingreso a la institución por la invitación de su mamá.

En la actualidad la señora Florencia tiene un negocio de venta carne y trabaja en el hace 22 años, nos cuenta que este negocio lo aprendió de su hermana. El crédito que sacará ahora es para aumentar su mercadería (carne), la que compra del matadero de El Alto (Final Los andes)  lo vende en el mercado de Villa Exaltación de Lunes a domingo, en horas de 8:00 a 14:00. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, pues ella vive en concubinato y tiene tres hijos

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el ahorro y el crédito completo.
texts.en:
The community bank called "Progresso" will start their first loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Centro Focal de Villa Adela. The group has 8 members and their president is Florencia. The members of the group run various businesses, including: a butchers shop, neighborhood store, sewing skirts, machine knitting sweaters, gift store, selling tennis shoes, and selling CDs.
Florencia, the president of the community bank, says that she has been working with Pro Mujer for 10 years and that her mother invited her to join the institution.
Currently, Florencia has a store selling meat, and she has worked there for 22 years. She tells us that she learned this business from her sister. The loan that she is requesting will be used to increase her supplies of meat, which she buys from the El Alto slaughterhouse (Final Los Andes). She sells this in the market called Villa Exaltación from Monday to Sunday between the hours of 8:00am and 2:00pm. This work gives her the resources to support her family, she lives with her partner and has three children. 
When she was asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she said that she likes the savings and full credit.

loans.use: to increase capital and buy meat

loans.name: 25 De Marzo Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “25 DE MARZO” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Villa Adela.  Está compuesta por ocho integrantes y tiene como presidenta a la señora Juana.   Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: macrame de mantas, tejido a máquina de enaguas, macramé e hilados, tejidos a chompas, compra y venta de ganado, venta de verduras, venta de frutas.

La señora Juana, presidenta de la asociación comunal, indica que trabaja con Pro Mujer hace 10 años y que ingreso a la institución por la promoción en zona que se hizo.

En la actualidad la señora Juana tiene un negocio de venta de verduras que trabaja hace 17 años, nos cuenta que este negocio lo aprendió este oficio de su hermana mayor. El crédito que sacará ahora es para aumentar su mercadería (compra de verduras), la que compra de la Ceja, de la cuidad de El Alto y la venderá en las ferias de lunes a domingo de 7:00 a 20:00. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, pues ella vive en concubinato y tiene tres hijos

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta los servicios integrales, salud y crédito.
texts.en:
The “25 DE MARZO” (March 25th) community bank is beginning its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Villa Adela regional office.  The group has eight members and its president is Juana.  The businesses that the members of the bank are engaged in are varied and include: macramé-ing blankets, weaving 'enaguas' (traditional underskirts) by machine, macramé and spinning yarn, knitting sweaters, buying and selling livestock, selling vegetables and selling fruit.

Juana, the bank's president, says that she has been working with Pro Mujer for 10 years and became a member of the institution when they were doing some promotional activities in her area.

Juana has a business selling vegetables which she has owned for 17 years.  She tells us that she learned the business from her older sister.  Juana will use the loan that she is currently requesting to increase her merchandise (buying vegetables).  She buys her merchandise in La Ceja, in the city of El Alto and sells it in street markets from Monday to Sunday, from 7.00am to 8.00pm.  This work allows her to make the money she needs to support her family.  Juana lives with her partner and has three children.

When we asked her what she likes about Pro Mujer, she replied that she likes the comprehensive services they offer, the health services and the loans.

loans.use: to buy vegetables

loans.name: Perlitas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “PERLITAS” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Los Andes.  Está compuesta por ocho integrantes y tiene como presidenta a la señora Justina.   Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: Tejido de mantas, tejido de chompas, venta de comida, tejido de gorritos, tejido de buzos.

La señora Justina, presidenta de la asociación comunal, indica que es su primer ciclo con  Pro Mujer y que ingreso por la promosión en zona que se desarrolla

En la actualidad la señora Justina tiene un negocio de elaboración de productos en tejido que trabaja hace 20 años, nos cuenta que este negocio lo aprendió ella sola. El crédito que sacará ahora es para la compra de lana para vender polainas por mayor. Su materia prima la compra de la 16 de Julio de las tiendas grandes, los productos ya concluidos los venderá en las ferias. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, pues ella esta casada y tiene cinco hijos

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta los servicios integrales, salud y crédito.
texts.en:
The rural communal bank "Perlitas" is starting its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer, at its central offices in Los Andes.  This group has 8 members, and the president is Justina.  The group members have a variety of different businesses, including: weaving blankets, knitting sweaters, selling food, knitting hats, and knitting jackets.

Justina, president of the communal bank, states that this is her first loan cycle with Pro Mujer, and that she joined the organization because of a promotion in her area.

Justina currently has a business making knitted products.  She has done this work for 20 years, and she tells us that she learned this business on her own.  She will use this loan to purchase wool so that she can sell leggings at wholesale.  She purchases her raw materials from the big stores on "16 de Julio" street, and she will sell the finished products in the  markets.  This type of work allows her to generate resources to support her family; she is married and has 5 children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responded that she likes the comprehensive services offered, including both health and credit services.

loans.use: to purchase wool to make leggings to sell at wholesale

loans.name: Twitezimbere Number 4 Group

texts.fr: Theogene N. est commerçant de boutique, et membre du groupe Twitezimbere no 4.  Il a 39 ans, il est marié, né au Rwanda, et il a 2 enfants entre 3 mois et 3 ans.  Il a une éducation d’école primaire, et ce crédit est son premier cycle avec ACB.  Il va utiliser son prêt pour acheter des articles(riz, savons, haricot, l'huile,...) a revendre pour son commerce de boutique, et sa stratégie pour la croissance de l’affaire est de bien accueillir les clients.  Il voudrait augmenter son chiffre d’affaire, et scolariser tous ses enfants.
texts.en: Theogene N. is a shopkeeper and member of the group Twitezimbere Number 4.  He is 39 years old, married, a native of Rwanda and has two children between the ages of 3 months and 3 years.  He has a primary school education and this loan is his first cycle with ACB.  He will use his loan for his shop and his strategy to increase business is to really welcome the customers.  He would like to increase his net revenue and educate both of his children.

loans.use: To buy rice, soap, beans, and oil to retail in his food store

loans.name: Twisungane Kirigo Group

texts.fr: Therese Mukamugema est agricultrice, et membre du groupe Twisungane Kirigo.  Elle est mariée, née a Rwanda, et elle a 3 enfants entre 13 ans et 20 ans.  Un de ses enfants va à l’école.  Ce crédit est son premier cycle avec ACB, et elle va utiliser son prêt pour son agriculture du riz.  Sa stratégie pour la croissance de l’affaire est d’avoir le moyen de cultiver le riz.  Elle voudrait satisfaire des besoins des clients qui cherchent le riz.   Elle voudrait satisfaire des besoins de sa famille, et aussi payer facilement les minervaux.
texts.en: Therese Mukamugema is a farmer and member of the Twisungane Kirigo group.  She is married, a native of Rwanda, and has 3 children between the ages of 13 and 20.  This loan is her first cycle with ACB and she is going to use it for her rice farming.  Her strategy for increasing business is to have the means to grow rice so that she can meet the needs of her clients in search of rice.  She would also like to meet the needs of her family as well as easily pay their tuitions.

loans.use: Rice farming

loans.name: Gaspard

texts.fr: Gaspard M.  est commerçant dans le secteur de Rubavu.  Il a 41 ans, il est marié, née à Rutsiro-Rwanda, et il a 6 enfants entre 16 ans et 2 ans, et aussi 1 personne en charge.  4 de ses enfants vont à l’école, et il a fini 2 ans d’école secondaire.  Ce crédit est son premier cycle avec ACB, et il va utiliser son prêt pour l’achat des  50 tôles pour couverture de sa maison, 40 planches pour les portes, 2portes métalliques, 2 fenêtres, 10kgs de clous pour la construction de sa maison.  Sa stratégie pour la croissance de l’affaire est la construction d’une belle maison et beaucoup d’autres pour les locataires et  en  bénéficier de plus.  Il voudrait devenir une grand locataire.  Pour sa vie, elle voudrait améliorer le niveau de vie de sa famille, scolariser ses enfants, ainsi tous les enfants a sa charge.
texts.en: Gaspard M. is a businessman in the area of Rubavu.  He is 41 years old, married, a native of Rutsiro-Rwanda, and has 6 children between the ages of 2 and 16 as well as one other person in his care.  Four of his children attend school and he himself finished 2 years of secondary school.  This loan is his first cycle with ACB and he will use it to purchase 50 sheets of metal for the roof of his house, 40 planks for the doors, 2 metal doors, 2 windows and 10 kg of nails.  His strategy for increasing business is the construction of a beautiful house and many others for the current tenants and to attract more.  He would like to become a big landlord.  For his life, he would like to improve the quality of life of his family, educate his children and all the children in his care.

loans.use: To purchase sheet metal, planks, windows, nails, etc... for the construction of his house

loans.name: Iman

texts.en:
Iman is a young woman from Jabalia refugee camp; she has recently married. Iman took out a loan from FATEN to purchase home appliances such as an iron and a heater. She also wants to use part of the loan amount to fix the windows.

Iman's husband Abdul Qader appears in the picture here as she is a religious woman as are most Gaza Strip inhabitants.

loans.use: to purchase home appliances and fix her windows.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase home furniture.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase birds and feed for them.

loans.name: Maysoun

texts.en:
Maysoun is a young woman from Jineen, married to Hmaza and the mother of three daughters and three sons. Maysoun wants build an extension and make it a room for the sons as the house is becoming small for a big family.

Maysoun took out a loan from FATEN to pay for part of the building expenses. Maysoun's husband is a Palestinian National Authority employee.

Maysoun appears in the picture above in FATEN's branch in Jenin.

loans.use: to build a room next to her house.

loans.name: Bassam

texts.en:
Bassam is a young man from Jineen.  Bassam lives with his family and helps, together with his brother, to take care of the family. He took out a loan from FATEN to purchase home appliances that they need to replace their old stove and washing machine.

Bassam is photographed in the picture here in FATEN's branch in Jenin.

loans.use: to purchase home appliances.

loans.name: Naeem

texts.en:
Naeem K. is a young man who is a father of three young daughters, Naeem has been building a small house for a long time and now he needs a loan from FATEN to install tiles, paint the walls, and fix the roof.

Naeem, who appears in the picture here, is from Jenin which is famous for its olive trees and agriculture.

loans.use: to fix up his house: paint, fix the roof and install tiles.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to do maintenance on car used as taxi.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to prepare a store to start selling shoes.

loans.name: Carlos Kleber

texts.es:
Carlos es un hombre trabajador que tiene un pequeño bar de comidas rápidas. Tiene muchas aspiraciones con su negocio ya que el inicio el bar de comidas porque no tenia trabajo. 

En la actualidad vende todo tipo de comidas rápidas, sanduches, bebidas, snack,  desde muy temprano comienza el labor en su negocio hasta la tarde. Tienes muchas aspiraciones de continuar con su negocio por eso quiere comenzar con un préstamo para comprar snack y así generar más ingresos.
texts.en:
Carlos is a hardworking man who manages a small fast food eatery.  He started the snack shop when he was unemployed, and aspires to steadily grow his business. 

Carlos sells all kinds of fast food, sandwiches, drinks and snacks.  He starts early in the morning and stays open into the evening.  In order to expand his sales, he seeks a loan to increase the variety and quantity of his stock of snack foods.

loans.use: to buy more inventory for a snack shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to repay relatives and friends who loaned money to him to start his family.

loans.name: Byron Alexis

texts.es:
Byron de 24 años. Joven emprendedor que inicio su actividad como conductor haciendo mandados. Un día su padre le compro un auto y le enseño a conducir.

En la actualiza trabaja solo en todo día y diariamente recogiendo pasajeros y haciendo mandados. Con el préstamo desea comprar materiales de construcción. En un futuro quiere llegar a tener su propio negocio.
texts.en:
24 year old Byron is a young entrepreneur who started work as a driver running errands. One day his father bought him a car and taught him to drive. 
Today he works alone and works every day picking up passengers and running errands. He wants to use the loan to buy construction materials. In the future he wants to have his own business.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Hector Juan

texts.es:
Héctor de 35 años, un hombre trabajador que inicio vendiendo ropa. Un día su tío le pidió ayuda en la panificadora y desde allí le gusto esta actividad de preparación y ventas de panes y dulces.

En la actualidad el trabaja en la panadería con ayuda de su esposa desde las 3 de la mañana hasta la noche. Con el préstamo quiere compra materiales como harina, manteca, huevos para poder mejorar su negocio e incrementar sus ganancias. En un futuro desea seguir en el negocio y adecuar su vivienda para darles todo lo mejor a sus hijos en los estudios y lo personal.
texts.en:
Héctor, 35, is a hard working man who started out selling clothes.  One day his uncle asked him for help in his bakery and since then he liked the activity of making and selling bread and sweets.

He currently works in the bakery with help from his wife from 3am until nighttime.  He wants to us the loan to buy supplies like flour, lard and eggs to improve his business and increase profits.

In the future he’d like to stay in business and furnish his home in such a way as to provide his children with the all the best both for their persons and for their education.

loans.use: to buy flour, lard and eggs.

loans.name: Marco Antonio

texts.es:
Marco de 43 años, hombre trabajador que inspira en sacar adelante a su familia. Se inicio desde niño con su padre en su negocio que quedaba en suburbio aprendió ese oficio y le gusto. Desde allí abrió un taller propio en los Vergeles.

En la actualidad el empieza su trabajo desde las 8:00 am  a 17:00pm. No tiene dificultades en su trabajo su esposa se dedica a los quehaceres domésticos. Con el préstamo desea comprar materiales de reparación para así mejorar su negocio. En un futuro lo que más quiere es ampliar su negocio y así mejorar su condición económica y darle lo mejor a familia en lo que necesiten.
texts.en:
Marco, 43, is a hard working man who aspires to move his family ahead.  He started working while still a little boy with his father in his business located in Suburbio; he learned the occupation and liked it.  Since then, he opened his own shop in Los Vergeles.

He starts work at 8am and goes until 5pm.  He doesn’t have any difficulties at work and his wife is a housewife.  He will use the loan to buy repair supplies in order to improve his business.  In the future what he’d like the most is to expand the business to improve his economic situation and provide the best for his family in everything they need.

loans.use: to buy repair supplies.

loans.name: Laura Clara

texts.es:
Laura de 67 años, una mujer trabajadora que empezó hace 11 años en su mini tienda para poder apoyar a su esposo en lo económico.

En la actualidad trabaja diariamente en todo el día. Con el préstamo ella quiere comprar mercadería como atún, azúcar, etc. Una de sus metas desea ponerse en su domicilio un restaurant.
texts.en:
Laura, 67, is a hard working woman who opened her minimart 11 years ago to help her husband economically.

She currently works all day, every day.  She will use the loan to buy merchandise like, tuna, sugar, etc.  One of her goals is to open a restaurant in her home.

loans.use: to buy tuna and sugar.

loans.name: Ana Miriam

texts.es:
Ana de 34 años, es una mujer trabajadora que inicio su negocio de una tienda con una amiga, un día ella viendo que si ganaba vendiendo realizo su propia tienda aparte.

Ahora trabaja sola atendiendo en todo el día y diariamente. Lo que dé afecta en su trabajo es la delincuencia que es frecuente por el sector. Con el préstamo quiere comprar lácteos, embutidos, confites para mejorar su negocio. Su meta mas desea es que su negocio se incremente mas en las ventas y mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Ana, 34, is a hard working woman who opened her store with a girl friend.  One day, seeing that selling was profitable, she opened her own store some place else.

Now she works alone working all day, every day.  What does affect her work, however, is the delinquency that’s frequent in her neighborhood.

She wants to use the loan to buy dairy products, cured meats and snacks to improve her business.  Her long-term goal is to increase sales even more and to make some home improvements.

loans.use: to buy dairy products, cured meats and snacks.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim is a young man from Jabalia Refugee camp. Ibrahim lives with his parents and helps his father take care of the household.

Ibrahim has a small barber shop where he works with his brother. Ibrahim uses only half the space in the shop and he took out a loan from FATEN to prepare the rest of it as a waiting area for customers.

Ibrahim appears in the picture here in his shop.

loans.use: to prepare a waiting area for the barber shop.

loans.name: Ingrid Katerine

texts.es:
En la ciudadela Circunvalación de la ciudad de  Manta  cada 15 días se reúne el Banco Comunal Nuevo Proyecto. Esta ciudad es conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año por turistas nacionales y extranjeros, es uno de los puertos más importantes del país y de América  y está situado a orillas Océano  Pacifico.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Ingrid, ella tiene 37 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de 17 y 10 años de edad, la mayor este año comienza la Universidad y el menor esta en escuela. Su esposo es maestro constructor.

Ella tiene una mini tienda de viveres de consumo y  también vende productos de Esika, (artículos de belleza, cosméticos perfumería y accesorios para damas), en su misma tienda realiza todas sus ventas. Trabaja todos los días desde las 7h00 hasta las 20h00, los productos compra en Manta y algunos los recibe en su local. Nos cuenta que lleva tres años con su tienda.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir mas su tienda, va a comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, y productos de Esika como perfumes, cremas, entre otros productos. Está en el Banco Comunal 6 años, es la tesorera del banco y le gusta porque los créditos le ayudan mucho en sus negocios.
 
Su meta es terminar sus estudios y le gustaría ser farmacéutica.
texts.en:
In the Circunvalación [ring road] area of the city of Manta, the Nuevo Proyecto [New Project] communal bank meets every two weeks. The city of Manta is known for its beautiful beaches, which are visited by many domestic and foreign tourists during all seasons of the year. On the shores of the Pacific Ocean, it is one of the most important ports in Ecuador and in the Americas.

In this place, we meet Ingrid, who is 37 years old and married. She and her husband have two children, aged 17 and 10. The older one is starting at the university this year, and the younger one is in school. Her husband is a master builder. 

Ingrid has a small grocery store, and she also sells Esika products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes and accessories for women). She sells all of her products in the same store. She works every day from 7 a.m. until 8 p.m. She buys the products in Manta, and some of them are delivered to her store. She reports that she has operated her store for three years. 

She will use this loan to stock her store with more goods; she will buy rice, sugar, oil, and also Esika products such as perfumes and creams, among other products. She has been a member of the communal bank for 6 years; she is the bank's treasurer, and she likes it because the loans help the members very much with their businesses. 
 
Her goal is to finish her studies, and she would like to be a pharmacist.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, and oil, as well as creams, perfumes, cosmetics, etc.

loans.name: Issa

texts.en:
Issa is a talented man from Ramallah city. He is a father of one daughter (Luna) and one son (Awni). Issa is an employee of Al-Ayyam daily newspaper. 

Issa makes wallpaper out of children's cartoons as shown in the picture here. He makes the wallpaper to order for families. Issa wants to increase production to meet demand. He took out a loan from FATEN to purchase a larger amounts of materials needed to execute his work.

loans.use: to buy raw materials to produce more art work.

loans.name: Dolores Margarita

texts.es:
En la ciudadela Circunvalación de la ciudad de Manta cada 15 días se reúne el Banco Comunal Nuevo Proyecto. Esta ciudad es conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año por turistas nacionales y extranjeros, es uno de los puertos más importantes del país y de América  y está situado a orillas Océano  Pacifico.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Dolores, tiene 39 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de 15 y  13 años de edad que estudian en colegio. Su esposo es taxista.

Ella se dedica al comercio, vende ropa y joyería de plata, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta y también vende en su  casa donde tiene un pequeño local. Trabaja sola todos los días más que todo por las mañanas ya que sus hijos estudian a esa hora y es cuando aprovecha para realizar sus ventas, deja a crédito a sus clientes  y cobra cada semana. La ropa compra en Guayaquil y las joyas le envían desde Cuenca.

Este crédito es para comprar  pantalones, camisetas, blusas, cadenas, pulseras, aretes, entre otras prendas. Ella fue unas de las fundadoras del banco pero luego se retiro y regreso en este ciclo y espera quedarse mucho tiempo.

Su sueño es que sus hijos sean buenos profesionales.
texts.en:
In the Circunvalación [ring road] area of the city of Manta, the Nuevo Proyecto [New Project] communal bank meets every two weeks. The city of Manta is known for its beautiful beaches, which are visited by many domestic and foreign tourists during all seasons of the year. On the shores of the Pacific Ocean, it is one of the most important ports in Ecuador and in the Americas. 

In this place, we meet Dolores, who is 39 years old and married. She and her husband have two children, aged 15 and 13, who are in secondary school. Her husband is a taxi driver. 

Dolores works in retail trade, selling clothing and silver jewelry. She sells her merchandise door to door, and she also sells from her home, where she has a little store. She works alone every day, above all in the mornings, since her children are in school at that time, and she takes advantage of this to carry out her sales. She offers credit to her customers and collects payments each week. She buys the clothing in Guayaquil, and the jewelry is sent to her from Cuenca.

This loan will be used to buy pants, shirts, blouses, necklaces, bracelets, and earrings, among other articles. Dolores was one of the bank's founders, but later she left it; she has returned for this loan cycle and hopes to remain for a long time. 

Her dream is to see her children become successful professionals.

loans.use: to buy pants, shirts, blouses, necklaces, bracelets, earrings, etc.

loans.name: Yajaira Katherine

texts.es:
En la ciudadela Circunvalación de la ciudad de  Manta  cada 15 días se reúne el Banco Comunal Nuevo Proyecto. Esta ciudad es conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año por turistas nacionales y extranjeros, es uno de los puertos más importantes del país y de América  y está situado a orillas Océano  Pacifico.

Aquí conocimos a la señorita Yajaira, ella tiene 19 de edad, es soltera y vive en casa de sus padres, estudia el primer semestre de marketing en la Universidad Laica de Manta. Lleva en el Banco Comunal 4 ciclos y le gusta la facilidad para conseguir los créditos.

Se dedica junto a su madre a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, ellas tienen un local en su casa. Trabaja todos los días desde las 8h00  hasta 18h00. Su mercadería  la recibe en Portoviejo ya que se las envían desde Panamá y Perú, nos cuenta que lo que más venden es la ropa femenina y la de niños aunque ellos tienen de todo y para toda edad, tienen este negocio 2 años y seis meses y que les ha ido muy bien.

Este crédito es para comprar  pantalones, camisetas, blusas, ropa de niños, interiores, entre otras prendas.

Sus sueños son terminar su carrera profesional y llegar a ser una gran empresaria.
texts.en:
In the Circunvalación [ring road] area of the city of Manta, the Nuevo Proyecto [New Project] communal bank meets every two weeks. The city of Manta is known for its beautiful beaches, which are visited by many domestic and foreign tourists during all seasons of the year. On the shores of the Pacific Ocean, it is one of the most important ports in Ecuador and in the Americas. 

Here we meet Yajaira, who is 19 years old and single. She lives in her parents' house and is studying marketing in her first semester at the Civil University of Manta. She has been with the communal bank for 4 cycles, and she likes the convenience in obtaining loans. 

Together with her mother, she works selling clothing of all types. They have a store in their home. Yajaira works every day from 8 a.m. to 6 p.m. Her merchandise is sent to her from Panama and Peru, and she picks it up in Portoviejo. She reports that the highest sales are in women's and children's clothing, although they offer everything, for all ages. They have had this business for 2 years and six months, and it has gone very well for them. 

This loan will be used to buy pants, shirts, blouses, children's clothes, and underwear, among other garments. 

Her dreams are to finish her professional studies and become a large entrepreneur.

loans.use: Comprar pantalones, camisetas, blusas, ropa de niños, ropa interior, etc.

loans.name: Mayra Beatriz

texts.es:
En la ciudadela Circunvalación de la ciudad de  Manta  cada 15 días se reúne el Banco Comunal Nuevo Proyecto. Esta ciudad es conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año por turistas nacionales y extranjeros, es uno de los puertos más importantes del país y de América  y está situado a orillas Océano  Pacifico.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Mayra, tiene 29 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de 10 y  5 años que estudian en escuela. Su esposo es chofer. Nuestra amiga lleva en el Banco Comunal tres ciclos y le gustan las reuniones y las charlas educativas.

Es una ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos se dedica a la venta de productos de Yanbal, Esika y Avon (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, trabaja todos los días por las mañanas, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada semana. Nos cuenta que lleva 5 años en esta actividad y que fue una amiga que la impulso a dedicarse a este tipo de ventas y que le va muy bien.

Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y otros productos de todas las marcas que vende.

Su sueño es comprarse un carro para realizar más ventas.
texts.en:
The Banco Comunal Nuevo Proyecto meets every two weeks in the Circunvalación neighborhood in the city of Manta. This city is known for its beautiful beaches. Many domestic and foreign tourists visit these beaches throughout the year. Manta is one of the most important ports in Ecuador and in the Americas. It is located on the Pacific Ocean.

This is where we met Mayra, a 29-year-old married woman. She and her husband have two children together, a ten year old and a five year old. Both children are in school. Her husband works as a driver. This is our friend Mayra's third loan cycle with the Banco Comunal. She enjoys the bank's meetings and educational talks.

Mayra is a housewife. She makes some money for herself by selling Yanbal, Esika and Avon products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfume and women's accessories). She works every morning selling these products door to door. She sells her products on credit and collects payment every week. She told us she has been doing this job for five years now. A friend of hers convinced her to begin selling these products and it has worked out well for her.

She plans to use this loan to buy perfume, lotion, cosmetics and other products from all the brands that she sells. She would like to buy a car one day in order to increase her sales.

loans.use: to buy perfume, lotion, cosmetics and other Avon, Yanbal and Esika products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase eggs and items for her house

loans.name: Vilma Lorena

texts.es:
Vilma de 38 años, es una mujer trabajadora que empezó vendiendo cosméticos por medio de códigos con otros empleados ya que no contaba con mucha capital. Pero luego con un dinero que le dieron empezó desde cero vendiendo sus productos de maquillaje.

Ahora trabaja diariamente en horas de la tarde de 2:00 pm a 6:00 pm. No tiene dificultades en su trabajo ya que tiene a sus clientes fijos. Con el préstamo quiere comprar perfumes, cremas, maquillajes para seguir aumentando sus ingresos. En un futuro quiere tener su propio local para así seguir en las ventas de productos de belleza y darle lo mejor a sus hijos en lo que más necesiten.
texts.en:
Vilma is a 38-year-old hardworking woman. She began selling cosmetics with other vendors using an i.d. code as she didn't have much money. Later, she used the money that they gave her to start from scratch selling make-up.

Now she works every afternoon from 2:00pm to 6:00pm. She has no problems with her work as she has a loyal group of customers. She plans to use the loan to purchase perfume, lotion and make-up in order to keep increasing her income. In the future, she would like to open her own shop where she could continue selling beauty products. She wants to provide her children with everything they need.

loans.use: to purchase perfume, lotion, and make-up

loans.name: Manuel Antonio

texts.es:
Manuel de 48 años, es un hombre trabajador que inicio su actividad vendiendo pollos por unidades para sus cliente y así mejorar su condición económica.

Ahora el trabaja en todo el día con la ayuda de su esposa. Lo que le afecta en su trabajo es la delincuencia que es frecuencia por el sector, con el préstamo va a comprar materiales de construcción para arreglo del local. Sus metas es incrementar su negocio en las ventas y hacer adecuar su casa para darle una vida mejor a para su familia.
texts.en:
Manuel, 48, is a hard working man who started his business selling chickens by the unit to his customers and thus improving his economic situation.

He now works every day with help from his wife.  What affects his business is the delinquency that’s frequent in his neighborhood.  He will use the loan to buy building materials and supplies to fix up his locale.

His goals are to increase his sales and to equip his house to provide a better life for his family.

loans.use: to buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Segundo Vicente

texts.es:
Segundo de 63 años, es un hombre trabajador que inicio su actividad repartiendo pollo por su sector. Luego se expandió hasta la aurora donde es su mercado de trabajo.

 El empieza su trabajo desde muy temprano diariamente en la repartición de pollos en cada sector donde está ubicado. Una de su dificultad del trabajo es la delincuencia ya que es frecuente por la sola. Con préstamo quiere comprar pollo, huevos, balanceados para aumentar sus ganancias. En un futuro quiere tener una avícola.
texts.en: Segundo is 63 and works hard distributing poultry products in his neighborhood. He has expanded his business to include the la Aurora area market as well.  Working from early morning and often alone, one of the hardships Segundo faces is the threat posed by thieves and delinquency in the area. He seeks credit in order to purchase greater stock of chicken, eggs and weighing scales, in order to increase his profits.  Segundo hopes to begin raising chickens in the future as well.

loans.use: to buy chicken, eggs and scales

loans.name: Sergio Norberto

texts.es:
Sergio de 35 años, es un hombre trabajador que trabaja en una empresa de créditos Polo ya hace varios años.

El trabaja  verificando las cobranzas de lunes a sábados de 9:00 am a 16:00 pm. Le afecta mucho es la delincuencia ya que el sector donde traslada dinero es peligroso. Con el préstamo el quiere comprar materiales de construcción y así ponerse un negocio de soldadura para mejorar sus ingresos y ser independiente para sacar adelante a su familia en lo que necesiten.
texts.en:
Sergio is 35 years old. He is a hard-working man who has worked for Polo, a credit institution, for several years. 

He works verifying payments from Monday through Saturday, from 9:00 a.m. to 4:00 p.m. He is affected greatly by crime, because the area where he carries money is dangerous. With the loan, he would like to buy construction materials in order to open a soldering business. His aim is to improve his income and be independent, so he can help his family get ahead and make sure they have what they need.

loans.use: to buy construction materials

loans.name: Angela Monserrate

texts.es:
Ángela de 30años, es una mujer emprendedora que empezó su actividad vendiendo productos de belleza por catálogos para ayudar a su familia.

Ella realiza sus pedido diarios y sale a recorrer por diferentes lugares para promocionar su revista y a cobrar sus ventas a los clientes que dejan a créditos sus productos. Con el préstamo quiere comprar más productos de perfume, ropa, etc. Quiere seguir trabajando para darle todo lo mejor a sus hijos en sus estudios.
texts.en:
Ángela, 30, is an enterprising woman who started her activity selling catalogue beauty products to help her family.

She takes orders daily and goes out to various places to promote her catalogue and collect payments from customers who buy from her on credit.  

She wants to use the loan to buy more products: perfume, clothes, etc.  She wants to continue working to provide her children with the best education.

loans.use: to buy perfume and clothes.

loans.name: Roque Gilberto

texts.es:
Roque de 63 años, es un hombre trabajador que empezó su actividad con poca  mercadería y le gusto que abrió una mini tienda.

El inicia su trabajo diariamente de 7:00 am a 9:00 pm. Con el préstamo quiere comprar arroz, aceite, fideos para aumentar su productividad en su tienda. Lo que más anhela de su trabajo es sacar adelante su negocio para así mejorar su casa y ponerse un comedor mas adelante.
texts.en:
Roque, 63, is a hard working man who started out in business with very little merchandise but liked it and opened a minimart.  His daily work schedule is from 7am until 9pm.  

He wants to use the loan to buy rice, oil and noodles to increase his store’s productivity.  What he wants most is that the business succeeds in order to make some home improvements and later on set up an eatery.

loans.use: to buy rice, oil and oatmeal.

loans.name: Leoba Alexandra

texts.es:
En la ciudadela Circunvalación de la ciudad de  Manta  cada 15 días se reúne el Banco Comunal Nuevo Proyecto. Esta ciudad es conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año por turistas nacionales y extranjeros, es uno de los puertos más importantes del país y de América  y está situado a orillas Océano  Pacifico.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Leoba, tiene 50 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen seis hijos todos mayores de  edad, el menor de ellos aun vive en su casa. Su esposo es jubilado.

Es una ama de casa que para tener sus propios ingresos instalo en su casa una sala de video juegos, ella abre su negocio a las 8h00 y cierra a las 18h00, nos cuenta que cierra temprano para que los jóvenes regresen temprano a sus respectivas casas, nos cuenta que lleva en su negocio cuatro años y que a pesar que hay competencia le va bien ya que cobra más barato.

Este crédito es para reparar unas maquinas que están dañadas y para comprar nuevos discos de juegos. Este es el cuarto ciclo para nuestra socia en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque allí ha conocido más a sus vecinas que ahora son muy buenas amigas. 

Su sueño siempre han sido tener una farmacia.
texts.en:
The “Nuevo Proyecto” (New Project) communal bank meets every two weeks in Manta’s Circunvalación neighborhood.  This city is known for its beautiful beaches that are visited all year round by national and foreign tourists alike; it is one of the country’s and America’s most important ports located on the shores of the Pacific Ocean.

We met Leoba, 50, here.  She’s married and has six adult children.  The youngest of them still lives at home, though.  Her husband is retired.

She is a housewife who, in order to have her own income, set up a video game room in her house.  She opens for business at 8am and closes at 6pm.  She tells us that she closes early so that the youngsters will go home early.  She tells us that she’s been in business four years and despite competition does well because she charges less.

This loan is to repair some damaged machines and to buy new game discs.  This is her fourth cycle in the communal bank and she likes it because she’s gotten to know her neighbors better and now they are all good friends.

Her dream has always been to own a pharmacy.

loans.use: to buy video games and to repair some machines.

loans.name: Noe Eduardo Del Jesus

texts.es:
Noé de 50 años, es un hombre trabajador que abrió una tienda hace 4 años ya que no había negocio por el sector donde vive.

En la actualidad trabaja solo todo los días, su esposa es empleada domestica tiene 1 hijo de trece años. Lo mas de esta afectando en su trabajo es que su tienda está en una loma y los carro algunas veces no llegan a subir. Con el préstamo quiere compra más mercadería como colas arroz atún, etc. Lo que más anhela es que su hijo se gradué y que su negocio crezca y sea una despensa completa para poder ayudar a su familia en lo que más necesiten.
texts.en:
Noé, 50, is a hard working man who opened his store 4 years ago because there was no business like it in the area where he lives.

He currently works alone every day; his wife’s a domestic employee and they have a 13-year-old son.  

What affects his business the most is that it’s located on a hill and sometimes cars aren’t able to go up.

He wants to use the loan to buy more merchandise like: soft drinks, rice, tuna, etc.

His greatest wish is that his son graduate and that the business grows and become a full-fledged market to help his family with what they need the most.

loans.use: to buy stock items for his store.

loans.name: Jose Vicente

texts.es:
José de 27 años, es una hombre que inspira en sacar adelante a su familia que inicio abriendo una papelería que lo atiendo su esposa.

Su esposa trabaja diariamente en la papelería tiene un hijo de 2 años. Algunas veces le afecta el polvo y la luz  por el trabajo. Con el préstamo quiere comprar productos para la papelería cono gel, aretes, esmaltes. Lo que más anhela es esta buen de salud y salir adelante en su negocio por bien de su familia.
texts.en:
José, 27, is a man who wants to move his family ahead; he started off opening a stationery shop that his wife runs.

His wife works every day in the stationery shop and they have a two-year-old son.  Sometimes the dust and light affects him because of the work.

He wants to use the loan to buy products for the shop like: gel, earrings and nail polish.

What he wishes for the most is good health and to succeed in business for his family’s wellbeing.

loans.use: to buy gel, earrings and nail polish.

loans.name: Cleofa Casilda

texts.es:
En la ciudadela Circunvalación de la ciudad de  Manta  cada 15 días se reúne el Banco Comunal Nuevo Proyecto. Esta ciudad es conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año por turistas nacionales y extranjeros, es uno de los puertos más importantes del país y de América  y está situado a orillas Océano  Pacifico.

En este lugar encontramos a la señora Cleolfa, tiene 49 años de edad, en la actualidad está separada pero de una relación que tuvo hace varios años tuvo cuatro hijos ya todos son mayores de edad y  comprometidos, solo el menor que es soltero vive con ella.

Ella tiene una tienda de víveres de consumo en su casa  en la que vende todo tipo de productos como arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes, embutidos y más artículos de primera necesidad, en ella  trabaja todos los días desde las 5h00 hasta las 20h00 y a veces hasta más tarde, su hijo le ayuda cuando está desocupado, los productos los compra en Manta y algunos  los recibe en su local, nos cuenta que lleva en su tienda ya 7 años.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir mas su tienda, va a comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, detergentes, embutidos y otros productos de primera necesidad. Está en el Banco Comunal hace 3 ciclos y le gustan las reuniones y la unión del grupo.
 
Su meta es seguir adelante en su negocio y crecer cada día más.
texts.en:
The “Nuevo Proyecto” (New Project) communal bank meets every two weeks in Manta’s Circunvalación neighborhood.  This city is known for its beautiful beaches that are visited year round by national and foreign tourists alike.  It is one of the country’s and America’s most important ports situated on the shore of the Pacific Ocean.

This is where we found Cleofa, 49.  She is currently separated but from the relationship she was in several years ago she had four children, all committed adults now; only the youngest, who is still single, lives with her.

She has a home-based grocery store where she sells all types of products like: rice, sugar, oils, detergents, cured meats and other first need items.  She works daily from 5am until 8pm and sometimes even later.  Her son helps her when he’s not busy.  She buys her products in Manta and some are delivered to her locale.  She tells us that she’s had her store for 7 years.

This loan will be used to better stock the store.  She will buy rice, sugar, oil, detergents, cured meats and other first need items.  She’s been in the communal bank for three cycles and she likes the meetings and the group’s unity.

Her goal is to stay in business and grow more every day.

loans.use: to buy stock items for her store.

loans.name: Noé Elias

texts.es:
En la ciudadela Circunvalación de la ciudad de  Manta  cada 15 días se reúne el Banco Comunal Nuevo Proyecto. Esta ciudad es conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año por turistas nacionales y extranjeros, es uno de los puertos más importantes del país y de América  y está situado a orillas Océano  Pacifico.

En este lugar encontramos a don Noé, tiene 62 años de edad, en la actualidad está divorciado pero de una relación que tuvo hace varios años tiene dos hijos ya todos son mayores de edad e independientes. Para él este es su segundo ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le agrada porque los créditos permiten a los socios sacar adelante sus negocios.

Es contador titulado y trabaja de profesor en la universidad Laica Eloy Alfaro de Manta, pero tiene un negocio en sociedad con una de sus hijas, ellos tienen un centro de cómputo, que también es librería y papelería, en este negocio realizan trabajos contables, asesorías y proyectos, además del servicio de internet. Trabajan todos los días desde las 8h00 hasta las 20h00, su hija está todo el día y él cuando no está dando clases en la Universidad.

Este crédito es para invertir en útiles escolares ya que pronto empieza la época de clases y se vende mucho de estos productos en esta temporada.

Su meta es ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
The “Nuevo Proyecto” (New Project) communal bank meets every two weeks in Manta’s Circunvalación neighborhood.  This city is known for its beautiful beaches that are visited year round by national and foreign tourists alike.  It is one of the country’s and America’s most important ports situated on the shore of the Pacific Ocean.

This is where we found Noé, 62.  He is currently divorced but from the relationship he was in several years ago he has two children, all independent adults now.  This is his second cycle in the communal bank and he likes it because the loans make it possible for members to succeed in business.

He has a professional degree as an Accountant and works as a Professor at Manta’s Eloy Alfaro Laic University but also has a business in partnership with one of his daughters: a computer center which is also a bookstore and stationery shop.  They do accounting jobs, assessments and projects here as well as provide Internet access services.  They work daily from 8am until 8pm.  His daughter is there all day and he’s there when he’s not teaching classes at the university.

This loan is to invest in school supplies because the new school term is about to start and these kinds of products sell very well during this season.

His goal is to expand the business.

loans.use: to buy school supplies.

loans.name: María Yolanda

texts.es:
En la ciudadela Circunvalación de la ciudad de  Manta  cada 15 días se reúne el Banco Comunal Nuevo Proyecto. Esta ciudad es conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año por turistas nacionales y extranjeros, es uno de los puertos más importantes del país y de América  y está situado a orillas Océano  Pacifico.

Aquí conocimos a la señora María, tiene 51 de edad, es madre soltera de dos hijos de 27 y 14 años, el menor vive con ella y estudia en colegio. Ella vive en casa de sus padres. Lleva en el Banco Comunal siete  ciclos y le gusta por la amistad que ha hecho en el grupo.

Tiene un salón de belleza en Tarqui de Manta, el local es propio el cual realiza diversidad de trabajos como  tinturados, cortes de cabello, manicura de uñas y otros. Trabaja desde las 7h00 hasta las 19h00 y a veces hasta más tarde si sus clientes requieren de sus servicios y los domingos  hasta las 13h00. También vende productos de belleza, nos cuenta que lleva en su negocio 8 años y que le ha servido para sacar a sus hijos adelante.
 
Este crédito lo va a emplear para comprar una silla para cortar cabello que le hace mucha falta.
 
Sus sueños son llegar a tener un SPA y su casa propia.
texts.en:
The “Nuevo Proyecto” (New Project) communal bank meets every two weeks in Manta’s Circunvalación neighborhood.  This city is known for its beautiful beaches that are visited year round by national and foreign tourists alike.  It is one of the country’s and America’s most important ports situated on the shore of the Pacific Ocean.

This is where we found María, 51.  She is a single mother of two children who are 27 and 14 years of age.  The youngest lives with her and goes to school.  She lives in her parents’ house and has been in the communal bank for seven cycles; she likes it because of the friendship she’s made with the group.

She has a beauty salon in Tarqui in Manta.  She owns the locale where she provides a variety of services like: hair coloring, hair cuts, manicures and others.  She works from 7am until 7pm and sometimes even later if her customers require her services; on Sundays she works until 1pm.  She also sells beauty products.  She tells us that she’s been in business 8 years and it has made it possible for her to raise her children.

She will use the loan to buy a barber’s chair that she needs very much.  Her dreams are to have a Spa and a house of her own some day.

loans.use: to buy a barber's chair.

loans.name: Karina Gabriela

texts.es:
En la ciudadela Circunvalación de la ciudad de  Manta  cada 15 días se reúne el Banco Comunal Nuevo Proyecto. Esta ciudad es conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año por turistas nacionales y extranjeros, es uno de los puertos más importantes del país y de América  y está situado a orillas Océano  Pacifico.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Karina, tiene 20 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen  un  bebe de 4 meses de edad. Su esposo es comerciante.
 
Ella tiene un puesto en el mercado de Tarqui en la ciudad de Manta, en el que vende frutas y legumbres. Trabaja con su esposo todos los días desde las  05h00 hasta las 14h00, ellos se desplazan desde la madrugada hasta el mercado mayorista a comprar los mejores productos para ofrecerles a sus clientes. También vende productos de Avon (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Esto lo hace para tener una ganancia adicional ya que como dice la vida está muy dura y hay que producir dinero siempre que sea trabajando honradamente.

Este crédito es para comprar frutas, legumbres y un algo de perfumes, cremas, cosméticos, entre atrás cosas. Este es el segundo ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta todas las facilidades que ofrece el banco.
 
Su sueño es tener su casa propia ya que vive en casa de su mamá.
texts.en:
The “Nuevo Proyecto” (New Project) communal bank meets every two weeks in Manta’s Circunvalación neighborhood.  This city is known for its beautiful beaches that are visited year round by national and foreign tourists alike.  It is one of the country’s and America’s most important ports situated on the shore of the Pacific Ocean.

This is where we met Karina, 20.  She’s married and has a four-month-old baby.  Her husband is a merchant.

She has a stand in the Tarqui Market in the city of Manta where she sells fruit and vegetables.  She works with her husband daily from 5am until 2pm.  They start out at dawn to go to the wholesale market to buy the best products to offer their customers.  She also sells Avon products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes and women’s accessories) in order to have an additional source of income because, as she says, life is hard and one must always make money, as long as it’s done honorably.

This loan is to buy fruit, vegetables, some perfumes, creams and cosmetics, among others.  This is her second cycle in the communal bank and she likes all the bank’s offers.  Her dream is to have a house of her own because she lives in her mother’s house.

loans.use: to buy fruit, vegetables, perfumes, creams, cosmetics, etc.

loans.name: Gabriela Margarita

texts.es:
En la ciudadela Circunvalación de la ciudad de  Manta  cada 15 días se reúne el Banco Comunal Nuevo Proyecto. Esta ciudad es conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año por turistas nacionales y extranjeros, es uno de los puertos más importantes del país y de América  y está situado a orillas Océano  Pacifico.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Gabriela, tiene 25 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen  dos hijos de 7 y 4  años de edad, la mayor estudia en escuela. Su esposo es comerciante.

Ella realiza el crédito para su esposo el cual tiene un negocio de compra y venta de pescado, para comprar estos productos más baratos él se desplaza mar adentro hasta donde están los barcos pesqueros para comprarles sus productos los mismos que luego vende  a las fabricas que procesan el pescado en la ciudad de Manta, esto lo realiza todos los días por las mañanas aunque a veces tambien en las tardes cuando  las fabricas lo llaman para pedirle más producto.
 
Este crédito es para comprar pescado. Es el tercer ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque aquí ha obtenido mucha ayuda para salir adelante junto a su familia.
 
Su sueño es tener su casa propia ya que vive en casa de sus suegros.
texts.en:
The Nuevo Proyecto (New Project) Communal Bank meets every two weeks in the Circunvalación neighborhood in the city of Manta. This city is known for its beautiful beaches. Many domestic and foreign tourists visit these beaches throughout the year. Manta is one of the most important ports in Ecuador and in the Americas. It is located on the shore of the Pacific Ocean.

This is where we meet Gabriela, age 25.  She is married and has two children, ages 7 and 4.  The oldest goes to school.  Her husband is a merchant.

She is getting a loan for her husband, who has a business of buying and selling fish.   In order to buy these products at a cheaper price he has to go out to sea where the fishing boats are.  He buys their products and later sells them to factories that process fish in the city of Manta.  He does this every day in the mornings, although at times he also does this in the afternoons when the factories call him to order more products.

This loan is to buy fish.  It is the third cycle in the communal bank.  She likes it because she has gotten a lot of help in order to get ahead with her family.

Her dream is to have her own house because she lives in her mother and father-in-law’s house.

loans.use: to buy fish

loans.name: Carmen Liliana

texts.es:
En la ciudadela Circunvalación de la ciudad de  Manta  cada 15 días se reúne el Banco Comunal Nuevo Proyecto. Esta ciudad es conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año por turistas nacionales y extranjeros, es uno de los puertos más importantes del país y de América  y está situado a orillas Océano  Pacifico.

La señora Carmen es socia fundadora del Banco comunal y le gusta porque los intereses son más bajos que en otras instituciones de crédito. Tiene 43 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene 4 hijos tres de  los cuales ya son mayores de edad y una niña de 10 años que estudia en  escuela, tres de sus hijos  aun viven con ella. Su esposo es ebanista.

El esposo tiene un taller de ebanistería en el cual realiza una gran variedad de trabajos con la madera como por ejemplo: camas, muebles, puertas, cajoneras, anaqueles entre otras muchas obras, trabaja bajo pedido todos los días desde las 8h00hasta las 16h00 y cuando tiene muchos encargos hasta más tarde, nos cuenta que lleva 20 años que su esposo se dedica a esta actividad y que gracias a Dios nunca le ha faltado trabajo.

Este crédito es para comprar madera, pinturas, clavos, selladores entre otros productos que se necesitan para fabricar sus productos.

Su meta es tener un negocio con más tecnología.
texts.en:
The “Nuevo Proyecto” (New Project) communal bank meets every two weeks in Manta’s Circunvalación neighborhood.  This city is known for its beautiful beaches that are visited year round by national and foreign tourists alike.  It is one of the country’s and America’s most important ports situated on the shore of the Pacific Ocean.

Carmen is a founding member of the bank and she likes it because interest rates are lower than in other credit institutions.  She’s 43 years old, married and has four children three of whom are already adults and a 10-year-old daughter who goes to school.  Three of her children still live with her.  Her husband is a cabinet maker.

Her husband has a cabinet making shop where he does a great variety of jobs with wood, for example: beds, furniture, doors, chest of drawers, and shelving, among many others.  He works to order every day from 8am until 4pm and, when he has a lot of orders, even later.  She tells us that her husband has been in this line of work for 20 years and, thanks to God, has never lacked work.

This loan is to buy lumber, paints, nails and sealants among other products needed to manufacture his products.

Her goal is to have a business with more technology.

loans.use: to buy lumber, paints, sealants, nails, etc.

loans.name: Elva Rosa

texts.es:
Elva tiene 34 años de edad. Vive con su esposo e hijos menores en el distrito de José Leonardo Ortiz  en Chiclayo, la capital de la región de Lambayeque.  Su comunidad es grande, urbana y en proceso de expansión. 

Elva cuenta con una caretilla ambulante donde vende emoliente, una bebida caliente, típica de Perú a la cual se atribuyen diferentes propiedades medicinales, ya sea para el tratamiento del aparato digestivo, reproductor, respiratorio, circulatorio, etc. Vende su producto afuera del Mercado Atusparias en su comunidad. Cuenta con una experiencia de un año en este negocio y ya tiene una clientela establecida. 

Elva desea invertir su crédito en la compra de útiles escolares para sus hijos ahora que la temporada escolar ha comenzado en Perú. Por ello, ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 500 nuevos soles. Elva es muy trabajadora y responsable. Posee buenas referencias personales y laborales de su comunidad urbana. Su mayor anhelo es seguir mejorando la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Elva is 34 years old and lives with her husband and young children in the District of José Leonardo Ortiz in Chiclayo, the capital of Lambayeque region. This large urban community is in the process of expansion.

Elva has a mobile cart from which she sells natural remedies. These hot beverages are traditionally consumed in Peru for their different medicinal properties used in treating digestive, reproductive, respiratory, circulatory, and other types of ailments. She sells her product outside of the Atusparias Market in her community. Elva has one year of experience with this business and already has an established customer base.

Elva wants to invest her loan in the purchase of school supplies for her children now that the school year has started in Peru. For this reason, she is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 500 PEN.

Elva is hardworking and responsible. She has good personal and work-related references from her urban community. Her greatest wish is to continue improving the quality of life of her family.

loans.use: To purchase school supplies for her children.

loans.name: Danitza Sarit

texts.en:
Danitza is 27 years old, married, and has two children. They live in their own home in the village of Guaraguaos Alto in the Tambogrande district, an agricultural area in the province of Piura, more than four hours from the city of Chiclayo, capital of the Lambayeque region. Unlike many other residents in the area, Danitza and her family are fortunate to have access to electricity, however they still do not have access to potable water. 

Danitza earns a living by raising poultry and sheep. She raises her animals near her house in pens that are spacious and appropriately built. When the animals are fully-grown, she sells them to merchants and the general public in the local market. She has built up a loyal client base in this market.

Danitza plans to buy nutritionally balanced feed to fatten her livestock. She hopes that her animals will reach a better weight and size in less time so that she can sell them for a higher price at the market. She also plans to make repairs to her corrals. To achieve her goals, Danitza has requested from Edpyme Alternativa a loan of 1800 nuevos soles. 

Danitza is a hard-working woman. With her business she is able to supplement her husband’s income and help pay for her family’s expenses.

loans.use: purchase feed for her livestock and make repairs to her farmyard

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.en:
Mr. L. is 56 years old, married, and has two children. They live in their own home in the village of Las Juntas in the Pacora district of the Lambayeque region of Peru. 

For the past 6 years, Mr. L. has dedicated himself to his business of raising and trading livestock. He raises his animals near his house in pens that are spacious and appropriately built. When the animals are fully-grown, he sells them to merchants and the general public in the local market. He has built up a loyal client base in this market. Mr. L. learned this trade from his father, who provided him with significant experience and knowledge.

Mr. L. wishes to expand his business and plans to invest this loan in the purchase of more animals and balanced feed to fatten his livestock. He hopes that his animals will reach a better weight and size in less time so that he can sell them for a higher price at the market. He also plans to make repairs to his corrals. To achieve these goals, he has requested from Edpyme Alternativa a loan of 2000 nuevos soles. 

Mr. L. is a hard-working and responsible man. He had received a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the past and had repaid it punctually. His greatest goal is to continue investing in his business so that he can use the income to pay for his family’s expenses and provide them with a better quality of life.

loans.use: purchase additional livestock and feed, and make repairs to his farmyard

loans.name: Willam Ricardo

texts.en:
Willam is 28 years old and single. He lives in a house with his parents in the district of Jose Leonardo Ortiz in Chiclayo, the capital of the Lambayeque region. His community was formed about 17 years ago. It is a small community and does not yet have paved roads. It does, however, have access to electricity and potable water. 

For over a year, Willam has earned a living as an employee in a company that makes plastic containers used to hold plants in plant nurseries. He is responsible for operating the machine that produces the containers. This job allows for him to pay for his personal and household expenses. At the moment, Willam’s house is in a state of deterioration. He would like to make some repairs to it, which will help him to improve his family's quality of life. For this reason, he decided to ask Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 500 new soles. Willam is a hard-working man and he has a good personal and work-related reputation in the community.

loans.use: To make repairs to his home.

loans.name: Felicia Mirella

texts.en:
Felicia is 27 years old, single and does not have any children. She lives with her parents in a house that they own. They are located in the district of Olmos, an agricultural area with considerable commercial activity. Olmos is in the province of Lambayeque, more than an hour and a half outside the city of Chiclayo.

For the past two years, Felicia has been working for her municipality. She also manages a business in which she sells beauty products such as make-up and perfumes. She sells her products from her home and she also visits some of her customers in nearby villages. Felicia already has an established customer base in the area. She wishes to expand her business with the purchase of additional merchandise and beauty products. For this reason, she has requested a loan of 2000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa. Felicia is a hard-working, responsible woman. She is a recurring client with Edpyme Alternativa and always repays her loans punctually.

loans.use: to purchase additional merchandise for her business.

loans.name: Maria Magdalena

texts.es:
Maria tiene 34 años de edad, es casada y tiene una hija de tres años de edad. Vive en casa con su familia en el distrito de Pimentel, a unos veinte minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo. Su comunidad es pequeña, urbana y recién está en crecimiento.

Desde hace un año, se dedica a la venta de comida, ya que una tía le ofreció un pequeño espacio en la fachada de su casa, para que improvise un pequeño comedor. Desde muy temprano en el día, María va de compras a los mercados mayoristas de Moshoqueque y Modelo para comprar los insumos que le permitirán preparar cebiches y otros platos peruanos. Sus principales clientes son los médicos y otro personal del hospital cerca de su negocio y también estudiantes universitarios de las dos universidades en su comunidad. 

Actualmente, María solo cuenta con tres mesas y unas sillas de madera y de plástico. Desea ampliar su mobiliario con la compra de más mesas y sillas. Por ello, ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 800 nuevos soles. El más grande sueño de María es llegar a tener un restaurante Turístico. Ella agradece a los prestamistas de Kiva por apoyarla en crecer su negocio.
texts.en:
Maria is 34 years old, married, and has a three year old daughter. She lives at home with her family in the District of Pimentel, which is approximately twenty minutes away from the city of Chiclayo. This small urban community has experienced recent growth.

For the past year, Maria has been selling food. Her aunt offered her a small space in front of her house which she turned into a makeshift diner. During the early hours, Maria goes to the wholesale markets in Moshoqueque and Modelo to buy the supplies for preparing ceviches and other Peruvian dishes. Her main customers are doctors and other hospital staff who work nearby. She also serves students who attend the two universities in her community.

At the moment, Maria only has three tables and a few wooden and plastic chairs. She wants to expand her facilities by purchasing more tables and chairs. For this reason, she is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 800 PEN. Her greatest wish is to open a tourist restaurant. She is grateful to Kiva lenders for supporting the growth of her business.

loans.use: To purchase tables and chairs.

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.es:
Gregoria tiene 46 años de edad, es casada y tiene 2 hijas de edades escolares. Viven en casa propia en Monsefú, una zona conocida por sus festividades turísticas y religiosas. Las principales actividades que se realizan en este caserío son la producción de flores, la artesanía y la crianza de ganado vacuno. La zona está llena de vegetación y la comunidad es muy pequeña.

Desde hace más de siete años, Gregoria se dedica a la venta de pescado. Cuenta con un puesto en el Mercado Moshoqueque, un mercado grande, muy conocido y con bastante movimiento. Desea ampliar su negocio y planea invertir una parte de su préstamo en la compra de más mercadería. También, desea renovar una parte de su casa a fin de poner una bodega en su domicilio. Por ello, ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 2000 nuevos soles. Gregoria es muy trabajadora y responsable. Quiere seguir creciendo su negocio y sus ingresos para seguir sacando adelante a su familia.
texts.en:
Gregoria is 46 years old and has two daughters who are in school. She lives in her own home in Monsefú, an area that is known for its tourist and religious festivals. The main business activities in this village are growing flowers, producing handicrafts, and livestock breeding. This area is full of vegetation, yet the community is quite small.

Gregoria has been selling fish for more than seven years. She has a vending stall at the Moshoqueque Market. This large market is well-known and experiences considerable business activity. Gregoria wants to expand her business and plans to invest part of her loan in the purchase of more inventory. In addition, she wants to remodel part of her house so that she can establish a grocery store in her home. For this reason, she is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 2000 PEN.

Gregoria is hardworking and responsible. She wants to continue growing her business and her income so that her family can continue moving forward.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory and remodel her house so that she can establish a grocery store.

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es: Ana Maria tiene 46 años de edad y es casada con 04 hijos. Viven en casa propia la cual han ido construyendo de a pocos en el distrito de San José en la región de Lambayeque. Desde hace más de 5 años, Ana Maria cuenta con una bodega instalada en su domicilio. Allí ofrece en venta a sus vecinos diversos productos de consumo diario entre gaseosas, abarrotes y productos de primera necesidad. Desea responder a la demanda de sus clientes para útiles escolares ahora que la temporada escolar ha comenzado. Por ello, ha creído conveniente solicitar un préstamo de 500 nuevos soles a Edpyme Alternativa para la compra de más mercadería como papelotes, cuadernos, lapiceros, libros, laminas, carpetas plastificadas, tintes, gomas, plastilinas, grapadoras, y perforadores. Ana Maria es muy trabajadora y responsable. Agradece mucho a los prestamistas de Kiva por apoyarla crecer su negocio y sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Ana Maria is 46 years old, married, and has four children. She lives in her own home which is one of the few that have been built in the District of San José in Lambayeque region. More than five years ago, Ana Maria established a store in her home. There she offers her neighbors different everyday products such as sodas, groceries, and basic necessities. She wants to respond to the demand for school supplies from her customers now that the school year has started. For this reason, she is requesting a loan of 500 PEN from Edpyme Alternativa to purchase more merchandise such as bond paper, notebooks, pens, books, prints, plastic folders, paints, rubber bands, modeling clay, staplers, and hole punchers.

Ana Maria is hardworking and responsible. She is grateful to the Kiva lenders for helping her grow her business and her income.

loans.use: To purchase school supplies to sell in her store.

loans.name: Delia

texts.es: La Sra. Delia tiene 25 años de edad, es casada y tiene 3 hijos dependientes a su cargo. Actualmente vive en el Caserío Virgen la Purisima ubicado a 20 minutos  de la ciudad de Lambayeque. Se gana la vida desde hace 4  años criando y vendiendo animales menores en corrales ubicados en la parte posterior de su domicilio. Ella suele criar ganado porcino, ovino, pavos y patos y cuando estos ya han alcanzado un buen punto de desarrollo las ofrece en venta a los negociantes que siempre visitan la zona en donde vive. La Sra Delia solicita el crédito para la compra de materiales para hacer arreglos a sus corrales y a su techo. Con estos arreglos podrá mejor proteger sus animales de las lluvias. La Sra Delia es  honesta y trabajadora. Su mayor anhelo es crecer su negocio y sus ingresos para lograr que su familia tenga una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Sra. Delia is 25 years old, married, and has three dependent children. She currently lives in the village of Virgen La Purisima, which is located twenty minutes away from the city of Lambayeque. For the past four years, she has earned her living by selling small animals that she raises in pens located behind her home. Delia raises pigs, sheep, turkeys, and ducks. Once the animals have developed properly, she offers them for sale to traders who are constantly visiting the area where she lives.

Sra. Delia is requesting a loan in order to buy materials for making repairs to her pens and the roof of her house. The repairs to her pens will enable her to shield the animals from the rain. Delia is honest and hardworking. Her greatest wish is to grow her business and her income so that her family can have a better quality of life.

loans.use: To make repairs to her animal pens and the roof of her house.

loans.name: Juliana Mabel

texts.es: Juliana tiene 29 años de edad, es soltera y no tiene hijos. Vive en casa con su hermana en la zona urbana del distrito de Picsi, una pequeña comunidad urbana-marginal en vías de crecimiento cerca de Chiclayo. Se dedica a la fabricación de cerámica. Cuenta con más de 08 años de experiencia en este rubro y tiene una clientela establecida. Realiza esta labor en la vivienda de su hermana. Aprendió la actividad de su madre, es decir conoce a la perfección su rubro.  Actualmente, cuenta con una aumentación en los pedidos de sus productos y necesita comprar más insumos para hacer su cerámica y responder a la demanda de sus clientes. Por tal motivo, ha solicitado un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles de Edpyme Alternativa. Juliana es muy honesta y trabajadora. Cuenta con buenas referencias personales y laborales de sus vecinos de la zona.
texts.en:
Juliana is 29 years old, single, and has no children. She lives at home with her sister in the urban section of the District of Picsi, a small marginalized community near Chiclayo that is experiencing growth. Juliana has been making ceramics for more than eight years and has built up an established customer base. She performs her work at her sister’s house. Juliana learned this trade from her mother, who is known for perfecting her craft. At the moment, she has experienced an increase in orders for her products and needs to buy supplies for her ceramics so that she can meet the demands of her customers. For this reason, she is requesting a loan of 1000 PEN from Edpyme Alternativa.

Juliana is honest and hardworking. She has good personal and work-related references from her neighbors in the area.

loans.use: To purchase supplies for her ceramics business.

loans.name: Brenda Marjuri

texts.es: Brenda tiene 18 años de edad y no tiene hijos. Vive con su prometido en el distrito de Tambogrande, una zona agrícola que se encuentra situada en la provincia de Piura, a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque. Desde hace 9 meses, se dedica a la venta de comida y bebidas lo cual realiza desde una parte de su domicilio. Desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más mesas, sillas y bebidas. Por ello, ha creído conveniente solicitar un préstamo de 1500 nuevos soles de Edpyme Alternativa. Espera seguir creciendo su negocio para lograr una utilidad aceptable que le permitirá mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Brenda is 18 years old and has no children. She lives with her fiancé in the District of Tambogrande, a farming district that is located in Piura Province and more than four hours away from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of Lambayeque region. Brenda has been selling food and beverages for nine months from a section of her home. She wants to expand her business by purchasing more tables, chairs, and beverages. For this reason, she is requesting a loan of 1500 PEN from Edpyme Alternativa.

Brenda hopes to continue growing her business so that it can attain an acceptable level of profitability, which will allow her to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: To purchase tables, chairs, and beverages.

loans.name: Felix Arnaldo

texts.es:
Felix tiene 53 años de edad, es casado y tiene un hijo dependiente. Viven en casa propia en la parte rural del distrito de Tambogrande. Ésta es una zona agrícola que se encuentra en la provincia de Piura, a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque. Actualmente, no cuentan con servicios básicos como luz o agua potable.

Desde hace más de 15 años, Feliz se dedica a la crianza de ganado caprino y vacuno, el cual cría de edades menores y cuando los animales alcancen un buen nivel de desarrollo, los vende en el mercado local. En adición, siembra y cosecha maíz que comercializa también en el mercado local. Realiza estas actividades en su parcela propia ubicada cerca de su casa. 

Desea invertir su crédito en alimentos balanceados para el engorde de su ganado. Espera lograr un buen peso y tamaño de sus animales para venderlos a un mejor precio y  seguir creciendo en su actividad. También, planea hacer unos arreglos a sus corrales para proteger su ganado de las fuertes lluvias que se avecinan. Por ello, ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 2000 nuevos soles. Felix es muy trabajador. Su mayor anhelo es aumentar sus ingresos para lograr mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Felix is 53 years old, married, and has one dependent child. He lives in his own home in the rural section of the District of Tambogrande. This farming district is located in Piura Province, which is more than four hours away from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of Lambayeque region. At the moment, Felix and his family do not receive basic services such as electricity and potable water.

For more than fifteen years, Felix has been raising goats and cattle. He raises the animals from a young age and when they have reached the proper level of development, he sells them at the local market. In addition, he grows corn to sell at the market. These activities are conducted on a parcel of land that he owns and is located near his house.

Felix wants to invest this loan in balanced feed so that he can fatten his cattle. He hopes that his animals will reach a good weight and size so that he can sell them at a good price and continue growing his business. Felix also plans to make a few repairs to the animal pens in order to protect his livestock from the strong rains that are expected. For this reason, he is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 2000 PEN.

Felix is a very hard worker. His greatest wish is to increase his income so that he can provide his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and pay for repairs to his animal pens.

loans.name: Wilmer

texts.es: Wilmer tiene 28 años de edad, es casado y no tiene hijos. Vive en la parte rural del distrito de Reque, una zona ubicada a veinte minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo. Desde hace más de 5 años, Wilmer se dedica a la crianza y engorde de ganado. Cuando los animales alcancen un buen nivel de desarrollo, los vende en el mercado local.
