Actualmente, cuenta con un torete y una vaca. Realiza esta actividad, con la apoya de su esposa, en una parte posterior de su casa. Además, para generar más ingresos, hace faenas agrícolas en chacras en su caserío. Desea invertir su crédito en la compra de dos toretes para engordar y vender. Por ello, ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 1000 nuevos soles. Wilmer es muy trabajador. Cuenta con buenas referencias personales y laborales de sus vecinos. Su esposa y él trabajan juntos para seguir adelante y lograr mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Wilmer is 28 years old, married, and has no children. He lives in the rural section of the District of Reque, which is twenty minutes away from the city of Chiclayo. Wilmer has been raising and fattening cattle for more than five years. When the animals have reached the proper level of development, he sells them at the local market. At the moment, he has one bull and one cow. Wilmer’s business is located in an area behind his house and he manages it with the help of his wife. To generate more income, he also works on other farms in his village.

Wilmer wants to invest in the purchase of two bulls to fatten and sell. For this reason, he is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1000 PEN.

Wilmer is a hard worker. He presents good personal and work-related references from his neighbors. Wilmer and his wife work together so that they can get ahead and create a better quality of life for their family.

loans.use: To purchase two bulls.

loans.name: Silvia Ines

texts.es:
Silvia tiene 58 años D. edad, es casada y tiene 2 hijos. Vive en casa propia en el caserío Atahualpa Valle D. los Incas en el distrito D. TambogranD. – Piura. Vive en la parte rural D. este distrito y aún no cuentan con los servicios básicos como luz o agua.

Silvia se dedica a la crianza D. aves D. corral los cuales cría y engorda para luego comercializarlos en el mercado local. Realiza esta actividad en una parte posterior D. su casa. También se dedica a la agricultura contando con un pequeño terreno agrícola donD. siembra limón. Cuenta con más D. 10 años D. experiencia en estas actividades. 

Silvia planea usar su crédito para la compra D. alimentos balanceados para el engorD. D. ganado, con la finalidad D. obtener un buen peso y tamaño D. sus animales y venderlos a un mejor precio. También invertirá su crédito en la compra D. abono y equipo para el mantenimiento y poda D. su cultivo D. limón. Por ello, ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo D. 500 nuevos soles. Silvia quiere seguir creciendo en su negocio para aumentar sus ingresos y lograr mejorar la calidad D. vida D. su familia.
texts.en:
Silvia is 58 years old, married, and has two children. She lives in her own home in the village of Atahualpa Valle D. Los Incas in the rural section of the District of TambogranD.-Piura. Silvia and her family do not receive basic services such as electricity or water.

She raises and fattens poultry to sell later at the local market. These animals are kept in an area behind her house. Silvia also cultivates a small plot of land where she grows limes. She has been engaging in these business activities for more than ten years.

Silvia plans to purchase balanced feed to fatten her animals in hopes that they attain a good weight and size so that she can sell them at a good price. In addition, she will invest in the purchase of compost and equipment to maintain and prune her lime trees. For this reason, she is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 500 PEN.

Silvia wants to continue growing her business so that she can increase her income and improve the quality of life for her family.

loans.use: To purchase balanced feed for her birds and compost for her lime trees.

loans.name: Leonor

texts.es:
Leonor tiene 54 años de edad. Vive con su esposa e hija en casa propia en el distrito de Tambogrande. Ésta es una zona agrícola que se encuentra en la provincia de Piura, a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque. Actualmente, no cuentan con servicios básicos como luz o agua potable.

Desde hace más de 15 años, se dedica a la cultivación de mango. Cuenta con dos pequeñas plantaciones donde realiza esta actividad. También se dedica a la crianza y venta de ganado ovino, contando con 30 cabezas. Desea utilizar su crédito para la compra de fertilizantes y agroquímicos para mantener su producción de mango. Con esta inversión, se logrará una cosecha óptima y oportuna. Para lograr su meta, ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 1200 nuevos soles. Este préstamo será el segundo que ha solicitado de Edpyme Alternativa. Pagó su primer crédito de manera puntual. Leonor es muy trabajador. Cuenta con buenas referencias personales y labores de sus vecinos. Es bastante entregado a su familia y siempre vela por su bienestar y desarrollo.
texts.en:
Leonor is 54 years old.  He lives with his wife and daughter in his own home in Tambogrande district.  This is an agricultural area which is located in Piura province, more than four hours from the city of Chiclayo, capital of Lambayeque region.  They currently do not have access to basic services such as light or drinking water.

Leonor has been growing mangos for more than 15 years.  He has two small plantations where he carries out this activity.  He also raises and sells sheep.  He has 30 head of sheep.  Leonor would like to use his loan to buy fertilizers and agrochemicals to care for his mango crop.  Through this investment, he will obtain an optimum and timely harvest.  In order to achieve his goal, he has requested a loan for 1,200 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa.  This loan will be the second that he has requested from Edpyme Alternativa.  He paid back his first loan on time.  Leonor is a very hard-working man.  He has good personal references and work references from his neighbors.  He is committed to his family and is always looking out for their well-being and development.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and agrochemicals to care for his mango crop

loans.name: Dawoud

texts.en:
Dawoud is a father of four daughters and five sons. Dawoud owns a grocery store in Bethlehem city. Dawoud's children are school students and soon some of them will start university, therefore Dawoud needs to increase his income.

Dawoud took out a loan from FATEN to purchase a larger variety of goods and change the arrangement of the store by adding shelves and display windows.

Dawoud appears in the picture here in his store.

loans.use: to pay for goods and purchase shelves and display windows.

loans.name: Claire

texts.en:
Claire is a young woman from Bethlehem city, a mother of two daughters and five sons. Claire and her husband share in taking care of their big family. Claire produces favors for birthdays, weddings, baby showers...etc.

Claire who is photographed above in FATEN's branch in Bethlehem took a loan from FATEN to purchase a large amount of raw material to double her production. Claire started this work 15 years ago and has a good number of regular clients.

loans.use: Purchase raw material to produce a larger number of events favors.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase goats to breed, raise and sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay fees to Bethlehem University to run its cafeteria.

loans.name: Fawaz

texts.en:
Fawaz is a 51-year-old client of FATEN. He is a father of one daughter and three sons. Fawaz took out a loan from FATEN to purchase home furniture.

Fawaz, who appears in the picture above, bought a kitchen table, bedroom furniture for his daughter, and chairs for the sitting room. Fawaz took out the loan as he can't pay the amount at once from his salary and it would be easier to repay FATEN on a monthly basis.

loans.use: to purchase house furniture.

loans.name: Ghada

texts.en:
Ghada is a young woman from Qalqilia city. Ghada is a mother of two daughters and four sons. Ghada works in a tailoring workshop. She has been working in this field for a long time which gave her the experience to start her own project.

Ghada took out a loan from FATEN to purchase a sewing machine and start tailoring in her house to increase their income and help her husband in taking care of their family.

Ghada is a conservative woman who is not comfortable having her picture posted online, therefore her husband was photographed instead.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine.

loans.name: Ammar

texts.en:
Ammar is a farmer from Qalqilia. He has a plot of land that he plants with seasonal vegetables, besides the fruits trees he takes care of. This makes up his only source of income.

Ammar is a father of three daughters and three sons.  Ammar wants to increase the variety of vegetables he plants, so he took out a loan from FATEN to purchase more and different seedlings.

Ammar is photographed in the picture here.

loans.use: to purchase seedlings of seasonal vegetables.

loans.name: Naji

texts.en:
Naji, who is a father of five daughters and two sons, works in a settlement near his city and breeds chickens for sale in his backyard.

Naji took out a loan from FATEN to purchase chickens and increase his egg production and chickens sold which will enhance the financial situation of the big family he has.

Naji is photographed above.

loans.use: tp purchase chickens to breed and sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to do car maintenance and pay license fees.

loans.name: Adham

texts.en:
Adham is a young man from Hebron. Adham and his father share in taking care of the household expenses. Adham works in a restaurant while his father is a construction worker.

Adham took out a loan from FATEN to fix up their old family house. The loan will be used to pay for  fixing walls, painting, and fixing the rooftop.

Adham is photographed in the picture above.

loans.use: To improve the condition of his house.

loans.name: Zaheyya

texts.en:
Zaheyya is a young woman from Ramallah, married and a mother of one daughter and three sons. Zaheyya's husband runs an ornamental bird and flower store. He sells birds, their feed, and accessories needed when buying a bird.

Zaheyya took out a loan from FATEN so that her husband can purchase a larger variety of birds and feed for them.

Zaheyya's husband is photographed instead of her as she is a conservative woman.

loans.use: to purchase ornamental birds, feed, and bird accessories.

loans.name: Rokhaya

texts.fr:
Madame ROKHAYA T. est une femme de 53 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 10 enfants. Elle fait partie des promotrice du Banc Villageois (WANGO) Elle fait partie des membres du Comité de Gestion où elle occupe le poste d'assistante depuis 1996.

Elle fait du petit commerce. Elle vend des produits divers tels du riz, de l'huile, du mil, de l'arachide, du poisson séché, du poisson fumé etc.. Elle dispose d'une bonne expérience dans le domaine d'activité pour l'avoir exercé depuis plus d'une quinzaine d'année.

Son nouveau crédit lui permettra de se procurer de la marchandise cité ci-dessus

Avec les bénéfices réalisés à partir de son petit commerce elle va soutenir son mari dans la prise en charge des enfants.
texts.en:
Mrs. ROKHAYA T. is 53 years old, married, and the mother of ten children. She's a promoter of the WANGO Banc Villageois. She's a member of the managing committee, where she's been an assistant since 1996.

She's a retailer, who sells various products such as rice, oil, millet, peanuts, dried fish, smoked fish, etc. She has a good experience in this sector, due to the fact that she's been running this business for more than fifteen years.

Her new loan will enable her to buy the products listed above. With the profits of her business, she will support her husband in providing for the children.

loans.use: to buy rice, oil, millet, peanuts, dried fish, smoked fish, etc

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase home furnishings.

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.fr:
Madame ROSALIE D. est une femme de 60 ans. Elle est veuve et mère de trois enfants qui sont autonomes. Mais elle a la charge de ses deux petits fils. Elle est la présidente du Banc Villageois de WANGO depuis 1996, date de sa création. 

Elle fait du petit commerce avec la vente de tissus déjà confectionné. Elle a une bonne expérience dans ce domaine pour y avoir excellé depuis plus de dix ans. 

Avec son nouveau crédit de 500.000 francs CFA elle va au moins acheter une vingtaine de pièces pour revendre dans son quartier soit au comptant soit à crédit.

Avec les bénéfices qu'elle réalise elle prend en charge ses besoins personnels, ceux de ses petits fils et elle restaure sa maison.
texts.en:
Ms. Rosalie D. is a 60-year-old woman, a widow, and the mother of three children, who are independent. But she supports her two grandsons. She has been the president of the Banc Villageois of WANGO since 1996, the time it was established.

Rosalie has a small-scale business selling already-made cloth. She has good experience in this domain because she has excelled at it for over ten years.

With her new loan of 500,000 francs CFA, she is going to buy at least 20 lengths of cloth for resale in her district, either for cash or on credit.

With the profits she makes, Rosalie will take care of her personal needs and those of her grandsons. And she is renovating her house.

loans.use: to buy fabrics to sell

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en: Ahmad is a young man from Gaza Strip. He runs a mobile phone store where he sells mobile phones and phone accessories. Ahmed took out a loan from FATEN to cover the cost of mobile phones he bought. The store is the only source of income for Ahmad and his family. Ahmed is in the photo above.

loans.use: to purchase mobile phones to sell in his store.

loans.name: Khady

texts.fr:
Madame KHADY N. est une femme de 53 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 10 enfants. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de THILMAKHA depuis le 01 mars 2002. Elle fait partie des membre du comité de gestion. Et elle garde une bonne image dans le Banc Villageois.

Elle fait de la couture. Elle achète des tissus et fait la confection sur mesure.

Ce crédit lui permettra de s'approvisionner en quantité importante en tissus afin de constituer un bon stock pour mieux satisfaire sa clientèle.

Son principal objectif est de renforcer son niveau d'épargne en vue de réfectionner sa vieille maison
texts.en:
Mrs. Khady N. is a 53-year old woman. She is married and the mother of 10. She has been a member of the Banc Villageois of Thilmakha since March 1, 2002. She is a member of its Executive Committee, and enjoys a good reputation with the Banc Villageois. 

She is a seamstress. She purchases fabrics and sews made-to-measure outfits. This loan will allow her to purchase a big quality of fabrics in order to have a good stock and better meet her clients’ needs. Her main goal is to bolster her level of savings and eventually have her old house renovated.

loans.use: purchasing fabrics to make outfits for sale

loans.name: Samar

texts.en:
Samar is a young woman from Gaza City in Gaza Strip. Samar and her husband are the parents of three daughters and one son. Samar's husband runs a barber shop, which he started seven years ago. She took out a loan as her husband needed to buy a neck and shoulder massage machine to attract more customers to his shop 

Samar is a conservative woman (as are most of Gaza inhabitants); therefore, her husband is photographed instead.

loans.use: to purchase a neck and shoulder massage machine.

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
Mahmoud is a young man from Gaza Strip. He runs a mobile phone store. Mahmoud is single and lives with his parents, sharing the responsibility of his family. Mahmoud took out a loan from FATEN to purchase mobile phone accessories to sell with mobiles which will increase the profit of the store.

Mahmoud is photographed in his store.

loans.use: to purchase phone accessories to sell with mobile phones.

loans.name: Edwin

texts.es:
Edwin es padre de familia de 30 años de edad. Vive con su esposa y dos hijos en el distrito de Tambogrande, una zona agrícola situada en la región Piura, a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Desde hace más de 5 años, se dedica a la crianza de ovejas y chanchos. Realiza esta actividad en algunos corrales ubicados fuera de su domicilio. Cuando estos ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo los ofrece en venta a los negociantes que suelen visitar la zona en donde reside. Adicionalmente, para generar ingresos adicionales, trabaja como jornalero en distintas parcelas. 

Edwin desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más animales. Por ello, ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 1200 nuevos soles. Con esta inversión, pretende aumentar sus ingresos para seguir mejorando la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Edwin is a father and he is 30 years old. He lives with his wife and his two children in the Tambogrande district, a farming zone located in the Piura region. This region is more than four hours away from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of Lambayeque region.

For more than five years he has raised sheep and pigs. He raises them in a few barnyards located outside of his home. When they have reached a good level of development, he offers for them for sale to traders who usually visit the area where he lives. In addition, he works as a day laborer on certain plots of land to generate more income. 

Edwin wants to expand his business by purchasing more animals. For this reason, he thought it would be good to request a loan for 1200 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa. With this investment, he intends to increase his income in order to continue improving his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more animals to raise and sell

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es:
Julio tiene 25 años de edad, es casado y tiene 3 hijos. Vive en la zona rural del distrito de La Victoria, unos treinta minutos de la ciudad  de Chiclayo, el capital de la región de Lambayeque. Actualmente, no cuenta con servicios básicos como agua o electricidad.

Desde hace 3 años, se dedica al servicio de transporte de pasajeros en su mototaxi, un vehículo que consta de una moto y una cabina para movilizar personas en su interior. Realiza esta actividad en las zonas de Chacupe y La Victoria. Julio es muy conocido en su comunidad y tiene mucha demanda de sus clientes. Desea usar el préstamo para el mantenimiento y reparación de su mototaxi. Necesita mantener su vehículo en buenas condiciones para seguir ofreciendo un buen servicio a sus clientes. También, su casa se encuentra en un estado deteriorado. Julio desea invertir parte de su crédito para hacer unos arreglos a su techo. Con la ayuda de un préstamo, espera aumentar sus ingresos y seguir mejorando la calidad de vida de su familia. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Julio is 25 years old, married, and has 3 children.  He lives in the rural area of La Victoria district, thirty minutes from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of Lambayeque region.  They currently don't have access to basic services such as water or electricity.

For 3 years, Julio has been providing a passenger transport service in his mototaxi, a vehicle which consists of a motorbike with a cabin in back for transporting passengers.  He carries out his business in Chacupe and La Victoria.  Julio is very well known in his community and he has a lot of demand for his services.  He would like to use this loan to have some maintenance and repair work done on his mototaxi.  He needs to keep his vehicle in good condition so that he can continue offering a good service to his customers.  Julio's house is also in a bad state of repair.  He would like to invest part of his loan in making some repairs to his roof.  With the help of his loan, Julio hopes to increase his income and continue improving his family's quality of life.  For this reason, he has requested a loan for 1,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: to have repair and maintenance work done on his motorcycle taxi

loans.name: Jose Porifirio

texts.es:
José es padre de familia de 53 años de edad. Es casado y tiene 5 hijos menores aun dependientes de él. Viven en casa propia sin servicios básicos como luz y agua. La única fuente de agua es la que obtiene de una pequeña vertiente que pasa por su terreno. José vive en el distrito de San Felipe, una zona rural, en la provincia de Jaén.

Desde hace más de 30 años, José se dedica al cultivo de café, maíz, menestras y yuca. En la actualidad siembra 01 hectárea de café y proyecta cosechar entre los meses de abril y junio 4 quintales más de café, 20 quintales de menestras y 15 quintales de maíz. Desea invertir una parte de su crédito en el abono de su finca de café y hacer un deshierbo a su terreno. Considerando que el precio del café está alcanzando niveles que no tenía en años anteriores, el invertir en abono para aumentar su productividad es una buena opción. También, trabaja como albañilería y desea hacer unas pequeñas compras de artículos de carpintería. Por ello, ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 1500 nuevos soles. José es muy trabajador y es bastante entregado a su familia. Siempre vela por su bienestar y desarrollo.
texts.en:
José is a 53-year-old father. He is married and has 5 minor children who are still dependent on him. They live in their own home, which does not have basic services such as electricity and water. The only source of water is a small stream which passes through their land. José lives in the district of San Felipe, a rural area, in the province of Jaén.

For more than 30 years, José has worked growing coffee, corn, beans and yuca. Currently, he has 1 hectare planted with coffee, and he expects to harvest between the months of April and June, obtaining 4 more quintals [large sacks] of coffee, 20 quintals of beans, and 15 quintals of corn. He would like to invest part of his loan in fertilizer for his coffee plantation, and also in removing weeds from his land. Considering that the price of coffee is rising to levels it did not reach in previous years, investing in fertilizer to increase productivity is a good option. He also works as a mason, and he would like to make some small purchases of articles for carpentry. For these reasons, he has decided to request a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1500 Peruvian new soles. José is very hard-working and extremely dedicated to his family. He is always trying to ensure their well-being and development.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for his coffee plantings and articles for carpentry

loans.name: Elsa

texts.es: Elsa tiene 51 años de edad y es soltera. Vive en casa propia en la parte rural del distrito de Motupe, una zona agrícola que pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y que se encuentra ubicada a una hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo. Actualmente no cuenta con servicios básicos como agua o electricidad. Desde hace más de 6 años, Elsa cuenta con una bodega instalada en su domicilio. Allí ofrece en venta a sus vecinos diversos productos de consumo diario entre gaseosas, abarrotes y productos de primera necesidad. Desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más mercadería. Por ello, ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 2000 nuevos soles. Elsa es muy trabajadora y responsable. Agradece mucho a los prestamistas de Kiva por apoyarla crecer su negocio y sus ingresos.
texts.en: Elsa is 51 years old and a single woman. She lives in her own house in a rural part of the Motupe district. This region is located an hour and a half away from the city of Chiclayo. She does not have basic services like water or electricity. For more than six years, she has had a small store located in her home. She offers her neighbors a lot of products for daily use like soft drinks, groceries and basic needs products. She wants to expand her business with the purchase of more merchandise. For this reason, she thought it would be a good idea to request a loan for 2000 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa. She is grateful to the Kiva lenders for their support in growing her business and profits.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her store

loans.name: Aristides

texts.es: Aristides tiene 42 años de edad y es soltero. Vive con sus  dos hijos en la ciudad de Chiclayo, la capital de la región de Lambayeque. Su comunidad es grande con vías de mucho crecimiento. Desde hace más de 5 años, se dedica a la compra y venta de pasamanería, productos para hacer ropa como hilos, elástico, cierres, y botones. Con su préstamo, Aristides comprará un lote de mercadería. Espera seguir creciendo su negocio y incrementar sus ventas. Desea un día poder comprar una moto lineal para que el reparto de sus productos y la cobranza de sus clientes sean más efectivo y rápido. Para lograr su meta, ha creído conveniente solicitar un crédito de 500 nuevos soles a Edpyme Alternativa. Aristides es un hombre muy trabajador. Goza de buenas referencias personales y laborales. Es un padre bastante entregado a su familia y siempre vela por su bienestar y desarrollo. Las personas que le conocen le tienen mucha estima y cariño.
texts.en:
Aristides is 42 years old and single. He lives with his two children in the city of Chiclayo, the capital of the Lambayeque region. His community is large with many streets and a lot of growth. 

For more than five years he has worked buying and selling adornments and products to make clothing such as threads, elastic, zippers, and buttons. With this loan Aristides will buy a batch of merchandise. He hopes to continue expanding his business and increasing his sales. He wants to be able to buy a motorcycle someday so that the delivery of his products and the collections from his clients will be more efficient and rapid. To attain his goal he has decided to request a loan of 500 new soles from Edpyme Alternativa. 

Aristides is a very hard working man. He has good personal and work references. He is a father, very dedicated to his family and always looking out for their well being and development. The people who know him have a great deal of respect and affection for him.

loans.use: To buy and resell products for hand made, sewn articles.

loans.name: Edson

texts.en:
Edson would like a loan to pay school fees for his children.  He lives in his own house in Kyenjojo, Uganda and his dream is to educate his children to attain a degree as a minimum qualification.

He is a farmer and has been farming for ten years and the proceeds have helped him in paying school fees for his children.  He desires to become a successful farmer and export his produce.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children

loans.name: Luvina Clementina

texts.es:
La Señora Luvina Chávez es socia del banco comunal Luz y Vida, vive por el sector de Monay en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad  es de clima frió, tiene hermosos lugares llenos de historia para visitar, cuenta con una amplia gastronomía que cautiva los paladares de propios y extraños, Cuenca es una ciudad de cultura y tradiciones.

La Señora. Luvina tiene 50 años, es casada y tiene 11 hijos de los cuales tres de ellos son casados, dos de sus hijos casados viven en su casa y comparten gastos, cinco de sus hijos trabajan y ayudan en la economía de su hogar y sus tres últimos hijos  estudian en una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo labora en la agricultura y con el trabajo conyugal han logrado construir su casa propia.

Doña Luvina se dedica a la venta de productos como: papas, yuca, mellocos, ocas, queso, yogurt entre otros. Esta actividad  la realiza hace 30 años, tiene un puesto propio en el mercado donde vende solo los fines de semana y los demás días de la semana vende sus productos recorriendo la ciudad.

Este es el onceavo crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y lo va a invertir en la compra de papas, yogurt, queso, mellocos, etc.
  
Su meta es tener un vehículo para poder trasladase más fácilmente con sus productos.
texts.en:
Luvina Chávez is a member of the 'Luz y Vida' (Light and Life) community bank.  She lives in Monay sector, in the city of Cuenca.  This is a cold climate city which has beautiful, historic places to visit.  It offers visitors a wide range of top-quality food which captivates both local and foreign palates.  Cuenca is a city of culture and traditions.

Luvina is 50 years old, married, and has 11 children, three of whom are married.  Two of her children live at home and share expenses.  Five of her children work and help with the household expenses and her three youngest children are attending school in the city.  Her husband works in agriculture and, through their joint efforts, they have managed to build their own home.

Luvina's business is selling products such as potatoes, cassava, okra, cheese, yoghurt, etc.  She has been in this business for 30 years.  Luvina has her own stall in the market where she sells her products on weekends.  During the rest of the week she sells her products throughout the city.

This is Luvina's eleventh loan through her community bank and she will invest it in buying potatoes, yoghurt, cheese, mellocos (a native tuber) etc.  Her goal is to own a vehicle so that she can transport her products more easily.

loans.use: to buy potatoes, mellocos (a native tuber), okra, yoghurt, cheese, cassava etc.

loans.name: Narcisa Yolanda

texts.es:
La Señora. Narcisa es socia del banco comunal Luz y Vida, vive por el sector de Monay en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad que es de clima frió, tiene hermosos lugares llenos de  historia para visitar, cuenta con una amplia gastronomía que cautiva los paladares de propios y extraños, Cuenca es una ciudad de cultura y tradiciones.

Doña Narcisa tiene 38 años, está separada y tiene 3 hijos de 18, 17 y 14 años de edad, su primera hija pasa en casa y ayuda en los quehaceres, sus dos últimos hijos estudian en un colegio de la ciudad. Con su trabajo ha logrado construir su casa propia.

Nuestra socia se dedica a la venta de productos Yanbal, ropa por catalogo y zapatos, esta actividad la desempeña hace 5 años, trabaja solo medio día y sus productos los vende recorriendo la ciudad de domingo a domingo.
 
Este es el noveno crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y lo va a invertir en ropa, zapatos y productos Yanbal.
 
Su meta es  tener su vehiculo propio.
texts.en:
Narcisa is a member of the communal bank “Luz y Vida” (Light and Life) and lives in the Monay sector of the city of Cuenca.  This city has a cold climate and beautiful places full of history to visit.  It has a broad cuisine that captures the palates of its own residents as well as visitors.  Cuenca is a city with culture and traditions.

Narcisa is 38-years-old and is separated and has three children who are 18, 17, and 14-years-old.  Her first daughter is in the house and helps with the chores and her two other children study in a school in the city.  With her work she has been able to build her own house.

Our member works selling Yanbal brand cosmetics products, clothing from catalogs, and shoes.  She has worked in this for five years.  She works half days and sells her products traveling around the city from Sunday to Sunday.  

This is the ninth loan that she has made with the communal bank and she will invest it in clothing, shoes, and Yandal products.  

Her goal is to have her own vehicle.

loans.use: to buy Yanbal cosmetic products, shoes, and clothing.

loans.name: Zoila Cecilia

texts.es:
La Señora. Zoila Mizquero es socia del banco comunal Luz y Vida, vive por el sector de Monay en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad que es de clima frió, tiene hermosos lugares llenos de  história para visitar, cuenta con una amplia gastronomía que cautiva los paladares de propios y extraños, Cuenca es una ciudad de cultura y tradiciones.

La Señora. Zoila tiene 44 años, es casada y tiene 3 hijos de 25, 18 y 4 años de edad, su primer hijo trabaja y estudia en la universidad,  su segundo hijo estudia en la universidad y cuida a dos niñas de 11 y 9 años de edad ya que sus padres han migrado a otra ciudad.  Su esposo labora en un taller propio donde elabora cielos rasos, con el trabajo conyugal han logrado construir su casa propia.
 
Doña Zoila se dedica a los quehaceres de su hogar en donde cría chanchos y cuyes a los cuales los vende en su comunidad. También ayuda a su esposo en el taller y esta actividad la realiza hace 15 años, trabajan de lunes a sábados.

Es socia fundadora del banco comunal y todos los crédito le han beneficiado para sus negocios, el dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de material para la fabricación de los cielos rasos en el taller de su esposo.
 
Su meta es de crecer mucho más en el negocio.
texts.en:
Zoila Mizquero is a member of the village bank Luz y Vida. She lives in the Monay neighborhood of the city of Cuenca. The city has a cold climate and many pretty historical sites to visit. Cuenca offers a diverse cuisine which entices both locals and foreigners. Cuenca is a city of culture and tradition.

Zoila is a 44-year-old married mother of three. Her children are 25, 18 and 4 years old. Her eldest child works and is a student at the university. Her second child is a student at the university and takes care of two girls, ages 11 and 9, whose parents moved to another city. Her husband owns his own workshop where he builds ceilings. Working together, they've been able to build their own house.

Zoila takes care of household chores. She also raises pigs and guinea pigs out of her home which she sells locally. Additionally, she helps her husband in his workshop. They've had this business for 15 years now and work from Monday through Saturday.

Zoila is one of the founding members of the village bank. All the loans that she has received have gone to help her with her businesses. She plans to use this loan to buy more material to build ceilings in her husband's workshop.

Her goal is to help the business to grow much more.

loans.use: to purchase materials to build ceilings

loans.name: Leticia Alexandra

texts.es:
En la parroquia Eloy Alfaro de la ciudad de  Manta cada 15 días se reúne el Banco Comunal Mujeres Con Esperanza.  Este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año por turistas nacionales y extranjeros, es uno de los puertos más importantes del país y de América  y está situado a orillas del Océano Pacifico.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Leticia, tiene 33 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de 13 y 10 años que estudian en colegio y escuela. Su esposo es agente vendedor.

Es una mujer muy emprendedora que para tener sus propios ingresos hace un año decidió poner su propio negocio, tiene un pequeño local en la estación de Reinas Del Camino en la ciudad de Manta en el cual vende  desayunos y bocadillos. Trabaja todos los días desde las 4h30 hasta las 8h30. Nos cuenta que a pesar de que lleva poco tiempo ha logrado ganar mucha clientela que le dejan buenos ingresos diarios.

Este crédito es para comprar más productos para preparar los alimentos como leche, pan, huevos, fruta y víveres en general. Este es su segundo ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que le brinda la institución a través de los créditos.
 
Sus metas son tener un bazar y una tienda de víveres.
texts.en:
The Banco Comunal Mujeres Con Esperanza meets every two weeks in the parish of Eloy Alfaro in the city of Manta. This city is known for its beautiful beaches. Many domestic and foreign tourists visit these beaches throughout the year. Manta is one of the most important ports in Ecuador and in the Americas. It is located on the Pacific Ocean.

This is where we met Leticia, a 33-year-old married woman. She and her husband have two children together, a 13 year old and a 10 year old. Both children are in school. Her husband works as a salesman.

Leticia is a hardworking woman. One year ago, she decided to start her own business in order to earn her own money. She has a small shop at the Reinas Del Camino resort in the city of Manta where she sells breakfast and sandwiches. She works every day from 4:30 to 8:30. Even though she hasn't been working for very long, she has been able to attract many customers who provide her with a solid daily income.

She will use this loan to buy more products such as milk, bread, eggs, fruit and other groceries, in order to prepare the food. This is her second loan cycle with the Banco Comunal. She is grateful for the loans that she receives from the bank as they have helped her a lot.

Her goal is to one day own a stationary shop and a grocery store.

loans.use: to purchase bread, milk, eggs, fruit and other groceries

loans.name: Yolanda Moserrate

texts.es:
En la parroquia Eloy Alfaro de la ciudad de  Manta cada 15 días se reúne el Banco Comunal Mujeres Con Esperanza.  Este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año por turistas nacionales y extranjeros, es uno de los puertos más importantes del país y de América  y está situado a orillas del Océano Pacifico.

En este lugar encontramos a la señora Yolanda, tiene 43 años  y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene seis hijos,  cuatro de ellos son mayores de edad y dos de 17 y 15  años que estudian en colegio, cuatro de sus hijos aun viven en su casa. El marido es comerciante.
 
Ella tiene una tienda de víveres de consumo en su casa que empezó hace seis meses con el crédito que recibió de la institución, nos cuenta le está yendo muy bien, empezó con poco y hoy ya tiene su tiendita bien surtida ya que tiene de todo un poco para satisfacer a sus clientes, tiene productos como arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes, entre otros, trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 20h00, los productos los compra en el centro de Manta aunque la mayoría  los recibe en su local.

Este crédito lo va invertir en la compra de arroz, azúcar, aceite, detergentes, embutidos y otros productos de primera necesidad. Está en el Banco Comunal desde el inicio y le gusta porque con los créditos puso su negocio que le permite ganarse su sustento diario.
 
Sus metas son seguir adelante en su negocio y que  crezca cada día más.
texts.en:
The Banco Comunal Mujeres Con Esperanza meets every two weeks in the Eloy Alfaro parish in the city of Manta. This city is known for its beautiful beaches. Many domestic and foreign tourists visit these beaches throughout the year. Manta is one of the most important ports in Ecuador and in the Americas. It is located on the Pacific Ocean.

This is where we met 43-year-old Yolanda. She and her partner have six children, four of whom are adults now. The other two are 17 and 15 years old and are in school. Four of her children live with her. Her partner is a shopkeeper.

Yolanda owns a grocery store which she runs out of her home. She started this business six months ago with a loan that she received from the lending institution. She says that business is going well. She started with very little and now she has a well-stocked store. She satisfies her customers' needs by offering a little bit of everything. She sells products such as rice, sugar, oil and detergent, among others. She works every day from 6:00am until 8:00pm. Yolanda buys her products in downtown Manta, although most of them are delivered to her store.

She will use this loan to purchase rice, sugar, oil, detergent, sausages and other basic products. Yolanda has been with the Banco Comunal since the beginning. She appreciates how the bank loans have allowed her to start her own business and to earn a living.

Her goal is to keep developing and growing her business every day.

loans.use: to purchase rice, sugar, oil, detergent, sausages and other basic products

loans.name: Mayra Jacqueline

texts.es:
En la parroquia Eloy Alfaro de la ciudad de  Manta cada 15 días se reúne el Banco Comunal Mujeres Con Esperanza.  Este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año por turistas nacionales y extranjeros, es uno de los puertos más importantes del país y de América  y está situado a orillas del Océano Pacifico.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Mayra, tiene 29  años, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de 9 y 8 años de edad que estudian en escuela. Su esposo es fotógrafo. Este es su cuarto ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque son consientes con los pagos.

Tiene un salón de belleza en el barrio Cuba de Manta, arrienda un local en el cual  realiza diversos trabajos como tinturados, cortes de cabellos, manicura de uñas, etc.  Trabaja de martes a domingos desde las 8am hasta las 20h00. También vende productos de belleza y tratamientos para el cabello los mismos que vende en su mismo local donde tiene unas vitrinas. Lleva cinco años con su negocio y nos cuenta que de a poco ha ido creciendo su clientela.

Este crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de tintes, permanentes, tratamientos para el cabello entre otros productos.

Su sueño  es tener un SPA en el centro de Manta.
texts.en:
Every two weeks the 'Mujeres con Esperanza' (Hopeful Women) community bank meets in Eloy Alfaro parish, in the city of Manta.  This place is well known for its beautiful beaches which are very popular year round with both national and foreign tourists.  It is one of the most important ports in the country and in America, and is situated on the Pacific coast.

Here we meet 29 year-old Mayra who is married and has two children aged 9 and 8 who are in school.  Her husband is a photographer.  This is her fourth loan cycle as a member of her community bank and she likes it because the members are all responsible in making their repayments.

Mayra has a beauty salon in Cuba neighborhood, in Manta.  She rents premises in which she carries out different treatments such as hair colorings, haircuts, manicures, etc.  She works from Tuesday to Sunday, from 8.00am to 8.00pm.  She also sells beauty products and hair treatments in her salon where she has some display cabinets.  Mayra has been in this business for five years and she tells us that she has gradually increased her customer base.

Mayra will invest this loan in buying hair dyes, perms, hair treatments, etc.  Her dream is to own a spa in the center of Manta.

loans.use: to buy hair dyes, perms, hair treatments, etc.

loans.name: Jacqueline Concepción

texts.es:
En la parroquia Eloy Alfaro de la ciudad de  Manta cada 15 días se reúne el Banco Comunal Mujeres Con Esperanza.  Este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año por turistas nacionales y extranjeros, es uno de los puertos más importantes del país y de América  y está situado a orillas del Océano Pacifico.

En este lugar encontramos a la señora Jacqueline, tiene 24 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres hijos de  7, 3 y de 1 año, el mayor estudia en escuela. El marido es comerciante de pescado.

Ella tiene un bazar y papelería en su casa en el cual vende regalos, peluches, tarjetas, útiles escolares y productos de Avon (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). También los sábados y domingos ella prepara y vende los deliciosos encebollados, trabaja todos los días desde las 7h00 hasta las 18h00. Tiene dos años con su negocio en el cual le va muy bien.

Este crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de perfumes, cremas, útiles escolares, peluches, tarjetas entre otros productos. Este es su segundo ciclo  en el Banco Comunal y le agrada por el cumplimiento de sus compañeras.

 Su sueño es tener su casa con buenos acabados ya que lea que tiene es de caña.
texts.en:
Every two weeks, the members of the 'Mujeres con Esperanza' (Women with Hope) community bank meet in Eloy Alfaro parish, in the city of Manta.  This area is known for its beautiful beaches which are popular year round with both domestic and foreign tourists.  It is one of the most important ports in the country and in America, and is situated on the Pacific coast.

Here we meet Jacqueline who is 24 years old.  She lives with her partner and they have three children aged 7, 3 and 1.  Her eldest is attending elementary school.  Jacqueline's husband is a fish seller.

Jacqueline has a stationery store in her home where she sells gifts, cuddly toys, cards, school supplies and Avon products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes and ladies' accessories).  On Saturdays and Sundays she also makes and sells delicious 'encebollados' (a traditional stew made with tuna, cassava, tomatoes and onion).  Jacqueline works every day from 7.00am to 6.00pm.  She has been in her business for two years and it is doing very well.

Jacqueline will use this loan to buy perfumes, creams, school supplies, cuddly toys, cards and other products.  This is her second loan cycle as a member of her community bank and she likes the bank because her fellow members are reliable.  Her dream is to have a nicely finished home since her current home is made from cane.

loans.use: to buy school supplies, cuddly toys, cards, perfumes, creams, etc.

loans.name: Aracely Maribel

texts.es:
En la parroquia Eloy Alfaro de la ciudad de  Manta cada 15 días se reúne el Banco Comunal Mujeres Con Esperanza.  Este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año por turistas nacionales y extranjeros, es uno de los puertos más importantes del país y de América  y está situado a orillas del Océano Pacifico.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Araceli, tiene 26 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de 5 años y de  9 meses de edad. Su esposo es pintor, ella estudia enfermería, está en el cuarto año en la Universidad Laica Eloy Alfaro de Manta.

Con este crédito ella va a comenzar  un negocio de venta de ropa, antes vendía productos Yanbal pero se retiro de este tipo de negocios porque le quedaron mal con unos pagos por eso comienza este nuevo negocio ya que tiene algunos pedidos que le han hecho sus amigas y clientes.

Este crédito es para comprar pantalones, camisetas, blusas y ropa de niños.  Está en el Banco Comunal desde sus inicios y le gusta  la forma de trabajar de la institución.

Sus sueños son terminar sus estudios y trabajar en su especialidad.
texts.en:
In the Eloy Alfaro parish, in the city of Manta, the Mujeres Con Esperanza (Women With Hope) Communal Bank meets every two weeks. This place is known for its beautiful beaches which are often visited throughout the year by local and foreign tourists. It’s one of the most important ports for the country and for America and it is located on the Pacific Ocean. 

Here we meet Araceli. She is 26 years old and married. She has two children from this relationship; they are five years old and nine months old. Her husband is a painter. She is studying nursing. She is in her fourth year at the Laica Eloy Alfaro de Manta University. 

With this loan, she will start a clothing business. Before she was selling Yanbal products but she withdrew from this business because things went poorly with some payments. For this reason, she is starting a new business now that she has a few orders from friends and other customers. 

This loan will be used to purchase pants, t-shirts, blouses and children’s clothing. She has been a part of this Communal Bank since the beginning and she likes how the bank works. 

 Her dream is to finish her studies and work in her specialty.

loans.use: to buy pants, t-shirts, blouses and children's clothing

loans.name: Tatiana Lorena

texts.es:
En la parroquia Eloy Alfaro de la ciudad de  Manta cada 15 días se reúne el Banco Comunal Mujeres Con Esperanza.  Este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año por turistas nacionales y extranjeros, es uno de los puertos más importantes del país y de América  y está situado a orillas del Océano Pacifico.

En este lugar encontramos a la señora Tatiana, tiene 37 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cuatro hijos de 21, 18, 12 y 9 años de edad, los dos menores son los que aun viven con ella y estudian en colegio y escuela. Su esposo es comerciante de mariscos al por mayor.

Ella también tiene un negocio de venta de mariscos en su casa, vende camarón, pescado de algunas variedades, conchas, langostinos, calamares, ostiones, cangrejos, etc. Ella entrega  los mariscos limpios y a veces también lo hace a domicilio. Trabaja todos los días desde las 8h00hasta las 11h00, sus productos los compra a su esposo que entrega al por mayor el mismo que le vende a un precio especial. Lleva 18 años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien ya que tiene mucha clientela fija.

Este crédito lo va a emplear para comprar camarón, pescado, conchas, ostiones, langostinos, cangrejos, calamares, etc. Este es su sexto ciclo  en el Banco Comunal y le agrada porque los intereses son muy bajos.
 
Su sueño es tener un carro.
texts.en:
In the city of Manta's Eloy Alfaro parish every 15 days, the “Mujeres Con Esperanza” (Women with Hope) Communal Bank meets. The location is known for its beautiful beaches which are visited in all seasons of the year by national and foreign tourists. This is one of the most important ports in the country and of America, and it's located on the shores of the Pacific Ocean.

Here resides Tatiana, who is 37 years old and married, with 4 children from this union, ages 21, 18, 12, and 9. The 2 youngest still live with her and study in school. Her husband is a wholesale seafood merchant.

Tatiana also sells seafood in her home; shrimp, a variety of fish, conch, prawns, squid, oysters, crab, etc. She cleans the seafood and sometimes delivers them to the customer. She works every day from 8:00 until 11:00 am. Tatiana buys her products from her husband who charges her wholesale or a special price. She has been doing this for 18 years, and it is going very well since she has many fixed customers.

This loan will be used to buy shrimp, fish, conch, oysters, prawns, crabs, squid, etc.  Tatiana is in her 6th loan cycle with the Communal Bank and she is grateful because the interest rates are very low. 

Her dream is to own a car.

loans.use: TO BUY SHRIMP, FISH, CONCH, OYSTERS, PRAWNS, CRAB, SQUID, ETC., TO SELL

loans.name: Jorge Eber

texts.es: Jorge tiene 29 años de edad y soltero. Vive en el distrito de Motupe, una zona agrícola que pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y que se encuentra ubicada a una hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo. Jorge se dedica a la venta de útiles escolares. Vende los productos a sus vecinos en una parte de su domicilio.   Ahora que la temporada escolar ha comenzado en Perú, desea ampliar su negocio para poder responder a la aumentación de demanda para sus productos. Por ello, solicita un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles para poder comprar más útiles escolares incluyendo papelotes, cuadernos, lapiceros, libros, laminas, carpetas plastificadas, tintes, gomas, plastilinas, grapadoras, y perforadores. Su mayor anhelo es generar ingresos suficientes para poder abrir su propia tienda dónde puede vender sus productos.
texts.en: Jorge is 29 years old and single. He lives in the Motupe district, an agricultural zone in the province of Lambayeque located an hour and a half from Chiclayo. Jorge works selling school supplies. He sells the products to his neighbors from his home. Since the school year has begun in Peru, he would like to expand his business to be able to respond to the increase in demand for his products. For this reason he is asking for a loan of 1000 new soles to be able to purchase more supplies, such as baggies, notebooks, pencil cases, books, plastic folders, ink, erasers, staplers, and hole punchers. His biggest goal is to generate sufficient income to be able to open his own store where he can sell his products.

loans.use: to buy more school supplies to sell

loans.name: Roddy Patricio

texts.es:
En la parroquia Eloy Alfaro de la ciudad de  Manta cada 15 días se reúne el Banco Comunal Mujeres Con Esperanza.  Este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año por turistas nacionales y extranjeros, es uno de los puertos más importantes del país y de América  y está situado a orillas del Océano Pacifico.

Aquí conocimos a don Roddy, el tiene 39 años de edad, es soltero y vive en casa de su mamá. Es maestro titulado y trabaja de profesor en un colegio de Manta.
 
Además de trabajar de maestro también se dedica al comercio, tiene un deposito en el cual vende agua en bidón, trabaja por las tardes de lunes a viernes ya que en las mañanas está en su trabajo de profesor y los fines de semana todo el día, el vende en su local, a domicilio y también recorre la ciudad en su carro cuando sus clientes lo llaman. Nos cuenta que tiene 4 años que se dedica a esta actividad, además de esto también cría chanchos los mismos que faena y vende la carne por libras.

Este crédito es para comprar agua en bidón, alimentos y medicinas para los chanchos. Este es su primer ciclo y le ha gustado por la facilidad para conseguir el crédito.
 
Su meta es crecer en su negocio.
texts.en:
The "Mujeres Con Esperanza" ["Women With Hope"] Communal Bank meets every 15 days in Eloy Alfaro parish in the city of Manta. This place is known for its beautiful beaches that are visited year-round by national and foreign tourists. It is one of the most important ports in the country and in the Americas, located on the shores of the Pacific Ocean.

This is where Fundación ESPOIR met Mr. Roddy. He is 39 years old, single, and lives in his mother's house. He is a licensed teacher and works at a high school in Manta.

Besides working as a teacher, he is also a business man. He has a warehouse where he sells drums of water. He works in the afternoons from Monday through Friday, since he is at his job as a teacher in the mornings. He also works all day on the weekends. He sells from house-to-house in his area and also travels the city in his car when customers call him. He tells Fundacón ESPOIR that he has been doing this work for four years, and that he also raises and butchers pigs, whose meat he sells by the pound.

This loan will be used to buy drums of water, as well as food and medicine for his pigs. This is his first loan cycle and he was pleased with the ease of the loan process.

His goal is to grow his business.

loans.use: to buy drums of water to sell, as well as food and medicine for his pigs

loans.name: Claudina Martina

texts.en:
Claudina is 36 years old. She is single and has three children. They live in the district of Las Lomas, an agricultural area situated in the province of Piura, more than four hours from Chiclayo, the capital of the region of Lambayeque. 

Claudina earns a living by operating a business selling cases of beer. She sells the drinks in two methods: retail at higher prices and wholesale at discount prices. She has five years of experience in this activity. She also sells beauty and health products, which has begun to be a profitable venture. 

She has requested a loan of 500 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa to invest in her businesses and purchase additional cases of beer as well as beauty and health products. She hopes to increase her income so that she can continue providing for her children and offer them a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase additional merchandise to sell

loans.name: Narcisa Margarita

texts.es:
En la parroquia Eloy Alfaro de la ciudad de  Manta cada 15 días se reúne el Banco Comunal Mujeres Con Esperanza.  Este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año por turistas nacionales y extranjeros, es uno de los puertos más importantes del país y de América  y está situado a orillas del Océano Pacifico.

La señora Narcisa es socia fundadora del Banco comunal y le gusta por las facilidades para conseguir los créditos y por el grupo de amigas que han formado. Tiene  27 años, está casada y de esta relación tiene cuatro hijos de 12,8,7 y 4 años de edad, los tres mayores estudian en escuela. Su esposo es albañil.

Tiene un pequeño local en la estación de Reinas Del Camino en la ciudad de Manta en el cual prepara y vende deliciosos platos, trabaja todos los días en las tardes ya que solo prepara meriendas, trabaja sola. Nos cuenta que tiene este  comedor dos años y que siempre le ha ido muy bien ya que tiene muchos clientes que tienen en la estación su oficina, incluso hace un año también llevo a su hermana para que venda desayunos y al igual que a ella le va muy bien.

Este crédito lo va utilizar en comprar arroz, carne, pescado y otros ingredientes para la preparación de los alimentos. Está en el Banco Comunal desde el inicio y le gusta porque con los créditos logro poner su negocio y poco a poco lo ha ido mejorando.
 
Su sueño es algún día tener un local comercial.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Mujeres Con Esperanza” (Women with Hope) meets every fifteen days in the parish of Eloy Alfaro in the city of Manta. This place is known for its beautiful beaches that are visited throughout the year by both domestic and foreign tourists. Manta’s port, which lies on the Pacific Ocean, is one of the largest in the country and in all of the Americas.

Narcisa is a founding member of the Communal Bank. She enjoys the convenience of accessing the loans and the group of friends that have joined together. Narcisa is 27 years old, married, and has four children (ages 12, 8, 7, and 4). The three older children are in school. Her husband works as a mason.

Narcisa has an establishment at the Reinas Del Camino station in the city of Manta where she prepares and sells delicious dishes. She works every day in the afternoons preparing snacks. Narcisa says that she has been managing her eatery for two years and has always done well because she has many customers who come to the station. A year ago, she brought in her sister to sell breakfasts and she too is doing very well.

This loan will be used to buy rice, meat, fish, and other ingredients for preparing her dishes. Narcisa has been with the Communal Bank since the beginning and enjoys having access to loans for her business, which has been gradually improving. Her goal is to have a commercial location.

loans.use: To purchase rice, meat, fish, and other ingredients for preparing her dishes.

loans.name: Jose Johnny

texts.es:
José tiene 35  años de edad, es casado y tiene 3 hijos menores de edades escolares. Vive en la zona rural del distrito de Pacora en la provincia de Lambayeque.  Cuenta con el servicio de agua, pero no tiene acceso a la electricidad. Su comunidad es pequeña con un aproximado de 200  familias.

Se gana la vida desde hace 4 años brindando el servicio de transporte de pasajeros contando con mototaxi propia, un vehículo que consta de una moto y una cabina para movilizar personas en su interior. Realiza esta actividad en una ruta fija. José es muy conocido en su comunidad y tiene mucha demanda de sus clientes. También, se dedica a la cultivación de maíz en un terreno cerca de su domicilio. Desea usar el préstamo para el mantenimiento y reparación de su mototaxi. Necesita mantener su vehículo en buenas condiciones para seguir ofreciendo un buen servicio a sus clientes. También, desea invertir en la compra de abonos para su siembra de maíz. Por ello, ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 1500 nuevos soles. José es un hombre honesto y trabajador. Su mayor anhelo es lograr que su familia tenga una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
José is 35 years old, married, and has three young children in school. He lives in the rural section of the District of Pacora in Lambayeque Province. José receives running water, but he does not have access to electricity. This small community has approximately 200 families.

José has earned his living for the past four years by providing passenger transport services using his own motorcycle taxi. This type of vehicle consists of a motorcycle and an attached cabin for carrying passengers. He conducts his business by traveling along a fixed route. José is well-known in his community and experiences great demand from his customers. In addition, he grows corn on a piece of land near his home. He wants to use this loan to maintain and repair his motorcycle taxi. José needs to keep his vehicle in good condition so that he can continue offering excellent service to his customers. He also wants to invest in the purchase of compost for his crop of corn. For this reason, he is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1500 PEN.

José is an honest and hardworking gentleman. His greatest wish is for his family to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: To repair his motorcycle taxi and purchase compost for growing corn.

loans.name: Mariuxi Elizabeth

texts.es:
En la parroquia Eloy Alfaro de la ciudad de  Manta cada 15 días se reúne el Banco Comunal Mujeres Con Esperanza.  Este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año por turistas nacionales y extranjeros, es uno de los puertos más importantes del país y de América  y está situado a orillas del Océano Pacifico.

Aquí conocimos a la señorita Mariuxi, ella es soltera y tiene 20 años, vive en casa de sus padres. Estudia en primero de bachillerato en un colegio de Manta. Este es su segundo ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le agrada porque los créditos les permiten a personas como ella estudiar y poder ejercer una actividad comercial al mismo tiempo.

Se dedica a la venta productos por catálogos de Avon (artículos de belleza, cosméticos perfumería y accesorios para damas). Su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, trabaja dos días a la semana, nos cuenta que lo que más vende son los perfumes y los accesorios, sus productos los deja a crédito y cobra semanalmente dice que le encanta vender.
 
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar perfumes, bisutería, cosméticos y cremas.

Sus sueños son seguir estudiando para algún día llegar a ser una gran profesional y ayudar a sus seres queridos.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Mujeres Con Esperanza” (Women with Hope) meets every fifteen days in the parish of Eloy Alfaro in the city of Manta. This place is known for its beautiful beaches that are visited throughout the year by both domestic and foreign tourists. Manta’s port, which lies on the Pacific Ocean, is one of the largest in the country and in all of the Americas.

It is in this place that one can meet Srta. Mariuxi. She is 20 years old, single, and lives at home with her parents. Mariuxi is in her first year of undergraduate study at a college in Manta. She is participating in her second loan cycle with the Communal Bank and likes the fact that the loans help people like her who study and manage a business at the same time.

Mariuxi sells Avon products from catalogs (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes, and women’s accessories). She sells door-to-door and works every day. Mariuxi says the products that she sells most are perfumes and accessories. Her products are offered on credit and she collects payments on a weekly basis. She says that she enjoys selling.

This loan will be used to buy perfumes, trinkets, cosmetics, and crèmes. Her dreams include continuing her studies so that she will be a successful professional someday and helping her loved ones.

loans.use: To purchase perfumes, trinkets, cosmetics, and crèmes.

loans.name: Gloria Maria

texts.es: Gloria tiene 37 años de edad, es casada y tiene tres hijos. Vive en una comunidad marginal y urbana en el distrito de La Victoria, a unos veinte minutos de Chiclayo, el capital de la región de Lambayeque. Su comunidad es pequeña y joven pero muestra señales de crecimiento. Desde más de un ano, se dedica a la venta de jugos cerca del Mercado Az en su distrito. Cuenta con una carretilla ambulatoria que utiliza para distribuir sus productos. Ha solicitado un préstamo de 800 nuevos soles a Edpyme Alternativa para hacer unos arreglos a su carretilla y para comprar una sombrilla que protegerá sus productos del sol. Gloria es una mujer muy trabajadora y responsable. Ha manejado otro préstamo de Edpyme Alternativa y pagó su deuda en manera puntual. Con sus ingresos, ella puede ayudar a su esposo solventar sus gastos familiares.
texts.en:
Gloria is 37 years old, married, and has three children. She lives in a marginalized urban community in the District of La Victoria, which is approximately twenty minutes away from Chiclayo, the capital of Lambayeque region. Even though this small community is young, it is showing signs of growth.

A year ago, Gloria began selling juices near the Az Market in her district. She has a mobile cart that she uses to distribute her products. Gloria is requesting a loan of 800 PEN from Edpyme Alternativa so that she can make a few repairs to her cart and purchase an umbrella to protect her goods from the sun.

Gloria is a hardworking and responsible woman. She has managed another loan from Edpyme Alternativa and paid off her debt on time. With her earnings, she is able to help her husband cover the family expenses.

loans.use: To repair her mobile juice cart.

loans.name: Martha Elizabeth

texts.es: Martha tiene 22 años de edad, es casada y tiene un hijo. Vive en casa propia en el caserío San Pablo Hualtaco II en el distrito de Tambogrande, una zona agrícola situada en la región Piura, a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque. Cuenta con el básico servicio de luz, pero aun no tiene acceso a agua potable. Martha se dedica a la crianza de ganado ovino y porcino. Realiza esta actividad en algunos corrales ubicados fuera de su domicilio. Cuando estos ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo los ofrece en venta a los negociantes que suelen visitar la zona en donde reside. Es muy conocida en su zona y cuenta con una clientela ya establecida. Adicionalmente, para generar ingresos adicionales, trabaja en una fábrica de mango. Desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más animales y alimentos balanceados. Por ello, ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 1500 nuevos soles. Con sus ingresos, Martha puede ayudar a su esposo, quien trabaja como agricultor, con los gastos familiares.
texts.en:
Martha is 22 years old, married, and has one child. She lives in her own home in the village of San Pablo Hualtaco II in the District of Tambogrande. This farming district is situated in Piura region and located more than four hours away from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of Lambayeque region. Martha receives basic services such as electricity, but she does not have access to potable water.

She raises sheep and pigs and keeps the animals in pens located outside of her home. When the animals have reached the proper level of development, she offers them for sale to traders who frequently visit the area where she lives. Martha is well-known in her area and has an established customer base. In addition, she works at a mango processing plant to earn extra income.

Martha wants to expand her business by purchasing more animals and balanced feed. For this reason, she is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1500 PEN. With her earnings, she will be able to help her husband, who works as a farmer, with the family expenses.

loans.use: To purchase more animals and balanced feed.

loans.name: David

texts.es:
David tiene 34 años y reside junto a su esposa en su casa propia en la parte rural del caserío Anchovira, en el distrito de Motupe, una zona agrícola que pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y que se encuentra ubicada a una hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo. Actualmente, no cuenta con servicios básicos de agua o electricidad.

Desde hace cuatro años, David brinda servicios de transporte de pasajeros en su mototaxi, un vehículo que consta de una moto y una cabina para movilizar personas en su interior. Transporte sus clientes rutas entre Motupe y sus caseríos. Desea usar el préstamo para el mantenimiento y reparación de su mototaxi. Necesita mantener su vehículo en buenas condiciones para seguir ofreciendo un buen servicio a sus clientes. Con la ayuda de un préstamo, espera aumentar sus ingresos para seguir solventado sus gastos familiares. Por ello, ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 500 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
David is 34 years old and lives with his wife in their own home in the rural section of Anchovira, a village in the District of Motupe. This farming area is part of Lambayeque Province, which is located an hour and a half away from the city of Chiclayo. At the moment, he does not receive basic services such as running water or electricity.

For the past four years, David has been providing passenger transport services with his motorcycle taxi. This type of vehicle consists of a motorcycle and an attached cabin for carrying people. He drives his customers along the routes between Motupe and the surrounding villages. David wants to use this loan to maintain and repair his motorcycle taxi. He needs to keep his vehicle in good condition so that he can continue providing excellent service to his customers. With the help of this loan, he hopes to increase his income so that he can continue to cover the family expenses. For this reason, he is requesting a loan of 500 PEN from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: To pay for repairs and maintenance of his motorcycle taxi.

loans.name: Saul

texts.en:
Saul M. is from the village of Rizal, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. He is 43 years old and married with two school-aged children. Saul owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector. The main source of business income comes from manufacturing and selling firewood products to local businesses and community members. Saul has been engaged in his business for over three years and earns approximately 1,000 PHP a month.

In 2011, Saul joined Gata Daku Multi-purpose Cooperative (GDMPC) to access financial services to improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Saul is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP that he will use to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products. This is Saul's first loan request to GDMPC.  He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business. 

About Gata Daku Multi-purpose Cooperative (GDMPC):
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products

loans.name: Tem

texts.en:
Tem K., 32, resides in Siem Reap province, Cambodia, an area known for Angkorean temples. K. and her husband produce traditional drums to sell, earning an income of $15 per day. 

Each month, the family has to spend $75 on food and $25 on the other necessary expenses. K. is requesting a loan of $1,200 to purchase materials to produce drums. In the future, she would like to use the additional income to repair her house. This will be her third loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy materials to produce drums

loans.name: Ty

texts.en: Ty P., 43, resides in the Siem Reap province of Cambodia, an area known for Angkorean temples. P. sells vegetables, earning an income of USD 6 per day. Her husband is a construction worker, earning an income of USD 5 per day. Each month, the family has to spend USD 75 on food and USD 25 on other necessary expenses. P. is requesting a loan of USD 1,000 to purchase a machine to produce coconut milk for sale. In the future, she would like to use the additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: To purchase a machine to produce coconut milk for sale

loans.name: Ester

texts.en:
Ester E. is from the village of Bonbon, Sagay, Misamis Oriental. She is 27 years old. Ester is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Ester owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling seafood products including fish such as milk fish and sardines in the local community. Ester has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Ester joined Kiva's partner, HSPFI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Ester has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Ester is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase more fish such as mackerel and sardines for sale. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Ester from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional fish for sale

loans.name: Maria Esther

texts.es:
María tiene 22 años de edad y es casada sin hijos. Vive en la zona rural del distrito de Morrope, un distrito poblado por gente humilde y trabajadora que se dedica a la agricultura. Se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Lambayeque, a más de cuarenta minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo. Su comunidad es pequeña con un aproximado de 200 familias.

Gana su vida brindando el servicio de costura. Realiza esta actividad desde hace un ano en su domicilio. Aprendió esta actividad de su madre, es decir conoce a la perfección el rubro. Cuentan con clientela ya establecida en la zona porque ella es la principal costurera en su caserío.  Desea invertir su préstamo en la compra de una maquina industrial recta de mano segunda, la cual le permitirá brindar el servicio de costura con mayor rapidez. Así podrá aumentar el número de sus pedidos y por ende sus ingresos. Para lograr su meta, ha creído conveniente solicitar un crédito de 800 nuevos soles a Edpyme Alternativa.
texts.en:
María is 22 years old, married, and does not have children. She lives in the rural section of the District of Morrope. The residents of this area are humble and hardworking people who engage in agriculture. This community is located in Lambayeque Province, which is more than forty minutes away from the city of Chiclayo. There are approximately 200 families that live there.

María earns a living by providing sewing services. She started this business a year ago in her home. María learned this trade from her mother who is known for perfecting her skills. She has an established customer base in the area because she is the main seamstress in her village.

María wants to invest in the purchase of a used industrial upright machine so that she can provide her services more quickly. As a result, she will be able to accept more orders and increase her income. To accomplish her goal, she is requesting a loan of 800 PEN from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: To purchase an industrial sewing machine for her business.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth M. is from the village of Yumbing, Mahinog, Camiguin Province. She is 44 years old. Ruth is married and has 3 adult-aged children. To make a living, Ruth owns and operates a business venture in the food sector operating a mini-restaurant. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from serving a variety of different meals like afritada, caldereta, bulalo and humba to customers in the local community. Ruth has been engaged in her business for over 8 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Ruth joined Kiva's partner, HSPFI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Ruth has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase food and drinks for the restaurant. Ruth is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional raw ingredients like meat, vegetables and spices. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Ruth from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional raw ingredients like meat, vegetables and spices for her restaurant

loans.name: Nam

texts.en: Nam C., 47, resides in the Siem Reap province of Cambodia, an area known for Angkorean temples. C. produces traditional baskets, earning an income of USD 1.5 per day. Her husband is a security guard, earning an income of USD 3 per day. Each month, the family has to spend USD 40 on food and USD 25 on other necessary expenses. C. is requesting a loan of USD 1,000 to purchase a new motorbike for her husband to commute to work. In the future, she would like to use the additional income to repair her house. This will be her second loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: To buy a new motorbike for her husband to commute to work

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria M. is from the village of Dinas, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. She is 57 years old, widowed and has one adult-aged child.  Gloria owns and operates an agricultural business venture, in which she raises crops. The main source of income for her business comes primarily from planting and harvesting a variety of vegetables for sale. Gloria has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month.

In 2007, Gloria joined Gata Daku Multi-purpose Cooperative (GDMPC) to access financial services to improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gloria has successfully repaid GDMPC a previous 10,000 PHP loan. Gloria is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP that she will use to purchase addtional seddlings and fertilizer, such as manure.
