This loan will be the Gloria's seventh from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand the her business. 

About Gata Daku Multi-purpose Cooperative (GDMPC):

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase addtional seedlings and fertilizer

loans.name: Yuk

texts.en:
Yuk S., 28, resides in Siem Reap province, Cambodia, an area known for Angkorean temples. 

S. is a massager, earning an income of $4 per day. Each month, the family has to spend $60 on food and $25 on the other necessary expenses. 

S. is requesting a loan of $800 to purchase a new motorbike to commute to work. In the future, she would like to use the additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike to commute to work

loans.name: My

texts.en:
Mr. My T. and his wife, Mrs. Eun Y, live on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. They have three children, one son and two daughters. Two children are married and live outside the family home and the third has full-time employment.  

My and his wife used to be weavers. However, they stopped their weaving business. My now sells finished silk and cotton fabrics. He buys them from his fellow villagers for resale in other provinces that are far from his house. His wife sells Khmer noodle and Num Banh Chok in her village. Khmer noodles are considered the national dish of Cambodia, served with a green curry soup and banana flowers, bean sprouts, water lily stalks and cucumber. 

My is requesting a loan of $500 to supplement his funds to purchase a motorcycle for his daughter to get to work.

loans.use: To supplement his funds to purchase a motorcycle for his daughter to get to work.

loans.name: Jovita

texts.en:
Jovita G. is from the village of Tagulalo, Aurora Zamboanga Del sur. She is 60 years old. Jovita is married and has 3 adult children. To make a living, Jovita owns & operates a business selling flower plants in the local community. Jovita has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 200, Jovita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jovita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Jovita is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new pots and a variety of flowers for sale. This loan will be the seventh loan taken out by Jovita from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new pots, variety of flowers for sale

loans.name: Flordelez

texts.en: Flordelez A.'s main source of income comes from providing pedicure and manicure services to local community members. She is 43 years old, separated from her spouse and has three grown-up children. She is from the village of Tayong, Sagay, Camiguin Province. Flordelez has been in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 6,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2010, Flordelez joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Flordelez has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from HSPFI which was used to purchase materials needed to provide her service. Flordelez is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase supplies like nail polish and cuticle remover. This will be her second loan from HSPFI. She plans to use additional income to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase supplies needed for her service like nail polish and cuticle remover.

loans.name: Jivon

texts.en:
Mr. Jivon S. and his wife, Mrs. Souvpon Keov, live along National Road No. 1 approximately 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have six sons. One is married, three are garment factory workers and the other two have full-time employment.  In the past, the couple used to be farmers but they stopped the farming business. Now, Jivon is a security guard and his wife stays at home. 

Jivon is asking for his second loan of $1,200 to purchase additional materials for his daughter-in-law’s beauty salon.
Wife's name as previous borrower - http://partners.kiva.org/lend/151239

loans.use: to purchase additional materials for his daughter-in-law’s beauty salon.

loans.name: Sok

texts.en:
Sok H., 30, resides in Siem Reap province, Cambodia, an area known for Angkorean temples. H. provides security services for motorbikes and bicycles at a market, earning an income of $5 per day. Each month, the family has to spend $70 on food and $25 on the other necessary expenses. 

H. is requesting a loan of $1,200 to purchase a new motorbike to transport clothes to sell in the villages. In the future, he would like to use the additional income to repair his house. This will be his first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike

loans.name: Imee

texts.en:
Imee B. is from the village of Taguanao, Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She is 29 years old. Imee is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Imee owns & operates a business offering tricycle transport services. Imee has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 1,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2005, Imee joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Imee has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9,000 PHP from GDMPC.  Imee is requesting a new loan of 9000 PHP, which will be used to purchase tires and other accessories. This loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Imee from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase tires and other accessories

loans.name: Baygalmaa

texts.en: Baygalmaa, 43, is widowed and lives with her four children in Uvs province of Mongolia. Her eldest son attends a college while her two younger sons go to a local school. She makes deels (traditional Mongolian long coats) and a variety of other clothes by custom order. Her monthly net income is about 100,000 MNT depending on her orders. She is planning to operate a retail trading business in addition to her clothes making business. She is a hardworking and sociable person who says," I work hard in order to save money for my children's future education." She is requesting a loan of 300,000 MNT to purchase textiles and cloth for her business.

loans.use: To purchase textiles and cloth.

loans.name: Leat

texts.en:
Mrs. Leat M., 38, is a widow with two daughters. One attends school and the other is employed full-time. The family lives along National Road Number One, about 35 kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Leat sells clothes. She buys them from Phnom Penh’s market and resells them in her local market. She is applying for her first loan of $600 to create a concrete path leading to her house.

loans.use: To create a concrete path leading to her house

loans.name: Virgie

texts.en:
Virgie E., from the village of Macabayao, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental, is 34 years old, married, and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Virgie owns and operates a business venture raising pigs for sale. Engaged in her business for over three years, she earns approximately 1,500 PHP a month.

Virgie joined GDMPC In 2009 to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid her previous loan of 6,000 PHP from GDMPC, she is now requesting her fourth loan for 5000 PHP to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. Virgie plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership consists mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Reang

texts.en:
Mrs. Reang K., 50, is a widow with three children – two sons and one daughter. One of her children is a garment factory worker, one is in university and the other is in high school. The family lives in a suburb about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh.
Reang has been operating a business renting a part of her house to garment factory workers because her house is located near a garment factory. She is asking for her first loan of $1,200 to pay school fees and buy a computer laptop for her son who is in university.

loans.use: to pay school fees and buy a laptop for her son

loans.name: Mavy

texts.en:

To make a living, Mavy owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising cows for sale. Mavy has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 1,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2011, Mavy joined Kiva partner, GDMPC, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This loan will be her first from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

loans.name: Crisanta

texts.en:

She is from the village of Katipunan, a part of the municipality of Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental province on the Mindanao islands. Crisanta is a farmer who plants and harvests a variety of vegetables for sale. Crisanta has been in business for over three years and earns approximately 1,000 PHP a month.

In 2007, Crisanta joined GDMPC to gain access to its financial services. She successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. Crisanta is requesting a new loan, her second from GDMPC, of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fishers and small entrepreneurs.

loans.name: Horn

texts.en:
Mrs. Horn S. is a widow with three sons and three daughters (in the photo Horn is on the right, and her daughter is on the left). One is married, one is a construction worker, two are garment factory workers and two are employed full-time. The family lives along National Road Number One about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Horn stays at home. Her main source of income is from her children’s salaries. She is asking for a loan of $1,000 to repair her kitchen and fill up the land around her house.

loans.use: To repair her kitchen and fill up the land around her house

loans.name: Maria Hernestina

texts.es:
María tiene 49 años de edad. Es soltera y tiene 3 hijos. Vive en casa propia en la zona rural del distrito de Reque, una zona ubicada a veinte minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo. Su comunidad es pequeña con un promedio de 30 familias. Actualmente, no cuenta con energía eléctrica ni agua potable.

Desde hace 15 años, se dedica a la agricultura. Cuenta con un terreno propio donde cosecha tomate y camote. También, se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales como cuyas y cerdos. Cuando estos ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo los ofrece en venta a los negociantes que suelen visitar la zona en donde reside. Es muy conocida en su zona y cuenta con una clientela ya establecida. Aprendió estas actividades de sus padres, es decir conoce a la perfección el rubro. Desea invertir su crédito en la compra de más insumos y abono para el mantenimiento de su siembra de tomate y camote. Por ello, ha creído un préstamo de 1500 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
María is 49 years old, single, and has three children. She lives in her own home in the rural section of the District of Reque, a farming area that is located twenty minutes away from the city of Chiclayo. This small community has an average of 30 families. At the moment, she does not receive electricity or potable water.

María has been farming for fifteen years. She has her own land on which she grows tomatoes and sweet potatoes. In addition, she raises and sells animals such as guinea pigs and swine. When the animals have reached the proper level of development, she offers them for sale to the merchants who visit the area where she lives. María is well-known in her area and has an established customer base. She learned these farming activities from her parents, who are known for being perfectionists in this trade.

María wants to invest in the purchase of more supplies and compost for maintaining her tomato and sweet potato crops. For this reason, she is requesting a loan in the amount of 1500 PEN.

loans.use: To purchase farming supplies to maintain her tomato and sweet potato crops.

loans.name: Heoung

texts.en: Heoung S., 23, lives in Siem Reap province, Cambodia – an area known for Angkorean temples. S. is a massager, earning $8 US per day. Her husband is employed with a Korean company, earning $4 US per day. Each month, the family has to spend $40 US on food and $25 US on other expenses. S. is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase a new motorbike for her husband to commute to work. In the future, she would like to use additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for her husband to commute to work.

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
Elma C. is 35 years old, married and has three school-aged children. She is from the village of Corrales, a part of the municipality of Jimenez, Misamis Occidental province on the Mindanao islands. Elma runs a general store from which she sells both food and daily use products to the local community. Elma is just starting this business.

In 2011, Elma joined GDMPC to gain access to its financial services. She is requesting a loan, her first from GDMPC, of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase rice and corn grits to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand her business.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fishers and small entrepreneurs.

Earlier this year, Rolando joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services. He hoped to help improve his living situation and increase his ability to engage in business activities. Rolando is requesting his first loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase tires and other accessories. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business.

loans.name: Mao

texts.en: Mao S., 31, lives in Siem Reap province, Cambodia – an area known for Angkorean temples. S. sells vegetables, earning $7 US per day. Her husband sells wooden furniture, earning $5 US per day. Each month, the family has to spend $60 US on food and $25 US on other expenses. S. is requesting a loan of $1000 US to purchase more vegetables to resell. In the future, she would like to use additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.name: Jimmy

He is 34 years old, married and has five school-aged children. They are from the village of Tagdo, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. Jimmy has been in his business for over two years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2010, Jimmy joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living conditions and enable him to engage in business activities. Jimmy has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from HSPFI which was used to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. Jimmy is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional canned goods, snack foods and beverages. This will be his second loan from HSPFI. He plans to use additional income to improve and expand his business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. loans.name: Chanthorn

texts.en:
Mrs. Chanthorn S. is a garment factory worker. Her husband, Mr. Vutha Chot, is employed as a truck driver. They have been married since 1993 and have three sons. Two attend school and the youngest is not yet of school age. The family lives approximately 20 kilometers south of Phnom Penh.

She is requesting a loan in the amount of $500 so as to purchase a motorcycle for the family to use for commuting.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle for the family to use for commuting

loans.name: Gyan Devi

texts.en:
This is 29-year-old Gyan Devi M.. She is married and has three children, aged 12, 5 and 3. In 2000, she established her business of making brass religious statues. Working seven days a week and eight hours a day, she supports her family.  

She has already received and successfully repaid five loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent to buy raw materials for her business.  

In the future, Gyan Devi plans to uplift the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support. 

Nepal has a long and rich history of traditional handicrafts. Throughout the Kathmandu Valley, skilled artisans produce unique pieces of art that reflect Nepal's cultural diversity. Terracotta pottery comes from the red clay of the surrounding Himalayan foothills. Bronze and silver statuettes are formed using wax molds and intricate hand tool finishing.  

In Patan, Newari culture and traditions are reflected in the images and symbols etched into metal or formed in stone. With the help of a Kiva loan, Nepal's artisans are able to purchase raw materials in greater volume. This increase in volume allows a single artisan to work on several pieces at the same time while increasing her profit margin.  

This loan was administered by Kiva's local partner MFI (microfinance institution), Patan Business and Professional Women. Patan BPW became Kiva's first field partner in Nepal in 2007.  Patan BPW operates throughout the Kathmandu Valley, offering microcredit and business-training programs to low-income women.  

In addition to providing economic opportunity to their clients, Patan BPW seeks to empower Nepali women within the home and community.  For more information about Patan BPW, visit our partner page and keep an eye out for new loans and borrower updates.

BPW Partner Page: http://www.kiva.org/partners/62

Join our lending team: http://www.kiva.org/team/bpw_patan_nepal

loans.use: to buys raw materials for her business

loans.name: Nim

texts.en:
Mrs. Nim D. Nim sells vegetables at KoKi market, approximately three kilometers from her house. Her husband, Mr. Davy Srey, offers firewood-cutting services to his fellow villagers. 

The couple has two sons and six daughters. Two of the children are married and live outside the family home, one is a garment factory worker, one is a driver, three attend school, and one assists her mother in the business. The family lives in a village along National Road Number one, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.  

Mrs. Nim D. Nim is requesting her second loan of $1,200 in order to purchase neighboring plots of land to expand the family property.

loans.use: to purchase neighboring plots of land to expand the family property

loans.name: Tari

texts.en: This is 47-year-old Tari M.. She is married and has three children, ages 30, 22 and 15. In 2000, she established her tailoring business. Working 7 days a week and 8 hours a day, she supports her family. She has already received and successfully repaid six loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent loan to buy raw materials for her business. In the future, Tari plans to improve the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support. In the Kathmandu Valley, clothing is made to order. Tailor stalls line the streets where store owners sell material and work their sewing machines. These skilled tailors make school uniforms for children as well as the traditional women's kurta surwal and men's daura surwal. With a Kiva loan, BPW borrowers are able to purchase additional cloth material or sewing machines that will increase production and profitability. This loan is administered by Kiva's local partner MFI, Patan Business and Professional Women. Patan BPW became Kiva's first field partner in Nepal in 2007. Patan BPW operates throughout the Kathmandu Valley, offering microcredit and business training programs to low-income women. In addition to providing economic opportunity to their clients, Patan BPW seeks to empower Nepali women within the home and community. For more information about Patan BPW, visit our partner page and keep an eye out for new loans and borrower updates: BPW Partner Page. Join our lending team: BPW Lending Team.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for her work.

loans.name: Soy

Soy is asking for a loan of $350 to add to his own money to purchase a motorbike for his daughter to use to get to work.

texts.en:

"Kuyteav" is Khmer sounds meaning "the noodle with soup".
