loans.name: Enkhtuya

texts.en:
Enkhtuya is 42 years old and lives with her husband and two children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. They all live together in a small wooden house on their own plot of land. Her two children attend a university and her husband, Batkhuyag, has a family car that he uses for transporting people to Tuv province two or three times a month. 

Enkhtya operates a variety store in her own kiosk. She has been running this business for the last ten years. In Mongolia, a variety store is basically a small convenience store which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages, sold piecemeal to the local residents. Her store is in a good location, located near a bus station and close to all amenities. She is planning to expand her business into a supermarket in the future, and to provide a proper education for her children. 

She built a house on her land using her family's financial help, and now she needs to pay them back. Therefore she is asking for a loan to increase her working capital so as to buy more products and increase her inventory.

loans.use: to buy more products and increase her inventory.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina L. is from the village of Sorosoro, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 40 years old. Cristina is married and has six school-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling canned goods, snack foods, detergents, shampoo, soap and candies in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately $125 a month for these activities.

In 2010, Cristina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. 

Cristina is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional canned goods, detergents and instant noodles. This will be her 2nd loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional canned goods, detergents and instant noodles

loans.name: Theara

texts.en:
Mrs. Theara S. (in the photo with her loom) and her husband, Mr. Sovan Norn, live on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. They have one son and two daughters. Two are in school and the other one is still young.  

Theara is a weaver, while her husband is fisherman and farmer. She is requesting a loan of $300 to purchase weaving materials for continuing her business.

loans.use: To purchase weaving materials for her weaving business.

loans.name: Chhin

texts.en:
Mrs. Chhin M. (in the photo with her loom) is a widow with six children--two sons and four daughters. Four are married and live outside the family home; one has full-time employment and another one stays at home. They are living on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.  

Chhin is a weaver. She is requesting her first loan of $200 to purchase weaving materials (cotton thread) for her business.

loans.use: To purchase weaving materials for her weaving business.

loans.name: Chanda

texts.en:
Chanda A. is from the village of Maranding, Sagay, Camiguin Province. She is 35 years old. Chanda is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, she provides recycling services, buying and selling junk and other waste materials like plastics and bottles for local businesses and community members. She has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately $150 a month for these activities.

In 2010, Chanda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional scrap metal to sell.

Chanda is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional plastics and other recyclables to sell. This will be her 2nd loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional plastics and other recyclables to sell

loans.name: Maricyle

texts.en:
Maricyle G. is from the village of Cabuan, Guinsiliban, Camiguin Province. She is 24 years old. Maricyle is single and has one infant-aged child. To make a living, she buys and sells coconuts for copras (dried coconut used for making coconut oil) in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately $250 a month for these activities.

In 2010, Maricyle joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. 

Maricyle is requesting a new loan of 4,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional coconuts to sell. This will be her 3rd loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional coconuts to sell

loans.name: Luciano

texts.en:
Luciano N. Jr. is from the village of Lintugop, Aurora Zamboanga Del Sur. He is 37 years old. Luciano is single and has one infant child. To make a living, Luciano owns & operates a manufacturing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from manufacturing & selling Nipa (palm frond) products to local businesses and community members. Luciano has been engaged in his business for over two years and earns approximately 1,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Luciano joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Luciano is requesting a loan of 3000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products. This will be the first loan taken out by Luciano from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches  covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional "Nipa" products.

loans.name: Edgar

texts.en:
Edgar S. is from the village of Lintugop, Aurora Zamboanga Del Sur. He is 47 years old. Edgar is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Edgar owns & operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling bamboo mats & mattresses to tourists and local community members. Edgar has been engaged in his business for over five years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Edgar joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Edgar is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw materials like bamboo. This will be the first loan taken out by Edgar from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in raw materials like bamboo.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence U. is from the village of Kilon-ac, Sagay, Camiguin Province. She is 36 years old. Florence is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, she makes and sells snacks and other delicacies, like banana and sweet potato (or camote) cues, in the local community. She also sells snack foods. Florence has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately $125 a month for these activities.

In 2010, Florence joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. 

Florence is requesting a new loan of 4,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients like sweet bananas, sugars and barbecue sticks. This will be her 2nd loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients like sweet bananas, sugars and barbecue sticks

loans.name: Bolormaa

texts.en:
Bolormaa is 30 years old and lives with her husband and two children, aged 10 and 2, in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her family lives in a small house in her sister-in-law’s yard. Her son goes to primary school while her daughter attends kindergarten. 

Bolormaa supports her family by operating a retail clothing stall at a local store with help from her husband. When she first began her business in 2007, she had 2,000,000 MNT in working capital. Today her business has grown so that her working capital is now 5,000,000 MNT and she sells many kinds of clothes. 

She wants to expand her business with this loan during this very busy shopping season. She is requesting a loan of 1,000,000 MNT to purchase suits from Beijing, the capital city of China. Her family wants to improve the business so as to be able buy their own yard.

loans.use: to purchase suits from Beijing to resell

loans.name: Mourn

texts.en:
Mr. Mourn N. and his wife, Mrs. Yin Tiev (pictured together) are fruit sellers. They buy fruit from their fellow villagers on contract before harvesting. When the harvesting season comes they take the fruits to sell to a middleman who comes to buy at their house. The couple asked for a Kiva loan once, they now are requesting another loan of $1,200 to purchase additional fruits under contract for resale. 

The family lives along National Road Number One about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

loans.use: to purchase fruits under contract for resale

loans.name: Byambatsogt

texts.en:
Byambatsogt, age 40, lives with his wife and 11-year-old daughter in his friend’s small house, in the ger district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. His wife, Amartsetseg, helps him run the business, and his daughter attends a local public school. 
  
Byambatsogt supports his family by operating a glasses and phone accessories retail stall at Bayangol market, one of the Mongolia's biggest markets. When he first began his business in 2006, he had 1,000,000 MNT in working capital. Now he has a working capital of 3,000,000 MNT and is willing to increase it in the future. He bought a used car with his business earnings in 2010. 
  
He has been successfully expanding his business and was able to improve his living conditions gradually.  He said, "I want to grow my business with this loan. I would like to be able to buy my own house and yard in the future." In order to increase his glasses and phone accessories variety for his customers, Byambatsogt is requesting a 2,400,000 MNT loan.

loans.use: To purchase more glasses and phone accessories

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma L. is from the village of Poblacion, Mahinog, Camiguin Province. She is 38 years old. Gemma is separated from her spouse and has five school-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling canned goods, snack foods, shampoo, soap and biscuits in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately $125 a month for these activities.

In 2010, Gemma joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. 

Gemma is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional canned goods, snack foods and beverages. This will be her 2nd loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional canned goods, snack foods and beverages

loans.name: Celso

texts.en:
Celso G. is from the village of Poblacion, Mahinog, Camiguin Province. He is 46 years old and single. To make a living, he owns and operates a service-based business, providing hairdressing and beauty services in his beauty parlor to local community members. He has been engaged in his business for over twenty-seven years and earns approximately $250 a month for these activities.

In 2010, Celso joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase tools needed to provide service. 

Celso is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase items needed to expand his services, like hair solutions. This will be his 2nd loan from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase items needed to expand his services, like hair solutions

loans.name: Leap

texts.en:
Mrs. Leap L. (pictured) and her husband, Mr. Voek Bun, live along the Tonle Basac River, a tributary of the nearby Mekong River, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. They have been married since 1992 and have three children--one son and two daughters. 

Leap is hired by her villagers to farm. Her husband is a construction worker. She is asking for a loan of $1,200 to build a concrete brick room under her wooden house.

loans.use: to build a concrete brick room under her wooden house

loans.name: Chhon

texts.en:
Mrs. Chhon B. (pictured), 44, is a widow with four sons. One is married and other works for a plywood factory. They are living along National Road Number One, about 35 kilometers from Phnom Penh. 

Chhon works in the plywood factory along with her sons. She is asking for her first loan in the amount of $600 to repair the house where she lives.

loans.use: to repair the house where she lives

loans.name: Sokha

texts.en:
Mr. Sokha S. (pictured) is 32 years old and his wife, Mrs. Em Van, is 31 years old. They live in a suburb of Phnom Penh. They have been married since 2003 and have two daughters. One attends school and the other is still young.    

Sokhon sells pigs; he buys them from his village and the nearby villages and resells to a slaughter house. His wife is garment factory worker. He is requesting his first loan of $1,200 to purchase more pigs to resell.

loans.use: to purchase additional pigs for resale.

loans.name: Phalla

texts.en:
Mrs. Phalla S. (pictured) and her husband, Mr. Vin Reach, live on an island on the Mekong River, about 12 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They have three children--one son and two daughters. One is married, one has full-time employment, and the other one is in school. 

Mrs. Phalla S. runs a grocery store in front of her house and supplements her income with a new business selling clothes. Her husband is a motor taxi driver. She is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase a motorbike for her daughter to get to work.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for her daughter to get to work

loans.name: Sreyny

texts.en:
Mrs. Sreyny L. (in the photo) is 38, and her husband, Mr. Phaly Sin, is 39. They live on an island in the Mekong River, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 1991 and have four children--two sons and two daughters. Three are in school and another one stays at home. 
 
Sreyny is a fish seller; she buys fish from the market at the other side of Mekong River and resells in her village. Her husband is a wooden house builder. She is asking for her first loan of $1,000 to purchase additional construction materials for her husband’s construction business.

loans.use: to purchase additional construction materials for her husband’s construction business

loans.name: Karimjon

texts.ru: Мирзоев Каримчон проживает в городе Душанбе. Ему 34 года. Женат. Имеет двоих детей. Живет вместе с родителями. Жена, домохозяйка. Сам Каримчон предоставляет услугу. У него имеется столовая, где он работает поваром. В этой области более 5 лет. Кредит берет для открытия новой столовой, то есть для приобретения мебели и посуды. Он хочет расширить свою деятельность.
texts.en: Karimjon M. lives in the city of Dushanbe. He is 34 years old. He is married and has two children, they live together with them. His wife is a homemaker. Karimjon provides services, he has a cafe where he works as a chef. He has been in this business for more than five years. He is taking out the loan to open a new cafe to purchase furniture and tableware. He wants to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy furniture and tableware

loans.name: Chea

texts.en:
Mr. Chea P. (pictured above) and his wife, Mrs. Mala Chuong, live in a suburb of Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 1996 and have four  children – one son and three daughters. 
Mr. Chea P. is a motor taxi driver, while his wife is a garment factory worker. In addition, they rent out part of their house to garment factory workers because their house is located near the factory. Chea has received a Kiva loan once before, and is now requesting another loan of $500 to build more rooms to rent.

loans.use: to build more rooms to rent

loans.name: Samit

texts.en:
Mr. Samit O., 39 years old, and his wife, Mrs. Srun Lonh, 40 years old, live in a village about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have three sons and one daughter; one is a garment factory worker, two are in school and another one is still young.

Samit is a motor taxi driver, while his wife sells num onsorm, a kind of Cambodian cake which is made of rice and coconut with soybean and pork in the middle. She buys her ingredients from the market about three kilometers away, makes num onsorm on her own and then sells it in front of the garment factory. In addition, the couple also rents out a space in their house to garment factory workers because their house is located near the factory.

Samit is in the process of building more rooms to rent, but he does not have enough money to pay for the building fees. For this reason, he is asking for a loan of 1,100 USD.

loans.use: To pay for his building fees

loans.name: Hafez

texts.en:
Hafez is a 28-year-old married man and the father of two children. He lives and works in Baalback. Hafez used to transport people to and from their homes or work. Since 2000 he had also taken tourists all over Lebanon.

Hafez wanted to settle down, so he thought of starting a new business which could help provide his family with a good income that would lead to a secure and healthy life. Hafez chose to open a car wash and maintenance garage specializing in oil changes.

Hafez has requested a loan from Al Majmoua to assist in establishing his new business. This will be Hafez's third cycle as an Al Majmoua borrower, as he has proven to be a man with a good repayment history. All of his previous loans have positively affected his social and economic life.

loans.use: To start a new business

loans.name: Ra'nogul

texts.ru: Рахимова Раъногул жительница города Курган-Тюбе. Ей 39 лет. Она замужем, имеет 7 детей. Дети учатся в средней школе. Муж находится в России. Сама Раъногул занимается торговлей на рынке. Она арендует торговую точку, где продает женские аксессуары, косметику и детские игрушки. Этим видом деятельности она занимается уже 5 лет. Кредит берет для покупки парфюмерии и вещей для домашнего хозяйства.
texts.en: Ra'nogul R. lives in the town of Qurgan-tube. She is 39 years old. She is married and has seven children. Her children all go to secondary school now. Her husband is in Russia and Ra'nogul sells on the market. She rents out a vendor space where she sells accessories for women, cosmetics and children toys. She has been in this business for five years. She is taking out the loan to buy perfumes and household items.

loans.use: to buy perfumes and household items

loans.name: Peterson

texts.en:
Peterson is a hardworking married man living in a rented house in Fort Portal, Uganda, with a dream of building his own residential house in the next five years.

For five years, Peterson has been riding a motorcycle and this has facilitated him in maintaining his family welfare. His major challenge is high fuel  prices that results in low income and his plan is to own at least three motorcycles. Peterson wants the loan to buy a motorcycle.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle for transport business.

loans.name: Vicent

texts.en:
Vicent is an agriculturalist living in Kyenjojo, Uganda, and he has been farming for ten years now.

He has been able to educate his children with the income he generates. His goal is to buy a truck to transport his produce to the city where he can sell at higher prices. 

Vicent would like a loan to buy beans and groundnuts for planting.

loans.use: to buy beans and groundnuts for planting

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a 39-year-old single mother of six children, and she owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. 

She has been dealing in clothes for 20 years. She started with capital of 500,000 shillings and now has 3,000,000 shillings. She has a challenge of limited funds to meet the demands of her customers and her desire is to educate her children and set up a boutique.

She will use the loan to buy clothes to resell.

loans.use: to buy  clothes to resell

loans.name: Ulugbek

texts.ru: Саттаров Улугбек житель района Бохтар. Возраст, 35 лет. Женат. Имеет 2 детей. Жена, домохозяйка. Сам он имеет высшее образование, педагог. По профессии не работает. Он занимается торговлей. У него имеется магазин, где он продает канцелярские товары. Этим видом деятельности занимается 10 лет. Кредит берет для покупки книжек, маркеров, карандашей, ватманов и календарей.
texts.en: Ulugbek S. lives in the region of Bohtar. He is 35 years old, married and has two children. His wife is a homemaker. He has higher education and is a teacher. He does not work in his profession and does sales. He has own store where he sells stationary supplies. He has been in this business for ten years. He is taking out the loan to buy books, markers, pencils, Whatman paper and calendars.

loans.use:
Для покупки книжек, маркеров, карандашей, ватманов и календарей
to buy books, markets, pencils, Whatman paper and calendars

loans.name: Bonefance

texts.en:
Bonefance would like a loan to buy  sugar, rice, soap and bicycle spare parts for resale. 

He is a retailer and has been in business for four years.

Bonefance desires to educate his children and improve his family’s standard of living.

He has challenges in restocking his shop due to limited funds. 

His dream is to become a wholesale trader.

loans.use: to buy sugar, rice, soap and bicycle spare parts for resale

loans.name: Annet

texts.en:
Annet is a 33-year-old single mother of two children. She owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. 

She has been dealing in textiles and tailoring for seven years. She started with a capital of 600,000 shillings and now has 5,000,000 shillings. 

Her hardship is bad debtors. 

Her vision is to diversify and start selling shoes. Annet intends to use the loan to buy clothes for resale.

loans.use: to buy  clothes to resell

loans.name: Erisa

texts.en:
Erisa is a 50-year-old married man with eight children. He owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. 

He has been in a retail shop for five years. He started with a capital of 600,000 shillings and now has 2,000,000 shillings. 

His hardships include debtors, price fluctuation and high transport costs.

His vision is to own a large retail shop and to educate children.

Erisa would like to buy rice, salt, cooking oil and sugar for resale.

loans.use: to buy rice, salt, cooking oil and sugar for sale

loans.name: Jimmy

texts.en:
Jimmy is 30 years old and single with three children. He has no other dependents and lives in a rented home in Hioma, Uganda. 

He is solely charged with the responsibility of looking after his family and his goal is to educate his children up to university. 

He has a textile business and has been running it for four years, Jimmy is a policeman and started his business from his salary savings. He faces a challenge of seasonality. 

In the future, he hopes his business will grow and become self sustaining with no debts. 

Jimmy needs the loan to buy clothes.

loans.use: to pay for clothes

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en:
Jackson is 41 years old, married and the father of five children, aged 13 to 3 years. He has one other dependent and lives in Hioma, Uganda.  

He longs to educate his children to attain a degree as a minimum qualification, and the responsibility rests on him alone.

For 10 years he has been running a carpentry shop, and the business has been very lucrative. 

He faces a challenge of irregular power supply, which hinders his activities. In the future, he wants to have a big carpentry shop with a showroom.

Jackson needs the loan to buy timber, cushion covers and mattresses to use in the workshop.

loans.use: to pay for timber, cushion covers and mattresses to use in the workshop

loans.name: Dilafruz

texts.ru: Амонова Дилафруз проживает в городе Куляб. Возраст, 37 лет. Разведена. Детей не имеет. Живет вместе родителями. Отец и мать пенсионеры. Она одна работает и обеспечивает своих родителей. Работает поваром в столовой рядом с нашей организацией. Она в основном готовит плов. В этой области 4 года. Целью кредита является покупка больших тарелок и ложек для плова.
texts.en: Dilafruz A. lives in the Kulyab region. She is 37 years old, divorced and does not have children. She lives together with parents. Her mother and father are retired. She is the only one who works and supports her parents. She works as a chef in a cafe which is located next to our offices. She makes mainly plov (pilaf). She has been in this business for four years. The purpose of the loan is to purchase large plates and spoons for pilaf.

loans.use: to buy large plates and spoons

loans.name: Kaka

texts.en:
Kaka Kavundu is 37 years old, married, and a mother of two children. She runs a tailoring shop, which has been in operation for the past two years.  She earns  approximately 9,000 KES a month. 

She was introduced to KADET LTD by a friend and she is requesting for her first loan from KADET LTD  which she intends to use the entire loan a mount to buy textiles, frails, and buttons. 


She hopes to expand her business and create employment. She also hopes to improve the standard of living of her family.

loans.use: To purchase textiles, frails, and buttons

loans.name: Kochkorbay

texts.en:
Kochkorbay K. is a 64 year-old pensioner who has a cattle breeding business. He started it in 1990 with the initial capital of 10,000 Kyrgyzstani soms (KGS) which was spent to purchase milk cows. 

Today his farm allows Kochkorbay to earn 15,000 KGS in the period of two months. Unfortunately, last year he had to sell several cows because of hard economic conditions and now he plans to develop his farm with more cattle. For this reason, Kochkorbay has applied for a loan of 100,000 KGS to purchase cows and calves. With the revenues he plans to further broaden his business.

Kochkorbay is a very good-natured and responsible person who makes every effort to provide his family with a prosperous future. 

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading microfinance institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Sostene

texts.en:
Sostene is 28 years old and married. He has no other dependents. He lives with his wife,  who is a teacher, in a rented home in Hioma, Uganda.

His family goal is to build his own residential house. 

Sostene works in a bank as a teller, but he has also started a clothing business and it's still at the initial stages with prospects of breaking even.

Sostene wants the loan to buy clothes for resale.

loans.use: to buy clothes for resale

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 60 years old and married with six children. One child is in school. Teresita works very hard to provide for them.

Teresita runs a ready to wear (RTW) clothing business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock of RTW.

Teresita has been in this business for eight years and sells a variety of items such as t-shirts, blouses, shorts, pants, and underwear. Teresita also earns income from a junk shop.

In the future, Teresita would like to repair her house.

loans.use: to purchase more Ready to Wear clothing to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for weaves and a hair drier for her salon

loans.name: Rotchie

texts.en:
Rotchie works hard to support three children. Rotchie is married and has a motorcycle business in the Philippines.

Rotchie requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to maintain her motorcycle and to buy spare parts.

Rotchie has been in this business for seven years. In the future, Rotchie would like to purchase a new motorcycle.

loans.use: to maintain her motorcycle and buy spare parts

loans.name: Arlin

texts.en:
Arlin is 39 years old and married with five children. Two of the children are in school.  Arlin works very hard to provide for them.

Arlin runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell 

Arlin has been in this business for six years. Arlin also earns income from pig fattening.

In the future, Arlin would like to send her kids to school.

loans.use: to pay for stock for her general store

loans.name: Somos Impacto 2006 Group

texts.es: L. Sra. Margarita tiene 51 años D. edad es conviviente, y tiene 5 hijos, Margarita es integrante D. L. Alcancía Comunal "Somos Impacto 2006", Margarita trabaja desD. hace 20 años en L. confección y venta D. carteras D. tejido, este trabajo surge a raíz D. que sus hijos empezaron a estudiar y elL. deseaba darles lo mejor, es así que consiguió mayores ingresos trabajando día día sin descansar , se compro maquinas D. tejido y hoy en día cuenta con tres maquinas propias, a su vez a construido su casa. Margarita a solicitado un nuevo préstamo para darle mantenimiento a sus maquinas D. tejer, sabemos que margarita cumplirá sus metas con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación y que los prestamos D. D. EDAPROSPO le ayudaran.
texts.en:
Margarita, 51, has a life partner and five children.  She is a member of the “Somos Impacto 2006” (We Are Impact 2006) communal bank.  She has worked for over 20 years making knit purses for sale.  This work arose when her children started school and she wanted to proviD. the best for them so she earned higher income working day to day nonstop.  She bought knitting machines and today owns three; she also built her house.

Margarita is asking for a new loan to proviD. maintenance to her knitting machines.  We know that Margarita will meet her goals with much effort and dedication and that the EDPROSPO loans will help her.

loans.use: to provide maintenance to her knitting machines.

loans.name: Phiona

texts.en:
Phiona N. is 21 years old and lives in the town of Nasana in the Kampala central region of Uganda.  She is married and has one child.  Her child is currently in school.  Phiona has a business selling clothes, which she has had for three years.  She also has a second, small retail shop  business.

To help expand her business, Phiona has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase more clothes for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Phiona hopes to generate greater profits and take care of herself.  

In the future, Phiona hopes to own a plot of land and build a house.   Phiona is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by improving her standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes for resale.

loans.name: Basilisa

texts.en:
Basilisa is 64 years old and married with nine children.

Basilisa works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 19,500 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

Basilisa has borrowed and paid back 15 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for eight years and earns an income from it.

Basilisa aspires to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth K. is 21 years old and lives in the town of Nasana in the Kampala central region of Uganda.  She is married and has two children.  One of her children is currently in school.  Ruth has a salon, which she has had for three years.         

To help expand her business, Ruth has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase hair oil and braids for the hair for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Ruth hopes to generate greater profits and take care of herself.  In the future, Ruth hopes to own a plot of land and build a house. 

Ruth is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by learning how to save money for her future.

loans.use: to purchase hair oil and braids for resale.

loans.name: Fedila

texts.en:
Fedila is 52 years old, married and has two children. 

Fedila is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Fedila requested a PHP 19,500 loan through NWTF tobuy feeds and to purchase an additional pig.

Fedila has been in this business for seven years. In the future, Fedila would like to repair their house and expand her pig fattening business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and purchase an additional pig

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Allen

texts.en:
Allen N. is 18 years old and lives in the town of Nasana in the Kampala central region of Uganda.  She is single and has no children. Allen has a business selling clothes, which she has had for two years.         

To help expand her business, Allen has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase more clothes for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Allen hopes to generate greater profits and take care of herself.  In the future, Allen hopes to own a salon.    

Allen is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by expanding her capital.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes for resale.

loans.name: Virginia's Group

texts.en: Virginia D. G. is from the village of Villa Pascua, Diffun, Quirino. She is 53 years old. Virginia is the group leader of a 12-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Virginia D. G.'s group. Virginia is married and has three adult children. To make a living, Virginia raises pigs for fattening and sale. Virginia has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 3,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2010, Virginia joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Virginia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. Virginia is requesting a new loan of 9,000 PHP, which will also be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This will be the third loan taken out by Virginia from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Zulfiya

texts.ru: Рахимова Зулфия проживает в районе Вахдат. Ей 33 года. Замужем, имеет троих детей. Муж, находится в России на заработках. Сама Зулфия занимается пошивкой женской одежды. То есть она шьет национальные платья. Этим видом деятельности занимается два года. Целью кредита является приобретение новой швейной машинки для вышивки.
texts.en: Zulfia R. lives in the Vahdat region. She is 33 years old, married and has three children. Her husband is now working in Russia. Zulfia sews women's clothing. She makes national Tajik dresses. She has been in this business for two years. The purpose of the loan is to buy a new machine for embroidering.

loans.use: to buy a new machine for embroidering

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en:
Pauline N. is 19 years old and lives in the town of Nasana in the Kampala central region of Uganda.  She is single and has two children.  One of her children is currently in school.  Pauline has a business selling charcoal, which she has had for three years.  She also has a second business selling sugarcane.  

To help expand her business, Pauline has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase more charcoal for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Pauline hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children and buy food.  In the future, Pauline hopes to own a boutique.    

Pauline is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by being able to educate her children and pay the house rent.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Petronila

texts.en:
Petronila is 42 years old and married with three children, all in school. Petronila works very hard to provide for them.

Petronila runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to pay for the purchase of additional stock.

Petronila has been in this business for 25 years and sells a variety of items such as soap, sugar etc. Petronila also earns income from fish vending.

In the future, Petronila would like to send her kids to school.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Bennah

texts.en:
Bennah N. is 19 years old and lives in the town of Nasana in the Kampala central region of Uganda.  She is single and has no children. Bennah has a beauty salon, which she has had for two years.         

To help expand her business, Bennah has requested a loan of 350,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase braids and oil for the hair for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Bennah hopes to generate greater profits and buy food.  In the future, Bennah hopes to own another business like a hardware shop.   

Bennah is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by improving her business.

loans.use: to purchase braids and hair oil for resale.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian G. is currently in the business of selling groundnut paste, which is similar to peanut butter. 

She is 25 years old and married, with three children. Two of them go to school. 

Lilian borrowed a loan to stock more paste to sell. She hopes to buy land with the extra profits from her business in the future.

loans.use: to stock more groundnut paste to sell

loans.name: Solmaz

texts.en:
Solmaz M. is 52 years old. She has a business purchasing and reselling cows and sheep. She has six children, who help in her business. Solmaz would like a loan of 1,500 AZN to purchase additional cows to increase her inventory and meet customer demands. She believes this will lead to greater revenue and ultimately, greater profit for her family.

In the future, Solmaz would like to reinvest the earnings generated by this loan back into her business to purchase more cows and increase her income even further. She plans to use the increased income to save for the purchase of a house.

loans.use: to purchase two calves and six lambs

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine N. is 21 years old and lives in the town of Nasana in the Kampala central region of Uganda.  She is married and has two children.  Both of her children are currently in school.  Josephine has a business selling clothes, which she has had for five years.  She also has a second business selling shoes. 

To help expand her businesses, Josephine has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase more clothes and shoes for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Josephine hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children.  In the future, Josephine hopes to own a permanent shop and stop her mobile-sales (door-to-door) business.  

Josephine is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by making new friends who have played a big role in her life.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes and shoes for resale.

loans.name: Modesto

texts.en:
Modesto is a 52-year-old married man with 10 children, and he owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. 

He has run a retail shop and clothing business for more than a year, having taken money earned from farming to open a shop. His hardship is the seasonal nature pf his business, and his vision is to have a wholesale shop and to educate his children.

Modesto intends to use the credit to buy clothes to sell.

loans.use: To buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Sauda

texts.en:
Sauda N. is 20 years old and lives in the town of Nasana in the Kampala central region of Uganda.  She is married and has three children.  All of her children are currently in school.  Sauda has a poultry firm, which she has had for three years.  She also has a second business, a salon.  

To help expand her business, Sauda has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase more chicken feed for the chickens that she raises and sells.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Sauda hopes to generate greater profits and sometimes buy food and also pay school fees for her children.  

In the future, Sauda hopes to further expand her poultry business. Sauda is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by increasing her capital.

loans.use: to purchase more chicken feed for her chickens.

loans.name: Zainab

texts.en:
Zainab N. is 20 years old and lives in the town of Nasana in the Kampala central region of Uganda.  She is married and has three children.  Two of her children are currently in school.  Zainab has a bar, which she has had for two years.         

To help expand her business, Zainab has requested a loan of 250,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase more sodas, beer, and wine for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Zainab hopes to generate greater profits and take care of herself.  In the future, Zainab hopes to build a house of her own.   

Zainab is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by improving her standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase more sodas, beer, and wine for resale.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina is currently in the business of selling soft drinks. She is 30 years old and married with six children, and all of them go to school. 

Regina borrowed a loan to stock more soft drinks to sell. She hopes to expand with the extra profits earned from her business in the future.

loans.use: to stock more soft drinks to sell

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is 35 years old and married with four children aged between 4 and 15 years. He has a family of seven people and lives in his own home in Hioma, Uganda, with a family goal of educating his children. 

Ali transports passengers and has been in this business for three years. He started by working as a taxi conductor, then saved to buy his own taxi. He faces a challenge of constant vehicle breakdowns and, in the future, he needs to have at least three taxis.

Ali needs the loan to buy tires for his taxi business.

loans.use: to purchase tires

loans.name: Mbuzi Tukorrehamu Group

texts.en:
Richard is a 32-year-old married man living in his own semi-permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda. He is solely charged with the responsibility of looking after his children, and his dream is to construct a permanent residential house.

He has been a carpenter for 10 years and he learned on the job with the help of his father. He has a challenge of customers who fail to pay on time, and his desire is to own a workshop. Richard needs the loan to buy timber for his carpentry work.

loans.use: to purchase timber

loans.name: Hanifah

texts.en:
Hanifah S. is 21 years old and lives in the town of Nasana in the Kampala central region of Uganda.  She is married and has two children. Both of her children are currently in school.  Hanifah has a business selling clothes, which she has had for three years.         

To help expand her business, Hanifah has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase more clothes for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Hanifah hopes to generate greater profits and buy food and sometimes pay school fees for her children.  In the future, Hanifah hopes to own a plot of land.    

Hanifah is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by improving her standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes for resale.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina P. is from the village of Poblacion, Lantapan, Bukidnon. She is 54 years old. Cristina is married and has nine adult children. 

To make a living, Cristina runs a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling canned goods, beverages, powdered juice, shampoo, soap and biscuits. She has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Cristina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Cristina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory for working capital. 

Cristina is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional canned goods, snack foods and biscuits. This will be the second loan taken out by Cristina from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional canned goods, snack foods and biscuits

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth N. is 18 years old and lives in the town of Nasana in the Kampala central of Uganda.  She is married and has one child.  Her child is not currently in school.  Ruth has a business of outside catering, which she has had for one year.         

To help expand her business, Ruth has requested a loan of 250,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase cooking oil and baking flour for making chapattis for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Ruth hopes to generate greater profits and take care of herself.  In the future, Ruth hopes to build a house of her own.

loans.use: to purchase cooking oil and baking flour for making chapattis for resale.

loans.name: Amos

texts.en:
Amos is 38 years old, married and the father of two children. He lives in his own house in Hioma, Uganda. He is charged with the responsibility of looking after his sisters and his own family, and his dream is to educate them.

He has a retail shop and has been operating it for three years amid challenges of high rental fees and taxes. 

Amos started as a builder, then saved to start the retail shop. His goal is to become a wholesale trader. 

Amos needs the loan to buy soap, rice and maize flour for resale.

loans.use: to buy soap, rice and maize flour for resale

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn M. is from the village of Bantuanon, Lantapan, Bukidnon. She is 55 years old. Evelyn is married and has five adult children. 

To make a living, Evelyn sells used clothing, called "ukay-ukay" in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Evelyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. 

Evelyn is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional stocks of used clothing like t-shirts & blouses. This will be the second loan taken out by Evelyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of used clothing like t-shirts and blouses

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
Daisy is a 35-year-old single mother of five and has no other dependents living in Hioma, Uganda. She lives in a rented home and her family goal is to build a family house and educate her children. 

For nine years Daisy has been running a restaurant business. She started by selling pancakes, then saved to start the restaurant. However, she faces a challenge of customers not paying on time.

Her dream is to have a bigger restaurant in the future. Daisy intends to use the loan to pay school fees.

loans.use: to pay school fees

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan A. is currently in the business of selling alcohol. 

She is 28 years old and married, with six children. Four of them go to school. 

A. borrowed a loan to stock more alcohol to sell. She hopes to expand her business and buy land with extra profits in the future.

loans.use: to stock more alcohol to sell

loans.name: Claire

texts.en:
Claire T. is 21 years old and lives in the town of Nasana in the Kampala central region of Uganda.  She is single and has no children. Claire has a business of food production, which she has had for two years.         

To help expand her business, Claire has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase more millet to make flour for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Claire hopes to generate greater profits and take care of herself.  In the future, Claire hopes to own a big boutique with clothes. 

Claire is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by improving more in her business.

loans.use: to purchase more millet to make flour for resale.

loans.name: Darely

texts.en:
Darely A. is from the village of Bantuanon, Lantapan, Bukidnon. She is 41 years old, married, and has four adult children. To make a living, Darely owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling canned goods,snack foods, shampoo, soap, and biscuits in the local community. Darely has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month.

In 2010, Darely joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Darely has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI, which was used to to purchase additional inventory and acquire working capital. Darely is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional canned goods and snack foods. This loan will be Darely's second loan  from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional canned goods and snack foods

loans.name: William

texts.en: William is a 48-year-old married man who lives in his own house in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He trades in cattle and has been in business for five years. He smiles on his decision to take up this business. His desire is to educate his children and own a ranch. William would like a loan to buy cattle for resale.

loans.use: to buy cattle for resale

loans.name: Enid

texts.en:
Enid is a 48-year-old married woman with four children. She lives in her own semi-permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda. The responsibility to look after the family solely rests on her and her dream is to educate her children up to university level.
Enid decided to venture into the restaurant business five years ago. She is so happy with this decision since she has been able to educate two of her children and also expand her business. Her main business challenges are meeting the demands of her customers and paying high local tax. Her dream is to own a hotel. Enid is requesting a loan to pay school fees.

loans.use: to pay school fees

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth C. is from the village of Balila, Lantapan, Bukidnon. She is 35 years old, married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Elizabeth owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop selling canned goods, junk foods, biscuits, shampoo, soap and detergents in the local community. Elizabeth has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2010, Elizabeth joined Kiva partner, HSPFI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This loan was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Elizabeth is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional beverages and biscuits. This loan will be her second from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase beverages and biscuits

loans.name: Bahriniso

texts.ru: Наботова Бахринисо проживает в районе Вахдат. Возраст, 42 года. Замужем, имеет 5 детей. Муж, не работает, он инвалид. Сама Бахринисо имеет средне - специальное образование, продавец. Она занимается торговлей. Рядом с домом открыла продуктовый магазин. В этой области четыре года. Кредит берет для покупки холодильника. У нее имеется один холодильник, но из-за большого количества продуктов ей необходим еще один холодильник.
texts.en: Bahriniso N. lives in the region of Vahdat. She is 42 years old, married and has five children. Her husband is not working and is handicapped. Bahriniso has a specialized secondary education, she is a salesperson. She does sales and a has opened a grocery store next to her house. She has been in this business for four years. She is taking out the loan to buy a refrigerator. She has one refrigerator, but because of a large amount of food she needs one more.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha M. is from the village of Poblacion, Lantapan, Bukidnon. She is 49 years old, married and has four adult-aged children. To make a living, Editha owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop selling breads, junk foods, canned goods, shampoo, soap and biscuits in the local community. She also makes and sells banana cues (fried bananas coated with sugar). Editha has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2010, Editha joined Kiva partner, HSPFI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This loan was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Editha is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional canned goods and breads. This loan will be her second from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional canned goods and breads

loans.name: Winny

texts.en: Winny is 20 years old, married, and has one child who does not go to school. Winny is currently in the business of selling bread. She is requesting a loan to stock more bread to sell. In the future, with her extra profits, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to stock more bread to sell

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda M. is from the village of Poblacion, Lantapan, Bukidnon. She is 45 years old. Imelda is married and has 12 school-aged children. To make a living, Imelda owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means of generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling canned goods, junk foods, detergents, shampoo, soap and biscuits in the local community. Imelda has been engaged in her business for more than three years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Imelda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Imelda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. Imelda is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional canned goods, junk foods & instant noodles. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Imelda from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional canned goods, junk foods & instant noodles

loans.name: Purevdorj

texts.en:
Purevbat is 40 years old and lives with his wife and five children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. They all live together in Ger, the traditional Mongolian nomadic tent.  His older daughter currently graduated from college and other children are attending a local secondary school. He moved to UB from a rural area in 2000 so he could give his children a proper education. Since then, he has been employed at “Makhachkala” LLC as a truck driver during summer time and during the winter he drives his director’s car as driver. 

His wife, Dorj, is 24, and she runs a decoration business. He is planning to give a proper education to his children and teach them good morals.

Purevbat is currently building a small house on his land. The building work is 80 percent complete and he wants to do some plasterwork to the house. Therefore he is requesting a 1.000.000 MNT loan to purchase some construction materials.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials for his house.

loans.name: Batsaikhan

texts.en:
Mr. Batsaikhan is 37 years old and lives with his wife and two children, ages 4 and 1, in Erdenet, the third largest city of Mongolia. 

Batsaikhan owns a plot of land and small wooden house on it. His wife currently is looking after her baby. Since 2007, Batsaikhan has been running a transportation business. He has a small truck and carries goods between Erdenet and other cities of Mongolia. 

Mr.Batsaikhan is planning to build a proper family brick house next to his old one. He is asking for a loan to buy necessary building materials, such as bricks, concrete mix and wood.

loans.use: to buy necessary building materials such as bricks, concrete mix and wood to build a family house

loans.name: Gloria's Group

texts.en:
Gloria M., from the village of Holy Friday, is the 49-year-old group leader of a five-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each group member receives an individual loan, they are collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Gloria M.'s Group.

Gloria, a married mother of seven school-aged children, owns and operates a business planting and harvesting a variety of vegetables for sale. Engaged in her business for over 20 years, she earns approximately 4000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Gloria joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid her previous loan of 7,000 PHP from ASKI that was used to purchase fertilizers such as manure, she is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP for the purchase of fertilizers such as manure. This will be Gloria's fourth loan from ASKI, and she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children's tuition fees.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Maamuu

texts.en: Maamuu, 54, is married and lives with his wife and daughter in Uvs province, Mongolia. His wife works as a salesperson at the market and his daughter attends college. Maamuu learned carpentry skills in 1986 and worked for a construction company. He began operating his own business in 1992. He works for construction companies in the summertime and makes wooden products and furniture at home in the winter. He supports his family with his business profits. Recently, he has bought a car with his business revenues. In the future, he wants to expand his business and have a workshop. He is a hardworking and honest person who says, "I want to increase my profits and help my daughter to start her own life". He is requesting a loan of 500,000 MNT to purchase more wood and materials for his business.

loans.use: to purchase more wood and materials

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes is 26 years old, married, and has six children, four of whom go to school. She is currently in the business of selling alcohol. Agnes is requesting a loan to stock more alcohol to sell. In the future, she hopes to buy land with the extra profits from her business.

loans.use: to stock more alcohol to sell

loans.name: Sugar

texts.en: Sugar, 46, is married and lives with his wife and son in Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. They have an average standard of living and they live in a house on a small plot of land that they own. Sugar's wife works as a kindergarten teacher and his son attends a local secondary school. Sugar began retail trading in food and groceries in 1987. Now he operates a PC Game center in addition to his food shop. He wants to expand his business and enlarge his food shop and PC Game center as well. He is a hardworking and modest person who says, "I want to save money for my son and help him to finish  college". Sugar is requesting a loan of 2,500,000 MNT to renovate one room of his grocery store for his new PC game center business.

loans.use: to renovate a room of his grocery store for his PC game business

loans.name: Jane Mary Ndinda

texts.en:
Jane is married and has three children. Her primary business is selling cosmetics and she has been in this business for two years, earning an income of Ksh 8,100 per month. Jane's business is near the market and thus every day she has clients.

Jane was introduced to KADET by existing clients and she is servicing her first loan which she plans to use to buy more lotions, sanitary wares, towels and hair extensions. She will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for her children and feed her family. 

Jane hopes to be stable so as to sustain her business. She describes herself as hard-working.

loans.use: to buy lotions, sanitary wares, towels and hair extensions for her salon.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian is currently in the business of selling alcohol. She is 33 years old and married with seven children, six of them go to school. 

Lilian borrowed a loan to stock more alcohol to sell. She hopes to pay her children's school expenses with the extra profits from her business in the future.

loans.use: to stock more alcohol to sell

loans.name: Juliana Ndungu

texts.en:
Juliana  K. is 63 years old, married to John, who is a civil servant hence  contributes to the family income.  She has three children and has been a farmer for a period of 15 years, getting an income of approximately 15,000 Kenya shillings a month.


This is her fourth loan from KADET LTD after successfully repaying the previous ones. She wants to use the loan  a mount to buy seedlings and prepare the land for planting. 

She hopes to grow several varieties of crops in her land to increase the profit and to improve the living standard of her family.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and prepare the land for planting.

loans.name: Vergie

texts.en:
Vergie M. is from the village of Bantuanon, Lantapan, Bukidnon. She is 42 years old, separated from her spouse and has six adult-aged children. To make a living, Vergie owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising vermi worms to produce vermi products. She also buys and sells dried fish. Vergie has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2010, Vergie joined Kiva partner, HSPFI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This loan was used to purchase additional vermi worms. Vergie is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase feed for the vermi worms. This loan will be her second from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice, 61 years old, is married to T. Paul,  65 years old.  Together they have three children. Erick is 33 years old, Samantha is 28 (they are both working), and Caren is 23 years old and is in college.  T. is a businessman.  Alice runs a school located in their remote but busy area.  She has been in business for 3 years and earns a monthly profit of Kshs 2,500.

Alice was introduced to Kadet by the credit officer in charge of the Kitengela office. She has applied for her first loan to purchase desks for her school. If the loan boosts her business she plans to save for the future use. 

Alice dreams of starting a university in the future. She describes herself as a visionary woman.

loans.use: to buy desks for her school

loans.name: Michael Mutisya

texts.en:
Michael is married and has one child. His primary business is a barber shop and he has been in the barber shop business for 11 years. The barber shop brings in an income of Kshs 10,000 a month. His barber shop is in the market and has day to day customers who frequent the market.

Michael joined KADET through existing clients and is on his second loan after he repaid his previous loan successfully. He is requesting a loan of Kshs 30,000 which he shall use to purchase barber shop items like mirrors, a shaving machine and cream and towels so as to standardize his barber shop to attract more customers. With the extra profits, Michael shall invest and become financially stable.

Michael describes himself as hardworking.

loans.use: To buy barber shop items

Patrick is married and has two children. His primary business is selling clothes.  He has been in this business for 4 years, earning an income of Kshs 10,000. His business is located along the market and thus he has customers every day.

texts.en:

Jesselyn is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide service like nail polish & cuticle remover.
