loans.name: Almoudou

texts.fr:
Âgé de plus 45 ans, Monsieur Almoudou T. est marié et père de 4 filles, il réside avec sa famille à Médine, un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
N’ayant pas eu la chance d’avancer à l’école, il s’est très vite initié depuis plus de trente années à la couture auprès de son oncle à Sikasso. Son atélier se situe au grand marché de Sikasso et la plupart de sa clientèle est composée des hommes surtout les forains. Avec une telle expérience dans le domaine, il jouit d’une parfaite confiance de la famille des tailleurs ce qui lui a valu la présidence du Comité de Surveillance de l’Association des Tailleurs de Sikasso (A.T.S.). En plus de la couture, il achète des machines à coudre à Lomé (république de Togo) et des tissus d’homme afin de les revendre aux tailleurs de Sikasso. 
Dans les souci de mieux satisfaire des commandes de plus en plus croissantes, il sollicite ainsi ce quatrième crédit auprès de l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle il est en partenariat il y environ trois années. Ce quatrième crédit lui permettra d’acheter 20 machines à coudre et accessoires et 12 complets tissus.
Avec ce prêt, il envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 300 000 FCFA. Avec ces bénéfices réalisés, il compte résoudre l’essentielle de ses dépenses personnelles, contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son atelier.
texts.en:
Mr. T. Almoudou is more than 45 years old, he is married and has four daughters. He lives with his family in Medina, one of the neighborhoods of the city of Sikasso (third administrative region of Mali). Not having had the chance to get ahead in school, he started over by sewing with his uncle in Sikasso over thirty years ago. His workshop is located in the large market of Sikasso and most of its clients are mostly male salesmen.

With such strong experience, he has the complete confidence of the tailors' association and this earned him the chairmanship of the Supervisory Committee of the Association of Tailors Sikasso (TTY). In addition to sewing, he purchases sewing machines in Lome (Togo Republic) and fabric for mens' clothes in order to resell them to the other tailors in Sikasso.

In order to better meet his increasingly growing orders, he is requesting his fourth loan from the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso. He has been partnering with Soro Yiriwaso for about three years. This fourth loan will enable him to purchase 20 sewing machines, accessories and 12 sets of fabric. With this loan, he expects to earn a monthly profit of 300 000 FCFA. With these profits, he intends to pay for all essential personal expenses, contribute to family expenses, pay interest on the loan and invest the rest in his business.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of goods (fabric, sewing machines etc.)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase timber for resale

loans.name: Diènèbou

texts.fr:
Née vers 1975 à Mampè Préfecture de Sikasso,  Diènèbou C.  est mariée et mère de 5 enfants et réside chez son époux et leurs enfants dans la grande famille traditionnelle à Sanoubougou I Kapel Kourou, un des  quartiers périphériques de la ville de Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Après plusieurs activités sans succès, cette femme s’est initiée il depuis plus de 8 ans aux activités de petit commerce notamment à l’achat et la vente d’éventails et d’articles divers qu’elle achète au marché de Sarro (région de Ségou) avant de les revendre à sa place au marché de leur localité où ses marchandises sont beaucoup sollicitées de sa clientèle (composée essentiellement de  femmes de ménages et  de vendeuses de condiments) pour la qualité et surtout en cette période de chaleur.
Dans le souci de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, elle décida d’intégrer l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso depuis plus de deux années. Elle sollicite ainsi un troisième crédit pour augmenter son fonds de commerce afin d’acheter plus d’éventails (20 colis). 
Elle envisage réaliser avec ce premier crédit un bénéfice mensuel de 200 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour augmenter son fonds de commerce, contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Born around 1976 in the Mampè prefecture of Sikasso, Diènèbou C. is married and the mother of five children. She lives with her husband and their children in a large traditional family in Sanoubougou I Kapel Kourou, one of the neighborhoods on the outskirts of the city of Sikasso (third administrative region of Mali).

After several unsuccessful businesses, over eight years ago this woman started a small business purchasing and selling fans, as well as a variety of other goods. She purchase her wares in the market in Sarro (region of Ségou) before reselling them from her stand in her local market. In the local market her goods are in high demand with her customers (largely female homemakers and food vendors) due to the quality of her products; her wares are especially popular during the hot season.

In order to better serve her growing clientele, she decided to join the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso more than two years ago. She is requesting a third loan and to increase her business by purchasing more fans (20 boxes). With this loan she expects to earn a monthly profit of 200,000 FCFA which will be used primarily to grow her business, contribute to family expenses, pay interest on the loan and invest the rest in her business.

loans.use: To purchase fans

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn E. is from the village of Poblacion, Lantapan, Bukidnon. She is 34 years old and married with five school-aged children.  Jocelyn owns and operates a specialized retail store.  The main source of business income comes from dealing and selling clothing, sandals, shoes and AVON beauty products in her local community. She also buys and sells silver-plated jewelry. Jocelyn has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month.

In 2011, Jocelyn joined Hagdan sa Pag-uswag Foundation, Inc. (HSPFI) to access financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jocelyn is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase additional products like tee-shirts and blouses. This will be her first HSPFI loan. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy essential drugs for her pharmacy

loans.name: Kyarutanga Twetungura Group

texts.en:
A. John Baptist is a hardworking and ever-optimistic 37-year-old married father with five children. He is the leader of the Kyarutanga Twetungura group of Ibanda. A. operates a produce and retail shop business in Bwera, Ibanda, where he sells general merchandise such as soap, soft drinks, beer, salt, sugar and other items. He has run his business for over 13 years and has managed to sustain and significantly improve his family’s welfare. A. makes close to 300,000 UGX monthly. 

A. is requesting a new loan to buy more merchandise for his shop. This will enable him to expand his business and earn more revenue.

loans.use: to purchase general store merchandise

loans.name: Salif

texts.fr:
Âgé de plus de  51 ans, Monsieur  Salif Y. polygame et père de sept  enfants réside avec ses deux femmes et ses enfants dans sa propre maison à Sanoubougou I, un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
N’ayant pas eu la chance d’aller à l’école et après avoir mené plusieurs activités sans succès, il s’est vite initié aux activités commerciales notamment  à l’achat-vente des appareils électroniques (radios, cassette (K7), panneau satellitaires, Batteries, Antennes Paraboliques, téléphones portables et divers) il y a maintenant plus de 26 ans. Avec une telle expérience dans ce domaine, il jouit d’une forte réputation et accueille beaucoup de commandes, mais les ressources nécessaires pour satisfaire ces besoins fait défaut. Ainsi, il sollicite ce  nouveau prêt  qui lui permettra d’acheter 10 radios de marques différentes, 15 téléphones portables de marques différentes et accessoires, 4 panneaux satellitaires, 3 batteries blindées, 7 antennes paraboliques et 100 cassettes afin de pouvoir satisfaire à la demande de sa clientèle qui ne cesse d’accroitre. 
Il achète ses marchandises à Bamako qui seront vendues dans sa boutique située en plein cœur de la gare routière de Sikasso. Ses ventes se font au comptant comme à crédit.
Avec ce prêt, il envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 270 000 FCFA. Avec ces bénéfices réalisés, il compte résoudre l’essentielle de ses dépenses, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité principale.
texts.en:
Mr. Salif Y. is over 51 years old. He is polygamous and the father of seven children. He lives with his two wives and children in his own house in Sanoubougou I, one of the working class neighborhoods of the town of Sikasso (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali.)

He never had the opportunity to attend school and after having pursued several activities unsuccessfully, he quickly turned to commercial activities. More particularly he has been buying and selling electronic equipment (radios, tape players, flat-panels satellite antennas, batteries, satellite dishes, mobile phones and various products) for the last 26 years.  With such an experience in this field, he enjoys a strong reputation and receives a lot of orders. However, he lacks the necessary resources to fully meet this demand.

He is thus requesting a new loan, which will allow him to buy 10 radios of different brands, 15 mobile phones of different brands, 4 flat-panels satellite antennas, 3 shielded batteries, 7 satellite dishes and 100 tape players. This will allow him to meet the demand of his ever-growing number of customers.

He buys his merchandise in Bamako to sell them in his store located in the heart of the Sikasso bus station. He sells for cash or on credit.

With this loan he plans on making a monthly profit of 270,000 Francs CFA. With the profit he’ll make he is planning on covering most of his expenses, pay back his loan and invest the remainder in his main activity.

loans.use: to purchase various articles

loans.name: Ali

texts.ar: علي عمره 59 سنة متزوج وله ولد يعمل كسائق فان له في عمله 10 سنوات له رغبة في تحسين الوضع المادي والاجتماعي له ولعائلته يريد دائما التطور في العمل وان يزيد من مدخوله يريد من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة الى شراء فان جديد للعمل عليه ويريد ان يدعم ابنه في فتح مصلحة جديدة حتى يعتمد على نفسه عائلته هي كل اهتمامه وعمله جيد حيث انه مقصد للسواح في المواسم السياحية لتعريفهم على بعض المناطق
texts.en: Ali is 59 years old and married with a son. He works as a van driver and has 10 years experience. His family is his sole priority and he desires to improve their financial and social position. He is always seeking to develop his business and increase his income. With this loan he wants to purchase a new van for work purposes and wants to help his son open his own business so that he can be self-dependent. He is good at his work and many tourists use his services to visit sites of interest during the tourist season.

loans.use: to purchase a new van for his business.

loans.name: Drissa

texts.fr:
Monsieur Drissa B. est un célibataire de 25 ans, qui vit chez son grand frère à Hamdallaye “Zantiguibougou”, un des quartiers périphériques de ville de Sikasso ( troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Monsieur  B. après avoir mené plusieurs activités sans succès,  s’est initié  il y a plus de trois années au commerce notamment  à la vente d’articles divers (d’huile alimentaire, sel, spaghetti, savon etc.) dont il dispose une place au  marché avec une clientèle composée essentiellement des femmes de ménages. Il est beaucoup sollicité de sa clientèle pour la qualité de ses produits. 
Pour satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, il décida de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il y a environ trois ans. Il est à son troisième prêt individuel. Les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés.
Avec ce  troisième prêt, il compte acheter, 6 sacs de sel, 5 futs d’huile alimentaire, 2 cartons de cubes maggi, 3 cartons de spaghetti, 2 cartons de savon, 1 carton de sardine, 3 cartons de concentrée tomate, etc. Il s'approvisionne auprès de commerçants grossistes de place avant de les revendre en détail, au  comptant et à crédit.
Il envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 200 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour augmenter son fonds de commerce, contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Mr. Drissa B., aged 25, is unmarried and lives at his older brother’s place in Hamdallaye “Zantiguibougou”, an outlying district of Sikasso City (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). After having run several businesses without success, Drissa became familiar with commerce over three years ago, especially in the sale of various goods (cooking oil, salt, spaghetti, soap, etc.). He has a place at the market and a customer base composed essentially of housekeepers. He is much in demand by his customers for the quality of his products.

To satisfy his burgeoning customer base, Drissa decided to join the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso about three years ago. He is now on his third individual loan. The previous loans were properly repaid. 

With this third loan, he intends to buy: 6 sacks of of salt, 5 barrels of cooking oil, 2 boxes of Maggi bouillon cubes, 3 boxes of spaghetti, 2 boxes of soap, a box of sardines, 3 boxes of tomato paste, etc. He gets his supplies from local wholesalers and then sells them retail, for cash or on credit.

He envisions using this loan to make a monthly profit of 200,000 francs CFA that will be used essentially to increase his business capital and to cover the loan interest. The rest of the profits will be invested in his business.

loans.use: to buy various grocery items

loans.name: Divina Cajucom's Group

texts.en:
Divina Gracia C. is 47 years old and widowed with five school-aged children. She is from the village of S. P. and is the group leader of “Divina C.'s Group,” a nine-member loan group offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. 

To make a living, Divina Gracia owns and operates a business raising livestock. Her main source of income comes from raising pigs for breeding. Divina Gracia has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

Divina Gracia joined ASKI in 2011 to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This will be her first loan from ASKI. Divina Gracia plans to use the additional revenue generated from her loan to pay the tuition fees of her children.


About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed and supplies

loans.name: Jherome

texts.en:
Jherome L. is from the village of Bantuanon, Lantapan, Bukidnon. He is 22 years old and single.  Jherome owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. His main source of income comes from buying and selling canned goods, junk food, bread, biscuits, and candy in the local community. Jherome has been engaged in his business for over one year and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month.

In 2011, Jherome joined Hagdan sa Pag-uswag Foundation, Inc. (HSPFI) to access financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jherome is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase additional bread and beverages. This will be his first loan from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand his business. 

About Hagdan sa Pag-uswag Foundation, Inc. (HSPFI):

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional bread and beverages

loans.name: Gangerel

texts.en:
Gangerel is 35 years old and married. She lives with her husband and two children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. They live in their own apartment and their children go to a local school. In 1993, Gangerel began repairing cars in her backyard. Her business has now become more stable and she has gained significant experience. Gangerel is a hardworking and honest person who says, “I want to take care of my children’s study and help them finish their college.”  

Gangerel is requesting a loan of 700,000 MNT to purchase equipment for her business. In the future, she wants to expand her business and have her own workshop.

loans.use: to purchase auto repair equipment

loans.name: Kaniba

texts.fr:
Monsieur  Kaniba F. est un polygame de plus de 50 ans et père de seize  enfants (11 garçons et 5 filles) qui réside avec sa famille à Sanoubougou, le centre ville de Sikasso ( troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Monsieur F. est chauffeur de formation, après vingt années dans cette profession en république de Côte d’Ivoire, il s’est initié depuis son retour au bercail il y a environ sept années au de petit commerce notamment à l’achat et la vente de Cigarettes, bonbons, allumettes, Chewing-gum, lait en poudre, thé, sucre, savon, et maintenant au transfert de crédit pré payé des  téléphonies, la charge des batteries et la vente des cartes téléphoniques. Il est  également le représentant de la société Nationale de Tabacs et Allumettes du Mali (SONATAM SA) au niveau de son quartier. Il est beaucoup sollicité de sa clientèle pour la qualité, la diversité et la variété de ses produits. 
Pour satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, il décida de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso depuis plus de trois ans avec laquelle il est à son quatrième prêt individuel. Les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés.
 Il compte acheter avec ce  nouveau prêt, 15 cartouches de Cigarettes différentes, 5 sacs du sucre, 8 paquets de bonbon, 2 cartons du thé, 6 paquet de Chewing-gum, 7 paquets d’allumette, 2 cartons de savon, 5 chargeurs supplémentaires, 40 cartes de recharge téléphoniques Orange/Malitel, etc. Il achète ses marchandises auprès de commerçants grossistes de place avant de les revendre en détail au comptant à crédit à une clientèle composée des garagistes et routiers puisque sa tablette est située auprès des garages-auto et de la direction régionale de Douanes de Sikasso.
Il envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 230 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour augmenter son fonds de commerce de ses dépenses, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Mr. Kaniba F. is 50 years old, polygamous and the father of sixteen children (11 boys and 5 girls). He lives with his family in Sanoubougou in the center of Sikasso (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

Mr. F. is a trained driver. After exercising his profession for twenty years in the Republic of Côte d’Ivoire, he returned home seven years ago and began a small retail business buying and selling cigarettes, candy, matches, chewing-gum, powdered milk, tea, sugar, soap, and recently selling pre-paid mobile phone cards and telephone cards, and recharging batteries.

In his neighbourhood, he is also the local representative of the National Society of Tobacco and Matches of Mali (SONATAM SA). He is quite sought after for the quality and diversity of his products. Over three years ago he decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso MFI to satisfy his ever-increasing number of customers. He is now requesting his fourth personal loan, all preceding loans having been correctly reimbursed.

With his new loan he intends to buy 15 cartons of various cigarettes, 5 bags of sugar, 8 packages of candy, 2 cartons of tea, 6 packages of chewing-gum, 7 packages of matches, 2 cartons of soap, 5 additional battery chargers, 40 Orange/Malitel telephone recharge cards, etc.

He buys his products from local wholesalers before reselling them retail, for cash or credit, to a customer base of garage owners and truck drivers, as his stall is located close by car garages and the regional offices of the Sikasso Customs.

With this loan he hopes to attain a monthly income of 230,000 FCFA which will mainly be used to increase his working stock, pay loan interests and invest the remainder in his business activity.

loans.use: Buy various items

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is 40 years old and married with four children. Two of her children attend school. Mary is currently in the business of selling soft drinks and is requesting a loan to stock more soft drinks. In the future, Mary hopes to construct a house with the profits from her business.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks to sell

loans.name: Mariam

texts.fr:
Née le 04 Mars 1975 à Loutana Préfecture de Sikasso, Mariam T. est mariée et mère de 7 enfants et réside avec son époux et leurs enfants dans la grande famille traditionnelle à Sanoubougou I Kapel Kourou, un des  quartiers périphériques de la ville de Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Après plusieurs activités sans succès, cette femme s’est initiée depuis plus de dix années à cette activité de petit commerce notamment l’achat et la vente d’habillements (pagnes wax, sacs à main, tissus brodé, etc.). Elle achète ses marchandises à Bobo Dioulasso (république de Burkina Faso) avant de les revendre à sa place au marché de leur localité où ses marchandises sont beaucoup sollicitées de sa clientèle. 
Dans le souci de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, elle décida d’intégrer l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso depuis plus d’une année.  Elle a bénéficié d’un premier crédit qui fut correctement remboursé. Ainsi, elle sollicite un deuxième crédit pour augmenter son fonds de commerce afin d’acheter 20 pièces de pagne wax, 15 complets de tissus brodé, 12 sacs à main, etc. 
Elle envisage réaliser avec ce premier crédit un bénéfice mensuel de 120 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour augmenter son fonds de commerce payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Born March 4, 1975 in the Loutan Prefecture of Sikasso, Mariam T. is married with seven children and resides with her husband and their children in a traditional family in Sanoubougou I Kapel Kourou, an outlying district of the city of Sikasso (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

After several unsuccessful activities, she started a small retail business some ten years ago buying and selling apparel (wax fabrics, handbags, embroidered fabrics, etc..). She buys her goods in Bobo Dioulasso (Republic of Burkina Faso) before reselling them at her emplacement in the local market, where her goods are in high demand by her customers.

Wanting to better serve her ever-increasing number of customers, she decided over a year ago to join the Soro Yiriwaso MFI. She was granted a first loan that was properly reimbursed. Now she is requesting a second loan to expand her business and purchase 20 pieces of pagne wax cloth (colourful West-African fabric), 15 complete sets of embroidered fabric, 12 handbags, etc…

She intends to achieve with this loan a monthly profit of 120,000 FCFA which will be used mainly to increase her business, pay the interest on her loan and invest the rest in her activity.

loans.use: buy clothing

loans.name: Tsagaanhuu

texts.en:
Tsagaanhuu is 54 and married with five children. She lives in Uvs province with her family. They live in a ger, Mongolian nomadic housing tent, on a small plot of land that they own. Tsagaanhuu’s three elder children have their own jobs and live in Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. Her two younger children live with Tsagaanhuu and her husband and have their own jobs as well. 

For the past two years, Tsagaanhuu has been selling souvenirs and stationery. She purchases her goods from Ulaanbaatar. Now, she has inventory of 800,000 MNT and her monthly sales fluctuate up to 1,000,000 MNT with a monthly gross income of between 150,000 to 180,000 MNT. Tsagaanhuu is a polite and hardworking person who says, “I am trying to expand my business and increase my profits in order to help my children to buy an apartment in Ulaanbaatar.” 

Tsagaanhuu is requesting a loan of 500,000 MNT to purchase souvenirs and stationery for her business.

loans.use: to purchase souvenirs and stationery

loans.name: Rangua

texts.en:
Rangua L., aged 28 years, is married to Catherine Yiasi, aged 22 years. Together they have three children, Ressy aged eight years, Sempet, aged five years and Lesnah, aged three years. He describes himself as a focused man.

Rangua transports people and goods using his motorbike in a business popularly known as “bodaboda” in the Kajiado area, which is a busy area where most of his clients are male. His business of two years gives him a monthly profit of 5,000 KES.

Rangua was introduced to KADET by the credit officer in charge of the Kitengela office. He has applied for his first loan with KADET, which he will use to buy spare parts to repair his motorbike. If the loan boosts his business, he plans to purchase another motorbike. Rangua hopes to start a transport company.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for his motorbike

loans.name: Yatoufa

texts.fr:
Né vers 1955 à Nèbabougou Préfecture de Sikasso, Monsieur  Yatoufa G. est époux de deux épouses et père de neuf enfants. Il réside avec ses deux femmes et ses enfants dans sa propre maison à Sanoubougou I, un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
N’ayant pas eu la chance d’aller à l’école et après avoir mené plusieurs activités sans succès, il s’est vite initié il y environ six années aux activités vente de bois de construction qu’il achète dans les localités environnantes de Sikasso. 
Dans le souci de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle en nette croissance, il décide de collaborer avec le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso avec lequel il est à son premier prêt. 
Avec ce prêt, il envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 300 000 FCFA. Avec ces bénéfices réalisés, il compte résoudre l’essentielle de ses dépenses, celles de sa famille, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité principale.
texts.en:
Born around 1955 in Nèbabougou, in Sikasso prefecture, Mr. Yatoufa G. is the husband of two wives and the father of nine children. He resides with his two wives and his children in his own house in Sanoubougou I, a working-class district in Sikasso City (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). Not having had the chance to go to school, and after having run several businesses without success, he soon became familiar with selling construction lumber about six years ago. He buys his supplies in towns surrounding Sikasso.

Concerned about further satisfying his clearly growing customer base, Yatoufa decide to collaborate with the loan program of the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso and is now on his first loan. 

With this loan, Yatoufa envisions making a monthly profit of 300,000 francs CFA. He plans on using the profits derived for resolving most of his expenses, and those of his family, and for covering the loan interest. The rest will be invested in his principal business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of lumber for construction

loans.name: Oyun

texts.en:
Oyun, 57, is married and lives with her husband and a son in Uvs province of Mongolia. Her husband is retired and her son attends a college. 

Her husband helps her with the business. They make gers, Mongolian nomadic housing tents, and export them to Russia. They make 400,000 Mongolian tugriks (MNT) profit from each ger. Oyun is a hardwoking and sociable person who says, "We want to expand our business and make gers for our children." 

She is requesting a loan of 3,000,000 MNT to purchase felt, wood and other materials for her business.

loans.use: To purchase felt, wood and other materials

loans.name: Sary

texts.ar: ساري في عمر 29 سنة اعزب ويعمل في محل كوافير رجالي له في عمله 6 سنوات يحب عمله وقد طوره كثيرا منذ البدء به وهو يرغب كثيرا في تأسيس عائلة ودعم عائلته يتميز بالدقة في العمل والتجدد يريد ان يطور عمله بشكل مستمر لقد ساهم القرض السابق بدعم محله وتطويره يريد من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة الى شراء عدة جديدة للمحل ومساعدة الأخ في تطوير عمله من خلال تطوير معمل الأخ للألمينيوم فهو يحب عائلته ويريد لأخيه ان يعتمد على نفسه وان يطور عمله حتى يصبح معتمدا على نفسه وهذه من خلال القيم والروابط الأسرية التي يتمتع بها ساري
texts.en: Sary is 29 years old and unmarried. He works in a barber shop for men and has been doing this for six years. He loves his business and has developed it considerably since its inception. He deeply wishes to settle down with his own family. He is distinguished with attention to detail and keeping up to date, and wants to develop his business in a sustainable manner. The last loan helped him develop his business and with this loan he would like to buy some new equipment. He would also like to help his brother develop his own business as he wants him to be independent; this is due to Sary's values and the family ties he enjoys.

loans.use: to purchase new equipment for his barber shop.

loans.name: Diakalia

texts.fr:
Monsieur Diakalia T. est né le 26 Janvier 1971 à Sikasso, marié et père de 5 enfant, il réside avec son épouse et leurs enfants dans la grande famille traditionnelle élargie au quartier de Bougoula Ville, le centre ville de Sikasso ( troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Monsieur T. s’est initié à la menuiserie dès son jeune âge auprès de son père  qui était un maître d'œuvres  très connu et très sollicité par la population Sikassoise. Avec  sa grande expérience dans le domaine, Monsieur T. reçoit beaucoup de commandes, mais les moyens dont il dispose sont insuffisants pour mieux satisfaire tous ces besoins qui ne cesse d’augmenter, il décida alors de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il y a environ trois ans et avec laquelle il est à son troisième prêt individuel.  Ce nouveau prêt, sera utilisé pour acheter un chargement et demi de camion “10 tonnes”  en Chevron et planche et  un demi chargement de contre plaque.  
 Il achète ses bois dans les localités environnantes (Tinkréla, Denderso, Lobougoula, etc.) avant de les scier et les amener à Sikasso pour en faire des meubles, bancs, tables-bancs, bureau, chaises afin de les revendre. 
Il envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 300 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour augmenter son fonds de commerce de ses dépenses, contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Mr. Diakalia T. was born on January 26, 1971 in Sikasso. He is married and the father of five children, and he resides with his wife and their children in a large traditional extended family in the Bougoula Ville district, the downtown of Sikasso City (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali).  He became familiar with woodworking at a young age from his father, who was a well-known master craftsman. He is much in demand by the people of Sikasso. 

With major experience in his domain, Diakalia receives many orders, but the means he has at his disposal are insufficient to satisfy further all these needs, which are increasing continuously. So he decided to join the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso about three years ago and is now on his third individual loan. This new loan will be used to buy one and a half 10-tonne truck loads of rafters and planks and a half load of plywood.

He buys his lumber in surrounding towns (Tinkréla, Denderso, Lobougoula, etc.) and then cuts them up and brings them to Sikasso for making furnishings, benches, tables, desks, and chairs for resale.  

With this loan, Diakalia envisions making a monthly profit of 300,000 francs CFA that will be used essentially for increasing his business capital for expenses, to help with family expenses, and to cover the loan interest. The rest will be invested in his business.

loans.use: to buy lumber

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia M., age 39, earns a living by buying and selling clothing, plastic boots, plastic plates, and bed sheets in her local community. Letecia has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. She lives with her husband and their one child in the village of Bantuanon, Lantapan, Bukidnon. 
 
Letecia has just recently joined HSPFI in order to gain access to financial services. She wants to help improve her living situation and increase her ability to engage in business activities. Letecia is requesting her first loan in the amount of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional plastic cups and plates to offer for sale. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional plastic cups and plates to offer for sale

loans.name: Ongima

texts.en: E. is currently in a business of selling bread. She is 30 years old, married to a businessman, with one child and does not go to school. E. took out a loan to stock more bread to sell. She hopes to build a concrete house with the extra profits from her business in the future.

loans.use: to stock more bread to sell

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce M. K., from Mshomoroni, is 31 years old, married to Juma Suleiman, and the mother of two children. She has been selling fresh fruit juice for the last two years and her business is doing well.

Joyce is applying for her first loan from KADET in order to purchase mangoes, oranges, avocados and a blender so that she can make more fresh juice for her clients. She knows that this will boost her business and will use the additional profits to expand her enterprise.

Joyce’s dream is to own a bigger shop.

loans.use: to purchase mangoes, oranges, avocados and a blender

loans.name: Philip

texts.en:
Philip is a thirty-five year old married man with three children living in his own permanent house in Fort Portal Uganda. He is charged with the responsibility of looking after eight of his household members, four of them being his brothers. His goal is to educate them up to the university level. 

He has been in the transport sector for twelve years: he started as a driver, then later acquired a lorry, pickup, saloon car, and a motorcycle. Despite his success, Philip still has challenges in the high costs of repair and maintainance of these vehicles. His dream is to buy a bus and complete his house. Philip needs the loan to finish his house.

loans.use: to complete building his house

loans.name: Elyjane

texts.en:
Elyjane C., from the village of Bantuanon, Lantapan, Bukidnon, is 43 years old, married, and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Elyjane owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop selling canned goods, snack foods, breads, biscuits, shampoo, soap and candies in the local community. Engaged in her business for over two years, she earns approximately 5000 PHP a month.

In 2011, Elyjane joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Now requesting her first loan of 5000 PHP to purchase additional canned goods and junk foods, she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her store.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional canned goods and snack foods

loans.name: Boniface Mawiyoo

texts.en:
Boniface is married to Monica and they have three children. His primary business is running a butcher shop and this has been his business for 10 years. He is able to bring in an income of Kshs 10,000 a month.

Boniface was introduced to KADET by existing clients. He is requesting Kshs 60,000 which he shall use to purchase cows for slaughtering and to add stock to his butchery with meat for selling to customers who are in the market where his business is located.

Boniface will use the anticipated profits to invest and pay school fees. Boniface hopes to be financially stable to support his business and his family. Boniface describes himself as hardworking.

loans.use: To buy cows for slaughtering

loans.name: James Gichuru

texts.en:
James is married to Anne and they have two children. He has been operating their general store business which sells foodstuffs, and a secondary business distributing office supplies as well as photocopying office documents, charging customers for usage. These two businesses have been in existence for 12 years and he gets a monthly income of Kshs 15,000.

James was introduced to KADET by existing clients and he is now servicing his tenth loan after repaying the previous loans successfully. He plans to use the loan to purchase more stock like sugar and flour and reams of papers to use in the photocopying of office documents.

James will use the profits to expand his business and educate his children, and he describes himself as hard-working.

loans.use: To purchase more stock such as sugar and flour and also reams of paper for photocopying.

loans.name: Liene

texts.en:
Liene D., age 21, earns a living by buying and selling such items as canned goods, snack foods, shampoo, toothpaste, and biscuits from her sari-sari (general store) business. Liene has been engaged in her business for over a year now and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month. She and her husband have three small children and live in the village of Poblacion, Lantapan, Bukidnon. 
 
Earlier this year, Liene joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services. She hoped to help improve her living situation and increase her ability to engage in business activities. Liene is requesting her first loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional canned goods and snack foods to offer for sale. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional canned goods and snack foods to offer for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fresh food

loans.name: Kyakuwa Women's Group-Kayunga

texts.en:
Hariet N. is 32 years old. She is a hardworking, enterprising and ambitious businesswoman who has been running a pub business in Kayunga town for the past decade. Hariet is affiliated with the Kyakuwa Women’s Group. The happily married mother of five says it has been a worthwhile business despite the growing competition that makes it hard to keep clients loyal. Hariet began her current business with savings from her first business venture which was farming. Her pub generates a weekly profit of 150,000 UGX. 

Hariet is requesting a loan to purchase crates of beer and other beverages to sell.

loans.use: to purchase crates of beer and other beverages

loans.name: Alice Kasichana

texts.en:
Alice Kasichana C. is a 37-year-old mother of three. She is married to Julius Karisa. She runs a food kiosk in Kisauni, a business in which she has been engaged for the last two years. 

This will be her first loan from Kiva partner, Kenya Agency for Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET).  With the loan, she plans to purchase carrots, onions, garlic, and cooking oil.  She will also use the loan to renovate her business premises. The purchases will increase the stock in her business.  The renovations will enable her to attract more clients. She hopes to use the anticipated profits to expand her business.

Alice’s dream is to become a successful business woman and be able to provide for her children’s needs.

loans.use: To purchase carrots, onions, garlic, cooking oil and renovate her business premises

loans.name: Siba

texts.fr: Madame Siba habite Batomé un quartier périphérique de Lomé. Elle a un enfant. Elle exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce de pagnes et friperies. Elle a commencé depuis  2005 et s’approvisionne au grand marché de Lomé pour les pagnes et le marché de Hedzranawoé  pour les friperies.  Ensuite elle revend au marché d’Adidogomé et Djidjolé. Son activité rapporte tellement qu’elle a reçu de Wages un crédit qu’elle a déjà soldé.  Elle espère satisfaire plus de demande et sollicite un prêt pour acheter une balle de friperie. Avec son activité, elle contribue financièrement aux charges  de son enfant.
texts.en:
Mrs. Siba lives in Batomé, a neighborhood on the outskirts of Lomé. She has one child. She has a revenue generating business selling pagnes (colorful printed cloth) and used clothes. She started this business in 2005 and she purchases her pagnes from the large market in Lomé and used clothes from the market in Hedzranawoé.  She then re-sells the goods in the markets of Adidogomé and Djidjolé. 

Her business brings in profits and so her loan from Wages (the microfinance institution) has already been approved. She hopes to satisfy more of her clients demands and is requesting a loan to buy a bale of used clothing (the manner in which used clothing is sold). With this business, she contributes financially to her child's expenses.

loans.use: To purchase pagnes (colorful, printed cloth) and used clothes

loans.name: Kanan

texts.en:
Kanan M. is 35 years old. He is married and has two children. He is a small-business entrepreneur who sells candies, rice, cookies, beverages, and many other foodstuffs in his store. Kanan is not alone in this business. His wife actively helps him with sales. 

Today, Kanan is requesting a loan of 1,300 Azerbaijani Manat (AZN) to increase his stock. He is ready to work even harder, make sacrifices, and push every once in a while to achieve his goal and become a successful entrepreneur. Kanan’s main goal is to provide his beloved child with a fairly well to-do life. We believe his perseverance and clear vision will become key success factors in his small business.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to increase turnover.

loans.name: Rejie

texts.en:
Rejie G. is from the village of Poblacion, Lantapan, Bukidnon. He is 21 years old and single. To make a living, Rejie owns and operates a specialized retail store. His main source of income comes from buying and selling gasoline per liter in the local community. Rejie has been engaged in his business for over two years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month.

Rejie joined HSPFI 2011 to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase gasoline. This will be Rejie’s first loan from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from his loan to improve and expand his business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase gasoline to sell by the liter

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.ar: محمود عمره 36 سنة متزوج وله 3 اولاد يعمل في دهان السيارات له في العمل 23 سنة يعمل بجد ونشاط وله تاريخ جيد في عمله له زبائن من محيطه جيرانه يريد تأمين حياة أفضل له ولعائلته يريد من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة الى زيادة رأس مال المصلحة ودعم عمله لأن عمله من أولى اهتماماته يريد ان يزيد من مدخوله وان يوصل اولاده الى مراكز جيدة في العلم والتطور من خلال دعم عمله له تاريخ جيد مع المجموعة حيث كان يلقى الدعم الكامل من افراد عائلته
texts.en: Mahmoud is 36 years old and married with three children. He works in the refurbishment and repair of cars and has 23 years experience in this. He works hard and with enthusiasm and wants to secure a better life for himself and his family. His business has a good reputation and he has many local customers. With this loan he wants to increase his work capital and support his business as it is one of his priorities. He would like to increase his income and be able to send his children to good schools. He has a good credit history with Al-Majmoua and the full support of his family.

loans.use: to have access to working capital.

loans.name: Alvan

texts.en:
Alvan Q. is 59 years old. He sells washing detergents such as soap, shampoo, washing powder, and many others. He has been in this business for more five years. Because of his rich experience, Alvan is able to choose goods that meet the requirements of his clients, whose tastes differ. The business is quite successful and generates the stable income that allows Alvan to improve the living conditions of his family and to make his four children happy. 

Today Alvan is requesting 1,000 Azerbaijani Manat (AZN). He is planning to use the loan to purchase new washing items to sell, thus enlarging the range of goods in his store.

loans.use: To purchase more washing detergents.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is twenty-eight year old single mother living in a rented house in Fort Portal Uganda. After divorcing her husband, she realized that the only way to bring up her child is to have her own business, so she set up a shop. She sold her goats to raise the initial capital. 

One of her ongoing business challenges is bad debts. Beatrice needs the loan facility to buy sugar, salt, and soap to sell. Her desire is to set up a wholesale shop.

loans.use: To buy sugar, salt, and soap to sell.

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios N. is from the village of Bantuanon, Lantapan, Bukidnon. She is 58 years old. Remedios is widowed. To make a living, Remedios owns and operates a tailoring business. The main source of income for the business comes from providing general alteration and tailoring services to local community members. Remedios has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Remedios joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Remedios is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional fabrics and materials. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Remedios from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional fabrics and materials

loans.name: Islam

texts.en:
Islam I. is 38 years old, married, and has two children. He sells cattle. As a rule, Islam purchases small cattle in the central market, feeds them, and than resells them at higher prices in the local market. Being in this business for seven years, he knows how to choose the animals, how to breed them, and how to look after them. Islam gets up every morning in order to feed the animals and to look after them. His knowledge and skills allow him to make his business successful and to generate a stable, considerable income for his large family. 

Islam is planning to enlarge his stock and purchase more cattle. For this purpose, he is requesting a loan for 1,000 AZN, which he will use to purchase young cattle and feed for them.

loans.use: To purchase cattle and fodder

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria R. is from the village of Balila, Lantapan, Bukidnon. She is 53 years old. Gloria is married and has 7 adult children. To make a living, Gloria owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) shop selling canned goods, snack foods, biscuits & beverages. She also sells coconuts & green bananas. Gloria has been engaged in her business for over 21 years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Gloria joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gloria has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Gloria is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional snack foods, coconuts & bananas. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Gloria from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional snack foods, coconuts & bananas

loans.name: Mambo Kwisha Development Group-Kampala

texts.en:
Janet K. is 43 years old and happily married with eight kids. She is hospitable, enterprising and friendly and her first business experience was running a small restaurant. Janet’s experience, diligence and determination combine to improve her prospects for future success. She is a member of the Mambo Kwisha Development Group. 

For the past 15 years, Janet has run a retail business in Kampala. Her business generates 140,000 UGX in monthly profit. Janet is requesting a loan to purchase general merchandise and commodities to sell.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en: Patrick is a 27-year-old married man with a child living in a rented house in Fort Portal, Uganda. He is solely charged with the responsibility of looking after the family, since his wife does not work. His desire is to set up an income-generating activity for his wife. He is a banker and has been in service for three years as a loans officer. Patrick intends to use the loan to pay school fees.

loans.use: to pay school fees

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en: Emmanuel is a hardworking married man with three children living in a rented house in Fort Portal, Uganda, longing to build his own house. For two years, Emmanuel has been in the transportation sector, and he is also a builder. This has facilitated him in taking care of the family. One of his challenges is vehicle breakdown, and his desire is to buy a new motorcycle. Emmanuel needs the loan to buy a motorcycle.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Betty

texts.en: Betty is currently in the business of selling bread. She is 20 years old and single. Betty borrowed a loan to stock more bread to sell. She hopes to pay for her children in school with extra profits from her business in the future.

loans.use: to stock more bread to sell

loans.name: Kanybek

texts.en:
Kanybek D. is 59, married and has five grown children. For a long time, he worked as a driver in the local area but after the breakdown of the Soviet Union, he started his own business in cattle breeding and land cultivation. With starting capital of 5,000 KGS, he managed to develop a farm with eight cows and bulls earning a monthly profit of 5,000 KGS. With the revenues, he was able to provide a good education to his children.

Kanybek has now applied for a loan of 50,000 KGS to purchase cattle in order to broaden his business. In the future, he dreams of developing a big farm with a large number of cattle.

Bai-Tushum and Partners, one of the leading Microfinance Institutions in Kyrgyzstan, use Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas, leading to increased employment and meeting the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: to purchase cattle.

loans.name: Araz

texts.ru:
Araz M. 31 qod. On jenat i imeyet 2 detey kotoriye uchatsya v shkole. Araz yavlyayetsya IDP personom , On pereselenec iz Fuzuli qoroda, seychas projivayet v qorode Baku vmeste so svoyey jenoy i detmi.
Araz uje 5 let kak rabotayet taxistom. Etom u biznessu on nauchilsya u svoyeqo starsheqo brata. Araz seychas nujdayetsya v 2300 AZN chtobi kupit zapchasti (akumulyator, noviye kalesa mashine i t.d)dlya pochinki mashini.
texts.en: Araz M. is 31 years old.  He is married and has two children who go to school.  Araz is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person).  He is a refugee from Fuzuli city who now lives in Baku with his wife and children.  Araz has been driving a taxi for five years.  He started this business with his older brother.  Araz now needs 2300 AZN to buy car parts (a battery, new tires, etc.) to maintain his car.

loans.use: to buy car parts to maintain his car.

loans.name: Saleh

texts.ar: صالح في عمر 31 سنة متزوج وله ولد يعمل سائق سيارة أجرة له في عمله 8 سنوات يريد دائما تطوير عمله وعائلته ماديا واجتماعيا يسعى الى امتلاك سيارة تاكسي ثانية لكن ما يمنعه هي المادة يريد من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة الى صيانة الموتير وتجديد التأمين والميكانيك الخاص بالسيارة لا يواجه صعوبة في عمله سوى الصعوبة المادية يتلقى دائما الدعم من افراد عائلته ومحيطه ويساعد نفسه على تخطي المصاعب من خلال زيادة مدخوله في المواسم السياحية
texts.en: Saleh is 31 years old and married with a son. He works as a taxi driver and has been doing this for 8 years. He is always seeking to develop his business and improve his family's social and financial position. He wants to own a second car but shortage of funds is preventing him from this. With this loan he wants to perform maintenance and mechanical work on his car. He does not face any difficulty other than lack of financial support. He has the full support of his family and those around him and is trying to take the necessary steps to increase his income during the tourist season.

loans.use: to perform maintenance and mechanical work on his taxi.

loans.name: Roselyne

texts.en:
Roselyne is 31 years old and lives in the Cocotomey district on the outskirts of Cotonou, Benin's largest city. Together with her husband Florent, she looks after their three children, all of whom are schooled.

For the past seven years, Roselyne has run a general store outside her home. This is her second loan with ALIDE, following successful repayment of the first, and it will allow her to purchase charcoal, oil, and foods for resale from Tokpa, Benin's largest market. Her aim is to expand her business.

loans.use: to restock the store with charcoal, cooking oil, and foods

loans.name: Angèle

texts.en:
Angèle is 34 years old and lives in the Cocotomey district on the outskirts of Cotonou, Benin's economic centre. Together with her husband, Cyrille, she looks after their three children, all of whom are schooled.

Angèle sells various items from her stall outside her home, from homemade doughnuts to shoes. This is her third loan with ALIDE, following successful past repayments, and it will allow her to purchase stock in bulk from Tokpa, Benin's largest market. Her aim is to strengthen her business in the short term.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients for doughnuts

loans.name: Augustine

texts.en:
Augustine is 34 years old and lives in the Calavi district on the outskirts of Cotonou, Benin's economic centre. Together with her husband Denis, she looks after their three children, all of whom are schooled.

For the past 10 years, Augustine has made and sold clothing for distribution across her neighbourhood. This is her third loan with ALIDE following successful past repayments. It will allow her to purchase stock in bulk from Tokpa, Benin's largest market. She hopes to be able to grow her business.

loans.use: to purchase cloth for sewing.

loans.name: Mirzomaruf

texts.en:
Mirzomaruf is married with three children. He owns a shoe business where he repairs and also makes shoes. Mirzomaruf began his business just repairing shoes. Later he began to take orders to make individual shoes as well. Making shoes has become quite a profitable part of his business. 

Mirzomaruf has been in this business for 25 years and has gained a rich experience in making good quality shoes. He is a hardworking and responsible person and has a good reputation among his clients. He has many repeat clients who use his services. Mirzomaruf would like to borrow 3000 USD to purchase materials for his business.  

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase input materials for his business repairing and making shoes.

loans.name: Gisèle

texts.en:
Gisèle is 38 years old and lives in the Womey district of Cocotomey on the outskirts of Cotonou, Benin's economic capital. Together with her husband Lozare, she looks after their two children who both go to school, and also one other child.

For the past eight years Gisèle has run a general grocery store from outside her home. This is her third loan with ALIDE following successful past repayments and will allow her to purchase stock in bulk from Tokpa, Benin's largest market. She hopes to be able to build her business.

loans.use: to purchase various food items for resale.

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.ar: محمود في عمر 36 سنة متزوج وله ولدان يعمل سائق تاكسي له في هذا العمل 10 سنوات يحب العمل بجد ونشاط يريد ان يؤمن العيش الكريم لعائلته يريد ان يزيد من مدخوله وان يطور العمل له زبائن من محيطه واقاربه يعاني من بعض المصاعب في العمل وخاصة المصاعب المادية حيث يسعى بان يكون عمله دائما في تجدد ولكن الصعوبة المادية تقف عائق في وجهه يريد من خلال طلب قرض له من المجموعة الى صيانة السيارة + شراء بطارية
texts.en: Mahmood is 36 years old and married with two children. He works as a taxi driver and has for the past ten years. He likes to work hard. He would like to secure a good life for his family, and therefore he wants to increase his income by developing his business. He has customers from his community and from among his relatives. He struggles with certain difficulties, in particular, material difficulties, which hinder his repeated efforts to develop his business. With a loan from al-Majmoua, he wishes to have maintenance work done on his taxi as well as to buy a new car battery.

loans.use: to buy a new car battery for and maintain his taxi.

loans.name: Indahemuka Cb Group

texts.en:
Madeleine is 23 years old. She is a member of "Indahemuka" group.This group is made up of 31 members and most sell foodstuffs while others have small shops.

Madeleine sells foodstuffs such as sweet potatoes, beans and small fish. She has sold them for three years and this has enabled her to feed her family and meet her family needs as well. She is requesting a loan in order to buy more foodstuffs to increase her capital.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs.

loans.name: Narzullo

texts.en:
M. Narzullo lives in Isfara, Tajikistan. He is married and a father of three children. He is engaged in cultivation and the production of brooms. He imports his brooms from the Kyrgyz Republic and sells them in a local market. Narzullo has been in this business for over 16 years. His wife and daughter-in-law help him. Narzullo has leased land and he also engages in selling dried fruits and animal husbandry. Narzullo has a car UVAZ, which he uses to transport his goods. He would like to request a loan of 9,000 TJS to purchase dried fruits and fertilizer.

More about Tajikistan
Tajikistan, a key post on the Silk Road, is perhaps best known for its rich history. It was the location for the end of Alexander the Great's rule, and is known for its great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country, with its epic mountain passes, is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language and a civilization that dates back to the fourth millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mix of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

However, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the USSR, damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93 per cent of the country is mountainous and only 7 per cent of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands of people to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

More about IMON International
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to purchase dried fruits and fertilizer

loans.name: Monzon

texts.fr:
Monsieur Monzon B. est un célibataire de 23 ans, sans enfant, qui vit chez son grand frère à Bougouni, dans le quartier Médine.
Ayant vite abandonné l’école, très tôt il commença les activités génératrices de revenus notamment l’achat et la vente de téléphones portables et accessoires, qu’il apprit auprès de son oncle. Avec une expérience de 5 ans, Monsieur Monzon B. maîtrise parfaitement son activité.
Pour avoir un fonds de roulement consistant il décide de rejoindre Soro Yiriwaso, avec qui il est à sa première expérience, pour acheter des téléphones portables et accessoires telles les façades.  Il s’approvisionne à Bamako (capitale de la république du Mali).
Avec ce prêt, Monsieur Monzon B. compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 50 000FCFA.
Avec ce bénéfice, il envisage d’agrandir son entreprise et aider son grand frère assurer les dépenses de la famille.
texts.en:
Mr. Monzon B. is a 23-year-old man who is unmarried and living in his older brother's place in Bougouni, in the Médine district.  Having dropped out of school early, he soon started a revenue-generating business buying and selling mobile phones and accessories. He learned about this work from his uncle. With five years of experience, he has mastered his business. 

To obtain substantial working capital, Monzon decided to join the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso and is now on his first [loan] experience for buying mobile phones and accessories, such as cases or faceplates. He gets his supplies in Bamako (capital of the Republic of Mali). With this loan, he plans on making a monthly profit of 50,000 francs CFA. Using the profits, Monzon envisions expanding his enterprise and helping his older brother cover family expenses.

loans.use: to buy mobile phones and accessories

loans.name: Adjrohoue Group

texts.en:
The "Adjrohoue" group consists of 15 women who live in the same neighbourhood of Godomey, on the outskirts of Cotonou, Benin's largest city. This is their first loan with ALIDE. They have agreed to support each other in business and through loan repayments.

Afi (with her hand raised in the photo) is 52 years old. She and her husband Etienne still support four of their five children, all of whom have received education.

For the past 10 years, Afi has been selling meals from her stall outside her home and around the neighbourhood. This loan will enable her to purchase two sacks of corn from Tokpa, Benin's largest market. Her aim in the long term is to grow her business.

loans.use: to purchase two sacks of corn for food preparation.

loans.name: Omar

texts.ar: عمر متزوج وله ولدان عمره 30 سنة يعمل معلم عمار بناء وتعهدات له في عمله 20 سنة يعمل بشكل جيد ومبتكر يريد ان يزيد من مدخوله وان يدعم عائلته ماديا واجتماعيا له تاريخ جيد مع المجموعة وكان يلقى الدعم الكامل يريد من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة الى شراء عدة جديدة + شراء عجول ومواشي لدعم عمله وزيادة مدخوله حيث انه يواجه صعوبة مادية في تطوير نفسه
texts.en: Omer is married and has two children. He is 30 years old and works as a head contractor in construction. He has 20 years of experience in his field, and he does his work well and in innovative ways. He would like to increase his income in order to support his family in terms of their materiA. needs and their status in society. He has a good history with A.-Majmoua, and he received the full support of his family during his last loan. With a loan from A.-Majmoua, he wishes to buy new construction equipment, as well as calves and other livestock. By doing this, he should be able to increase his income and overcome the materiA. difficulties he faces in improving himself.

loans.use: to buy new construction equipment.

loans.name: Aysar

texts.en:
Aysar is a young man from Arraba village in Jenin district. Aysar is a public school teacher. He took out a loan from FATEN to purchase home furniture.

Aysar lives with his family and is working on starting a small poultry business to increase his income. Aysar is photographed above.

loans.use: to purchase home furniture.

loans.name: Juliette

texts.en:
Juliette lives in the Cocotomey district on the outskirts of Cotonou, Benin's largest city. Together with her husband Franck, she looks after their thee children, all of whom are schooled.

For the past 6 years, Juliette has run a general store in her neighbourhood. This is her third loan with ALIDE following successful past repayments, and it will allow her to purchase stock in bulk from Tokpa, Benin's largest market. She hopes to increase the size of her business.

loans.use: to restock her shop.

loans.name: Erkinbek

texts.en:
Erkinbek U. is 45 and married with four children. For the past 18 years, he has been engaged in breeding cattle. This is the only means of sustenance for his family. Begininng with the initial capital 2,000 KGS, Erkinbek has developed a farm that now has three cows, six sheep and eight goats. In addition, with the revenues from selling milk and meat products, he has been able to buy a car. 

Erkinbek has applied for a loan of 50,000 KGS to purchase sheep. He plans to continue to expand his business and start to build a house for his family.

About Bai-Tushum and Partners

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading microfinance institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: to purchase sheep

loans.name: Aminata

texts.fr:
Madame  Aminata Koné est âgée  de 38 ans, mariée mère de 6 enfants et vit dans une famille polygame dans le quartier Koko  de la préfecture de Koutiala ( Région de Sikasso ).  
Elle n’ a pas eu la chance de faire des études, très tôt elle s’est intéressée au commerce et à la petite restauration depuis auprès de sa maman. Elle opta pour la transformation des graines de haricot en pain de haricot appelé ‘’Fari''.  Elle exerce cette activité de vente Fari depuis 16 ans.  Sa notoriété est bonne, car  elle reçoit beaucoup de client par jour.  
Pour l’élargissement de son activité et la bonne satisfaction de sa clientèle, Aminata n’a pas pris du temps pour faire recours à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso depuis 3 ans.  Après avoir pris 3 prêts en solidaire ( prêt de groupe ) tous payés correctement sans difficulté, elle est à son troisième prêts  en individuel dont les deux précédents a été correctement remboursés. 
Avec ce financement, elle compte acheter 10 sacs de haricot auprès des acheteurs de céréale de Koutiala  et exerce son activité à son domicile et vente à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes, au comptant.   
Elle compte sur un bénéfice mensuel de  60.000 FCFA qu’elle envisage utiliser pour le remboursement des  taux d’intérêts de Soro Yiriwaso et participer aux dépenses quotidiens de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mrs. Aminata Koné is 38 years old, married, and the mother of six children. She lives in a polygamous family in the district of Koko, prefecture of Koutiala (in the Sikasso region).

Having not had the opportunity to pursue studies, she started early on to work in trade and small scale food service with her mother. She chose to sell “Fari”, a bean loaf made from bean seeds. She has been selling Fari for 16 years.  She enjoys a good reputation as evidenced by the numerous customers she serves every day. 

In order to expand her activities and maintain high customer satisfaction, Aminata turned to the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso three years ago. She previously benefited from three group loans, all fully repaid. She is now seeking her third individual loan, having correctly repaid the previous two as well.

With this loan, she plans to buy 10 sacks of beans from grain buyers in Koutiala. She runs her business from her home, selling for cash to a clientele composed of both men and women.

She expects to earn an average monthly profit of 60,000 FCFA, which will be used to pay the interest on the loan and to cover some of the family’s daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy sacks of beans

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase two cattle.

loans.name: Fatoumata

texts.fr:
Madame Fatoumata  Traoré est âgée  de 41 ans mariée, mère de 5 enfants et vit dans une famille polygame avec son époux ,ses deux coépouses et leurs enfants dans le quartier  Médina coura de la ville de Koutiala (Région de Sikasso). Elle n’a pas eu la chance d’être instruite,  pour cela elle a embrassé les activités génératrices de revenus depuis son jeune âge qu’elle a apprise auprès de sa maman . Après avoir tenté plusieurs activités génératrices de revenus, elle finit par opter pour la vente de bois de construction, il y a 11 ans.  Cette activité est rentable car elle peut vendre plus de 2 chargements de bois dans la semaine. 
Pour l’agrandissement de son activité,  Madame Fatoumata a fait  recours à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso depuis 1an. Elle est à son deuxième prêt individuel, et le précédent a été bien remboursé. Elle compte augmenter  son achat de chargements de bois dans les  villages environnants de Koutiala et elle effectue sa vente  au marché de Koutiala  à une clientèle essentiellement masculine et au comptant.  
Avec l’augmentation de son chiffre d’affaire, elle compte sur un bénéfice de 100.000 FCFA par mois qu’elle utilisera  pour le remboursement de l’échéance du prêt et contribuer aux petites dépenses de la famille
texts.en:
Mrs. Fatoumata Traoré is 41 years old, married and mother to five children. She lives in a polygamous family with her husband, her two co-wives and their children in the Médina coura district of the town of Koutiala (in the Sikasso region). She did not have the opportunity to be educated and for this reason she launched into revenue-generating activities at an early age, learning from her mother. Having tried several revenue-generating activities, she ended up opting for the sale of timber eleven years ago. This activity is profitable because she can sell more than two loads of timber per week. 

In order to expand her business, Fatoumata turned to the microfinance institution, Soro Yiriwaso, a year ago. She is on her second individual loan and the previous one was repaid in full. She is planning to increase her timber purchases in the villages surrounding Koutiala and she sells them at the market in Koutiala to a customer base made up principally of men, on a cash basis. 

With the increase in her turnover, she is expecting to make a monthly profit of 100,000FCFA, which she will use to repay her loan and to contribute to her family's expenses.

loans.use: to purchase loads of timber

loans.name: Henriette

texts.fr:
Madame Henriette Sangaré a 58 ans, mariée et mère de 6 enfants, elle  vit chez son mari dans une famille monogame à Darsalam I, un des quartiers de la préfecture de koutiala. 
Henriette, en plus des ses activités d’enseignante, excelle dans des activités commerciales depuis maintenant 28 ans. En réalité Henriette fait l’achat et la vente de diverses marchandises notamment la vente de jus de fruits et de l’eau glacée.  
Pour augmenter la taille de son activité et la diversifier, elle décida de s’approcher de l‘institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso  depuis 5 ans. Après avoir pris 10 prêts en solidaire (prêt de groupe) tous payés correctement, elle est à son deuxième prêt individuel et  le premier a été  bien payé. 
Madame Henriette compte acheter avec ce prêt, un congélateur et des matières premières pour la préparation des jus de fruits. Elle s’approvisionne auprès des commerçants grossistes de Koutiala et souvent à Bamako, et effectue sa vente à son domicile à une clientèle mixte au comptant. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 70.000FCFA qu’elle envisage utiliser pour rembourser les intérêts de son  prêt et contribuer aux charges quotidiennes de sa famille
texts.en:
Mrs. Henriette Sangaré is 58 years old, married and the mother of 6 children. She lives with her husband in a monogamous family in Darsalam I, one of the neighborhoods in the Koutiala prefecture. Besides working as a teacher, Henriette has also been a successful business woman for the past 28 years. Henriette buys and sells various products such as fruit juice and iced water. 

To increase her business, she decided to work with micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso five years ago. Having already had 10 group loans, all properly repaid, she is on her second individual loan, the first one having been correctly repaid.  With this loan, Henriette plans to buy a freezer and ingredients to make fruit juice. She obtains her supplies from the wholesalers in Koutiala and often Bamako too, and sells in front of her house to different types of customers for cash. She expects to make an average monthly profit of 70,000 CFA francs which she will use to pay the interest on the loan and to contribute to her family's daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy a freezer and ingredients to make fruit juice

loans.name: Wanyinan Group

texts.en:
